title: Hard Sauce
directions: Cream butter, add confectioners sugar and blend thoroughly.
Add undiluted evaporated milk slowly until mixture is light and fluffy.
About a cup milk will be necessary.
Add vanilla.
Keep cold until ready to serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mabelle S. Ehlers, Person.Florence J. Atwood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Sauce, Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, evaporated milk, vanilla

Equipment: egg beater, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Boiled Tongue
directions: Wipe the tongue well.
Place in a kettle and cover with cold water.
Add the vinegar.
Bring to a boil, and boil slowly until it seems tender when pierced with a fork.
(It should boil at least two hours.
) Take the tongue from the water, and remove the skin and roots while it is still warm.
Cool, and slice thin.
This may easily be cooked in the fireless cooker, in which case the water with which the tongue is covered must be brought to a good boil on the stove, and then removed to the cooker.
If the tongue is very salty, soak in cold water for two hours.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Main Dish, Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tongue, vinegar

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife, stove

title: Cheese Souffle II
directions: Add cheese to hot white sauce and stir until cheese melts.
Add well beaten egg yolks, pepper and salt.
Cool slightly.
Fold in the egg whites, that have been beaten until stiff but not dry.
Combine well.
Pour into greased baking dishes and bake in a slow oven (325f) 45 minutes.
Chicken souffle: substitute 2 quarts finely chopped chicken for the 1 1/2 quarts grated cheese.
Salmon souffle: substitute 2 quarts finely flaked salmon for the 1 1/2 quarts grated cheese, and add 1/2 cup lemon juice.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cheese, Thick White Sauce, egg yolk, pepper, salt, egg white

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven, baking dish

title: Sturgeon Balls
directions: Grind sturgeon three or four times with onion.
Put into a bowl and beat with electric beater while adding the milk slowly, add remaining ingredients and continue beating for about 20 minutes (more beating the better).
Drop by tablespoon (the size of walnuts) in hot broth made from trimmings of sturgeon, with salt added.
Cook 15 to 20 minutes in broth, sturgeon balls may be frozen for future use.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs Henry Larsen
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co

(1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood

Ingredient: sturgeon, potato flour, onion, milk, mace, salt, egg, nutmeg, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Crumb Cookies
directions: Cream shortening.
Add sugar and continue creaming until light and fluffy.
Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with salt, soda and spices, then add the bread crumbs.
Combine molasses and milk, and add alternately with the dry ingredients to the creamed shortening and sugar, beginning and ending with dry ingredients.
Roll out on slightly floured board.
Cut with cookie cutter.
Place cookies on a greased baking sheet and bake in a slow oven (300f) 15 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.M Faith McAuley, Person.Mary Adele Wood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: shortening, sugar, flour, salt, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, allspice, clove, bread crumb, molass, evaporated milk

Equipment: rolling pin, baking sheet, oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, sifter, board

title: Filled Cookies
directions: Cream butter with vanilla.
Add sugar and continue creaming until light and fluffy.
Add eggs.
Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with baking powder.
Add flour alternately with the diluted milk to the creamed butter and sugar mixture, beginning and ending with flour.
Chill dough, then roll out and cut.
Spread half of each cookie with 1/2 teaspoon jam.
Fold over other half and press edges together.
Place on greased baking sheets and bake in a moderate oven (350f) 8 to 10 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mabelle S. Ehlers, Person.Florence J. Atwood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Ingredient: butter, vanilla, sugar, egg, flour, baking powder, evaporated milk, water, fig

Equipment: baking sheet, refrigerator, measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, sifter

title: Soused Herrings
directions: Split and halve the herrings, roll and tie them up.
Place them in a pie-dish, half cover with vinegar, add whole peppers, salt, cloves, and bay-leaves, and bake in a slow oven until they feel soft (about 20 minutes).
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: herring, vinegar, bay leaf, pepper, salt, clove

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pie pan, oven

title: Cole Slaw
directions: Combine sugar, mustard, salt and pepper.
Beat egg; add.
Add melted butter and cream; mix well.
Add vinegar very slowly; cook over hot water, stirring constantly until mixture thickens.
Chill.
Toss dressing with shredded cabbage; sprinkle with paprika.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, mustard, salt, pepper, egg, butter, cream, vinegar, cabbage, paprika

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, double boiler

title: Chili Sauce IV

ingredients.name: (24 to 28 medium-sized) peeled and chopped tomatoes

directions: Combine the tomatoes, sweet pepper, onion, and hot pepper.

Put the celery seed, mustard seed, bay leaf, cloves, ginger, nutmeg, and cinnamon loosely in a thin, white cloth; tie top tightly; add to tomato mixture and boil until you have but one-half the original amount.
Stir frequently to prevent slicking.
Add sugar, vinegar, and salt.
Boil rapidly, stirring constantly, about 5 minutes.
Remove spices.
Pack chili sauce into hot, sterile jars; fill jars to top and seal.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Tomatoes On Your Table (1944-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove, jar

title: Chicken Hawaii
directions: Place a pineapple slice under each chicken piece s in bottom of baking tray.
Put tray in hot oven and allow to start cooking whilst you prepare sauce.
Chop peppers and onions and place in pan with small amount of oil.
Stir over low heat until soft.
Add rest of pineapple chopped to pan and pineapple juice from tins.
Add curry powder and corn flour to about 1 cup water per person.
Mix all together and simmer until consistency of thick cream.
Pour over chicken.
Cover tray with foil and cook for at least an hour (check chicken before serving).
Serve with rice.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Oracle Ace, Person.Debra Lilley


Source: ACE Cookbook (2013-02-23)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Equipment: oven, measuring cups, measuring spoons, baking pan, knife

title: Boiled Onions
directions: Peel under water and let stand 1/2 to 1 hour in cold water to which a little cooking-soda has been added.
Drain and add fresh water at least twice while cooking.
Cook 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
Serve with required seasonings or add 1 1/2 cup white sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: onion, water, butter, salt, pepper, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Mahshy Kosa (Stuffed Zucchini)
directions: Peel the zucchini and scrape out the center leaving a shell about h inch thick.
To prepare the stuffing: add meat, onion, salt, pepper, rice, h can tomato sauce, and one tablespoon butter.
Mix all very well with hands.
Fill the centers of the zucchini with the meat-rice mixture.
In a medium saucepan put the stuffed zucchini.
Cover with rest of the tomato sauce, 1 cup of water and one tablespoon butter.
Cook over medium low heat for about 45 minutes.
Serve hot.
other_info:

title: Pattigman Bakkels
directions: Add ingredients as given, mix well.
Roll thin and cut in diamond shapes, slashing a hole in the center.
Fry in hot lard.

title: Blueberry Cake
directions: Put butter, melted, in last.
Sift part of flour over the berries.

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Meat Filling For Noodles
directions: Make a recipe of noodle dough.
Roll thin, let dry and cut into 3 inch squares.
Brown meat in hot fat with the onion and seasoning.
Soak bread cubes in water and press dry then add to the meat.
Spoon mixture on the center of the noodle squares, fold in half and seal edges, like little pillows.
Drop the filled squares into saited boiling water and cook 8 to 10 minutes.
Lift carefully with draining spoon to a serving dish and top with the half cup of bread crumbs which have been browned in butter.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Potato Sticks
directions: Sieve the potatoes and place in a warm bowl with the slightly softened butter.
Work in the flour, and season well.
If the mixture is sticky, stand it in a cool place for a while.
Roll out 1/4 inch thick, brush over with beaten egg, and dust with caraway seeds.
Cut into sticks, and hake in a moderate oven till brown and crisp.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)

Ingredient: potato, seasoning, butter, egg, flour, caraway seed

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sieve, bowl, rolling pin, oven

title: Chocolate Caramels
directions: Boil all together for twenty minutes.
Stir as little as possible.
Pour into buttered dish and mark into squares.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pan

title: Egg Foo Yung
directions: Slice onions, water chestnuts and pork in fine lengthwise pieces.
Mix in beaten eggs and season to taste.
Fry like pancakes.

title: Smor Krans
directions: Take small amount of dough, roll and make a loop with ends lapping over each other.
Dip in egg white, then in crushed loaf sugar.
Bake in 350f oven.

Source: Country Coon Prairie Church Preservation Kokk Bok (1986-01-01)


Category: Bread, Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, egg yolk, sugar, flour, baking powder, salt, flavoring

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, oven

title: Pop Overs
directions: Mix flour and milk; add the eggs, beating yolks and whites separately; add baking powder just before placing in the oven.
Butter deep gem pans or cups and place in the bottom of the oven.
When nearly done put in the top part of the oven until brown.
To be eaten with custard or cornstarch made thin, using eggs.
other_info:
Author: Person.Martha P Hand


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1893-01-01)


Category: Bread, Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, flour, milk, baking powder

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, baking dish, oven

title: Cherry Pudding
directions: For a family of five persons, boil 4 potatoes (pared) with salt in the water.
When done, drain and mash them quickly, and, while still hot, stir in enough flour to roll out.
On this sprinkle your seeded cherries (morellas are best), sprinkle with sugar, roll neatly up, put into a cloth or a pudding bag (not too small) and boil or steam for 4 hours.
If the water evaporates fill up with boiling water.
Eat with butter and sugar (hard sauce) into which is stirred the white of 1 egg and 1 tablespoonful of brandy.
A dyspeptic may eat this crust with impunity.
The same crust will do for dumplings.
other_info:
Author: Person.Matilda C Barns

Equipment: pot, knife

title: Johnny Cake
directions: Sift flour, corn meal, baking powder, soda, salt and sugar together.
Combine eggs and sour milk (or buttermilk) and add to the flour mixture.
Mix well and stir in the shortening.
Bake in greased 8 x 8 x 2-inch pan, in moderately hot oven (375f) 40 minutes.

directions: Bake in moderate oven like gingerbread.

title: Colcannon
directions: Equal quantities of cooked cabbage and potatoes, chopped, mixed together, seasoned with pepper and salt, and fried in a little dripping.

Equipment: stove, pot, knife

title: Cabbages, Cauliflowers, Greens and Savoys
directions: Cut off the faded outside leaves and hard part of the stalk, and wash the vegetables well.
Cook in plenty of boiling water, with a tablespoonful of salt to every half gallon.
If the water is very hard, add sufficient carbonate of soda to cover a threepenny piece.
Boil with the lid off till the stalk is soft.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove

title: Deviled Eggs
directions: Cut eggs in half lengthwise.
Remove yolks and mash, adding salad dressing and salt.
Fill halved whites with yolk mixture.

Ingredient: egg, cooked salad dressing, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: Crab Meat Rolls
directions: Blend crab meat, celery, egg, and mayonnaise, adding seasoning to taste.
Cut rolls lengthwise, remove part of bread, butter and fill with salad.
Serve on crisp lettuce with sliced dill pickle.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs A E Young
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: German Potato Salad
directions: Cook potatoes in skins until soft.
Peel and slice.
Add onion.
Fry bacon till crisp; don't let bacon fat get too brown.
Remove bacon from pan, drain and crumble.
Pour off all but 2 tablespoon bacon fat, add butter and stir in cornstarch, sugar, then vinegar, water, salt and pepper.
Bring sauce to a boil, stirring constantly, and pour over potatoes and onion.
Reserve some crumbled bacon and two eggs, sliced, for garnish.
Chop rest of eggs and sprinkle eggs and bacon over salad, mixing in gently.
Garnish with reserved bacon, eggs and chopped parsley.
other_info:

Source: Festival of American Folklife: German Recipes (1976-01-01)


Category: Salad, Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, onion, bacon, butter, vinegar, water, sugar, salt, pepper, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, baking pan, oven, saucepan, stove

title: Indian Fish - Alder Wood Charcoal Salmon
directions: Cut salmon into 4 or % pound chunks (crsgs-wise cut through the fishâ€”â€”not fillet).
Make a brine by dissolving boiling water and salt.
Cool brine well.
Put the salmon in a crock and cover with brine.
Use a weight to hold it down and permit the salmon to stand in the brine 24 hours in a cold place.
Remove salmon, wipe dry, and wrap in the following manner: wrap wax paper around the salmon.
Wrap a sheet of white wrapping paper around it.
Wrap 2 thicknesses of newspaper, which has been moistened until wet but still able to handle, around it.
Wrap with about 4 to 5 double pages of dry newspaper, and place on the alder coals.
Permit the fish to be in the coals 15 to 20 minutes per pound.
Turn the fish frequently as it cooks, so that all sides cook until all paper is burned except the last layer of wax paper, which also will be charred.
Peel off all burned paper and remove skin from fish.
Serve either hot or cold.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs J Murto
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co


Source: Savory Seafoods of Oregon (1957-07-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, knife, stove, coal

title: Devil's Cocktail
directions: Shake well, and strain into glasses.

Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, brandy, peppermint cordial

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, shaker, strainer

title: French Peas with Butter
directions: Wash the peas in cold water and place them over a low fire, adding merely a tablespoon of boiling water—no more—and 2 tablespoons of butter.
If the peas are old, add about a teaspoonful of sugar.
Cook slowly, over a low fire, for thirty or forty minutes, adding the salt and pepper, if you like, about fifteen minutes before they are done.
You will find that the peas are greener after they are cooked than they were when they left the shell.
If they show signs of boiling dry, add more butter—but no water.
other_info:
Author: Person.Carol Dempster
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Main Dish, Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pea, water, butter, sugar, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Finnan Haddie Au Gratin
directions: Split open finnan haddie and place in pan with slit side up.
Cover with canned or fresh tomatoes, a little chopped onion and parsley.
Season with pepper and bake slowly in oven for thirty minutes, keeping plenty of tomato juice on to prevent drying out.
After baking thirty minutes cover thickly with grated cheese about half an inch thick with a generous sprinkling of paprika on top and return to oven for another half hour,.
other_info:
Author: Person.Otto Matiesen
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)

Ingredient: haddock, onion, tomato, parsley, pepper

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife, grater, oven, baking pan

title: Lentil Soup
directions: The lentils must be soaked all night in cold water.
Melt the dripping in a saucepan, fry the lentils, sliced onion, and celery cut in small pieces.
Stir over the fire for 5 minutes.
Then add the water and boil gently, stirring occasionally, till the lentils are quite soft.
Pass all through a sieve, return to the saucepan, add the pepper and salt, and heat again.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)

Ingredient: water,  lentil, onion, celery, dripping, pepper, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot, sieve, saucepan

title: Sugar Cakes
directions: Mix eggs and butter well.
Then add milk and soda.
Mix in enough four to make a soft dough, just so you can roll it.
Cut into any shape you wish.
Sprinkle with granulated sugar, bake in a moderately heated oven .
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, baking soda, butter, milk, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven

title: Cranberry Salad II
directions: Heat ginger ale and pour over gelatin to dissolve.
Add sugar to fruit.
Pour into pan or molds and set.
Walnuts may be added if desired.

Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: gelatin, ginger ale, sugar, pineapple, cranberry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, mold

title: Toast
directions: Toast slices of bread one-half an inch thick on the broiler directly under the flame, or on a toaster fitted for a burner on top of the stove.
Brown on one side, then turn and brown on the other.
When both sides are an even golden brown, butter one side, care being taken to butter the edges.
Set the toast on an enamel plate or tin pie-pan in the oven, until all the pieces are ready for serving.
Always serve toast very hot.

Category: Breakfast, Bread

Ingredient: bread, butter

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife

title: Grandma's Crumb Or Sugar Pie
directions: Combine sugar, flour and soda.
Cut in the shortening and blend well.
Add the liquid and rub into coarse crumbs.
Put crumbs loosely into the unbaked pie shell.
Bake in moderate oven (375f) for 40 minutes.
This is a breakfast treat especially good for dunking in coffee.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, buttermilk, brown sugar, shortening, salt, soda, pastry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, baking pan

title: Baked Ham Special

ingredients.name: slice of ham, cut 1/2 inch thick

directions: Cut the ham into six servings the size of the pineapple slices.
Place in a flat baking pan with a slice of pineapple on top of each ham slice.
Make six sweet potato cakes and put one on top of each of the above.
This may be topped with a marshmallow, if desired.
Mix the sugar, flour, butter, and pineapple juice together and pour over each serving.
Sprinkle each serving with crushed wheaties.
Bake one hour at 325f.

title: Boiled Pinto or Great Northern Beans
directions: Wash the beans well and soak overnight in water to cover.
In the morning add 2 cups more water, the salt pork, and salt and pepper.
Simmer for an hour, or until the beans are tender.
Add more water if needed.

title: Green Tomato Relish
directions: Mix tomatoes and salt thoroughly.
Let stand overnight; drain.
Combine with chopped onions, green and red peppers, sugar, and vinegar.
Put spices loosely in a thin, white cloth; tie top tightly, and add to tomato mixture.
Bring mixture to boil; boil gently with spices for 1 1/2 hours or until thickened, stirring frequently, remove spice bag.
Pour relish into hot, sterile jars, fill jars to top.
And seal.
Store in a cool, dry, dark place.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, strainer, jar, stove, pot

title: Brain Fritters
directions: Wash the brains in vinegar and water, then put them into boiling water and boil for 10 minutes.
Drain them, chop them, and put them into a basin with 1 teaspoonful chopped parsley, pepper, salt and 1 egg.
Add sufficient bread-crumbs to make them into a stiff paste (not exceeding two tablespoonfuls).
Form into flat, round cakes, dip into egg and bread-crumbs and fry.
other_info:

directions: Shred cabbage rather finely.
Put in sauce pan and sprinkle with salt.
Cover pan and place over low heat and steam until tender.
Beat the egg, add the vinegar, sugar and salt and pour over the steamed cabbage.
Heat five minutes and serve at once.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)

Ingredient: cabbage, sugar, egg, salt, vinegar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove

title: Baked Macaroni and Cheese
directions: Cook macaroni in boiling, salted water according to package directions.
Drain.
Set oven for moderate, 375f.
Melt butter or margarine; blend in flour.
1 teaspoon salt, and pepper.
Add milk; cook over low heat until smooth and thickened, stirring constantly.
Add cheese, onion, mustard, and worcestershire sauce; continue to cook until cheese melts.
Add macaroni.
Pour into a greased 2- quart casserole.
Top with crumbs.
Bake about 25 minutes or until browned.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: macaroni, water, salt, butter, flour, pepper, milk, cheddar cheese, onion, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, bread crumb

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, pot, casserole

title: Fruit Kuchen - Fruit Filling

ingredients.name: strawberries, or 10 apples, or 2 1/2 cups fresh rhubarb

directions: Use enough sliced fruit to fill a 9 x 13" cake pan.
Kinds: rhubarb, apple, peach, berry, cherry.
Rhubarb may be pre-cooked, if desired, by bringing it to a boil in 1/4 cup water (drain the water before using the filling).
Spread the fruit filling over the crust.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.National Park Service, Organization.Smithsonian Institution


Source: Festival of American Folklife: German Recipes (1976-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: strawberry

Equipment: knife, bowl, measuring spoons

title: Kukuricny Chleb (Corn Bread)

ingredients.name: cup corn meal, white or yellow

directions: Sift all dry ingredients together.
Add the beaten egg and the sour milk into which the soda has been whipped.
Beat well.
Pour into a well greased 9 by 13 inch pan.
Bake at 400 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes.
Cut into squares and serve hot.
An old czech variation was to substitute about 4 tablespoons chopped cracklings instead of the shortening.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, sugar, salt, butter, white flour, corn meal, sour milk, baking soda

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, egg beater, baking pan, oven

title: Cream Pie
directions: Beat the yolks of three eggs with the cup of sugar and the 2 tablespoons of cornstarch and when thoroughly mixed add to pint of milk that has been brought to the boiling point.
Add a pinch of salt and butter the size of a walnut.
Boil the ingredients for about five minutes and then fold in the beaten whites of eggs to the custard and pour into a baked pie shell and let the contents cool.
Before serving whip one-half pint of cream and spread over the top.
other_info:
Author: Person.George O'Brien
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, milk, sugar, butter, cornstarch, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, stove

title: White Bean & Tuna Salad
directions: Chop the onion.
Mix the oil, spices, onion, beans and tuna in a bowl.
Refrigerate at least 2 hours.
Serve cold on crackers.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Oracle Ace, Person.Lewis Cunningham


Source: ACE Cookbook (2013-02-23)


Category: Salad

Measure: Metric

Ingredient: bean, tuna, onion, olive oil, black pepper, garlic powder, Sriracha Hot Sauce

Equipment: knife, bowl, refrigerator

title: Stirred Eggs
directions: Melt the butter in a frying-pan, and break the eggs into this.
Stir in the gravy ; pepper and salt to taste ; stir quickly, until the whole is a soft yellow mass.
Have ready the fried toast, spread thickly with anchovy paste.
Heap the stirred egg on this and serve before it has time to harden.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: Metric

Ingredient: egg, gravy, butter, anchovy, toast

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, skillet

title: Cherry Pudding III
directions: Cream together the butter and sugar and add the egg then beat well.
Sift the flour and baking powder and add alternately with the milk.
Blend well, flour the cherries and stir in.
Pour batter into a baking dish and bake in moderate oven (350f) for 30 mins.
Serve with plain or whipped cream.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, flour, butter, milk, baking powder, egg, cherry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, sifter

title: Raw Potato Pancakes
directions: Combine milk, eggs, salt, baking powder, and flour and beat slightly with dover beater to blend well.
Add potatoes immediately after grated to prevent discoloration.
Drop by spoonfuls on hot well-greased skillet (bacon drippings are excellent for additional flavor).
Fry to golden brown on both sides.
After browned, fry more slowly until done.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, milk, egg, salt, baking powder, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, bowl, skillet, stove, knife

title: Dumpling Batter
directions: Season with salt and pepper.
Mix well.
If desired, 1/4 cup rice may be cooked in the broth before the dumplings are added.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef liver, bread crumb, egg, onion, garlic, marjoram, parsley

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl

title: Stewed Celery II
directions: Boil some heads of celery, cut into pieces about 2 inches long, in some good stock, add salt, pepper, and a little lemon-juice.
Thicken the stock with flour and serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: celery, stock, salt, pepper, lemon juice, flour

Equipment: stove, pot, knife

title: Salmon Bisque
directions: Scald milk and water.
Mix flour and the 2 cups water to a smooth paste and stir in the scalded milk.
Cook until slightly thickened.
Remove skin and bones from salmon and separate into flakes.
Add salt, paprika, lemon juice and butter.
Add to sauce and heat just before serving.
other_info:
Author: Person.M Faith McAuley, Person.Mary Adele Wood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: evaporated milk, water, flour, salmon, salt, paprika, lemon juice, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot

title: Cocoanut Blanc Mange
directions: Mix the cornstarch, sugar and salt with the cold water.
Add the milk slowly, stirring well.
Cook twenty minutes in a double boiler, stirring occasionally, or ten minutes over the flame, stirring constantly.
Cool slightly and add the shredded coconut and the stiffly beaten whites of the eggs.
Add the vanilla.
One-fourth of a cup of nuts, candied cherries or preserved pineapple may be added if desired.
Chill in moulds wet with cold water.
Serve with cream or custard sauce made from the egg yolks.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cornstarch, milk, sugar, coconut, salt, egg white, water, vanilla

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, stove

title: Kren (Horseradish)
directions: Mix all together.
This will keep indefinitely in refrigerator.
When ready to use, you can add 1 part grated apple to 2 parts grated horseradish mixture.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: horseradish, sugar, vinegar, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: Wine Jelly
directions: Dissolve gelatine in boiling water.
Add other ingredients.
Strain.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1919-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: gelatine, water, sugar, wine, lemon

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Parker House Dressing
directions: Beat the yolks of the eggs with the salt, sugar, pepper and mustard ; add the oil slowly, then the vinegar.
Beat the whites of the eggs to a stiff froth, adding them last.
Put all in a large bowl and set it over a boiling kettle to thicken, stirring it frequently to make it smooth.
Remove it from the heat before it becomes too thick.
Used for lettuce, cold meats, tomatoes sliced, potato salad, etc.
other_info:
Author: Person.Emma R Hoopes
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, salt, mustard, sugar, oil, vinegar, red pepper

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, pot

title: Bramborove Skubanky (Potato Fluff)

ingredients.name: salt, or more, according to taste

directions: Boil the potatoes with water to cover.
When almost done, pour off half the water.
Make wells in the softened potatoes.
Put the salt and flour into the wells.
Put over low heat and boil about 10 minutes more being careful to stir frequently as the mixture scorches easily.
Remove from fire and whip thoroughly.
Drop by tablespoonfuls into a bowl.
Dip the spoon in the melted butter to keep the potato mixture from sticking to it.
Sprinkle with the ground poppy seed mixed with the sugar.
Add the rest of the melted butter if desired.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, salt, white flour, butter, poppy seed, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, stewpot, egg beater

title: Long Island Cake
directions: Add fruitâ€”raisins, currants, and citron.
This will keep for some time.
other_info:
Author: Person.Henrietta Thomas
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, flour, egg, milk, baking powder, raisin

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Indian Bannock
directions: Mixed first four ingredients.
When cool, add two eggs, beaten separately.
Bake in a shallow earthen dish in a very hot oven, and serve in the dish, like a pudding.
other_info:
Author: Person.E E B
Contributor: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn meal, sugar, salt, milk, egg

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, cake pan

title: Spice Layer Cake
directions: Cream sugar and shortening and beat until fluffy.
Add the eggs and beat until light.
Sift the flour, add salt, spices, baking powder, then sift again.
Add the dry ingredients to the egg mixture alternately with the milk.
Beat thoroughly and add the floured raisins.
Pour into 2 greased layer cake pans.
Bake in moderate oven (350f) for 25 or 30 minutes.
For the icing use: 2 cups sugar, 3/4 cup milk, 2 tablespoon butter, cream together and boil until it forms a soft ball when dropped in water.
Add vanilla and beat until cold.
Spread between layers, over top and sides.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, shortening, clove, egg, milk, nutmeg, baking powder, raisin, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven, cake pan

title: Green Tomato Mincemeat

ingredients.name: (about 24 to 28 medium-sized) finely chopped green tomatoes
(about 8 to 10 medium-sized) pared finely chopped tart apples
minced citron, lemon or orange peel

directions: Combine all ingredients and cook mixture slowly until tender and slightly thickened.
Stir frequently to prevent sticking.
Pour into hot.
Sterile jars, fill jars to top, and seal.
Store in a cool, dry, dark place.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Tomatoes On Your Table (1944-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: green tomato, cinnamon, salt, allspice, apple, clove, brown sugar, raisin, sugar, citron, vinegar, lemon juice, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot, jar

title: Apple Or Peach Strudel
directions: Into bottom of a buttered baking dish put thick layers of apples (or peaches).
Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon mixed.
Dot with lumps of butter.
Into a mixing bowl sift sugar, flour, baking powder, salt.
Into this, break 1 egg.
Mix until crumbly.
Put over apples (peaches) bake in moderate oven (350f) till crust is brown.
Serve with milk, whipped cream or ice cream.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: peach, cinnamon, butter, sugar, flour, baking powder, salt, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, sifter

title: Haricot Beans
directions: Soak the beans over-night.
Next day boil them for 5 or 6 hours in plenty of water.
One hour before serving, mix the vinegar, sugar, pepper and salt well together, pour away some of the water from the beans, and add the mixture to them.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bean, vinegar, brown sugar, pepper, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove

title: Filling for Layers or Frosting for Loaf
directions: Dissolve com starch in a little of the milk and cook over double boiler with milk until mixture thickens.
Add sugar, beaten egg yolks and chopped nuts.
(1/2 recipe is sufficient to ice loaf cake).
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cornstarch, milk, sugar, egg yolk, nut, vanilla

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, double boiler, pot, stove, egg beater

title: Boiled Rice II
directions: Well wash the rice in cold water, then put it into the boiling water with the salt, and let it boil fast 15 to 20 minutes.
When it is quite tender, strain it into a colander, turn the cold water tap on to it for 2 or 3 seconds.
Then place it in a dry saucepan by the side of the fire, with the lid half on, to dry and get hot.
Shake it occasionally to prevent it burning, and serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side, Grain

Ingredient: rice, salt, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove, strainer, saucepan

title: Grapenuts Pudding
directions: Soak grapenuts in a little water.
Beat egg yolks, add sugar, raisins, milk and water.
Cook over boiling water until thickened.
Pour into custard cups or a shallow baking pan.
Cover with meringue.
Brown in a slow oven (325f).
other_info:
Author: Person.Mabelle S. Ehlers, Person.Florence J. Atwood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: grapenut, egg yolk, sugar, raisin, evaporated milk, water, egg white

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot

title: Sauerbraten II
directions: 2 inch thick piece of chuck, pot roast or tender boiling beef.
Place in dish or bowl and cover with solution of half vinegar and half water, put in two large onions sliced.
Do this two or three days before the meat is wanted.
On the day before it is to be cooked cut 3 or 4 slices of bacon into 1" pieces and chop fine 1 tablespoon of the onion which has been soaking in the vinegar.
Cut holes in the meat 1 or 2 inches apart and stuff bits of the bacon and chopped onion into the holes.
Put the meat back into the solution, add 1 tablespoon whole cloves and 1 teaspoon whole allspice.
Bake the meat as a pot roast in part of the solution until tender.
Use more of the solution, adding sugar to taste, in making the gravy which will be almost black.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef chuck, vinegar, water, onion, bacon, clove, allspice, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove

title: Roast Lamb with Banana Croquettes
directions: Remove the superfluous fat from a leg of lamb and score the thin layer of fat on the outer side of the leg diagonally; rub over with salt and pepper; dredge with flour, and set on the rack in the baking pan.
Have the oven very hot at first, to sear over the outside; after 15 minutes reduce the heat and let cook about 2 hours; baste frequently with bacon fat melted in hot water.
Remove to a serving dish; slip a paper frill over the bone, and garnish with parsley and banana croquettes.

Remove the skin and coarse threads from the bananas and trim the pulp of each to a cylinder-shape croquette; coat each with lemon juice to keep from discoloring; then roll in egg and then in sifted bread crumbs; fry in deep fat, and dust with powdered sugar.
other_info:
Author: Person.Helen Parker Headden, Person.Katherine Newsbury, Organization.Denver Gas and Electric Co


Source: A Book of Hints on the Art of Cooking (1907-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: lamb, salt, pepper, flour, bacon, water, parsley, banana, lemon juice, egg, bread crumb, powdered sugar

Equipment: baking pan, oven

title: Spanish Rice
directions: Take one cup of uncooked rice and put it in a frying pan with enough olive oil to cover the pan a half inch thick.
Stir it until the grains are separated and brown.
Add tomatoes, chopped onions, chopped peppers and seasoning to taste.
Add enough water to make the mixture well moist.
Cover with a top and do not stir or remove the top.
Allow this to simmer for half an hour.
Serve hot.
other_info:
Author: Person.Ramon Novarro
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Side, Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: rice, salt, tomato, pepper, onion, chili powder, green pepper, olive oil

Equipment: measuring cups, knife, stove, frying pan

title: Spinach in Cream
directions: Wash spinach carefully to remove all grit.
Cook in a covered kettle without water 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Press spinach through a coarse sieve, or chop fine.
Add about 1 cup undiluted evaporated milk to each quart of sieved spinach and heat.
Season with salt and pepper.
If canned spinach is used, drain off juice and chop fine.
Spinach liquid may be used for soup.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: spinach, evaporated milk, salt, pepper

Equipment: sieve, knife, pot

title: LMON Risotto

ingredients.name: lemon, or more depending on taste

directions: In large sauce pan, prepare rice by bringing chicken broth, wine, garlic and butter to a boil.
Add rice, little by little, stirring constantly.
Once all moisture is absorbed, (about 20 min).
Remove from heat.
Add in cream, dill, curry and then squeeze in desired amount of lemon juice and zest.
If left too long, over cooked, simply add a small bit of water to again achieve desired risotto texture.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Oracle Ace, Person.Kellyn Pot'vin


Source: ACE Cookbook (2013-02-23)


Category: Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: rice, chicken broth, wine, butter, heavy cream, garlic, lemon, dill, curry powder, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, saucepan

title: Potato Biscuit
directions: Boil and mash potatoes.
Sift flour, salt and baking powder together.
Add potatoes and cream in the lard.
Mix to a light dough with egg and milk.
Roll out rather thin and bake in hot oven until brown.
Serve hot.
other_info:
Author: Person.Lon Chaney
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, salt, flour, lard, baking powder, egg, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, rolling pin, sifter, stove

title: Chicken and Tomato Soup
directions: Cook the onion and parsley in the hot butter until yellowed.
Add the tomatoes and broth and let simmer fifteen minutes.
Press through a sieve.
Reheat to boiling point; stir in cornstarch ; let cook ten minutes.
Skim and season to taste.
other_info:
Author: Person.Dolores Costello
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Side, Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, parsley, cornstarch, tomato, onion, chicken broth, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Nut Cake
directions: Rub butter and sugar to a light, white cream.
Add egg yolks and beat until smooth.
Sift flour, salt and baking powder and add, together with milk, a little at a time, beating well.
Fold in chopped nuts and stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into 2 nine inch cake pans or 1 loaf pan.
Bake in medium oven (350-f) for 30 minutes for layer cake or 1 hour for loaf cake.
Use hickory nuts, black walnuts or shellbarks.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, nut meat, butter, baking powder, egg, milk, flour, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, knife, cake pan

title: Chicken Pot Pie
directions: Mix the above ingredients, roll out and cut in two inch squares.
Flour chicken and fry in butter.
Put layers of chicken, potato slices, sliced onion and squares of pot-pie dough.
Barely cover with boiling water and cook for two hours.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, flour, water, salt, baking powder

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, rolling pin

title: Fried Tomatoes II
directions: Cut large, solid, ripe tomatoes in 1/2 inch slices.
Dredge thickly with flour.
Fry quickly in 2 tablespoons of hot drippings or butter, browning well on both sides.
Remove to serving platter, sprinkle with salt, pepper and brown sugar.
Keep warm.
Add 1 tablespoon of butter to the pan fryings and blend in a tablespoon of flour,.
Add the milk and cook, stirring constantly.
It should be about the consistency of thick cream.
Pour it over the tomatoes and serve.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, flour, butter, milk, brown sugar, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, frying pan, stove

title: Rice Yeast Bread

ingredients.name: lukewarm water, to soften yeast cake

directions: Mix in ordinary manner.
The dough will be very stiff at first, but much thinner after first rising.
Probably you will have better results if you make a sponge with the rice, liquid, and a part of the flour, first, and, when risen, add the remaining ingredients.
other_info:
Author: Person.Edith Church, Person.Bertina A Leete


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes, Ten Lessons On Food Conservation (1918-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, sugar, shortening, salt, rice, flour, yeast cake

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven

title: Scalloped Sweet Potatoes And Apples
directions: Boil sweet potatoes until tender.
Slice in 1/4 inch pieces.
Butter baking dish and put a layer of sweet potatoes in bottom, then a layer of apples.
Sprinkle with sugar, salt and mace, and dot with butter.
Repeat until dish is filled, having the top layer of apples.
Bake in moderate oven (350f) for 50 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: sweet potato, butter, salt, brown sugar, mace, apple

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, knife, baking dish

title: Boiled Souffle
directions: Melt butter, sugar and yolks of the eggs together and stir till cold.
Add all the whites and the juice of one very large lemon.
Beat all up and put in a mould.
Set in a pan of boiling water and boil i hour.
Serve with foamy sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, egg, lemon juice

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, pan

title: Date Bars
directions: Beat eggs with sugar until very thick, add sifted dry ingredients; beat smooth.
Add dates, vanilla, and nut meats.
Bake in a 9 x 13 inch pan, lined with waxed-paper, in a moderate over (350) about 30 minutes.
While warm, cut in 1 x 4 inch bars; roll in confectioners sugar.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, date, sugar, vanilla, flour, pecan, salt, baking powder

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, sifter, baking pan, oven

title: Lima Beans Baked in Milk
directions: Soak lima beans in water overnight.
Drain, add salt and cook in the 3 quarts water until tender.
Add melted butter, onion, celery, milk and water.
Pour into shallow baking pan.
Cover and bake in a slow oven (300f) 2 hours.
Uncover the last half hour of baking.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: lima bean, salt, water, butter, onion, celery, evaporated milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, sieve, baking pan, oven

title: Eggless Mayonnaise
directions: Use confectioners sugar if available.
Mix dry ingredients in a mixing bowl and add 1 1/4 cups evaporated milk.
Beat vigorously.
Add oil a little at a time, beating each addition thoroughly into the milk before adding the next.
When mixture begins to thicken slightly, add vinegar and lemon juice alternately with oil, beating vigorously after each addition.
Add the 1/2 cup milk and beat thoroughly.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, mustard, salt, paprika, cayenne pepper, pepper, evaporated milk, salad oil, vinegar, lemon juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, egg beater

title: Oatmeal with Cheese
directions: Put boiling water and salt over a quick fire ; stir in gradually the rolled oats till the mixture thickens, then cover and cook over boiling water 2 hours.
At the last moment stir in cheese and butter, and just before serving, an egg, beaten light.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Breakfast, Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, salt, rolled oat, cheese, butter, egg

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, pot

title: Scandinavian Coffee Cake
directions: Scald milk.
Add shortening, sugar, and salt.
Stir until sugar dissolves; cool to lukewarm.
Dissolve yeast in water; combine with milk mixture.
Stir in half the flour; add eggs; beat well.
Add enough of remaining flour to make a soft dough.
Turn out on lightly floured board; knead till smooth and elastic.
(See recipe for white bread) put in a greased bowl; brush with shortening; cover; let rise in a warm place, 80Â° to 85Â° till double in bulk (about 2 hours).
Turn out on floured board; roll into a rectangle 8 by 12 inches.
Brush with butter.
Sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon.
Roll up like jelly roll; shape into a ring on greased baking sheet; pinch ends.
From the outside, cut through the ring toward center almost all the way through in 1- inch slices.
Fan out slices slightly to side.
Brush with shortening; cover; let rise about 45 minutes or till double in bulk.
Meanwhile set oven for moderate 375f.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes.
While warm spread with confectioners' sugar icing; sprinkle with chopped walnuts.

title: Walnut Gingerbread
directions: Cream the sugar and shortening in a bowl.
Add the molasses and pour the cup of boiling water over it.
Mix well.
Combine the flour, soda and spices, sift and add to the molasses mixture, beating well.
Add the eggs one at a time and blend thoroughly.
Next add the chopped nut meats.
Pour into a well greased loaf pan and bake in moderate oven (350f) for 40 minutes.

title: 'Cactus' Melon
directions: Thoroughly wash and dry the melon and the pepper.
Coat with the jelly, when this is on the point of setting.
And allow to set quite firmly.
Meanwhile, cream the cheese with milk until it is of a soft piping consistency.
Colour two-thirds of the cheese a pale pink, and the remaining portion a pale yellow.
Drain the anchovies and cut the fillets into narrow strips.
Using a small "cocktail" cutter, cut star-shaped pieces from the strips of pimento or tomato flesh.
Dip the strips of anchovy into stiff jelly and arrange in a diagonal lattice pattern over alternate sections of the melon; now dip the stars into jelly and arrange them on the remaining sections.
Place the pink cream cheese mixture in a forcing bag fitted with a large star pipe, squeeze a large star of cheese on to the bottom of the pear or pepper and secure it to the top of the melon.
Outline the sections of the melon with stars of pink cream cheese.
Using a small, plain writing pipe and the pale yellow cream cheese, pipe dots between the lattice of anchovy fillets.
Lattice the pear or pepper, and finish it with stars of pink cream cheese.

Beat in.

Variation for boston cream pie: put layers together with vanilla or chocolate cream filling made with pudding mix, dust top layer with confectioners' sugar.
Variation for washington pie: put layers together with raspberry jam, dust top with confectioners' sugar.

title: Veal and Green Bean Stew

Add cold water and 1 teaspoon monosodium glutamate.

Wash beans; break off tips; remove strings, if any.
Break into 1-inch pieces; add to veal: cover; cook 25 minutes or until tender.
Melt butter or margarine: blend in flour, sugar, salt, and remaining monosodium glutamate.
Measure liquid from green bean mixture; add enough water to make 4 cups; add to flour mixture with vinegar.
Cook, stirring until smooth and thickened; return to green bean mixture.
Add savory, parsley, and pepper.

Top each serving with generous mound of mashed potatoes.

title: Brown Stewed Fish For Fresh Water Fish
directions: Peel and cut up the onion, brown it in the oil, put it in the stew-pan with the fish and water, and cook for half an hour.
Soak the ginger-bread in the golden syrup and vinegar ; when soft, beat it up and add the lemon-juice, pepper and salt.
Ten minutes before the fish is ready, pour this sauce on to it, and tilt the stew-pan well backwards and forwards.
Serve cold.
other_info:

Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: fish, water, onion, oil, vinegar, ginger-bread, syrup, lemon, pepper, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove

title: Lamb Gravy
directions: Place half of the drippings in a sauce-pan.
Add the four, and allow it to brown.
Add slowly the water, salt and the rest of the drippings (two tablespoonsful).
Boil one minute.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Main Dish, Sauce

Ingredient: dripping, flour, water, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, saucepan

title: Round Steak Rolls
directions: Buy round steak cut one-half inch thick.
Wipe meat with a damp cloth.
Cut into six servings.
Brown the diced bacon and chopped onions.
Spread on meat which has been seasoned with salt and pepper.
Roll, fasten with skewers.
Brown in the remaining bacon fat.
Add one-half cup water, cover, reduce heat and simmer gently for 1 hi hours.
These may be finished in a moderate oven (350f).
other_info:

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: steak, bacon, onion, salt, pepper, water

Equipment: knife, saucepan, skewer, oven

title: Cream of Tomato Soup II
directions: Boil tomatoes with all the seasonings 5 minutes, then rub through a sieve.
There should be 5 3/4 quarts liquid and pulp.
If not, add water.
Pour tomato mixture slowly into hot white sauce when ready to serve, stirring to blend well.
If white sauce is made from milk diluted with an equal quantity of chicken or meat broth, a delicious variation results.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, parsley, thyme, bay leaf, pepper, clove, onion, sugar, Thin White Sauce

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sieve, pot

title: Sturgeon Balls With Crab Supreme
directions: Make rich cream sauce with milk, capers and chives.
Add 14 sturgeon balls and crabmeat.
Heat slowly in casserole or double boller; garnish with parsley and pimiento when serving.
other_info:

(1957-07-01)

Ingredient: milk, caper, parsley, pimento, sturgeon, crab

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Radishes
directions: Wash the radishes thoroughly with a vegetable brush.
Cut off the long roots and all but one iach of green tops.
These tops make the radishes easier to handle and more attractive.
Serve in a bow! Of chopped ice.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)

Ingredient: radish, ice

Equipment: measuring cups, knife

title: Buttered Vegetables
directions: Scrape carrots and cook 1 to 2 hours.
Slice or cut in strips either before or after cooking.
Add required seasonings or serve in 1 cup white sauce.

Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)

Ingredient: turnip, water, butter, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Tomato Chowder

ingredients.name: or water to make about 3 qts soup

directions: Make like corn chowder.
Serve with crackers, or toast.
This is substantial enough for a dinner, if sliced hardcooked eggs are added just before serving, allowing one egg to a person.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, corn, lima bean, potato, salt pork, onion, stock, salt, pepper, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Whole-Wheat Butterscotch Raisin Bread
directions: Mix egg, sugar and fat and beat well together.
Mix flour, baking powder and salt together and add to egg mixture alternately with liquid.
Add raisins.
Pour into greased loaf pan and bake in moderate oven for 50 to 55 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Bureau of Home Nutrition and Home Economics


Source: Whole-wheat (Graham) Flour Recipes (1940-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, baking powder, salt, water, raisin, brown sugar, fat, whole wheat flour

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, bowl, oven, loaf pan

title: Kidney Stew II
directions: Cut kidney in small pieces and soak in water for thirty minutes.
Dice bacon and fry until light brown, then put in kidney and fry until water is cooked out.
Add about two tablespoons mustard seed, garlic salt, half a teaspoon worcestershire sauce and a sprinkle of cayenne.
When all is smooth, add water and simmer for an hour, keeping plenty of water on so that consistency is that of thick gravy.
Care must be taken not to let the flour stick to the pan.
Serve this with toast points or baking powder biscuits.
other_info:
Author: Person.John T Murray
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: kidney, garlic salt, bacon, Worcestershire sauce, mustard seed, cayenne pepper, flour

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife, stove

title: White Sauce
directions: Melt the butter in a saucepan and add the flour and salt, stirring constantly.
When well mixed add the liquid, a little at a time.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
This is far better than mixing the flour with a little of the liquid when cold, as so many people do when creaming potatoes or other things.
If the white sauce seems too thick for the purpose, thin with a little more liquid before removing from the fire.
Vegetable sauce variation: 2 tablespoon butter, 2 tablespoon flour, 1 cup milk 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Pattie sauce variation: 3 tablespoon butter, 3 tablespoon flour, 1 cup milk 1/3 teaspoon salt.
Croquette sauce variation: 3 tablespoon butter, 4 tablespoon flour, 1 cup milk 1/3 teaspoon salt.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Ingredient: flour, liquid, butter, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove

title: Boiled Fruit Pudding
directions: Sift the baking powder well through the flour, rub the butter thoroughly into this, and use cold milk enough to make a light dough.
Roll this into a square about an inch thick, and spread it with fruit, leaving a margin of an inch all around.
Wet the edges slightly, roll up and sew in a cloth which has been wrung out of hot water and well dredged with flour.
Boil or steam one hour, and serve with cream and sugar, or hard sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.Annie Caley
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, baking powder, butter, milk, fruit

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, sifter, rolling pin, steamer

title: Rockfish Salad
directions: Combine all ingredients, except lettuce, being careful not to break the fish into small pieces.
Chill.
Serve in lettuce cups.
other_info:
Author: Person.Anne Strachan
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co

(1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood

Ingredient: pepper, fish, cucumber, lemon juice, pimiento, salad dressing, onion, salt, lettuce

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: Green Tomato Meat Stew

ingredients.name: fat, beef fat may be used

directions: Boll meat in mixture of salt, pepper, and 2 tablespoons of the flour.
Brown in the fat.
Add onion; cook until lightly browned.
Pour in 2 cups of the water, cover, and simmer about 1 hour or until meat is almost tender.
Wash, remove stem ends, and quarter the tomatoes; add with potatoes, carrots, and 1 cup water to the meat.
Cover and cook until vegetables and meat are tender.
Add more water as needed.
Blend remaining 2 tablespoons flour with the 1/4 cup water; add to stew, and cook until slightly thickened.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Tomatoes On Your Table (1944-01-01)


Category: Meat, Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: chuck, onion, salt, water, pepper, green tomato, flour, fat, potato, carrot

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Hot Fudge Cake
directions: Cream the butter, add the sugar and continue creaming.
Add the egg yolks, meited chocolate, molasses, sour milk, hot water, flour, cinnamon, soda, baking powder, salt and vanilla.
Beat two minutes, and add the stiffly beaten egg whites.
Fill well-buttered muffin pans one-half full, and bake in a moderate oven for twenty-five minutes.
Serve hot as a dessert, with whipped cream.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Ingredient: butter, water, sugar, flour, egg yolk, cinnamon, chocolate, soda, baking powder, molass, salt, sour milk, vanilla, egg white

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater

title: Cream Raspberry Pie
directions: After lining a pie plate with pie crust, fill it with red raspberries.
Cover it with granulated sugar and with an upper crust, but rub the edges of both upper and lower crusts with butter, so they will not stick together.
Then when pie is baked make a cream filling with: milk, 2 tablespoons sugar, cornstarch, vanilla.
Cook this and when cool, add the whites of three eggs stiffly beaten.
Lift the sift with powdered sugar.
Upper crust of the pie and pour in this cream filling.
Replace the crust and sift with powdered sugar.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pie crust, raspberry, sugar, butter, milk, cornstarch, vanilla, egg white, powdered sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, sifter

title: Halibut Crême
directions: Remove the skin and bone from the fish, mash it up with a fork, then place it in a vegetable dish; melt the butter in a small saucepan, stir in the flour carefully, then add the milk by degrees.
When it boils remove from the fire add the salt, pepper, and nutmeg, spread this mixture over the fish and sprinkle with grated cheese, or if preferred with bread-crumbs.
Bake in the oven till brown.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cooked fish, butter, flour, milk, cheese, pepper, salt, nutmeg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, saucepan, stove, oven

title: Pissaladeira
directions: Soak anchovies in cold water two hours; clean and take off the fillets.
Pat out bread dough 1 inch thick, to fit a round pan about one foot in diameter.
Oil the pan with olive oil, lay in the dough and let it rise.

Decorate the top with onion rings, tomato slices, and cheese slices; arrange the anchovy fillets and olives attractively in the open spaces between the slices, and lay some within the onion rings and on top of the tomato slices.
Season with salt and pepper, and sprinkle generously with olive oil.
Bake in a hot oven (400f) 20 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Cora Brown


Source: European Cookbook for American Homes (1936-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: anchovy, bread dough, olive oil, olive, onion, cheese, tomato, salt, pepper

Equipment: knife, bowl, pan, oven

title: Roast Leg of Lamb with Potatoes
directions: Wash the lamb with a damp cloth.
Wipe dry and sprinkle with two teaspoons of salt.
Place the lard in a frying-pan.
Place when hot, add the lamb, and brown well on all sides.
The meat in the fireless utensil.
Sprinkle the potatoes with salt and paprika.
Arrange these about the leg of lamb.
Place the disks, heated for baking, over and under the baking pan.
Cook three hours in the fireless.
Use the drippings for gravy.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)

Equipment: measuring spoons, stove, oven, baking pan, frying pan

title: Cinnamon Waffles (Zimmet Waffles)
directions: Cream the butter and sugar.
Beat in the eggs 1 at a time and add cinnamon.
Work in enough flour to make a soft dough.
Form into small balls.
Place several in a hot waffle iron, suitably spaced, press down top and bake.
This is an old recipe which the “dutch” brought over from germany.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, waffle maker

title: Corn Fritters II
directions: Beat the egg yolks and add the flour, salt and a little pepper.
Add the corn and fold in the stiffly beaten egg whites.
Drop small spoonfuls on greased griddle or frying pan.
Do not cook too fast.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc

title: Pork Pot Pie with Dumplings
directions: Boil the pork chops in water for 1/2 hour.
Then add the potatoes cut in half and the sausage cut in 1 inch pieces.
Cook until potatoes are almost done.
Drop well-beaten dumpling dough into the boiling meat mixture, cover and cook 10 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pork, potato, sausage, dumpling

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Alumnae Taffy
directions: Put sugar and water in a saucepan, and when the mixture comes to a boil add the melted butter and ginger.
Boil without stirring until the taffy hardens quickly in cold water.
Remove from fire and place in buttered tins to cool.
Vanilla, or other flavoring, may be used instead of ginger, and nuts may be added, if desired.
other_info:

Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: brown sugar, water, ginger

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, saucepan

title: Seafood Dip Ã  la Bread Basket
directions: Mix seasonings in sour cream and fold in seafoods.
Hollow out a loaf of bread after cutting off top of loaf and toast in slow oven until lightly toasted.
Place chilled mixture in hollow loaf and add top of loaf for lid.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs H R Kuratli
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co

Ingredient: sour cream, mustard, horseradish, onion soup, lemon juice, salt, shrimp, crab

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: Grapefruit Sunflowers
directions: Remove the skin from a grapefruit and cut the sections of fruit into thin slices.
Arrange these round the sides of the glasses to form petals.
Over the bottom of the glasses arrange some slices of preserved ginger, and place half a black grape in the centre.
Chill before serving.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: grapefruit, ginger, grape

Equipment: knife, peeler

title: Cucumber Pickles II
directions: Take cucumbers; add salt and enough boiling water to cover and let stand over night.
In morning drain; take equal parts of water and vinegar, pour over cucumbers and bring to the boiling point, remove from stove and allow to stand 12 hours more.
Then drain again, and cover with fresh vinegar without water and let come to the boiling point; add stick cinnamon and sugar to taste and bottle while hot.
The day before using boil bunches of raisins in vinegar and sugar; let stand 12 hours in the syrup and serve with the pickles.
other_info:
Author: Person.Helen Parker Headden, Person.Katherine Newsbury, Organization.Denver Gas and Electric Co

Ingredient: cucumber, salt, water, vinegar, cinnamon, sugar, raisin, pickle

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Tomato Rabbit

ingredients.name: cup fresh or canned (No. 2 can) tomatoes

directions: Cook together celery.
Green pepper, and onion in the fat, 8 to 10 minutes, stirring frequently.
Blend in the flour.
Add tomatoes, cheese, and salt.
Cook over low heal; stir constantly until mixture thickens and cheese melts.
Gradually add some of the tomato mixture to beaten eggs; mix well, then pour all back into the tomato mixture.
Continue to cook over low heat; stir constantly until thickened and creamy (2 to 3 minutes).
If desired, add a few dashes of tabasco sauce.
Serve on toast or crackers.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Tomatoes On Your Table (1944-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Lemon Cake Filling
directions: Cream snowdrift with butter, salt and lemon rind, add sugar, alternately with lemon juice.
Fill and frost cake.
Sprinkle nuts on top.

Author: Person.Elah Miles
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven, baking pan

title: 1000 Island Dressing
directions: Mix all ingredients together.
Add to 1000 island potato salad.

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: boiled dressing, mayonnaise, ketchup, relish, olive, egg, salt, pepper, paprika

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, knife

title: Ginger Cookies
directions: Cream shortening and sugar thoroughly.
Add egg and molasses.
Beat well.
Add vinegar to evaporated milk, then pour into first mixture.
Blend well.
Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with other dry ingredients into first mixture.
Drop from teaspoon onto greased baking sheets.
Bake in a moderate oven (375f) about 15 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: shortening, sugar, egg, molass, vinegar, evaporated milk, flour, baking soda, salt, ginger, cinnamon

Equipment: oven, egg beater, baking sheet, measuring spoons, measuring cups, sifter

title: Tomato Salad
directions: Two or three hours before meal time peel 5 tomatoes, 1 cucumber, 1 onion, and place them on the ice.
Just before the meal is served, slice and arrange on a platter trimmed with lettuce or parsley.
Pour over them this dressing : mix thoroughly in a bowl 3 tablespoonfuls of oil, 1 teaspoonful of salt, 1/2 teaspoonful of curry powder, and, last, 1 tablespoonful of vinegar.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mary Stirling
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1893-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, cucumber, onion, oil, salt, curry powder, vinegar

Equipment: knife, bowl

title: Currant Jelly
directions: Pick over currants, but do not remove the stems.
Wash and drain.
Mash a few with a vegetable masher in the bottom of a porcelain-lined or granite kettle.
Add more currants and mash.
Continue adding currants until all are used.
Bring to a boil slowly and let simmer without stirring until the currants appear white.
Strain through a coarse strainer, and allow juice to drain through a jelly bag.
Measure the juice, and boil ten minutes.
Gradually add an equal amount of heated sugar, stirring occasionally to prevent burning, and continue boiling until the test shows that the mixture has jelled.
When filling sterilized glasses, place them in a pan containing a little boiling water.
This keeps the glasses from breaking when hot jelly is poured in.
Fill and set the glasses of jelly aside to cool.
Cover with hot melted paraffin.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: currant, sugar

Equipment: strainer, stove, pot

title: Walnut Stew
directions: Proceed as for hash, but when heating the meat, add 2 pickled walnuts cut up small, and a little of the liquor, and garnish with 6 or 8 walnuts instead of toast.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)
