Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: walnut

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: Gin Ricky
directions: Mix together the gin and lemon juice, pour the mixture over the ice chips and fill up with soda water.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: gin, lemon juice, ice, soda water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Faarikaal (Mutton Stew with Cabbage)
directions: Brown meat in butter.
Add about 2 cups of water and seasonings.
Cover and simmer until nearly done.
Add cabbage cut into eighths and cook until done.
The broth may be thickened with flour for gravy.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Coon Prairie Church


Source: Country Coon Prairie Church Preservation Kokk Bok (1986-01-01)


Category: Meat, Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: mutton, butter, cabbage, pepper, salt, water

Equipment: measuring cups, saucepan, stove, knife

title: Tea
directions: Scald an earthen or agate teapot, put in the tea, pour over it the boiling water; let stand on back of stove 5 minutes and serve.
Never boil tea nor use a tin teapot, as the action of the tannin is thereby increased.
A tea ball containing the tea may be suspended in the teapot and the boiling water poured over it.
Russian tea variation: follow directions for "tea" and put a slice of lemon and 2 teaspoons sugar in each cup when serving.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, tea

Equipment: teapot, stove, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Corn Pudding For A Vegetable
directions: Grate corn; beat eggs with a spoon and mix all ingredients together.
Butter deep earthen dish and pour mixture into it.
Bake slowly 2 hours.
When corn is old it will take 1 quart milk; when young, 1 pint.
other_info:
Author: Person.Miss Hunter
Contributor: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn, egg, milk, salt, sugar

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, grater

title: Rice Soup
directions: Throw the rice into boiling water and let it remain five minutes, then pour it into a sieve and allow it to drain well.
Now add it to the stock boiling and stew till quite tender, season to taste and serve quickly.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.W Drysdale & Co


Source: Cookery for the Million (1877-01-01)


Category: Soup, Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: rice, stock, salt, cayenne pepper, mace

Equipment: measuring cups, stove, pot, sieve

title: Zitny Chleb (Rye Bread)
directions: In the evening make a thin sponge using 1 1/2 cups water, fresh yeast or 2 pkgs of the dry yeast softened in 1/2 cup warm water, rye flour, white flour, and caraway seed.
Let rise overnight or for at least 4 to 5 hours.
Then add brown sugar, lard, salt, 1 cup water, 2 cups rye flour and about 2 1/2 cups white flour.
Mix and knead well for 15 minutes or more.
Grease crock and let rise until double in bulk, punch down and let rise again, cut into 2 portions and form into loaves.
Let set 10 minutes and reform loaves slightly to give a smooth appearance.
Place in greased loaf pans with seams down.
Grease bread.
Let rise until doubled in bulk.
Then bake in 375f oven for 20 minutes and then reduce to 360f for 40 minutes or until done.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, yeast, rye flour, flour, caraway seed, brown sugar, lard, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven

title: Curried Fish
directions: Peel and cut up the onions and apple, or rhubarb ; fry till brown in hot butter.

Add the curry powder, flour, salt and pepper, and stir the water or fish-liquor in gradually ; boil this all up and simmer gently for half-an hour, then add the lemon-juice or vinegar ; strain, and return to the saucepan with the fish cut into neat pieces to get thoroughly hot.
Serve the curry in a border of boiled rice.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cooked fish, apple, butter, onion, water, curry powder, flour, lemon juice, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Roast Sheeps' Hearts
directions: Put the hearts into boiling water for a few minutes.
Meanwhile make the stuffing as follows:â€”chop the suet, mix with the herbs, bread-crumbs, lemon-rind, pepper, salt and beaten egg.
Take the hearts out of the water, dry them, stuff them, skewer them up, flour them, put them in a saucepan with a little dripping, baste occasionally, and turn them over.
When done pour a little stock into the saucepan, stir it well, boil it up, and pour over the hearts.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sheep heart, dripping, suet, herb, bread crumb, lemon rind, egg, pepper, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, saucepan

title: Cream Fudge
directions: Boil together until a soft ball forms when tried in cold water, take from fire and beat well with a wooden spoon until creamy looking and thick—pour on to a buttered dish.
Dust before it is cold mark into squares and when it is quite cold break into pieces.
other_info:
Author: Person.Gloria Swanson
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: brown sugar, cream

Equipment: egg beater, stove, oven

title: Hampton Corn Bread
directions: Make a sponge of the flour and 1 cup of the water, add yeast cake dissolved in 1/4 cu water.
Let stand until light, which should be within an hour.
Add the remaining ingredients.
Mix thoroughly.
The mixture should be a little too soft to shape into loaves.
Spread in shallow baking pan to a depth of one inch.
Let rise an hour and bake thirty minutes in hot oven.
Notice that the bread is put into the baking pans as soon as meal is added to the sponge, without waiting for it to become light.
other_info:
Author: Person.Edith Church, Person.Bertina A Leete


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bread flour, white meal, water, yeast cake, salt, shortening, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, baking pan, bowl

title: Rice and Peach Pudding
directions: Cook rice in the water over boiling water.
Add milk as rice thickens, and continue cooking 30 minutes.
Beat eggs, add sugar and stir quickly and carefully into rice mixture.
Place alternate layers of rice and peaches in a buttered linking dish.
Bake 20 minutes in a moderate oven (350f).
Serve with peach sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mabelle S. Ehlers, Person.Florence J. Atwood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: rice, water, evaporated milk, egg, sugar, peach

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, pot

title: Smoked Salmon Roll-Ups
directions: Drain salmon and flake finely.
Add horseradish, lemon juice, onion, mayonnaise, salad dressing, and pepper and blend into a paste.
Prepare pastry according to directions on package.
Divide in half and roll halves into very thin circles about 9 inches in diameter.
Spread pastry circles with salmon mixture and cut each circle into 16 wedge-shaped pieces.
Roll each wedge, starting with wide end and rolling to point.
Bake on greased baking sheet in hot oven (425 degrees) for 15 minutes or until light brown.
Remove from oven, sprinkle with paprika and serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs Arthur Paquet
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co


Source: Savory Seafoods of Oregon (1957-07-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, rolling pin, baking sheet, oven

title: Barley Soup II
directions: Prepare the vegetables, put them with the other ingredients into a saucepan, and simmer gently for 3 or 4 hours.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, barley, onion, carrot, parsley, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, saucepan, pot, sieve, stove

title: Lemon Pie
directions: Mix sugar, cornstarch and salt in top of double boiler, add boiling water slowly and stir.
Cook over the fire until boiling point is reached.
Place over hot water and cook 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Mix butter and stir.
Grated rind and juice of lemon and egg yolks, slightly beaten.
Add cook two minutes.
Cool and turn into a cooked pastry crust.
Spread meringue and bake 8 minutes in moderate oven.
other_info:

Ingredient: sugar, lemon, cornstarch, salt, egg yolk, water, butter, pastry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, grater, oven, egg beater, stove

title: Curry
directions: Peel and cut up the onion and apple, and cut the meat into neat slices ; fry the vegetables brown in the dripping, add the curry powder, flour, salt and pepper, and stir the water into it gradually.
Let it boil, and then simmer for 1/2 hour with the lid off.
Add the meat, heat it through, but do not let it boil.
Serve in a ring of boiled rice.

Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Clam Chowder III
directions: Fry diced bacon and chopped onion together.
Add clam liquor, water and diced potatoes.
Cook until tender.
Add clams and milk.
Thicken with butter and flour creamed together.
Pour chowder over crackers and sprinkle with chopped parsley.
other_info:
Author: Person.John Gilbert
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)

Ingredient: clam, butter, water, flour, potato, parsley, bacon, salt, onion, cracker, milk, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove

title: Overnight Salad
directions: Cook egg yolks, salt, mustard, and lemon juice until thick.
Cool.
Whip the cream and add to above.
Add the pineapple, cherries and marshmallows.
Refrigerate overnight.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg yolk, salt, mustard, lemon juice, whipping cream, pineapple, cherry, marshmallow

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, refrigerator

title: Crumb Topping
directions: Combine ingredients.
Blend thoroughly.
Sprinkle over apples in apple coffee cake.
Bake as in apple coffee cake directions.

Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, flour, cinnamon, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl

title: Orange Ice
directions: Boil water and sugar together ten minutes.
Add gelatine which has been softened with two tablespoons of cold water.
Allow mixture to cool on ice.
Add beaten whites of eggs, the grated orange rind, the juice of the orange and the juice of the lemon.
Freeze in ice cream freezer.
other_info:
Author: Person.Carmel Myers
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, egg white, sugar, orange, lemon, gelatine

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, grater, egg beater, stove, freezer

title: Cheese and Corn in Peppers
directions: Add part of cheese to corn and sprinkle with salt, pepper and paprika.
Beat in the yolks of 2 eggs.
Then fold in the stiffly beaten whites.
Remove the tops of the peppers; scoop out the seeds and fill with the mixture.
Sprinkle more grated cheese and the bread-crumbs on top and bake in a hot oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn, cheese, egg, green pepper, bread crumb, salt, pepper, paprika

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, baking pan

title: Egg Balls for Soup
directions: Rub the yolks of three or four hard boiled eggs to a smooth paste and salt.
To these add two raw ones lightly beaten.
Add enough flour to hold the paste together.
Make into balls with floured hands and set in cool place until just before your soup comes off.
Put the balls carefully into the soup and boil one minute.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, salt, flour

title: Hog Maw
directions: Clean stomach well and soak in salt water.
Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Stuff the stomach with the mixture and sew up the opening.
Simmer for 2 hours in a large kettle with water to cover.
Remove to baking pan with hot fat, brown in hot oven (400f) basting frequently.
Slice with sharp knife.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: stomach, bread crumb, sausage, onion, celery, potato, parsley, apple, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, baking dish

title: Flaky Pastry
directions: Divide the fat into three equal portions, rub one part into the flour in the usual way, add a pinch of salt and mix to a stiff paste with cold water.
Roll out into a long narrow strip, rolling backwards and forwards only.
Spread the second portion of fat evenly over the paste, fold into three and turn with the rough edges towards you.
Roll out again and proceed in the same way.
Fold over and roll to required shape.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, rolling pin

title: White Fruit Cake II
directions: Cream the butter, add sugar gradually, and beat thoroughly, then add milk, fruit soaked in brandy and flour mixed with baking powder.
Have oven temperature 250f.
Bake 3 hours.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Denver Gas and Electric Co, Person.Katherine Newsbury, Person.Helen Parker Headden


Source: A Book of Hints on the Art of Cooking (1907-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, almond, brandy, milk, sugar, coconut, wine, egg white, flour, pineapple, raisin, salt, baking powder, citron

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven

title: White Bread Loaf
directions: Scald milk; stir in sugar, salt, and shortening; stir until sugar dissolves; cool to lukewarm.
Sprinkle yeast on water; stir till dissolved.
Add milk mixture.
Stir in 3 cups of the flour; beat till smooth.
Stir in remaining flour.
Turn out on a lightly floured board.
Knead: fold dough over toward you.
Press down away from you with the heel of your hand.
Give dough a quarter turn.
Continue until dough is smooth and elastic, and does not stick to the board.
Place in a greased bowl; brush top with melted shortening.
Cover with a damp cloth; let rise in warm place 80Â° to 85Â° until doubled in bulk (about 1 hour).
Punch down: turn out on lightly floured board.
Divide dough in half.
Shape into 2 loaves: place in greased loaf pans, 8 by 4 by 3 inches.
Cover with a damp cloth: let rise in a warm place 80f to 85f until center of dough is slightly higher than the edges of the pans, about 1 hour.
Meanwhile set oven for hot, 400f.
Bake 50 minutes to 1 hour.
Remove from pans immediately and cool on a rack.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Bread, Breakfast

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: milk, sugar, salt, shortening, yeast, water, flour

Equipment: oven, pot, egg beater, board, bowl, brush, loaf pan, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Split-Pea Soup
directions: Pick over and wash the vegetable and soak several hours or overnight.
Drain and add measured water and small onion, with a 2-inch cube of salt pork if desired.
Cook gently 5 or 6 hours until liquid is reduced one half.
Remove salt pork and rub vegetable through a strainer to remove skins.
Melt butter, add flour and enough stock to make mixture thin enough to pour.
Add to rest of stock, stir until it boils, season, and serve.
Milk may be added or not.
If used, it may be mixed with butter and flour as for white sauce.
If too thick, soup may be thinned with milk or water, and water must be added if it boils away.
Variations: lima-bean soup, kidney-bean soup, black-bean soup (add 2 hard-cooked eggs and lemon, thinly sliced before serving), lentil soup.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Soup, Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pea, water, milk, flour, butter, salt, pepper, onion

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sieve, pot, knife, baking pan

title: Pineapple Trifle
directions: Cook pineapple juice, sugar and eggs in double boiler until mixture thickens.
Set aside to chill.
Just before serving, whip cream and add.
Cut fruit in small pieces—you may use oranges, pineapple, strawberries or any fruits and berries in season.
Chill fruit and mix with trifle.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bessie Love
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pineapple juice, egg, sugar, cream, fruit

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife, egg beater, stove, refrigerator

title: Hopping John with Pinto or Great Northern Beans
directions: Wash the beans well and soak overnight in water to cover.
In the morning add 2 cups more water.
And cook until tender.
Fry the salt pork until crisp remove from the fat and add to the beans.
Brown the onion in the salt pork fat.
Mix all the ingredients, and add salt and pepper to taste.
Continue cooking for 10 minutes.
And serve at once.
other_info:

Source: Pinto and Great Northern beans are a valuable food (1940-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, frying pan, knife, stove

title: Peanut Biscuit
directions: Mix and bake.

Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn meal, salt, peanut, baking powder, flour, shortening, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven

title: Big Walnut 12 Cake Part 2

ingredients.name: cup milk, or half and half

directions: First prepare dough from part 1.
Grind walnuts in food chopper with finest blade.
Melt butter in large saucepan and add milk, sugar and honey.
Then cook to rolling boil, taking care not to let it boil over.
Pour hot mixture over walnuts and then add vanilla and grated peel.
Mix thoroughly and allow to cool.
Beat egg whites till stiff, fold into cooled walnut mixture.
Punch down dough, on slightly floured surface roll.
Spread on the filling all over the dough.
Roll up jelly-roll fashion and place the loaf into the pan.
Let loaf rise until almost doubled (around 30 minutes).
Meanwhile start heating the oven to 190c.
Brush the top of the loaf with melted butter bake the loaf for 35 min when done, remove from the pan.
Lay upside down on rack to cool completely.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Oracle Ace, Person.Matjz & Eva


Source: ACE Cookbook (2013-02-23)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: walnut, butter, milk, sugar, honey, vanilla, lemon peel, egg white, cinnamon

Equipment: mixer, oven, food processor, measuring spoons, measuring cups, bowl, egg beater, cake pan

title: Cottage Pudding
directions: Mix flour, baking powder and salt and sift twice.
Cream butter until soft; add sugar gradually, beating until light.
Beat in the egg and flavoring.
Add flour mixing alternately with the milk, beating smooth after each addition.
Turn into a buttered square tin (8 x 8 x 2 inches).
Bake in moderate oven (350f) for about 40 minutes.
Serve with butterscotch or orange sauce.
It’s delicious covered with crushed berries or other fruits.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, sugar, baking powder, egg, lemon extract, salt, butter, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, sifter

title: Russian Salad
directions: Take equal quantities of carrots, turnips, french beans, haricot beans, cauliflower, green peas, potatoes, beetroot and celery, or any other vegetables that may be in season- boil till tender: the carrots and turnips together, the french beans and green peas together, the haricot beans (which must have been soaked overnight), cauliflower, and potatoes all separately.
When cold, cut all the vegetables into neat pieces.
Mix all well together, with some mayonnaise sauce, turn into a basin or mould.
When required, turn the salad on to a dish, and pour mayonnaise sauce over it.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: carrot, turnip, bean, cauliflower, green pea, potato, beet, celery

Equipment: knife, pot, stove

title: Apple Sauce Cake

ingredients.name: mixed, chopped raisins, nut meats, and dates

directions: Cream the butter, add the sugar gradually.
Stir well.
Add the well-beaten egg.
Mix the soda and apple-sauce, and add to the first ingredients.
Aliternately with the flour and spices, add the vanilla and fruit.
Beat for two minutes.
Turn into a square pan, and sift granulated sugar over the top.
Bake in a moderate oven one-half hour.

Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, sifter

title: Grape Nut Pudding
directions: Pour boiling water over grapenuts.
Set aside to cool.
Beat yolks of eggs with sugar, spices and butter.
Then add nut meats, raisins and dates.
Mix all with grapenuts.
Lastly fold in the beaten whites of eggs to which salt has been added.
Bake in moderate oven twenty-five minutes.
Serve with whipped cream.

title: Rhubarb-Orange Pie

ingredients.name: grate rind and squeeze juice of 1/2

directions: Make pastry and line pie plate and roll dough for top strips.
In the bowl used for making pastry, combine rhubarb, orange juice and rind, and sugar with cornstarch blended in.
Place rhubarb mixture into pie plate.
Using the same bowl, put in eggs and beat until slightly thickened.
Pour over rhubarb mixture.
Cover with pastry strips.
Bake 10 minutes in 425f oven and reduce heat to 325f for 35 min.
Cool before serving.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, rolling pin, egg beater, oven

title: Mutton Cutlets

ingredients.name: best end of a neck of mutton

directions: Saw off the upper rib bones, leaving the bones which will form the cutlets about three inches long.
Cut off each cutlet, trim neatly, scraping off the fat.
Dip each one in the egg, which has been well beaten, sprinkle with bread-crumbs, and fry a golden brown in hot fat or oil.
Arrange on a hot dish round mashed potatoes or other vegetables.

title: Dormers
directions: Chop the meat, suet and rice fine, and mix with pepper and salt; roll like sausages in egg and breadcrumbs, and fry in dripping till brown.
Serve in a dish with mashed potatoes round them, and pour on some hot gravy.

May be cut in cubes before cooking and served in a white sauce.

title: Batter Cakes
directions: Add flour to thick cream to make a stiff batter.
Beat thoroughly.
Add beaten yolks of two eggs and baking soda.
Mix well, salting slightly.
Toss in beaten whites and bake on a griddle.

title: Lemon Chiffon Pie
directions: Dissolve gelatin in boiling water; add sugar, lemon juice and grated peel.
Fold in whipped evaporated milk (see recipe).
Spoon into crumb crust.
Chill until set.

title: Tea Punch
directions: Pour the boiling water over the black tea, allow to steep with the shavings of lemon rind a few minutes, strain, add sugar and fruit juice, cool.
Then strain again, pour in claret, and dilute with ice water.

directions: Add potatoes to white sauce immediately after milk is stirred in.
Continue cooking over boiling water until sauce is thickened and potatoes are hot.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot

title: Brown Stewed Fish For Salmon and Other Rich Fish
directions: Stew a crust of bread and the onions in the porter when tender, take out the crust, and put in the fish with the spice, lemon-juice, vinegar, pepper and salt.
When the fish is nearly cooked, add the treacle gradually, cook 3 minutes, and serve cold with slices of lemon between bunches of scraped horse-radish.

directions: Melt the fat, add the ham, herbs, seasoning and egg yolk, and heat.
Pile on the toast, and garnish with walnut.

title: Onion Soup
directions: Cook onions in fat until lightly brown.
Sprinkle with flour and stir.
Add meat broth, made by cooking a soup bone in water, and stir until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper and simmer until the onions are tender and flavor well blended.
Serve in bowls with a slice of toast in each.
If you have dry cheese on hand, grate a little over the toast.

title: Peach Sherbet
directions: Boil the sugar and water twenty minutes; let cool, add the frnit juice and freeze.
Serve with slices of fruit.

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, peach, sugar, orange, lemon

Equipment: measuring cups, knife, stove, refrigerator

title: Papa's Pudding
directions: Put into a bag, allowing sufficient room to swell, and boil 3 hours.
Make a sauce to eat with it, according to taste.
We use beaten butter and sugar flavored with vanilla.
other_info:
Author: Person.Ella Murdoch
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School

Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: molass, beef suet, milk, raisin, currant, baking powder

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, pot

title: Walnut Rocks
directions: Cream butter and sugar and add the beaten eggs.
Dissolve soda in the hot water and add to the creamed mixture.
Sift flour, salt and spices twice and add half of it to mixture and mix thoroughly.
Combine chopped raisins and nuts with the other half and add to the dough.
Mix thoroughly and drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased baking sheets spaced a couple of inches apart.
Bake in moderate oven (350-f) for 12 to 15 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, salt, brown sugar, cinnamon, egg, clove, soda, raisin, water, walnut, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, baking sheet, egg beater

title: Temperance Mince-Meat
directions: Boil the beef till very tender, set it away for a day or more to be perfectly dry and cold, then chop it so fine that it becomes mealy when rubbed in the hands.
Remove from the suet all stringy substances, chop it fine and mix with the meat.
Now add all the other ingredients.
This dry mixture will keep all winter in an air-tight jar.
When ready to make pies, add chopped apples and sugar to taste, and for moistening take equal parts of new orleans molasses and best cider vinegar (diluted with water and a little sugar).
other_info:
Author: Person.Eliza A Fischer
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef, beef suet, clove, nutmeg, lemon peel, citron, raisin, currant

Equipment: oven, knife, pie pan, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Gravy
directions: Loosen the pieces of chicken which have stuck to the frying pan, add the butter, stir constantly until the butter “bubbles,” add the flour, salt and paprika.
Mix thoroughly.
Add the milk slowly, cook for two minutes, add the chopped parsley and pour the gravy into a gravy bowl for serving.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: fat, salt, butter, paprika, , milk, parsley

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove

title: Blitz Torte - Custard Filling
directions: Prepare torte layers.
To prepare custard, combine sugar, flour and salt.
Gradually stir in milk.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly till bubbly.
Cook and stir two more minutes.
Remove from heat, stir small amount of hot mixture into egg.
Immediately return to hot mixture.
Cook one minute stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and add vanilla.
Cool well.
Spread filling over bottom torte layer, and top with almond-sprinkled layer.

title: Shrimp and Macaroni Salad
directions: Cook macaroni in water.
Drain.
Combine with peas.
Add shrimp, celery and pimento.
Mix with mayonnaise and horseradish.
Sprinkle paprika on top.
Refrigerate before serving.

title: Manhattan Special
directions: Stir well, strain into glasses and serve with a piece of orange or lemon peel on top.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, tumbler, strainer

title: Onion Soup II
directions: Slice the onions and fry them slowly in butter in an iron skillet until they are soft and brown.
Add the beef bouillon and allow to simmer for about ten minutes.
Place squares of dry toast, sprinkled with parmesan cheese in the bottom of each soup plate.

Equipment: knife, stove, pot

title: Potato Biscuit

ingredients.name: white flour, or enough to make a soft dough

directions: Cut out; let stand 1 hour; bake about 15 minutes.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, dutch oven

title: Cole Slaw III
directions: Toss vegetables in a bowl, vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper just before serving add dressing made by stirring into mayonnaise.

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cabbage, onion, carrot, green pepper, mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, bowl

title: Baked Apples
directions: Select apples of uniform size.
Wash and core.
Place in a pan, cover the bottom with water.
Fill each cavity with sugar, a dash of powdered cinnamon and a tiny lump of butter.
Bake for thirty minutes, basting occasionally.
Serve around the platter of pork chops.

Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, water, sugar, cinnamon, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven

title: Cranberry Jelly
directions: Cook berries with the water for 15 min.
Strain, rubbing as much as possible through sieve, add sugar, cook 5 minutes, and pour into a mold or glasses.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cranberry, sugar, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, sieve

title: Potted Red Cabbage
directions: Cut cabbage into small pieces.
The onion must be finely chopped.
Put the bacon fat into a heavy pot and when hot add the chopped onion.
Then put in the chopped red-ca bage and cook for 30 minutes, without water.
Add the apples which have been cut up small, the lemon juice and sugar.
Season to taste and cook for another 30 minutes, turning it occasionally with spoon.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: cabbage, apple, bacon, lemon juice, onion, sugar, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Carrot, Apple, and Lemon Salad
directions: Put lemon through the food chopper, rind and all.
Mix lemon, sugar and salt together.
Wash apples, do not peel, out into 1/2 inch cubes.
Mix together lightly the shredded carrots, apples and lemon mixture.
Serve from a bowl or place a generous spoonful on salad greens on salad plates.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: carrot, apple, lemon, sugar, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, bowl, peeler

title: Potato Doughnuts
directions: Beat mashed potatoes, add melted shortening, beaten eggs and milk.
Sift dry ingredients together and add to the liquid.
Dough should be soft yet firm enough to roll.
Separate dough into 2 parts and roll each out to thickness of 3/4 inch.
Cut with doughnut cutter and cook in deep fat (365f) fry to golden brown.
Drain on absorbent paper.
Dust with powdered sugar or sugar and cinnamon mixture.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, flour, egg, shortening, potato, salt, milk, nutmeg, baking powder

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, rolling pin, egg beater, pot, stove

title: Sausage and Rice
directions: Wash and drain the rice well, put it in a saucepan with the saffron and boiling water.
Skin the sausage, place it on the top of the rice, and simmer very gently till the rice swells and soaks up all the water.
Serve the sausage in a ring of rice.
Sausage cooked alone should simmer about 20 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Meat, Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sausage, rice, water, saffron

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, saucepan, stove, knife

title: Molasses Walnut Cookies
directions: Mix and sift flour, salt, and baking soda; set aside.
Beat shortening until creamy; add sugar gradually; continue beating until light.
Stir in molasses and water.
Add eggs; beat well.
Add flour mixture and nuts to egg mixture: mix well.
Cover; chill 2 hours.
Set oven for hot, 400f.
Drop dough by tablespoons on greased baking sheets, about 2 inches apart.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1939-02-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, salt, baking soda, shortening, brown sugar, molass, water, egg, walnut

Equipment: oven, egg beater, measuring spoons, measuring cups, refrigerator, baking sheet

title: Apple Fritters II
directions: Peel and core 3 large apples, cut them into slices half an inch thick, put them in a dish with the sugar and brandy, cover with another dish, and leave them 2 hours.

In a separate basin mix the flour with the oil salt, and sufficient tepid water to make a batter the thickness of cream, avoiding lumps cover the basin, and let the batter stand 2 hours then add the well-beaten white of egg to the batter, dry the slices of apple on a cloth, dip each piece in the batter, so that it is quite covered, and fry in hot fat or oil serve with powdered sugar.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, brandy, loaf sugar, flour, salad oil, salt, water, egg white

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Apple Coffee Cake
directions: Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, cinnamon into mixing bowl.
Cut in shortening.
Combine egg, milk and vinegar.
Blend thoroughly.
Add to flour mixture.
Mix lightly until flour is moistened.
Pour into well-oiled 9-inch baking dish.
Arrange apples on batter.
Sprinkle with crumb topping.
Bake in moderate oven 400f, 30 minutes, or until apples are done.
other_info:
Author: Person.Claire V Pulliam
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, cinnamon, sugar, egg, baking soda, milk, salt, vinegar, vegetable shortening, apple

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, bowl, oven

title: Indian Pudding The 'Champion'
directions: Stir cornmeal into boiling milk and let stand until lukewarm.
Mix salt, melted butter, sugar, raisins and well beaten eggs into the batter.
Stir thoroughly and bake 1 1/2 hours.
Eat with cream or hard sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.Marian Ash
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn meal, milk, salt, butter, sugar, raisin, egg

Equipment: bowl, measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven

title: Smetanove Mechurinky (Cream Puffs)
directions: Add the butter to the hot water and bring to boiling point.
Add flour and salt all at one time.
Stir rapidly and constantly until the paste leaves the sides of the pan.
Remove from the fire and when cool add the eggs one at a time, beating until thoroughly blended with the paste mixture.
Drop by spoonfuls on a greased baking sheet about two inches apart or bake in muffin pans.
During baking, the dough expands to twice or more its original size.
Bake in a hot oven 425 degrees until puffed and golden brown for 25 minutes.
When cool slit the side, fill with whipped cream, crushed fruit, or custard.
If desired, sprinkle the top with powdered sugar.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, water, flour, egg, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pan, stove, baking sheet, oven

title: Oatmeal Muffins
directions: Cook oatmeal, using one part oatmeal to two parts water.
A larger proportion of water makes gummy muffins.
Mix milk, oatmeal, egg, and melted shortening.
Add dry ingredients after sifting them together.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes, Ten Lessons On Food Conservation (1918-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove, oven

title: Zanzibar
directions: Shake well with the ice, and strain into glasses.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, Cointreau, brandy, orange bitter, vermouth, lemon juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, shaker, strainer

title: Black Bean Soup
directions: Soak overnight 1 pint of black beans.
In the morning put them on to oil in 2 quarts cold water.
Simmer about 5 hours, adding more cold water as it boils away (about 1/2 cupful every 1/2 hour), so there will still be 2 quarts when done.
Rub through a strainer, put on to boil again ; add 2 teaspoonfuls of salt, 1 saltspoonful each of pepper and mustard, and a pinch of cayenne.
As soon as it boils, thicken with 1 tablespoonful of flour and 1 tablespoonful of butter, which have been cooked together.
Add more seasoning if required.
Slice a lemon and 2 hard-boiled eggs in a tureen, and pour the soup over them.
other_info:
Author: Person.Minnie Murdoch
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: black bean, water, salt, cayenne pepper, pepper, mustard, flour, butter

Equipment: strainer, tureen, measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Christmas Salad

ingredients.name: strawberry, raspberry, or cherry flavored gelatin

directions: Dissolve red gelatin in hot water; add drained cherry juice and enough water to make 1 cup.
Pour into mold and add cherries when partially set.
Dissolve green gelatin in hot water; add juice and water.
Chill in pan until it begins to thicken.
Add remaining ingredients and pour on top of firm red layer.
Chill until set.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club
Contributor: Person.Sharon Athrop


Source: Stout's Favorites (2020-03-07)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: gelatin, water, cherry juice, cherry, pineapple juice, pineapple, celery, mayonnaise

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, mold, refrigerator

title: Belsnickel Christmas Cakes
directions: Pour melted butter over sugar in a bowl and beat until smooth and creamy.
Add the eggs, beating one at a time, into the mixture.
Sift the baking soda through the flour add the salt and add to the cake mixture.
Stand the dough in a cold place for an hour.
Roll out on floured board, quite thin.
Cut into small rounds or other shapes.
Sprinkle with sugar and bake in hot oven (400f) for 10 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, flour, egg, butter, baking soda, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, baking sheet, egg beater, rolling pin

title: Corn on the Cob
directions: Carefully remove husks and all silk from the corn.
Cover with boiling water.
Cook ten minutes, or longer if the corn is old.
If salt is added to water, it turns the corn yellow and toughens the husks.
Very tender young corn needs little cooking.
Salt may be added (one teaspoon to a quart of water) two minutes before removing from the fire.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn

Equipment: stove

title: Mango Pudding
directions: Puree the mangoes in a blender.
Transfer to a bowl.
Pour the evaporated mile onto the mango puree, and the sugar and mix well in a separate bowl, pour in hot water and add the gelatin (and not the other way around or you will get lumpy bits).
Quickly stir until all the gelatin granules have dissolved and add to the pureed mangoes and mix well.
Ladle the mixer into 4 dishes.
Place on a tray and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
When ready to serve, briefly put the dishes in a baking pan filled with 1 in of hot water to help loosen the pudding.
Use a flat knife to run around the edges of the pudding.
Place a plate on top of the dish and quickly invert it - the pudding should fall onto the plate.
Squeeze over lime juice, dust with powdered sugar and decorate with lime zest and sprig of mint.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Oracle Ace


Source: ACE Cookbook (2013-02-23)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: mango, evaporated milk, sugar, water, gelatin, lime juice, powdered sugar, mint

Equipment: blender, measuring spoons, measuring cups, bowl, baking pan, knife

title: Good, Quick Cake
directions: Sift all dry cake ingredients.
Soften butter.
Put dry ingredients into bowl, then add butter, milk and vanilla.
Beat 2 minutes on low speed of mixer.
Add eggs and beat two more minutes.
For icing, mix and cover with coconut.
other_info:
Author: Person.Claudia Biggs
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, sugar, baking powder, soda, salt, butter, buttermilk, vanilla, egg, Karo-white, egg white, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, bowl, egg beater, oven

title: Rice Bavarian Cream
directions: Wash rice.
Add rice and salt to the boiling water.
Boil until tender, about 25 minutes.
Drain and rinse.
Combine pineapple, sugar, orange juice, lemon juice and orange rind with the rice.
Soften the gelatin in the cold water and dissolve over boiling water.
Add to the rice mixture.
Cool.
When the rice mixture begins to thicken, fold in the evaporated milk which has been thoroughly chilled and whipped stiff.
Chill until firm.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: rice, water, salt, pineapple, sugar, orange juice, lemon juice, orange rind, gelatin, evaporated milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, egg beater

title: Pinto or Great Northern Beans with Ground Beef
directions: Fry the salt pork until crisp, remove from the fat and add to the beans.
Then brown the onion in the salt pork fat.
Add the beef.
Stir, and cook slowly for 5 minutes.
Combine all the ingredients, add salt and pepper to taste, and simmer until the meat is tender and the flavors well blended.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Pinto and Great Northern beans are a valuable food (1940-01-01)


Category: Side, Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bean, tomato, salt pork, salt, onion, pepper, beef

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, frying pan, knife, stove

title: Shoo-Fly Pie
directions: Work shortening, brown sugar and flour together.
Mix rest of ingredients well together and add hot water.
Into an unbaked pie shell, combine the crumbs and liquid in alternate layers with crumbs on bottom and top.
Bake 15 minutes at 450 degrees, then 20 minutes at 350 degrees.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: brown sugar, shortening, flour, baking soda, salt, nutmeg, molass, ginger, cinnamon, clove, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, pie pan

title: Coffee
directions: Add coffee to water and bring to boiling point.
Coffee can be improved by mixing 2 eggs and 2 cups cold water with coffee and tying in a cheese cloth bag.
Place bag in water and bring to boil.
Remove bag and serve.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, coffee

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, pot

title: Fried Corn Meal Mush
directions: Moisten corn meal with a little cold water and stir into the salted boiling water.
Cook over slow fire, stirring often, for 45 minutes.
(Most of the corn meal sold today has been processed to cook much faster, so follow the directions.
) Pour the hot corn meal into a greased loaf pan or glass baking dish.
Let stand, uncovered, until cold and firm.
Cut into slices dip in flour and fry in hot fat until browned.
Serve with syrup.
Wonderful with sausage.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn meal, salt, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Pineapple Sherbet
directions: Combine pineapple, water, lemon juice and sugar.
Freeze to a mush in a 1:6 salt-ice mixture.
Whip the evaporated milk, which has been thoroughly chilled, and add to the partially frozen mixture.
Continue freezing until stiff.
other_info:
Author: Person.M Faith McAuley, Person.Mary Adele Wood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pineapple, water, lemon juice, sugar, evaporated milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, refrigerator, egg beater

title: Emergency Biscuit
directions: Mix the dry ingredients and cut in the fat.
Add the milk, mixing with a knife.
Drop by spoonfuls on a buttered pan, placing one inch apart.
Bake twelve minutes in a hot oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, salt, baking powder, fat, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven

title: Apple Crumb Pie
directions: Pare apples and cut into thick slices.
Mix half the sugar with the cinnamon and sprinkle over apples.
Put into unbaked pastry shell.
Blend the flour, the remaining sugar and the butter and work into small crumbs, with your fingers.
Sprinkle the crumbs over the apples.
Bake in hot oven (425f) for 10 minutes then reduce to moderate (350f) and bake for 35 minutes more.
Serve with cheese.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, flour, cinnamon, sugar, butter, pastry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven

title: Baked Potatoes II
directions: Choose potatoes of equal size.
Brush them very clean, drop them into a basin of cold salt and water, then dry them.
Place them on a baking sheet, and bake in a moderate oven.
When a fork will pierce them easily they are baked.
The skins should never be eaten.
Another way: brush the potatoes, peel them very thin, parboil them, then brown them under the meat.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: potato, salt, water

Equipment: oven, baking sheet, brush, peeler

title: Dried Green Peas
directions: Soak over-night ; next morning put them in a jar in the oven with plenty of water, salt and a spoonful of sugar.
Stew gently for 3 or 4 hours, until quite tender.
A pinch of carbonate of soda may be added to the water, to improve the colour of the peas.
Serve either with gravy, or a little butter, pepper and salt.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: green pea, water, salt, sugar, soda, 

Equipment: stove, pot

title: Pepper Cabbage
directions: Mix the cabbage, pepper, chopped fine and salt.
Let stand 1 hour in cool place.
Drain off all liquid.
Make a hot dressing with rest of ingredients.
Melt the butter and blend in the flour.
Add vinegar and stir until mixture thickens.
Mix mustard, salt and pepper and add to the liquid.
Cool for 4 minutes, pour over the beaten egg yolk and mix well.
Cook for 1 minute more.
Pour this over the pepper cabbage and mix well.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cabbage, salad dressing, green pepper, salt, butter, pepper, flour, egg yolk, mustard, vinegar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, egg beater, stove, pot

title: Mrs L's Lemon Butter
directions: Beat eggs and sugar together, add butter and lemons.
Boil five minutes, stirring all the time.
other_info:
Author: Person.E Terese Dickes
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: lemon, egg, sugar, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, pot

title: Monterey Jack
directions: Fry bacon crisp; drain on absorbent paper.
Cook onion and green pepper in 2 tablespoons of the bacon fat until soft but not brown.
Add kidney beans, tomatoes, seasonings, and cheese.
Stir over low heat until cheese melts.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bacon, onion, green pepper, kidney bean, tomato, chili powder, salt, monosodium glutamate, cheddar cheese

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, skillet

title: Date Cake
directions: Mix evaporated milk and vinegar.
Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with other dry ingredients.
Cream shortening.
Add sugar and continue creaming until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs.
Add dry ingredients alternately with the soured milk, beginning and ending with flour.
Add sliced dates and chopped nuts with last few stirs.
Pour into 2 greased tube or loaf pans.
Bake in a moderate oven (350f) about 1 hour.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: evaporated milk, vinegar, flour, baking soda, cinnamon, clove, salt, shortening, sugar, egg, date, nut

Equipment: oven, loaf pan, egg beater, measuring spoons, measuring cups, sifter, knife

title: Chicken Creole

ingredients.name: cup fresh or canned (No. 2 can) tomatoes
fat, chicken fat may be used

directions: Cut chicken into serving pieces.
Roll in mixture of the flour, salt, pepper, and paprika.
Brown in melted fat.
Add onion; cook 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the water, cover, and simmer about 1 hour or until almost tender, adding more water if necessary.
Stir occasionally to keep from sticking.
Add green pepper and tomatoes.
Simmer about 30 minutes longer.
Serve on seasoned hot noodles or rice.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Tomatoes On Your Table (1944-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: chicken, onion, flour, water, salt, green pepper, pepper, paprika, tomato, fat

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Glazed Roast Duckling
directions: Set oven for slow, 325f.
Stuff duckling.
Place breast side up on rack in shallow open pan.
Roast, 3 to 4-pound duckling about 2 1/4 to 2 3/4 hour, 4 to 5-pound duckling about 2 3/4 to 3 hours, 5 in 6-pound duckling about 3 to 3 1/2 hours.
Meanwhile combine sugar, salt, and cornstarch.
Add thawed orange juice concentrate (do not dilute).
Stir over moderate heat until slightly thickened.
An hour before duckling is done brush entire surface with orange juice glaze.
Repeat every 15 minutes until duckling is done.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: duckling, bread stuffing, sugar, salt, cornstarch, orange juice

Equipment: oven, measuring cups, measuring spoons, baking pan, pot

title: Meat Croquettes
directions: Rub the potatoes through a sieve, add the flour and salt and rub in the dripping.
Mix to a stiff paste with cold water, roll it out and cut in into rounds.
Put a little chopped meat in each round, egg half the round, press the edges together and nick them.
Roll each croquette first in egg and then in bread-crumbs or vermicelli, and fry in boiling fat or oil.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: meat, pepper, salt, potato, flour, dripping, bread crumb, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sieve, frying pan, stove

title: Svitek (Farina Bread)
directions: Beat eggs.
Add a little salt and farina.
Pour into buttered pan.
Bake in hot oven until brown.
Remove from oven.
Pour milk or water over it and put back into the oven until puffy.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, egg, farina, salt, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, baking pan, oven

title: Old-Time Rice Pudding

ingredients.name: granulated sugar, or 2/3 cup brown sugar

directions: Combine rice, milk, sugar, and salt; pour into greased 1-1/2 quart baking dish.
Bake in a slow oven (300f) one hour, stirring several times.
Add lemon peel, nutmeg, and raisins.
Continue baking 2 to 2 1/2 hours.
Serve hot or cold.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: rice, milk, sugar, salt, lemon peel, nutmeg, raisin

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, baking dish, dutch oven

title: Stuffed Mushrooms
directions: Peel the mushrooms, remove the stalks, and trim with a round cutter.
Chop ham and mushroom trimmings.
Lightly fry the onion, add ham and chopped mushroom, crumbs, parsley, seasoning and cream, and cook for a minute to bind.
Pile the filling on each mushroom and bake in a moderate oven for about 20 minutes, until tender.
Place a slice of tomato on each croute, put a mushroom on top and decorate with parsley.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: mushroom, ham, margarine, onion, parsley, seasoning, cream, tomato, toast, breadcrumb

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pan, oven

title: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake II
directions: Cream butter thoroughly, add sugar gradually, and cream together until light and fluffy; add egg, then flour alternately, with milk a small amount at a time.
Beat after each addition until smooth; add vanilla.
Melt the other four tablespoons butter in iron skillet; add brown sugar and stir until melted.
Add pineapple and pour batter over mixture.
Bake in moderate oven fifty minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Annie Elem
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, milk, baking powder, salt, shortening, vanilla, sugar, brown sugar, egg, butter, pineapple

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, bowl, sifter, skillet, oven

title: Ice Box Rolls II
directions: Sift flour before measuring.
To 1 1/2 cups flour add salt and butter, combining as for pie crust.
Mix lukewarm milk with yeast and 1 tablespoon sugar; blend well and stir into first mixture.
Cover, let stand 20 minutes, then add well-beaten egg, vanilla and remaining 1 1/2 cups flour.
Stir until smooth.
The dough will be stiff and slightly sticky.
Tie dough loose in a piece of cheese cloth, drop into a pail of cool water 70 to 80 degrees.
In about one hour the dough will rise to the top of the water.
Remove from water and turn onto a platter.
Cut off pieces the size of an egg and let stand about fifteen minutes in a cool place.
Roll each piece in a mixture of chopped nuts and sugar.
Twist into figure eight, or any desired shape and place on a greased baking sheet.
Let stand about 10 minutes, then bake in 425f oven ten to fifteen minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Lucy Buttler
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, yeast, salt, egg, sugar, water, shortening

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, oven, refrigerator, bowl, egg beater

title: The Perfect Custard Pie
directions: Add water to pie mix, small amount at a time, mixing quickly and evenly through the flour and lard until the dough just holds in a ball.
Roll on slightly floured board, line pie pan, making a heavy rim around the edge.
For pie: scald the milk.
Beat eggs slightly and add sugar and salt.
Stir constantly while adding the hot milk.
Pour into pie crust.
Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Bake in a hot oven (435f) for 10 minutes, then reduce heat and finish in moderate oven (350f) for 25 minutes.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.Mary Cullen's department, Household arts service of The journal


Source: Food Fashion Revue Cooking School Second Session (1938-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pie mix, water, milk, egg, sugar, salt, nutmeg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pie pan, rolling pin, stove, oven

title: Blitz Torte - Torte Layers
directions: To prepare torte layers, cream together the butter and granulated sugar.
Beat in the egg yolks, one at a time.
Sift together the flour and baking powder and fold alternately with the milk into the mixture.
Pour batter into two buttered round nine-inch pans.
Make a meringue by beating the six egg whites until stiff.
Gradually add the powdered sugar.
Spread over the batter in the pans and sprinkle one with almonds.
Bake at 350f for 20-25 minutes.
When cool, remove layers from pans, placing the one without almonds on serving plate.

Source: Festival of American Folklife: German Recipes (1976-01-01)

Ingredient: butter, sugar, egg, milk, flour, baking powder, powdered sugar, almond

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, egg beater, baking pan

title: Sour Cream Dressing
directions: Mix salt, vinegar, and mustard.
Stir slowly into milk just until well blended.

Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: salt, lemon juice, mustard, evaporated milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl

title: Pineapple Cornmeal Muffins
directions: Drain crushed pineapple.
Mix and sift dry ingredients.
Beat egg, add pineapple syrup and water.
Stir into flour mixture.
Stir in quickly the shortening and drained crushed pineapple.
Fill greased medium-sized muffin pans 2/3 full.
Bake in moderately hot oven (400f) about 20 to 25 minutes until lightly browned.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69
Contributor: Person.C V Pullian

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, egg beater, muffin pan, oven

title: Kjodboller (Meat Balls)
directions: Mix sausage well, add other ingredients.
Form into balls.
Fry until brown, then put on cover and.
Let simmer.
other_info:

Source: Country Coon Prairie Church Preservation Kokk Bok (1986-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sausage, egg, cracker, onion, milk, salt, pepper, ginger

Equipment: knife, measuring cups, pot, stove

title: Shourba B'Tarbia (Chicken Soup with Egg and Lemon)
directions: Prepare chicken soup by boiling the chicken backs and necks in 6 cups water for about 30 minutes.
Add pepper, salt, and small onion.
Remove all the chicken backs and necks and the onion, leaving only the soup.
In a medium size bowl put 2 egg yolks, add the lemon juice.
Mix very well with a fork.
Add about 4-6 cups of boiling soup previously prepared.
Stir well.
Serve hot.
other_info:
Author: Person.Soad Mansour, Person.Layla Risk, Person.Suzy Grindi


Source: Festival of American Folklife: Egyptian Recipes (1976-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: chicken, water, egg yolk, onion, lemon juice, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove

title: Confectioner’s Icing
directions: Mix the cream and vanilla, add sugar slowly until the consistency to spread (more sugar may be needed).
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Ingredient: vanilla, cream, powdered sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: An Excellent Rice Pudding
directions: Put rice in an earthen basin.
Soak for an hour in barely enough cold water to cover it.
Add milk (alderney is best) and a tablespoon of vanilla extract.
Sweeten to taste, and bake three hours in a moderate oven.
When done, the milk will be very deep yellow and of the consistency of thick cream.
Keep stirring from the bottom about every twenty minutes until nearly done; then let it brown.
After cooling, put in the refrigerator.
other_info:
Author: Person.Lydia F Hamor
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: rice, milk, vanilla extract

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven

title: Strudl s Jablky (Apple Strudl)
directions: For dough: warm cream and butter until butter melts.
Add: salt, vanilla, egg yolks, sugar, flour.
Knead dough and place in bowl which has been set in a pan of hot water so that the dough will remain warm.
Prepare filling.
For filling, mix: apples, sugar, cinnamon, bread crumbs (lightly browned in butter), nuts, raisins, butter.
While dough is warm, stretch it over a floured cloth on the table until paper thin.
Trim hard edges.
Sprinkle with part of melted butter.
Arrange apple slices over dough.
Sprinkle with the remaining ingredients.
Sprinkle with the remaining butter.
Roll as for jelly roll.
Arrange in a grease pan (15 x 18 inches).
Bake about 1 hour at 350 degrees.
While baking brush often with milk.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cream, butter, salt, vanilla, egg yolk, sugar, flour, apple, cinnamon, bread crumb, nut, raisin, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, knife, baking pan, oven

title: Coconut Macaroon Pie
directions: Set oven for moderate, 375f.
Line 9-inch pie pan with pastry.
Flute rim.
Add salt to egg yolks: beat until thick and lemon-colored.
Add sugar, 1/2 cup at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add milk, butter or margarine, lemon juice, and almond extract; blend well.
Fold in coconut and stiffly beaten egg whites; turn into pie shell.
Bake 50 minutes or until knife inserted comes out clean.
Cool.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pastry, salt, egg, sugar, milk, butter, lemon juice, almond extract

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, pie pan, egg beater

title: Schnitz Un Knepp
directions: Boil a 3 lb.
Piece of ham for two hours.
Pick over and clean 1 qt.
Of dried apples; soak in enough water to cover.
When meat has boiled for the stated time, add dried apples and water in which they have been soaking and continue to boil for another hour.
Sift together the dry ingredients and mix the dough with egg, which has been well beaten, the melted shortening and the milk.
Drop batter by spoonfuls into the boiling liquor of the ham and apples.
Cover tightly and cook for 15 minutes.
Raisins may be added if desired.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove, sifter

title: Green Tomato Mincemeat Fruit Cake
directions: Blend together the fat, vanilla, and orange rind.
Gradually add sugar and marmalade, creaming well after each addition.
Add eggs one at a time, boating well after each.
Sift together the flour, baking powder, soda, and salt.
Add alternately with the mincemeat to the creamed mixture, beginning and ending with dry ingredients.
Add nut meats.
Pour into a greased 7 1/2-inch tube pan or a loaf pan.
Bake in a slow oven (325f) 1 1/2 hours.
Cool 1/2 hour before removing from the pan.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven, loaf pan

title: Peanut Cookies
directions: Cream shortening.
Add sugar and continue creaming until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, then add milk and lemon juice.
Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with baking powder and salt into first mixture.
Stir in peanuts.
Drop from a spoon onto slightly greased baking sheets.
Flour palm of hand lightly and press cookies out flat.
Bake in a moderate oven (375f) about 10 minutes.
Peanut butter cookies variation: use 1 cup peanut butter in place of 3 cups ground peanuts; increase sugar to 1 1/3 cups.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association

Equipment: egg beater, oven, baking sheet, measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Baked Ham
directions: Scrub ham and soak for a few minutes.
Drain.
Make a thick paste of rye flour and water and spread it over the ham.
Set on rack in pan.
Bake in 400f oven until rye crust browns.
Lower temperature to 300f and bake about 4 hours.
Make a hole in the crust and pour in hot cider.
Bake 1 more hour at 300f.
Remove rye crust.
Slice and serve on a roll or with mashed potatoes or potato salad.

title: Pumpkin Pie II
directions: Beat the eggs.
Add pumpkin, sugar, salt, spice, and milk.
Pour into unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes.
Reduce to 325 degrees for 30 minutes or until done.
Serve with whipped cream.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven

title: Cocoa Shells
directions: Put the cocoa shells into a coffeepot with cold water and boil steadily for at least 1 hour (this may be reheated if all is not used).
Serve with hot milk, cream, and sugar.

title: Nut or Noisette Bread
directions: Entire wheat flour as needed for dough.
Mix in morning and let it rise till light.
Knead; put in tins and let rise again before baking.

Ingredient: yeast, water, milk, shortening, molass, hazelnut, white flour

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, baking pan

title: Codfish Stew

ingredients.name: pound fresh or thawed frozen cod, filets
pound potatoes, cut in 3/4 inch cubes
celery seed, or 1/4 cup diced celery

directions: Saute bacon in deep kettle or dutch oven until lightly browned.
Remove bacon and set aside.
In same kettle, saute onion slices until tender.
Add fish, cut in 2 1/2 inch pieces, add next seven ingredients.
Simmer covered, until vegetables are tender, about 25 minutes.
Add tomatoes, heat through.
Garnish with parsley and bacon bite.

(1957-07-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Derby Canapes
directions: Pound together the ham, cream, mustard and seasoning.
Spread the biscuits with the mixture, and decorate each canape with a slice of pickled walnut.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side, Meat

Ingredient: ham, seasoning, cream, biscuit, mustard, walnut

Equipment: measuring cups, knife

title: Chocolate Upside-down Cake
directions: Sift together: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt.
Add to the dry ingredients and beat well for 2 minutes: butter, pecans or walnuts, milk, vanilla.
Pour into an 8 x 8 inch pan.
Mix together and sprinkle over the batter in the pan: 1 cup sugar, cocoa.
Pour over the cake batter: water bake for 35 minutes in 350f.
Oven.
Cool and serve with whipped cream.
other_info:

Ingredient: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, butter, walnut, milk, vanilla, cocoa, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, egg beater, baking pan, oven

title: Hungarian Delicate Fritters
directions: Beat egg yolks, sugar, and salt together until light and lemon colored.
Add cream, flavoring, cardamon seeds, and stiffly beaten egg whites.
Add flour and mix thoroughly.
Chill in refrigerator several hours or over night.
On a lightly floured board roll chilled dough out 1/8 inch thick and cut into diamond shapes about two inches in length.
Cut a slit near the top of one point and draw opposite point through the slit.
Fry in deep fat (360f) until golden brown.
Drain and sprinkle with confectioners sugar.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg yolk, sugar, salt, lemon extract, cream, cardamon seed, egg white, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, bowl, refrigerator, rolling pin, knife, pot, stove

title: Salad a la Philippine
directions: Remove the pulp from the grapefruit and orange without breaking the membrane.
Cut the pear in lengthwise slices.
Cut the endive in halves, discard the outer leaves, and wash with care.
Dispose the endive halves on plates, set the pear fan shape over these.
Back of the pears place a section of orange pulp, and a section of grapefruit just above the tips of the leaves.
To the fruit juice add the olive oil and salt; beat vigorously, and pour over the salad.
other_info:
Author: Person.Irene Rich
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife, egg beater

title: Creamed Salsify
directions: Scrape salsify, cut in 1/2-inch slices, and let stand for 1/2 hour in cold water to which 1 tablespoon vinegar has been added.
Drain, cook in boiling water till tender (1/2 to 1 hour), then drain again and serve in a white sauce made from remaining ingredients.

Equipment: knife, measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove

title: Almond Milk
directions: But the ground almonds in a saucepan with the water, and stew slowly about 3/4 hour, stirring occasionally.
Strain the milk through a piece of muslin.

Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: almond, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, saucepan, stove

title: Jelita (Blood Sausage)
directions: When butchering a hog, save the blood, which could be about 1 quart, or use according to how dark you want the sausage to be.
Beat the blood well to keep it from curdling.
Cook fat jowl.
Salt to taste.
Cut meat and fat into small cubes.
Cook barley so that proportions will be abut 2 parts barley to 1 part prepared meat.
Mix the meat, barley, the beaten blood, pepper, ginger, cloves and onion which has been lightly fried in fat.
If the mixture is too thick you may add some of the meat stock.
Stuff into the casings and cook as you do liver sausage.
These may be frozen.
Heat in the oven and serve with fried potatoes, onions and sauerkraut.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: blood, pork jowl, barley, onion, pepper, ginger, clove

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, egg beater, pot, stove

title: Surprise Sandwich Loaf
directions: Divide the cheese into three portions, and leave one plain.
Cream one-third of the cheese with the chopped prawns, butter and a few drops of anchovy essence, seasoning to taste, a little pink colouring and a little milk.
Reserve one or two sprigs of watercress for garnish, chop the rest finely and mix with another one-third of the cheese, then colour this a pale green.
Cream the remaining portion of cheese with a little seasoning and milk until fairly soft.
Remove the crusts from the loaf, and cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch slices.
Spread one slice of bread thickly with the prawn filling, spread the watercress filling on a second slice, and place on top of the prawn-covered slice.
Place another slice of bread on top, repeat until all the slices are used, press lightly, and leave in a cool place until firm.
Cover the whole loaf with the plain cheese, as though icing a cake.
Pipe with small stars of cream cheese, and decorate with radish concertinas and cucumber diamonds.
Garnish the serving dish with some small lettuce leaves and the remaining sprigs of watercress.
To serve the loaf, cut it downwards into slices.
Any other savoury fillings may be used instead of those given, provided they contrast well with each other.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)

Ingredient: cream cheese, prawn, margarine, anchovy, seasoning, milk, watercress, bread, radish, cucumber, lettuce

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, egg beater

title: Whole Wheat Waffles
directions: Combine flour, baking powder and salt in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, beat the eggs and whisk in oil, milk, sugar and vanilla extract.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients.
Stir until no dry flour is seen.
Heat your waffle iron and cook according to the manufacturer's instructions.

title: Frosting for Hot Milk Butter Cake
directions: Combine all ingredients, blend well.
Frost cake, return to hot oven or broiler to brown.

directions: Chop carrots or turnips and season with salt and pepper.
Add chopped green or sweet red pepper.
Melt fat in a frying pan and spread a thin layer of the vegetable in the pan.
Heat slowly, serve hot.

title: Fish Cake
directions: Boil potatoes in jackets.
Skin and mash.
Potatoes may be hot or cold.
Mix ingredients together thoroughly.
Shape into small flat cakes and fry in hot fat until crusty and brown on both sides.

directions: Brush the potatoes, peel them very thin, slice them, dry them, and fry them a light brown in hot fat.

title: Basic Fudge
directions: In a 2.
5 quart saucepan, combine brown sugar, evaporated milk and (if using) corn syrup.
Bring to a boil, stirring frequently.
Continue boiling and stirring frequently until the soft ball stage (238 degrees f, 116 degrees c).
Remove from heat and add vanilla and butter, but do not stir.
Let cool for 25 minutes, then beat with a wooden spoon until fudge just begins to thicken.
Add any add-ins and stir until fudge begins to lost its gloss.
Pour into a greased 8 inch x 8 inch cake pan.
When cool, cut into pieces.

directions: Cook over slow fire until thick and add flavoring or nuts.

title: Chocolate Chip Cake
directions: Pour water over: soda, dates.
Set aside to cool.
Cream: shortening, sugar.
Add alternately with date mixture: eggs, cocoa, flour, salt, vanilla.
Pour into pan, sprinkle chocolate chips and nuts on top and push in.
Bake for 35-40 minutes in 350f oven.

title: Spiced Cantaloupe
directions: Pare the cantaloupe, remove seeds and cut into strips, 1 x 2 inch or squares.
Dissolve the alum in the water and bring to a boil.
Add the cantaloupe and cook for 15 minutes.
Drain well.
Combine vinegar, sugar and spices.
Cantaloupe and simmer slowly until fruit is transparent.
(About 45 minutes).
Place in hot sterilized jars and seal.

title: Frozen Strawberries
directions: Cover berries with sugar.
When the sugar is melted, mash the berries, add water and freeze.
