Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, milk, flour, salt, paprika

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Lemon Pie Filling
directions: Beat the egg yolks, add the sugar gradually and beat; add the flour, salt, water, lemon juice and rind.
Cook in a double boiler until it thickens.
Pour into the pastry shell, cover with meringue and bake in a moderate oven until the meringue is brown.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, stove

title: Baked Apple Dumpling
directions: Peel and core the apples, and fill the centre of each with moist sugar and 2 cloves or 2 pieces lemon-rind.
Rub the dripping into the flour, add the baking-powder and enough cold water to form a stiff paste, divide it into four, and roll each piece out.
Place an apple in the centre of each piece of paste, and work it well round the apple.
Grease a tin, place the dumplings on it, and bake about 1/4 hour.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, dripping, baking powder, apple, clove, brown sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, rolling pin, baking pan, oven

title: Green Pea Boats
directions: Line small boat-shaped moulds with pastry, fill with bread raspings and bake blind in a hot oven for 10-15 minutes.
Brush out the raspings, and place a little chutney in each boat.
Cook the peas (if necessary), sieve, and cream to a piping consistency with fat and seasoning.
Pipe the mixture in the boats with a small star nozzle, and decorate with a piece of pickled walnut.
Tomato boats may be made in exactly the same way by using the flesh of tomatoes instead of the peas,.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pastry, margarine, pea, seasoning, walnut

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, baking mold, oven, stove

title: Ham and Green Beans
directions: Place ham in large pot and cover with water.
Cook slowly for a couple of hours (less if the ham is tenderized) keeping plenty of water on the ham.
Clean and break-up the string beans, put them in with ham and cook for 25 minutes more.
Add the potatoes, which have been pared and cut-up, and cook slowly until ready.
Season to taste.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ham, potato, string bean, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Anchovy Canapes
directions: Soak anchovies 2 hours in cold water; rub off skin and strip fillets from the bones.
Mash several anchovies to a paste; mix with melted butter, strain.
Heat, and quickly fry bread brown on both sides.
Cover fried bread with anchovy fillets, sprinkle with the chopped olives, and then with parmesan.
Place for a moment under grill for cheese to color, and serve hot.
other_info:

title: Christmas Salad II

ingredients.name: to make a total of 4 cups of liquid.

directions: Pour into mold and refrigerate.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, refrigerator, mold

title: Grape Shake
directions: Pour juices into diluted milk.
Beat vigorously.
Chill.
If unsweetened grape juice is used, add 1/2 cup sugar.

title: Apple Sauce Cake

ingredients.name: butter, size of a walnut for icing

directions: Cream together butter, sugar and spices.
Add apple sauce, flour and soda dissolved in a little warm water.
Add the raisins (or currants).
Beat thoroughly and pour into a loaf tin.
Bake in moderate oven (350f) for approximately 50 minutes.
For icing: moisten sugar and butter with a little water and spread over cake.

title: Tomato Sauce
directions: Heat tomato juice with onion juice or grated onion.
Blend melted fat and flour to a smooth paste.
Add tomato juice, salt and sugar.
Cook slowly, stirring until thick.
One gallon canned tomatoes may be strained and used in place of tomato juice.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato juice, onion juice, butter, flour, salt, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot

title: Fastnachts — Raised Doughnuts
directions: At night break and soak yeast in lukewarm water for 20 minutes.
Mix with flour to a thick batter.
Cover, let rise in warm place overnight until doubled.
In the morning cream together the shortening, sugar and salt.
Add this to the risen sponge, with the beaten eggs and spice.
Stir in as much flour as mixture will take up readily, making a rather soft dough.
Mix well.
Let rise until doubled in bulk.
If desired, stir down and let rise again until nearly doubled.
Turn onto floured board, pat or roll until 1/3 inch thick and cut with doughnut cutter.
Cover to prevent drying and let rise until doubled.
Fry in deep hot fat about 375 degrees.
If no thermometer is at hand, test temperature with 1 inch square of bread, which should brown in 1 minute .
other_info:

title: Chicken a la King II
directions: Melt butter in a pan with mushrooms.
Fry five minutes.
Add 2 cups thin white sauce.
Add the boneless chicken and pimento.
Season, serve on toast.

title: Cheese Straws III
directions: Roll out pastry thinly and cut into fingers, measuring about 3 inches long and 1/4 inch wide.
Stamp a few rings out of the pastry, using two cutters, and bake all in a hot oven for about 10 minutes.
When cold, the straws may be stacked inside the rings.

title: Mushrooms in Cream
directions: Wash mushrooms; remove stems, and peel caps, and cut in pieces; melt butter and cook until tender; sprinkle with salt and pepper; dredge with flour and add cream.
Let cook until heated thoroughly, then pour on pieces of toast and garnish with toast points.

title: White Plum Pudding

ingredients.name: quart soft fine bread crumbs, (18 ounces)

directions: Scald milk and water.
Pour over the egg whites, which have been slightly beaten.
Combine sugar, butter, salt, vanilla, bread crumbs and the plums, which have been drained and cut in pieces (save the juice for the sauce).
Add the bread crumb mixture to the milk and egg mixture.
Beat well.
Fill buttered pudding molds, set in pan of hot water, and bake in a moderate oven (350f) about 45 minutes or until, when tested with a silver knife, the knife comes out clean.
Remove from pudding molds and serve with plum sauce.

title: Potato Stew
directions: Fry the onions with the bacon, then put them into a stew-pan with the potatoes and broth.
When the potatoes are cooked the stew is ready.
With a norfolk dumpling, this will make a good meal at a surprisingly low cost.
other_info:

title: Fruit Whip

ingredients.name: fruit, pulp (crushed berries. peaches. applesauce, prune, or apricot pulp)

directions: Beat egg whites until stiff.
Add sugar gradually while beating.
Fold in pulp.
Pile in sherbet glasses; chill.

Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company

Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg white, powdered sugar, fruit

Equipment: egg beater, refrigerator, measuring spoons, measuring cups, oven

title: Roze B'khalta (Rice Vegetable Dish)
directions: Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a frypan, add nuts, stir and fry for 2 minutes; add raisins and cook for another 2 minutes.
Remove nuts and raisins from pan and set aside.
Saute meat and onion in frypan over medium heat for about 10 minutes.
Add nuts and raisins.
In medium-sized saucepan, melt 3 tablespoons butter, add rice, stir and fry for 2 minutes.
Add water, broth and salt; bring to boil, reduce heat and cook for 30 minutes.
Combine the rice with half of the ground meat mixture and put in serving dish.
Put the rest of the ground meat mixture on top and serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.Soad Mansour, Person.Layla Risk, Person.Suzy Grindi


Source: Festival of American Folklife: Egyptian Recipes (1976-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, walnut, raisin, meat, onion, rice, water, chicken, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, skillet, knife

title: Apple Bread

ingredients.name: unpeeled raw red apple, chopped fine

directions: Sift together flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, soda, nutmeg.
Add eggs.
Combine and add corn syrup, lemon rind, lemon juice, apple, nuts, and margarine.
Mix as little as possible to form dough and leave ingredients evenly distributed.
Turn into well-greased bread pan, 4 1/2 by 9 in.
Top with thin apple wedges dipped in melted oleo, then in sugar.
Bake in moderate oven, 350f, about one hour.
Cover pan first 20 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69

Ingredient: flour, baking powder, salt, egg, sugar, soda, nutmeg, corn syrup, lemon rind, lemon juice, apple, nut, margarine

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, bread pan

title: Banana Chocolate Cream Pie
directions: Melt chocolate in milk in top of double boiler over boiling water, beating until blended.
Combine sugar, salt, and flour.
Stir slowly into chocolate mixture.
Cook, stirring constantly until thick.
Cook 10 minutes longer; stir occasionally.
Stir small amount of hot mixture into egg yolks; then pour back into remaining hot mixture while beating vigorously.
Cook 1 minute.
Add butter or margarine and vanilla.
Cool thoroughly.
Cover bottom of pie shell with small amount of cooled filling.
Peel bananas; slice into pie shell.
Cover with remaining filling.
Top with sweetened whipped cream and additional ripe banana slices, if desired.
Or, make a meringue using 3 egg whites and 6 tablespoons sugar.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: chocolate, milk, sugar, salt, flour, egg yolk, butter, vanilla, pie shell, banana

Equipment: oven, double boiler, measuring spoons, measuring cups, pie pan

title: Baked Rice with Cheese
directions: Separate the whites and yolks of the eggs.
Beat the yolks and stir into them the cheese, rice, milk and butter.
Lastly fold in the beaten whites.
Make into patties and bake 20 minutes.
other_info:

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater

title: Cooked Salad Dressing
directions: Combine first 5 ingredients in top of double boiler; stir in egg yolks, melted butter or margarine, and milk: blend well.
Add vinegar very slowly.
Cook and stir over hot water until mixture coats spoon.
Cool, then chill.
(If overcooked, this dressing will curdle).

Equipment: double boiler, measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Rice Stew
directions: Break the bones and cut up the bacon small, put both into the water and simmer for two hours, skimming now and then, add the other things and bring to a boil, after which let it simmer for half an hour.

Equipment: measuring cups, pot, knife, stove

title: Baked Cottage Pudding
directions: Mix dry ingredients, add egg and milk.
Beat well and add melted butter and extract.
Bake twenty-five minutes in a well buttered mould.
Serve hot with the lemon sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, sugar, baking powder, butter, salt, milk, egg, lemon extract

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater

title: Saba's Passover Noodles

ingredients.name: vegetable oil, (olive oil does not work well)

directions: Mix all ingredients together.
Drop a few drops of oil into a small pan (a crepe pan or other non-coated pan works well).
Pour a thin layer of the batter into the pan.
Tilt the pan to cover.
Turn the crepe over and watch that it does not burn.
Remove the crepe and lay it on a plate.
Stir the mixture occasionally.
Continue to make the crepes.
Let cool.
Roll the crepes and cut thin slices.
Unroll or "fluff" the slices into thin long noodles.
Place in a covered dish.
Refrigerate if not served on the same day.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Oracle Ace, Person.Sheeri Cabral


Source: ACE Cookbook (2013-02-23)


Category: Grain, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, vegetable oil, water, potato starch, oil

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, pan

title: Pea Soup II
directions: Soak the peas over-night; next morning put them on in the cold water or pot-liquor.
Bring to the boil, and then add the prepared vegetables, bones, and seasoning.
Skim well, and boil for 1 1/2 hour, stirring occasionally.
Remove the bones, and pulp the soup through a sieve.
Heat it again, and serve with dried mint and fried bread.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

title: Unbaked Oatmeal Drop Cookies
directions: Boil 3 minutes: butter, sugar, milk.
Add: peanut butter, oatmeal, cocoa, vanilla, salt.
Mix and place in small drops on waxed paper.

Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, milk, peanut butter, oatmeal, cocoa, vanilla, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, bowl

title: Macaroni Mutton II
directions: Fry (in a saucepan) some slices of mutton (underdone is best) in the dripping, with the onion cut in pieces, then add the stock or pot-liquor, worcester, harvey or other sauce, pepper, salt and macaroni.
Simmer for 2 hours and serve.

directions: Cook the eggs, powdered sugar and brandy over range 5 minutes, stirring.
Set in pan of ice-water and beat till cold.
Then add the cream, vanilla and a pinch of salt!.

Add syrup and lemon juice, chill, and serve in glasses.

Cover the top with bread crumbs.
Bake in a moderate oven until crumbs are golden brown.

directions: Mix dry ingredients ; then add butter and eggs and vinegar and cook in double boiler till thick.
Cool and add enough cream to beat smooth.
When cold, add best of cream, whipped stiff.
Put in ice-box for several hours before serving.

title: Cucumber and Celery Salad
directions: Trim and wash celery and, having cut it lengthwise into fine strips, let it remain in cold water for half an hour.
Peel cucumber and cut in strips like the celery.
Mix the celery and cucumber with the salad dressing.
Garnish it with radishes, cut like roses, slices of hard-boiled eggs and sprinkle with parsley and paprika.
Serve on lettuce.

directions: Heat the plum juice to boiling.
Combine cornstarch and water and add to boiling plum juice.
Cook until slightly thickened.

Equipment: pot, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Celery Soup
directions: Cook vegetable in water until soft (15 to 30 minutes) and rub thoroughly through a strainer.
Add more water if it boils away much.
There should be about 4 cup of the vegetable stock.
Scald onion in milk, or chop it and cook 5 minutes in the butter, being careful not to brown it.
Add flour to butter and stir into this mixture the hot milk, as for white sauce, method i.
Combine with the stock, reheat, season, and serve.
1 tablespoon chopped parsley may be added.

title: Scalloped Noodles, Hungarian Style
directions: Cook the noodles in boiling, salted water to which the garlic has been added, for 10 minutes.
Drain.
Mix, with other ingredients.
Put in a buttered casserole, and bake 45 minutes, in a moderate oven (350 f).
Sprinkle generously with cheese and paprika.
Return to oven for 5 minutes.

title: Tvarohovy Paj (Cottage Cheese Pie)
directions: Line a pie pan with pie crust.
Fill with cottage cheese, dot with bits of butter, raisins (sprinkle over cheese).
Mix together: eggs, milk, sugar, lemon extract.
Pour the custard over the cottage cheese.
Bake at 275 degrees until custard is set (about 30 minutes).

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven

title: Tomato Ketchup
directions: Cut up the tomatoes and boil until quite soft.
Then strain through a sieve until nothing remains but skin and seeds.
To this liquid add the spices, vinegar, etc, and boil until quite thick.
Bottle while hot, and if tightly corked will keep for two years without sealing.

title: Lemon Sherbet
directions: Boil sugar and water ten minutes.
Cool, add lemon juice and strain.
Freeze, and when nearly stiff, add beaten egg white and finish freezing.

Equipment: egg beater

title: Banana Nut Cake
directions: Sift together in large bowl flour, soda, baking powder and salt.
Add snowdrift, brown sugar, buttermilk and mashed bananas.
Mix enough to dampen flour, beat two minutes, low speed, add eggs, vanilla and flavoring.
Beat 1 minute to smooth batter, fold in chopped nuts.
Bake in two layers, 375f, about 30 minutes; cool and frost with lemon cream filling.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven, baking pan

title: French Toast
directions: Beat eggs, add salt, sugar, milk and water.
Soak both sides of bread in the mixture.
Lift carefully to hot, well greased griddle.
Brown on both sides.
Sprinkle lightly with sugar and serve at once, plain, or with syrup or jelly.
French toast is delicious if butter is used for frying.

title: Pecan Pie
directions: Chill pie shell thoroughly.
Set oven for moderate, 375f.
Cream butter or margarine.
Add sugar gradually and continue beating until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, syrup, salt, vanilla, and chopped nuts.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake 40 to 45 minutes.
Garnish with whole nuts.
Serve with whipped cream, if desired.

title: Nut Squares
directions: Spread not more than one-quarter inch thick on a shallow greased pan.
Bake 20 minutes in a slow oven.
As soon as cold, cut in long, narrow strips.

Pour over corn meal
Add flour, mix well
Roll our very thin, bake on hot lefse plate
Put in 225 degree oven to dry out

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, oven, rolling pin

title: ACEd Up Ham
directions: Cut a series of 1/2-inch slashes in the ham in a crosshatch pattern.
Rub the ham with the oil and sprinkle it with the black pepper.
Put the ham in a crock pot on medium heat and cook to an internal temperature of 150 degree fahrenheit.
Should take around 3-4 hours, depending on your crock pot.
Mix the bbq sauce and the brown sugar.
Glaze the ham with the mix.
Continue cooking the ham to an internal temperature of 160 degrees.
Remove from the crock pot, let rest for 15 minutes at room temperature.
Slice & serve.

title: Schnitz Pie (Dried Apples)
directions: Cover schnitz with water and soak over night.
Add orange rind and juice and more water if necessary.
Boil until soft, then put through colander and add sugar and cinnamon.
Pour into past lined shell, dot with butter, cover with top crust or lattice strips.
Bake in hot oven (450f) for 10 minutes.
Reduce to 350f bake 30 minutes.

title: Whole Wheat Rolls
directions: Mix milk, butter, honey, and vegetable, cool this mixture to lukewarm temperature by adding water (or leftover vegetable water).
Add yeast, blend in egg, and finally add whole wheat flour and 2 tablespoons wheat germ.
Let rise in warm place until the bulk is doubled.
Form in rolls and place in buttered muffin pan.
Bake at 400f for just 20 minutes.

Spread in a large tin or buttered paper.
Cook 15 or 20 minutes.

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, knife, baking pan

title: Waffles
directions: Mix 1 cups flour and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Gently rub in 4 table yolks with milk; then the melted butter, the flour, and lastly the beaten whites.
Have waffle iron very clean and let it be thoroughly heated on both sides.
Rub it over with a piece of salt pork or butter.
Close the iron, and turn it so the grease will cover every part.
Put enough batter into each section of iron to fill it two-thirds full.
Shut the iron and cook waffles a minute or longer on each side.
Serve hot, with maple syrup and powdered sugar mixed with ground cinnamon.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, stove

title: Walnut Twists
directions: Prepare recipe for Scandinavian Coffee Cake

After first rising, combine 2/3 cup each of finely chopped walnuts and sugar; drop the dough by spoonfuls into the sugar-nut mixture, and toss lightly until each portion is well coated; shape each piece into a rope about 8 inches long
Twist into figure 8's
Place on well greased baking sheet; let rise again until light
Meanwhile set oven for hot, 400°
Bake 12 to 15 minutes

title: Meat Pie
directions: Add flour to drippings and blend, add milk gradually and cook, stirring constantly until it thickens.
Stir in the salt, onion and green pepper.
Mix cut up meat into the gravy and pour it into pastry lined baking dish.
Top with crust and bake in hot oven (425f) for 25 minutes.

directions: Combine chocolate and milk.
Heat over low heat until chocolate is melted.
Add sugar and salt; them stir until dissolved.
Cook until mixture reaches soft ball stage (228f).
Cool slightly; add vanilla.
Mix with other ingredients.
Press into well buttered pan.
Cut into squares.

Add required seasonings or serve in 1 1/2 cup white sauce.

2 tablespoon cornstarch, (according to the consistency desired)

directions: Cook on stove.

Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, tomato, peanut butter, cornstarch, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Jule Kage (Christmas Bread)
directions: Dissolve yeast in the water.
Scald milk, stir in sugar, salt, butter, cool to luke warm.
Add cardamom and yeast.
Stir in 2 cups flour.
Beat until smooth.
Add fruit, raisins and rest of flour, knead until smooth.
Place in greased bowl, let rise until double, punch down and let rise again 1 hr.
Shape into loaves, let rise till double.
Bake at 375f about 40 min.
Frost if liked.
Makes 2 loaves.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Coon Prairie Church


Source: Country Coon Prairie Church Preservation Kokk Bok (1986-01-01)


Category: Dessert, Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: milk, sugar, butter, salt, , water, yeast, raisin, candied fruit, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, egg beater, oven

title: Philadelphia Baked Beans
directions: Soak over night 3 pints of soup beans in enough water to cover them.
Take 1 pound of fresh pork, 2 tablespoonfuls of brown sugar, salt to taste, and add to the beans.
Stir all together in an earthen crock, and set to bake in a moderate oven for about three hours.
Add a little water from time to time as the beans dry in the baking.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mary Sterling
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1893-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bean, pork, brown sugar, salt

Equipment: oven, casserole

title: Water Bucket Rolls
directions: Sift flour before measuring.
To 1 1/2 cups flour add salt and butter, combining as for pie crust.
Mix lukewarm milk with yeast and 1 tablespoon sugar; blend well and stir into first mixture.
Cover, let stand 20 minutes, then add well-beaten egg, vanilla and remaining 1 1/2 cups flour.
Stir until smooth.
The dough will be stiff and slightly sticky.
Tie dough loose in a piece of cheese cloth, drop into a pail of cool water 70 to 80 degrees.
In about one hour the dough will rise to the top of the water.
Remove from water and turn onto a platter.
Cut off pieces the size of an egg and let stand about fifteen minutes in a cool place.
Roll each piece in a mixture of chopped nuts and sugar.
Twist into figure eight, or any desired shape and place on a greased baking sheet.
Let stand about 10 minutes, then bake in 425f oven ten to fifteen minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Tina K Mowery
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, yeast, salt, sugar, butter, egg, milk, meat, vanilla

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, rolling pin, oven, egg beater

title: Banana Trifle

ingredients.name: cream, or whipped white of one egg

directions: Slice bananas and lay them in glass dish in alternate layers with four ladyfingers split in two.
Put the milk and water in a saucepan; add the sugar, salt and the cornstarch diluted in a little cold water.

When it has thickened pour it over the bananas, and let it stand until cold and ready to serve, then cover the top with whipped cream, or if that is not convenient use the whipped white of one egg sweetened with one tablespoonful of sugar.
Split and break in two the remaining ladyfingers, and place them upright around the edge.
other_info:
Author: Person.Pola Negri
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, egg beater

title: White Mountain Cream Icing
directions: Boil the sugar and water without stirring until it threads when dropped from the spoon.
Pour slowly into the whites of the eggs beaten stiffly.
Beat until it holds its shape.
Add the flavoring and spread on the cake.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, stove

title: Whole-Wheat Peanut Butter Bread

ingredients.name: cup water, or milk if available

directions: Mix dry ingredients together.
Rub in peanut butter with fingertips, or cut in with fork, until mixture looks crumbly.
Add water.
Stir well mixing only until flour is thoroughly moistened.
Pour into greased loaf pan.
Let stand 20 minutes.
Bake 1 hour in moderate oven.

Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, bowl, oven, loaf pan

title: Seven-Minute Frosting
directions: Put unbeaten egg white, sugar, water, and corn syrup in upper part of double boiler.
Place over rapidly boiling water.
Beat constantly with rotary egg beater for 7 to 10 minutes or until frosting will stand in peaks.
Remove from heat; add vanilla; beat until thick enough to spread.
Makes enough to fill and frost a 2-layer cake.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg white, sugar, water, corn syrup, vanilla

Equipment: double boiler, egg beater, measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Scrambled Eggs
directions: Mix eggs, milk, salt and pepper with fork or spoonâ€”mixing thoroughly if a uniform yellow is preferred or mixing slightly if streaks of white and yellow are preferred.
Heat fat in 8-inch skillet just hot enough to sizzle drop of water.
Pour in egg mixture.
Reduce heat promptly.
Cook slowly, lifting from the bottom and sides as the mixture thickens.
As the cooked mixture is lifted, the thin uncooked part should flow to the bottom.
Avoid constant stirring.
Cook until eggs are thickened throughout but still moist.
5 to 8 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Breakfast, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, cream, salt, pepper, butter

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, skillet

title: Orange Marmalade
directions: Clean fruit with stiff brush and wipe dry; cut crosswise in very thin slices, reject the ends, pick out the seeds.
Pour the water over the fruit and let stand 36 hours.
Then put in preserving kettle and let cook slowly 2 hours.
Then add sugar and cook 1 hour or until the mixture jellies.
other_info:

title: Bacon Muffins
directions: Sift flour, add sugar, salt and baking powder and sift again, add beaten egg and milk.
Add melted shortening beating in quickly.
Add bits of crisped bacon.
Bake in hot (425 degree) oven for 15 to 20 minutes.
Serve with orange marmalade.

directions: Pound up the fish, melt the butter, add it to the fish with the beaten yolks of eggs and seasoning.
Beat up the whites of eggs to a stiff froth, add them lightly to the other mixture in a pie-dish and bake in a quick oven about 20 minutes.

Mix well.
Add dates, which have been stoned.
Add nut meats.
Stir to an even consistency.
Place in greased muffin tins and bake in a slow oven for thirty minutes.
Test to see if done.
Serve with whipped cream.

Frost with semi-sweet or sweet chocolate.

Garnish with parsley.

Do not throw away the cracked cocoa; by adding a little fresh each day it may be used for several days.

title: Soft Fruit Squash
directions: Simmer the prepared fruit with the water for 10-15 minutes and add the sugar.
Sieve, and serve cold.

title: Venetian Ham Horns
directions: Cut the ham in small triangles, dip each piece into liquid aspic jelly and slip it inside a metal horn case.
Stand these moulds upright in a bowl of ice.
Dissolve the gelatine in the 1 tablespoon aspic jelly and mix with the mayonnaise, vegetable macedoine and seasoning to taste.
Fill this mixture into the ham horns, and leave to set firmly.
Unmould by dipping the cases for a moment into hot water.

title: Nadivka z Maku (Poppy Seed Filling)
directions: Cover raisins with water and simmer until almost dry.
Drain.
Combine raisins, poppy seed, and butter.

title: Kidney Stew
directions: Cut kidneys in half and soak 45 minutes in cold, salted water.
Trim and skin.
Cut in small pieces, place in a kettle of water and bring to a boil.
Drain and rinse with cold water.
Roll in flour and brown quickly in butter.
Add salt, pepper, onions and potatoes, cover with boiling water and cook until tender.
Add milk and vinegar just before serving.

directions: Peel the lemons thinly and squeeze out the juice.
Place the peel and all the other ingredients in a large pan and heat, but do not boil.
Strain, and serve at once.

Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, peeler, pan, stove, strainer

directions: Cream snowdrift with butter, add pinch of salt, and add sugar with milk or cream.
When smooth, vanilla and frost cake.

title: Corned Beef and Cabbage
directions: Allow corned beef to boil slowly.
When almost tender add vegetables that have been cut in cubes.
The heads of cabbage should be cut in fourths.
Add seasoning and cook until done.
Serve with sliced bermuda onions with vinegar and oil, green onions, radishes, horse radish, mustard, brown bread, limburger cheese and near beer.

Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck

Equipment: knife, stove

title: Tuna Casserole
directions: Cook noodles in plenty of boiling, salted water until just tender.
Cook onion and celery in butter until tender, blend in flour, salt and mustard.
Ada milk.
Cook and stir until thickened.
Blend in worcestershire sauce, tabasco, flaked tuna, pimiento, parsley, olives, and cheese.
Mix with cooked noodles: and turn into a greased 3-quart casserole, top with buttered crumbs.
Bake one hour in moderate oven, 360 degrees.
other_info:

(1957-07-01)

title: Vegetable Soup No. 1
directions: Cut up the vegetables into thin slices, boil them in the water for two hours and a half, stirring often; mix up in a basin the butter in mustard, flour, salt and pepper, with a little cold water, and stir this into the soup: boil ten minutes.
Beat up the yolks of eggs in a tureen and pour the soup boiling on them; stir well.
other_info:

title: Baked Chinook Salmon with Vegetable Dressing

ingredients.name: melted butter, margarine or bacon drippings

directions: Remove backbone from salmon.
Sprinkle inside of fish with salt and pepper.
Crush crackers.
Add carrots, onions, celery, parsley, seasonings, well beaten eggs, and melted butter, margarine, or bacon drippings.
Mix well and place in cavity of fish.
Place in greased baking dish and bake for 3 hours at 325f.
Remove from oven and remove top skin.
Cover with the following mixture of buttered toasted crumbs and minced onion.
Place in oven and brown for about 15 minutes.
Garnish and serve.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, baking dish, oven

title: Poor Man's Goose
directions: Make holes in the meat with a skewer, and fill them up with the stuffing, made as follows: chop the suet and onion fine, squeeze the bread dry, and mix all together with the sage, pepper and salt.
Flour the meat and roast it.
Serve with baked potatoes.

title: To Clarify Drippings
directions: Pour the dripping from the pan into a basin of cold water.
When cool lift off the cake of clarified dripping, scrape away the sediment from the bottom, and wipe dry.

Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)

title: Devilled Steak
directions: Melt the butter in a frying-pan, slice the onion in it and sauté gently until golden brown in color.
Remove the onion from the butter, cut the flank steak into pieces three by two inches.
Dredge these lightly in one tablespoon flour and sauté in the butter until well browned.
Remove the meat from the frying- pan ; add the salt, pepper, paprika, mustard, vinegar and flour.
Mix all together and add the water slowly.
Replace the steak in the pan, cover closely and simmer one hour, or until the steak is tender.
Serve on a warm platter and pour the gravy over it.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, frying pan

title: Haricot Mutton
directions: Cut the mutton into neat pieces, fry them brown in the dripping, then take them out and brown the flour carefully.
Stir in the water or stock, and put back the meat.
Cut the vegetables into dice, and add them with the seasoning.
Skim well and simmer 2 hours.

title: Luscious Dressing
directions: Combine flour and sugar in top of double boiler; stir in egg.
Add fruit juices.
Stir over hot water until thickened.
Chill.
Whip cream; fold in.

title: Kedgeree
directions: Boil the eggs hard, break the fish into small pieces, chop the white of egg and grate the yolks.
When the boiled rice is dry, melt the butter in a stew-pan and add the rice, fish, white of egg, cayenne pepper, grated nutmeg, and salt.
Mix well and serve on a hot dish, with the grated yolks sprinkled over.

title: Mock Hollandaise Sauce II
directions: Make like white sauce (medium), method i.
Just before removing from fire add yolk of 1 egg mixed with a little of the sauce, and when ready to serve, stir in lemon juice.
Cheese sauce variation: add 1/3 cup chopped cheese to white sauce (medium) and stir until melted.

Equipment: stove, bowl, pot

title: Salted Almonds
directions: Shell, blanch, and spread the almonds on a bright tin pie dish, add a piece of butter the size of a hickory nut, and stand them in a moderate oven until a golden brown.
Take them from the oven, stir them around, dredge thickly with salt, and turn them out to cool.

To blanch almonds: shell them, throw them into boiling water, and let them stand on the back part of the range five minutes; then throw them into cold water, and rub them between the hands to remove the skins.

Equipment: pie pan, oven

title: Pressed Beef
directions: The tender part of the round free from fat and stringy parts is best.
Your butcher will grind it for you in the sausage cutter.
Mix well together in a loaf.
Bake two hours.
Eat hot for dinner or cold for tea.
Good for picnics.

directions: Sprinkle the pieces of chicken with salt a nd pepper and dredge in flour.
Place the melt butter and fry chicken until a golden brown on all sides.
Chicken in a casserole, pour the cream over it.
Cover and bake in a moderate oven (350-f) for 2 hours.
Serve with gravy made from the pan fryings left after frying the chicken.

directions: Sift together dry ingredients; add onion; add beaten egg and milk to dry ingredients.
Stirring lightly.
Drop a teaspoon of batter for each hush puppy into hot deep fat (these are good with fish-so use the same fat that the fish was fried in), frying only a few at a time.
Fry until a golden brown.
Drain on absorbent paper.

title: Couracka (Sauerkraut Soup)
directions: Make a thickening of: cream, flour (the amount of flour depends on the thickness of the cream).
Bring to a boil: sauerkraut (including juice), water.
Slowly add the cream mixture to the kraut, stirring constantly.
This should make a thin gravy, like soup.
Salt to taste.
Add pepper.
Set aside on a very low fire.
Drop eggs (more or less, according to the number of servings desired) into the soup mixture and poach.
Keep on a low fire until the eggs are done.
Serve this with potatoes that have been boiled in the jackets.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Soup

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove

title: Philadelphia Cinnamon Bun
directions: Dissolve the yeast-cake in a half cupful of warm water, and beat in enough flour to make a stiff dough, knead a moment, cut a gash in the top, and drop it, gash up, into a pitcher of warm water.
In a few minutes this will come to the surface, when it is ready for use.
Put 4 cupfuls of flour into a bowl, add the milk, the butter, melted, the sugar, salt, eggs, well beaten, and the yeast-biscuit.
Work together till well blended, adding more flour, if necessary, to make a soft dough.

Cover and let rise, till very light, about 3 hours ; then roll out in an oblong sheet a half inch in thickness, spread lightly with soft butter, dredge thickly with about a cupful of sugar, dust with cinnamon, sprinkle on a few currants and roll up like jelly roll.
Cut crosswise in slices, three inches thick, and crowd them, cut side up, into small, deep, round pans; let rise and bake about 35 minutes in a moderate oven.
As the sugar melts and forms a syrup, they must be watched closely lest they burn.
To serve, cut in slices or pull apart with a fork.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)

title: Sour Milk Fudge
directions: Mix cocoa and sugar together.
Add some milk and butter.
Stir often and cook till it forms a soft ball in water.
Remove from fire and beat in vanilla well.
Put in buttered pan and mark before it is cold.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf

Let them boil very fast with the lid off, until tender.
Drain the water off and serve.

title: Crescent Rolls
directions: You can use the same dough as for kolaches.
Form into balls the size of a walnut.
Let rise until about double in size.
Then form into crescents.
Place into a well greased pan, well spaced.
Let rise and when double in size brush with egg, beaten with a little salt.
Sprinkle with poppy seed.
Bake in a hot oven 400f degrees 12 to 15 minutes.

Cream this mixture and pour either into a loaf pan or make two layers in 9-inch pans.

directions: Boil the melon rind in water until tender ; drain the water off ; make a syrup of the other ingredients.
Boil all this and pour over the rind boiling hot; drain off the syrup and let it come to a boil; then pour it over the second time and seal jars.

directions: Cook potatoes and peas in separate pans, in salted water until soft and almost free of water.
Mix the peas and potatoes and add the milk.
Bring to the boiling point then add the butter and flour which have been blended smooth and cook until thickened.

For many tastes 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg, and 1/4 teaspoon cloves would be a good combination.

directions: Cook together the tomatoes, garlic, and bay leaf about 20 minutes for fresh tomatoes, 10 for canned.
Press through a sieve.
Brown the beef, onion, and green pepper in the fat.
Blend in the flour.
Add cooled, sieved tomatoes, sugar (if used), salt, and pepper.
Cook over low heat , stirring constantly, until thickened.
Serve hot on cooked spaghetti, noodles, or rice.

title: Lutefisk
directions: Cut fish in four sections.
Place in kettle of cold water, add plenty of salt and gradually bring to a boil.
Do not boil lutefisk to long or it will fall to pieces.
It may be boiled in a cloth bag, as it will keep its shape better.
Drain and serve with melted butter.
other_info:

Equipment: pot, stove

title: Mexican Tamales
directions: Boil 2 pounds of veal until tender; salt while boiling.
Chop very fine, and season with plenty of cayenne pepper and a little garlic.
Have ready a thick paste made of 1 cup corn meal mixed with a little boiling water.
Shape the veal into rolls the size of the little finger, and encase each in the corn meal paste.
Take the inner husks of indian corn, cut off the ends, leaving the husks about 6 inches long, and wash them in boiling water.
Wrap each tamal in corn husk, throw 2 or 3 mexican peppers into the liquor in which the veal was boiled, and cook the tamales in it for 15 minutes.
Chicken, with a little fresh pork, can be used instead of veal.

directions: Mix the dry ingredients together.
Combine the beaten egg, liouid, and melted fat.
Add to the dry ingredients all e.
T once; stir just enough to moisten and give the mixture a rough appearance.
Fill greased muffin pans two-thirds full.
Bake in a hot oven for about 20 minutes.

Stir in the onion, cabbage, salt, and dill.
Cover and simmer until just tender, about 15 minutes.
Pour sour cream over cabbage.
Serve hot.

title: Pennsylvania Dutch Chicken And Oyster Pie
directions: Stew chicken until tender, season with 1/4 pound butter, salt and pepper.
Line deep dish with pastry crust.
Pour in the stewed chicken and cover loosely with a crust in the center of which a hole the size of a tea cup has been cut.
Prepare separately 1 pint oysters, heating the liquor with a little flour and when it comes water.
Season with salt, pepper and 2 tablespoons of butter.
To a boil, pour over oysters.
20 minutes before pie is done, lift the top crust and put the oyster mixture in.

Chop onion and parsley very fine.
Cut bacon into very small dice.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Put a spoonful of this on each slice of steak.
Roll together and tie with thread.
Brown these on both sides first, then let simmer on a slow fire for one hour.

title: Fruit Whip II
directions: Chill milk thoroughly and whip until stiff.
Add lemon juice and whip until very stiff.
Fold in cold fruit pulp.
Serve cold.
Fruit whip may be frozen in either the trays of an automatic refrigerator or packed in a mold and frozen with a 1:3 salt-ice mixture.
Apple sauce may be used in this whip.

Mix well add the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, nut-meats, salt, milk, vanilla and lemon extract.

Pour into a loaf-cake pan prepared with waxed paper.
Bake thirty minutes in a moderate oven.

When the mixture is cold, add the remaining cider, chill, and just before serving add the soda water.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, peeler, saucepan, stove

title: Spanish Lima Beans
directions: Cover lima beans with cold water; let stand overnight; drain.
Cover with boiling salted water: bring to boil; cook 1/2 hour.
Cook onions in fat or salad oil until golden brown: add remaining ingredients.
Drain beans; add.
Simmer in 1 1/2 -quart saucepan 1 hour or until beans are tender.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: lima bean, onion, salad oil, tomato, bay leaf, salt, pepper, sugar

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, pot, saucepan

title: Chicken Corn Soup
directions: Put cut-up chicken and onion into the water and cook slowly until tender, add salt.
Remove chicken, cut the meat into small (1-inch) pieces and return to broth, together with corn, which has been cut from the cob, celery and seasoning, continue to simmer.
Make rivels by combining 1 cup flour, a inch of salt, 1 egg and a little milk.
Mix well with fork or fingers to form small crumbs.
Drop these into the soup, also the chopped, hard-boiled eggs.
Boil for 15 minutes longer.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: chicken, celery, water, onion, corn, egg, salt, pepper, rivel

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Caesar Salad II
directions: Toast bread squares in shallow pan in 300f.
Oven for 20 minutes, or until golden brown, turning often.
Tear lettuce into bite-size pieces.
Rub salad bowl with garlic.
Just before serving, sprinkle cheese over greens.
Pour over greens the salad oil mixed with worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper.
Toss gently.
Break whole raw egg over greens; pour lemon juice over the salad.
Toss until all of the egg disappears and all of the greens are shiny.
Sprinkle bread crumbs over top of the salad; toss lightly, and serve at once.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: garlic, salad oil, bread, lettuce, blue cheese, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, egg, lemon juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, baking pan, bowl, knife

title: Carrot Cake
directions: Mix spices with sugar, boil for five minutes, with cold water, raisins, shortening, and carrots.
Cool thoroughly.
Add walnuts, flour, salt and soda.
Mix well and bake slowly in pan.
other_info:
Author: Person.Lela Bray
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, carrot, water, raisin, cinnamon, clove, nutmeg, shortening, walnut, salt, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, tube pan, oven

title: Flaky Pastry II
directions: Divide the fat into three equal portions, rub one part into the flour in the usual way, add a pinch of salt and mix to a stiff paste with cold water.
Roll out into a long narrow strip, rolling backwards and forwards only.
Spread the second portion of fat evenly over the paste, fold into three and turn with the rough edges towards you.
Roll out again and proceed in the same way.
Fold over and roll to required shape.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, rolling pin

title: Chleb Psenicny (White Bread)

ingredients.name: fresh yeast, or 2 pkgs. active dry

directions: Soften yeast in warm water.
Scald milk and cool.
Combine yeast mixture, milk, sugar, salt, shortening, and half the flour.
Mix with spoon until smooth.
Let set for 1/2 hour.
Then add remaining flour and knead until smooth and elastic.
Let rise in warm place until doubled in bulk (about 1 1/2 hours).
Punch down.
Let rise again until almost doubled in bulk (about 30 minutes).
Shape into 2 loaves.
Place in greased bread pans.
Let rise about 1 hour.
Bake at 375 degrees for 25 minutes.
Reduce to 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until done.
The loaves are done when they shrink from the side of the pan and give a hollow sound when tapped on the bottom or side.
Remove from pans and let cool on wire rack.
Brush the crust with grease.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven, baking pan

title: Brides' Salad
directions: Mix the gelatin with water or fruit juice and allow to stiffen to consistency of thick syrup.
Then whip.
Beat cream cheese.
Then add to whipped cream.
Fold into beaten or whipped gelatin.
Add the rest of the ingredients.
Pour into molds and set away to congeal.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)

Ingredient: gelatin, fruit juice, cream cheese, whipped cream, apple, pineapple, celery

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, egg beater, mold

title: Chocolate Frosting
directions: Melt chocolate over hot water.
Add salt, vanilla and milk.
Sift in sugar, about a cupful at a time, stirring to blend well.

Equipment: stove, measuring spoons, measuring cups, pot

title: Whole-Wheat Bread
directions: 1 cupful liquid yeast or "leaven " may be used in place of 1 yeast cake.
Use less liquid in the bread.
other_info:

Contributor: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: milk, sugar, salt, yeast cake, water, whole wheat flour, white flour

Equipment: oven, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Pineapple Charlotte
directions: Soak gelatine in cold water ten minutes.
Add boiling water and sugar.
Stir this until ingredients are thoroughly dissolved, then add juice of 1/2 an orange and shredded pineapple.
Mix well and put in ice box to cool.
Before the mixture quite hardens, beat 1/2 pint of cream in it and replace it in the ice box to harden.
Garnish with shredded cocoanut or cherries and serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.Olive Borden
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: gelatine, sugar, water, orange, pineapple, whipped cream

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, stove

title: To Boil Meat
directions: Weigh the meat, allow twenty minutes to each pound, and twenty minutes extra for dishing up.
Put the meat into boiling water, boil five minutes, then draw the saucepan to the side of the fire, and simmer ; keep the meat well covered with water ; serve with a teacupful of its own liquor.
Never throw away the liquor in which meat has been boiled ; it makes excellent soup.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Meat

Ingredient: meat, water

Equipment: pot, stove, saucepan

title: Lentil Soup with Frankfurters
directions: Soak lentils overnight in cold water.
Remove from water, cover with bouillon and let simmer slowly for two or three hours, or until lentils are soft.
If the stock cooks down, add more stock.
You will probably find it convenient to use the canned bouillon.
When the lentils are soft, put through strainer, crushing the lentils and adding the lentil paste to the soup.
Skin frankfurters and cut into one-half inch slices and add frankfurters and grated onion.
Cook slowly for ten or fifteen minutes, seasoning to taste.
other_info:
Author: Person.Ford Sterling
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, grater, stove, strainer, pot

title: Mustard Butter
directions: Cream all the ingredients well together.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater

directions: Mix and bake.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven

title: Brown Sugar Chocolate Cake
directions: Set oven for moderate, 350f.
Grease and flour two 8-inch round cake pans.
Sift together the first 4 ingredients.
Cream shortening; add sugar gradually; beat until fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time: beat well after each addition.
Stir in vanilla and chocolate.
Add sifted dry ingredients, a little at a time, alternately with milk; stir only enough to blend well.
Pour into pans.
Bake 30 minutes or until top springs back when lightly touched with fingertip.
Cool in pans 5 minutes.
Remove; cool on a rack; frost.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, cake pan, egg beater, sifter

title: Vino Pampeliskove (Dandelion Wine)
directions: Boil water, allow to cool.
Pour over lemons, oranges, raisins, dandelion blossoms, and sugar.
Add yeast.
Let stand 10 days, then strain.
Let stand again 4 weeks.
Then put in jugs.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club

title: Turnip Tops or Spinach
directions: Wash well in several waters, strip oif the leaves and place them in a saucepan of cold water with a little salt, and boil till tender.
Strain and squeeze them as much as possible, chop very fine on a board, put tack in the sauce- an with the dripping, pepper and salt, and mix well till thoroughly hot.
Serve decorated with hard-boiled eggs cut in quarters.
other_info:

Equipment: saucepan, measuring cups, stove, strainer, knife

title: Barley Biscuits
directions: Sift the dry ingredients together, mix in the fat, and add the liquid until a soft dough is formed.
Roll to about three-fourths inch thick, cut with a cookie cutter, and bake in a hot oven.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Food Administration, Organization.United States Department of Agriculture

Ingredient: barley flour, salt, fat, baking powder, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, bowl, rolling pin, oven

title: Bamia B'lahma Mafrouma (Okra with Ground Beef)

ingredients.name: fresh okra, or 2 8 oz. packages frozen whole okra

directions: In a deep skillet melt one tablespoon butter over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until it becomes yellow; then add ground beef, pepper and salt, and cook, stirring constantly for about 5 minutes.
Stir in half of the tomato sauce (4 oz) and continue to cook over low heat for 15-20 minutes.
In a medium saucepan put half of the okra.
Top it with the prepared meat.
Then add the other half of okra, one spoon of butter and the rest of the tomato sauce, the garlic powder and 1 1/2 cup of water.
Cook over medium heat for about 20 minutes until okra is tender (you may add a little more water if needed) and just covered with sauce.
Serve hot with rice and salad.
other_info:

title: Salmon and Grape Rolls
directions: Sprinkle a little lemon juice on thin slices of smoked salmon, place half a peeled green grape on each, roll up, and serve on sticks.

title: Fricassee of Potatoes
directions: Place a layer of sliced raw potatoes in bottom of baking dish, season with salt, pepper, and bits of butter; then another layer of potatoes and season the same way, and so on until you have the quantity desired.
Then cover the whole with milk, place in the oven, and bake until a delicate brown.
other_info:

Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Equipment: oven, baking dish

title: Cream Dressing
directions: This dressing may be used for asparagus, or toast, or dried beef.
Put milk in a farina kettle.
Beat yolk of 1 egg.
Dissolve 1 teaspoonful cornstarch in a little milk, and mix with the yolk.
When milk comes to a boil, stir in the mixture ; then add a lump of butter, and salt and pepper to taste.

title: Rum Punch
directions: Dissolve the sugar and butter in a little boiling water.
Mix in the other ingredients, adding 1/2 pint boiling water, and serve hot.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, saucepan, stove, strainer

title: Maple Ice Cream
directions: Put maple syrup over the fire in a granite dish; heat just to boiling; before removing from the fire, add the beaten yolks of eggs; let them scald, not boil, or they will curdle.
When cool, stir in cream and add the white of an egg beaten stiff, then freeze.

title: Baked Tomatoes
directions: Hollow out centre (half way) of each tomato.
Season bread crumbs with pepper, salt, and sweet marjoram, and butter well rubbed through.
Fill hollowed-out part of each tomato with the seasoned bread crumbs.
Bake in hot oven until thoroughly soft.
other_info:

title: Stuffed Flank Steak
directions: Set oven for slow, 325f.
Melt butter in a 10-inch skillet.
Add onion.
Cook until golden brown.
Add next 6 ingredients and mix well.
Spread on steak.
Roll up like a jelly roll; tie securely with string.
Heat fat in the skillet.
Brown meat roll on all sides.
Sprinkle with additional salt and pepper; add the 1/2 cup boiling water.
Cover; bake 1 1/2 hours or until meat is tender.
other_info:

title: Chocolate Sauce for Ice Cream
directions: Sift cocoa and sugar together; pour on boiling water and let it come to a boil and boil 1 minute.
When cold, beat in 1 teaspoonful vanilla.

title: Peanut Butter Sandwiches
directions: Cream the peanut butter, add the butter.
Cream again, add the salt and salad dressing, mixing well.
Cut the bread evenly.
Butter one side of the bread very thinly with the peanut butter mixture.
Place the lettuce leaf on one slice and place another slice upon it, buttered side down.
Press firmly and neatly together.
Cut in two crosswise.
Arrange attractively in a wicker basket.

title: Deep-Dish Apple Pie
directions: Set oven for hot 400f.
Pare and core apples; cut in eighths.
Place in a greased 8 by 8 by 2-inch baking dish.
Combine sugar, brown sugar, nutmeg, lemon and orange rinds.
Sprinkle over apples.
Dot with butter or margarine.
Roll out pastry; adjust over apples.
Prick with a fork.
Bake 50 to 60 minutes.

title: Potato Soup (Gruumbier Suupe)
directions: Boil potatoes and onion in small amount of water until soft.
Add milk, salt and pepper then reheat.
Brown flour in the butter and blend it slowly into the potato mixture.
Add a little water to the beaten egg and stir into the soup, let it cook for a few minutes and serve with a sprinkling of chopped parsley.

title: Egg Sauce II
directions: Melt the butter in a stew-pan, mix in the flour, and add the milk, and cook 3 minutes after it boils, stirring it all the time add the finely chopped whites of eggs, pepper and salt the sieved yolk to be used for decorating.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pastry cutter, bowl

title: Apple Sauce
directions: Quarter the apples and cook with the water until soft enough to rub through a strainer, adding sugar and spice about 10 min.
Before removing from fire.
If sauce is desired unstrained, core the apples before cooking.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, sugar, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, strainer, pot

title: Ginger Cookies—Gingerbread Men
directions: Cream together shortening, brown sugar, spices and salt.
Add the egg, mix thoroughly.
Add molasses and blend.
Sift together twice the flour, soda, baking powder and add to the molasses mixture.
Stir well and chill.
Roll out a fourth of the dough at a time, on floured board to a little more than 1/8 inch thick.
Cut with gingerbread man cutters or other shapes.
Bake on greased cookie sheets in moderately hot (375f) oven, 8 to 10 minutes.
Cool before decoration.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, baking sheet, egg beater, rolling pin, refrigerator

title: Peach Dumplings
directions: Make a syrup of the sugar with the butter and 2 cups hot water.
Add the peaches.
Let this come to a boil.
Make dumplings by mixing flour and baking powder and sait into a fairly stiff batter with milk or cream.
Drop large spoonfuls of this batter into the boiling syrup and peaches.
Cover and cook for 20 minutes.
Serve while hot.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, flour, butter, baking powder, cream, salt, peach, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Egg Sauce
directions: Prepare a white sauce of the butter, flour, water and milk.
Blend beaten egg yolks with a little of the hot sauce, stir into sauce and cook 5 minutes longer.
Remove from fire.
When cool, add lemon juice.
Beat 1 to 2 minutes.
Serve with asparagus, broccoli, or fish.

title: Sour Milk Biscuits
directions: Mix and sift dry ingredients.
Work in shortening with fork or blender.
Add all liquid quickly and make soft dough.
Pat or roll on dough board, cut and bake at once at 500f.
other_info:

title: Scalloped Potatoes II
directions: Melt butter in double boiler or sauce pan.
Add flour, seasoning and stir smooth.
Slowly add the hot milk stirring constantly.
When it thickens melt the grated cheese in the sauce.
Into a buttered baking dish or casserole put layers of the sliced potatoes, onions and cheese sauce, repeating until all ingredients are used.
Bake in a moderate oven (350f) for 1 hour.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, double boiler, oven, baking dish

title: Banana Sherbet
directions: Select full, ripe bananas, well flecked with brown spots.
Remove peelings and outside fibrous portion.
Press bananas through a coarse sieve.
Combine ingredients in order given.
Let stand in cold plate 1/2 hour before freezing.
Freeze with a 1:6 salt-ice mixture.
If 1/3 cup lemon juice is added to ingredients given above and orange juice is increased to 5 cups and sugar to 7 1/2 cups (3 3/4 pounds) another very excellent sherbet results.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: banana pulp, sugar, evaporated milk, orange juice, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sieve, refrigerator

title: White Fruit Cake
directions: Mix flour with fruit (no butter).
other_info:
Author: Person.Claudia Biggs
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg white, sugar, milk, flour, baking powder, vanilla, almond, pecan, cherry, pineapple

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven

title: Butterscotch Rolls
directions: Follow instructions for rolls until second rising.
After second rising, roll dough to 1/4 inch thickness.
Brush with melted butter, sprinkle with brown sugar and raisins or chopped nuts.
Roll as for jelly roll.
Cut slices about 1 inch thick and place in pan that has been spread with a mixture of brown sugar and melted butter.
About 2 1/2 quarts brown sugar and 1 pound butter will be required.
Cover and let rise until doubled in bulk.
Bake in a moderate oven (375f) about 25 minutes.
Remove from pan as soon as baked.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, salt, shortening, water, evaporated milk, yeast, flour, brown sugar, butter

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, rolling pin, baking pan

title: Cheese Straws
directions: Mix together flour, cheese, salt, cayenne and the yolk of one egg, then add enough water to make paste sufficiently consistent to roll.
P]ace it on a board and roll to 1/4 inch thickness.
Cut it into narrow strips and roll so each piece will be the size and length of a lead pencil.
Place them in a baking tin and press each end on the pan.
Bake to a light brown in a moderate oven.
These straws are very nice with salad and will keep for several days.
It is well to heat them before serving.
other_info:
Author: Person.Florence Vidor
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: salt, flour, egg yolk, Parmesan, cayenne pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, rolling pin

title: Green Peppers Stuffed with Rice
directions: Cut the stem ends from the peppers, and remove all seeds; add one-eighth of a teaspoonful of soda to each pepper, fill with water and allow to stand one-half hour.
Mix one cup of white sauce with the rice, onions, chopped pepper and paprika.
Fill the pepper cases and bake thirty minutes in a moderate oven.
other_info:

After stuffing cherries and olives, place in mold attractively, then add gelatin, small amount at a time, to set until all is added.
Serve with mayonnaise as decoration.

White corn syrup makes a more delicate sauce.

Mix lightly with onion, cucumber, bacon and salad dressing.
Let stand 1 hour in a cold place to season.
When ready to serve, garnish with sliced hard cooked eggs.

title: Browned Rice
directions: Wash rice.
Pat dry with paper towels.
Heat fat or salad oil in deep heavy 2-quart saucepan.
Add rice; stir over low heat until each rice kernel is golden brown.
Add boiling water slowly and carefully as steam will rise.
Add salt.
Cover.
Simmer 25 minutes (do not lift cover or stir).
The rice should have absorbed all the water and be dry and flaky.

directions: Boil sugar and water ten minutes without stirring, add lemon cool and bottle.
Juice, and any other fruit juices.
Keep on ice and dilute with ice water when desired for use.
Serve mint leaves with the fruit juice.

directions: Wash peas, add cold water, vegetables and ham bone and simmer for three hours or until mixture is thick.
Remove ham bone, force peas through coarse sieve and season to taste.
Dilute with milk.
Serve with toasted croutons.

Bake in buttered pans or custard cups in a moderate oven (350Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â° f.

title: Pineapple Sliced
directions: Remove the skin and eyes from the pineapple.
Cut cross- wise in half-inch slices, and the slices in cubes, at the same time discarding the core.
Sprinkle with sugar and stand in a cold place for an hour before serving.

Category: Dessert

Ingredient: pineapple, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, knife

title: Rye Bread
directions: Soak yeast in 1/2 cup warm (not hot) water until dissolved.
Mix this with all the other ingredients except the lard and salt.
Set bowl holding dough in warm water until bubbles form in dough.
Add lard and salt.
Knead, adding enough white flour to make a firm dough.
Let rise in warm place until double in bulk.
Punch down.
Form into two loaves (see weissbrot recipe for specific directions on shaping loaves).
Place in greased pans.
Leave in warm place to rise again until doubled in bulk.
Bake at 350f for 35-40 minutes.
For a soft crust, sprinkle water over baked loaf and cover with a cloth.
For a hard crust, spread butter on hot loaf.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven, baking pan

title: Baked Custard
directions: Set oven for 325f.
Combine eggs, sugar, and salt; mix well.
Scald milk; add slowly, stirring constantly.
Add vanilla.
Pour into 1 1/2 -quart casserole.
Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Set in pan of cold water.
Bake 1 1/4 hours, or until knife inserted near rim comes out clean.
Cup custard variation: use 4 eggs instead of 6, set cups in pan of cold water and bake as above 1 hour.

[T is now ready to serve.

Shape into balls about the size of a walnut.
Chill in refrigerator for at least four hours or store in freezer.

Serve hot.

Shake well, strain into a tail glass and add the ice and soda water to taste.

ingredients.name: fine dry bread crumbs, or corn meal

directions: Cut fillets into serving-size pieces.
Sprinkle with salt.
Mix egg and milk in a flat dish.
Dip fish in egg mixture, then in bread crumbs.
Heat fat about 1/8-inch deep, in a skillet.
Add fish; fry over medium heat, turning to brown evenly.
Reduce heat to low and cook 10 minutes, or until it flakes easily with a fork.
Drain well.

title: Home-made Bread
directions: The flour is sifted carefully and into the centre is poured the yeast (1/2 cake), which has been previously mixed with a little water added to the half pint of lukewarm milk.
Beat the sponge well and set to rise.
When it becomes light, add sugar, butter and salt.
Knead well and set to rise again.
Bake in a moderate oven.

title: Chicken a la King

ingredients.name: sliced raw mushrooms, or 2 2/3 cups canned

directions: Cook peppers and mushrooms, if they are raw, slowly in the butter 10 minutes.
Cover while cooking.
Remove mushrooms and peppers from butter and add flour.
Blend well, then add broth.
Boil until mixture begins to thicken, then add milk and seasoning.
Cook over boiling water until sauce thickens, stirring to keep smooth.
Add chicken, mushrooms, peppers and pimientos and reheat.
Serve on hot buttered toast or in patty shells.

title: Savory Broiled Chicken
directions: Place chicken in shallow baking pan.
Combine remaining ingredients to make a marinade.
Pour over chicken.
Let stand in refrigerator at least 1 hour; turn chicken once.
Remove from marinade.
Place, skin side down, on broiler rack.
Put in preheated broiler 4 to 5 inches from heat.
Broil 12 minutes, basting often with marinade.
Turn; broil 15 minutes or until tender, continuing to baste.

title: Tomato-Apple Butter
directions: Sterilize jars by placing clean jar, lids, and caps in warm water, and boil 15 - 20 minutes.
Cook tomatoes 20 to 30 minutes.
Press through a sieve and measure out 4 cups.
Cook apples in water until very tender.
Press through a sieve and measure out 2 cups.
Combine sieved tomatoes and apples, lemon juice, sugar, and spices.
Cook mixture rapidly about 25 minutes, or until thickened and clear.
Stir frequently to prevent sticking.
Pour into hot, sterile jars.
Seal.
Store in a cool, dry, dark place.

title: Nut Candy
directions: Put maple syrup into a marbelized pan; add cream.
Stir over a hot fire until, when a little of the syrup will harden in cold water.
Now add nuts, cut or broken as may be desired.
Stir the nuts into the syrup.
Pour into a buttered plate, and then when partly cold mark in squares.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Nudle (Noodles)
directions: Beat egg yolks.
Add milk and beat.
Add flour and salt.
Stir lightly with a fork and turn onto floured board.
Knead dough, working in additional flour.
This requires about 1/2 cup flour.
Do not overknead as the noodles will become tough.
Roll the dough thin, as for pie crust.
Cut into strips.
Stack the strips and slice off narrow slices.
Toss with a small amount of flour so that the noodles will not stick together.
Drop noodles into a large kettle of boiling water or broth, slowly, and stir after each addition so that the noodles will not lump together.
Cook for about 15 to 20 minutes.

Chill.

Heap in lettuce-lined bowl.
Garnish with eggs and tomato wedges.

Combine egg, brown sugar, buttermilk, and shortening.
Add.
Mixx just enough to moisten dry ingredients.

Beat egg yolks and add.
Sift in baking powder and flour, then add the water and honey.
Put fruit and nuts thru food chopper and flour well.
Follow soloman's advice for making good boys- 1st clause of proverbs, 23:14.

title: Indian Croutes

Melt the fat in a pan, fry the shallot and add the curry powder and seasoning.
Stir over the heat for a few seconds, and add the haddock.
Mix well, and stir in the cream.
Place a slice of tomato on each piece of toast, pile the mixture on top, put in the oven to make really hot, and serve sprinkled with parsley.

title: Mulligatawny Soup
directions: Prepare the vegetables, fry the onions in hot dripping in the stew-pan; when brown add the apples cut up and cored, carrots, turnip, celery, herbs and salt.
Boil these in the stock.
Mix the flour, curry paste and powder into a smooth paste with the water, pour into the soup, and stir till it boils.
The fat should be skimmed off as it rises.
Boil at least 1 hour, and then strain through a sieve.
Serve with well-boiled rice.

ingredients.name: cup fresh or canned (No. 2 1/2 can) tomatoes, .

directions: Cook together the tomatoes and onions about 20 minutes for fresh tomatoes, 10 for canned.
Press through a sieve.
Melt the fat; blend in flour and sugar (if used).
Gradually add cooled, sieved tomatoes.
Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Gradually add tomato mixture to milk, stirring constantly.
Heat slowly to serving temperature.
Add salt.
Serve at once.

Blend thoroughly.
Pour into well greased loaf pans.

Shape dough into long rolls.
Roll in wax paper and store in cold place for 12 hours.

title: Chicken Paprika II
directions: Cut up and boil chicken until tender.
Sauce : skim fat from broth in which the fowl was boiled.
Place two tablespoons of the chicken fat in a pan and blend into it 3 tablespoons of flour.
Add to it the broth and allow to boil.
Add sour cream, paprika and the liver put through a sieve.
Salt to taste.
Lay the chicken in the sauce and heat through.
While preparing sauce have noodles cooking in plenty of salt water.
Drain and sprinkle with one cup of bread crumbs that have been slightly browned in butter.
Noodles: to every egg add 1/2 shell of cold water.
Beat slightly and salt.
Add flour enough to make a stiff dough.
Roll out very thin, dry slightly, roll up and cut.
Let dry and boil in salted water 1/2 hour.
Serve with the chicken and sauce.

Category: Dessert, Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: evaporated milk, peanut butter, corn syrup

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, bowl

title: Baked Pinto or Great Northern Beans

ingredients.name: molasses, or 2 cups water sorghum syrup

directions: Wash the beans well, and soak overnight in water to cover.
In the morning add 2 cups more water, and cook until almost tender.
Score the rind of the salt pork, put half of the pork with the onion in the bottom of the bean pot, and add the beans.
Mix the molasses or sorghum syrup and other seasonings with a little hot water, and pour over the beans.
Add just enough more water to cover.
Place the rest of the salt pork on top, cover the pot.
And bake the beans very slowly for several hours.
Add a little hot water from time to time to replace that which cooks away or is absorbed by the beans.
Keep the lid on the bean pot until the last hour of cooking.
Then uncover and allow the beans and pork on top to brown.

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, knife, bowl

title: Hungarian Honey Cakes
directions: Bring honey to a boiling point, then skim and take from fire.
When cool, add one pound of the flour and set overnight in a cool place.
Next day beat up eggs with sugar, add almonds, peels, spices and baking powder, grated rind and strained juice of the lemon.
To this add the honey dough, mix well and add remainder of flour, or sufficient to make a dough that can be easily rolled out with a rolling pin.
Take a small part of dough (leave the remainder in a cool place) roll it out thin and cut in round forms or squares.
Lay on greased tins and bake in a hot oven until crisp.
Repeat this process until the dough is all used.

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot, sieve, baking pan, oven

title: Kebab Hela (Meat Cassarole)

ingredients.name: 1/2 pound beef, English cut (cut in 1 inch cubes)

directions: Mix onion, lemon juice, garlic powder and meat.
Set aside for about 45 minutes.
In a medium saucepan cook the meat mixture over medium heat, turning constantly with a large spoon till all moisture is gone.
Add the butter, stirring till all meat is coated with the butter.
Add about 2 cups of water, cover and simmer over lowered heat.
When all water has evaporated, add more; repeat until meat is tender, then add salt and pepper.
Simmer for another ten minutes until little sauce is left.
Serve hot with vegetables and salad.

title: Potato Pancakes
directions: Add egg yolks to the mashed potatoes and mix well.
Add the flour and baking powder alternate with the milk until smooth.
Fold in the stiffly beaten egg whites and drop spoonfuls on hot greased griddle or skillet.
Finely chopped onion is sometimes sprinkled on the batter on griddle before turning.
Serve hot with meat.

directions: Mix dry ingredients thoroughly.
Beat eggs and add all dry ingredients, then mix with heated water and vinegar.
Cook in double boiler until thick.
Fine for potato or egg salad or on fresh tomatoes.

title: Glaze for Savouries

To make a red glaze use tomato sauce and omit the meat extract and gravy browning.

title: Grapefruit and Crab Cocktail
directions: Cut the grapefruits in half, carefully remove the flesh, chop and place in the skins or in glasses.
Mix the asparagus with the oil, lemon juice and seasoning, pile on the grapefruit, and top each with a little crab.
To decorate, put 1 teaspoon mayonnaise on each portion, and garnish with parsley,.

title: Brownie Cakes
directions: Cream sugar, butter and eggs together; add melted chocolate, flour, walnuts and vanilla.
Beat well.
Pour into large flat greased pan and bake in slow oven for 25 minutes.
When cool cut in medium sized squares.

title: Braised Leg of Mutton
directions: Place the mutton in a stew-pan on a layer of slices of smoked beef, add some pepper and salt, the stock or water, and simmer gently 3 1/2 hours (in the oven, if possible).
Prepare and cut up the vegetables, and add all the ingredients, except the sprouts, to the meat 1 hour before serving.
Boil the sprouts separately and add them when serving.
Thicken and brown the gravy if liked.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, saucepan, stove, oven

title: Christmas Butter Cookies
directions: Cream butter until it resembles whipped cream and slowly add the sugar, beating well.
Add flour gradually and blend thoroughly.
Wrap in waxed paper and chill for several hours.
Knead dough slightly on floured board, form into a smooth ball.
Roll to about 1/4 inch thick and cut to desired shapes.
Place on ungreased cookie sheets and bake in moderate oven (350f) about 12 minutes.
When cold decorate with butter icing, candied fruit, etc.

Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, flour, brown sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, baking sheet, egg beater, rolling pin

title: Boiled Sheep's Head
directions: Soak the head for one hour in lukewarm water.
Then remove the tongue, brains, and all the thin soft bones from the inside of the head.
Tie it together put it in a saucepan, cover with water, adding the salt, and bring it slowly to the boil ; take off the scum.
Prepare the vegetables, wash the barley, and add all to the head.
Let the whole simmer gently for 3 hours.
About 1/2 hour before it is done, tie the brains in a little piece of muslin, and throw them into the saucepan.
Boil the tongue separately.
When done, place the head on a hot dish.
Mash the turnips with a little dripping, pepper and salt, form into little balls, and place round the dish alternately with the carrots.
Halve the tongue, and lay it across the head.
Pour over all a sauce made of the flour browned in the dripping, half a pint of the stock in which the head has been boiled, the brains, slightly chopped, and a little finely-chopped parsley.
The broth may be used as it is, or made into a soup of any kind.

title: Twice Baked Potatoes
directions: Bake potatoes until done.
Cut in half lengthwise and remove the potatoes from the skin which is used as a shell for serving.
Put potato through ricer, add butter, salt to taste and beat in cream or milk until light and fluffy.
Stir in 1/2 cup chopped onion; fill six potato skins with mixture and sprinkle grated cheese and paprika over the top.
Bake until brown.

title: Whole-Wheat Muffins (2)
directions: Mix the dry ingredients together.
Combine the beaten egg, liquid, and melted fat.
Add to the dry ingredients all at once; stir just enough to moisten and give the mixture a rough appearance.
Fill greased muffin pans two-thirds full.
Bake in a hot oven for about 20 minutes.
