title: Mint Jelly
directions: Wash and cut open apples.
Put in kettle with water to almost cover.
Boil till cooked thoroughly.
Strain in jelly-bags, leaving over night.
To a cupful of juice, add seven-eighths cupful sugar.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Boil till a drop jellies on a saucer when dropped from the spoon.
Remove from stove ; hang a cheese-cloth bag full of mint-leaves over the edge of the kettle and press with back of wooden spoon till the desired flavor has been secured.
Color the desired shade with leaf green.
Pour into jelly glasses which have been boiled in pan on the stove.
When cold, pour melted paraffin over the jelly, cover and set away.

title: Orange Nut Bread
directions: Cut oranges with rind left on-into 1-inch pieces.
Cover with water boil 10 minutes, drain.
Save liquid.
Add raisins to orange pulp, blend thoroughly.
Place medium blade m food grinder.
Grind fruits.
Combine flour, graham flour, baking powder, salt, sugar.
Blend thoroughly- do not sift.
Gradually add fruits to dry ingredients, stirring constantly.
Add egg, beat vigorously, dissolve baking soda in orange iiquid.
There should be one cup of, liquid.
Add water, if necessary.
Gradually add iiquid to dry ingredients, beating vigorously.
Add vanilla, nuts.
Blend thoroughly.
Pour into well-oiled pan-bake fifty minutes, 350 degrees.

directions: Mix the flour, lemon-juice and eggs together, stir in the water stir over the fire till the sauce has thickened add salt or sugar as required.

title: Peach Cobbler
directions: Set oven for very hot, 450f.
Blend 1 cup sugar, cornstarch, and cinnamon in 2-quart saucepan; add water.
Bring to boil, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat.
Add butter and peaches.
Pour into a shallow baking dish.
Combine biscuit mix and 2 tablespoons sugar; blend in cream with a fork.
Drop dough in 6 mounds around edge of baking dish.
Combine 2 remaining tablespoons sugar and lemon peel; sprinkle on dough.
Bake 25 minutes or until peaches are tender and biscuits golden brown.
Serve warm with plain or whipped cream.

Add the water, sherry, lemon juice, sugar, mint and nutmeg.
Stir well, cover with a lid and allow to stand for 20 minutes.
Just before serving, strain the cup, and add the beer and a few pieces of ice.

directions: Mash fish roe with a fork, add one unbeaten egg, cream and seasoning.

Roll in beaten egg.
Then roll in cracker crumbs.
Fry in deep fat.
Garnish with parsley and cream sauce.

Beat well.
Add vanilla and butter.
When cool place the custard mixture in the puffs.

Powder and seasoning.
Bake fifteen minutes in hot oven.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, rolling pin, egg beater

title: Creamy CBO Pudding
directions: Preheat oven to 350f degrees.
Melt 4 tablespoons of the butter in a frying pan, add chopped onions, a pinch of salt and pepper, cooking up onions until soft.
Place cream, eggs, flour, sugar, 2 cups of the corn, a pinch of salt and pepper into a deep bowl, using beaters, blend until only slightly "lumpy" with the corn.
Add the cooked onion and the remaining corn, using the beaters on the lowest setting to simply mix well into the earlier mixture.
Grease a 2 quart oven safe baking dish and pour the mixture into the dish.
Sprinkle the fresh chives on top and back at 350 for 50-60 min.
The mixture is ready when set, but with still light movement in the middle.
Allow to set for 15 minutes before serving.

title: Hrozinkovy Paj (Raisin Pie)
directions: Cook raisins in water until tender.
Remove from fire.
Add sugar mixed with flour.
Add flavoring.
Fill two unbaked pie shells.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, crock pot, oven

title: Cabinet Pudding

ingredients.name: English walnut, cut or broken into particles
walnuts, cut or broken into particles
raisins, boiled till tender and seeded
milk, leave enough to wet 3 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch

directions: Mix first five ingredients in a bowl and prepare the following pudding: boil milk, beat eggs and sugar into cornstarch and add to milk.
When the cornstarch is thoroughly cooked, take from the fire, flavor with lemon extract, and stir in the nuts, citron, and raisins.
Then pour into cups, adding a macaroon to each cup.
When cold turn out of the cups and serve with the following sauce : beat the yolk of an egg and 1 1/2 tablespoonfuls sugar together, add a large cupful cream and a teaspoonful vanilla.
If the cream is too rich, part milk may be used.
The white of an egg beaten very light, added, is an improvement.

title: Lemonade
directions: Cut 3 thin slices of lemon, and reserve them for decorating.
Thinly peel the remaining lemons and place the rind in a bowl with the sugar, pour on the boiling water and leave until cold.
Add the lemon juice, strain and cool.
Serve in a jug, with the lemon slices and ice cubes,.

Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, peeler, stove, strainer, pot

title: Bride’s Cake
directions: Cream the butter, add the sugar and continue creaming the mixture.
Mix and sift three times the flour, salt, baking powder and cream of tartar.
Add these dry ingredients alternately with the milk to the first mixture.
Add the almond and vanilla extracts.
Beat two minutes.
Cut and fold in the egg-whites which have been stiffly beaten.
Pour the cake batter into a large, round loaf cake pan, having a hole in the center.
Bake forty-five minutes in a moderate oven.

When the cake is removed from the oven, allow it to stand in a warm place for five minutes, then with a spatula and a sharp knife, carefully loosen the cake from the sides, and turn out onto a cake cooler.
When cool, cover with white mountain cream icing.

ingredients.name: oatmeal (one fourth the quantity of potatoes)

directions: Mash the potatoes, and make into a paste with the other things, roll out about 1 1/2 inch thick, grease the bottom of a dish, fit the paste in and bake it.

title: Ham
directions: Wipe a slice of ham (one-third of an inch thick) and remove the rind.
Place in a hot frying-pan.
Add the water.
Cook until brown on both sides (about fifteen minutes).

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife, stove

title: Stewed Steak
directions: Melt the dripping, cut the steak into 3 pieces, and fry them.
Then take out the meat, cut the onion and carrot into thin slices, the turnip into thick blocks, and fry these in the dripping.
When they are browned, lay the meat on top of them, add the seasoning and 1/2 pint of warm water.
Close the lid and simmer 2 hours.
Thicken with the flour 1/4 hour before serving; add the chopped parsley at the last minute.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, saucepan, pot

title: Asparagus
directions: Vegetables should be thoroughly washed and cooked till tender in freshly boiling, salted water (1/2 tablespoon salt to 1 quart water).
Remove white part of stalk and tie in bunches.
Cook about 20 minutes.
When asparagus is soft, drain well and place on slices of buttered toast which have been previously dipped in the water in which the asparagus was cooked.
Season with required seasonings.
other_info:

Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: asparagus, water, butter, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Jenny Lind Pudding
directions: Make a quart of soft custard, and season with one teaspoonful of lemon extract or two tablespoonfuls of wine.
When cold, pour on the cakes, which have been arranged in a deep glass dish.
Sprinkle the grated cocoanut over this, and serve.
If you have not the fresh cocoanut use one cupful of the prepared.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mary Brian
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ladyfinger, macaroon, cocoa, cocoanut cake, lemon, flavoring

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, grater

title: Dutch Apple Cake
directions: Mix flour, salt and baking powder.
Cut in the butter.
Add the milk and egg.
Mix well spread one-half an inch thick in a shallow pan.
Pare and cut the apples in lengthwise sections.
Lay in rows in the dough with the sharp edges pressed lightly into the dough.
Mix the sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle over the top.
Bake thirty minutes in a moderate oven.
Serve with lemon sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, egg, salt, milk, baking powder, apple, butter, sugar, cinnamon

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven

title: Light Rolls
directions: Add the sugar and salt to the scalded milk and when lukewarm, add the yeast dissolved in the lukewarm water, and cover and set in a warm three-fourths of a cup of flour.
Place to rise.
Then add the melted butter, the well-beaten egg, and enough flour to knead.
Let rise in a warm place.
Roll to one-half an inch in thickness and shape with a biscuit cutter.
Butter the top of each.
Fold over, place in a buttered pan, close together.
Let rise again for forty-five minutes and then bake in a quick oven for twenty minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Bread

Ingredient: sugar, flour, salt, butter, milk, egg, yeast cake, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, rolling pin, egg beater

title: Kugel
directions: Shred the suet and candied peel, wash and dry the currants, stone the raisins, mix all the dry ingredients together, add the eggs, well-beaten, place in a greased basin and tie a cloth over.
Put the basin at the bottom of a large earthenware pan ; place a plate on the top of the basin and the meat on this.
Throw the peas, beans, onion, pepper, salt and flour into the pan, cover all with water, and tie a piece of brown paper over the pan.
Put it in the oven when the cooking is finished on friday, and dish up when required on saturday, serving the soup, meat, and pudding as separate courses.
other_info:

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, baking dish

title: Apple-Stuffed Pork Shoulder
directions: Cook onion in butter or margarine until golden brown; combine with remaining stuffing ingredients.
Set oven for moderate, 350f.
Fill pocket in pork shoulder with stuffing; fasten with small skewers laced together with white twine.
Place pork on rack in open roaster.
Roast, figuring 40 minutes per pound.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: onion, butter, salt, pepper, oregano, bread crumb, apple, water, pork shoulder

Equipment: oven, measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, skewer

title: Lemon Bread Pudding
directions: Bring lemon juice and butter to boiling point.
Add the 1 1/4 quarts sugar and pour slowly over the 15 beaten eggs.
Cook over hot water until mixture thickens.
Pour this mixture over the bread crumbs and let stand 10 minutes.
Add the 10 beaten eggs, 1 cup sugar, salt, lemon rind, milk and water.
Pour into buttered pudding molds or baking powder cans.
Lemon bread pudding puffs up while steaming, so fill molds only 3/4 full.
If individual molds are used, this recipe will fill 54 molds with 1/3 cup mixture each.
Cover and steam 1 1/2 hours.
Serve while still warm.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: lemon juice, butter, sugar, egg, salt, lemon rind, evaporated milk, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pan, egg beater, steamer

title: Old-Fashioned Duten Cake
directions: For the sponge take 1 quart and 1 pint of flour, 1 quart of warm water, 1 tablespoonful sugar, 1 tablespoonful lard, 1 cent's worth baker's yeast.
Melt the lard and sugar in the warm water.
Stir this into the flour, which must be sifted.
Lastly, stir in the yeast.
Beat up hard for several minutes and set to rise over night.
The next morning sift 2 quarts and i pint of flour in a deep bread tray with 2 tablespoonfuls of salt.
Into this mix thoroughly 1/2 pound roll butter and 1/4 pound lard.
Make a hole in the middle of the heap, into which put the following:â€” grated nutmeg, 3 cups sugar, eggs,sultana raisins and currantsâ€”washed and dried, the risen sponge.
Work this the same as bread.
Then divide into loaves, putting these into well-greased, round, deep pans.
Set the pans in a warm place (over the range, if possible), with a cloth thrown over them to exclude the air and dust.
Let rise from five to six hours.
Then bake in a moderate oven one hour, or until a clean straw, run through the thickest part, will come out clean.
other_info:
Author: Person.Laura G Fagen


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Ingredient: flour, water, sugar, lard, yeast, salt, butter, nutmeg, egg, raisin

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, grater, baking pan

title: Red Beet Eggs
directions: When making pickled beets, save some of the spicy pickling liquid and put into it a half-dozen, shelled, hard-boiled eggs.
These take on a beautiful color and excellent flavor and are grand as appetizers served with crisp hearts of celery.
They are also good sliced in sandwiches or salads.

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, beet

Equipment: knife

title: Bengal Savouries
directions: Stamp out rounds of the bread and butter, potato and beetroot with a 1 1/2-inch cutter.
With a smaller cutter remove the centre of the rounds from the beetroot slices, to form rings.
Place a slice of potato on each bread round, then a beetroot ring.
Fill the centre with chutney, and pipe with mustard butter.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: brown bread, butter, potato, beet, 

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Fish Chowder

ingredients.name: cooked eggs, chopped, may be omitted

directions: Halibut, haddock or cod are best.
Remove bone and cut fish into small pieces.
Cook head and back bone in 6 quarts boiling water 15 minutes.
Strain.
There should be 5 1/2 quarts fish stock.
Fry salt pork and onions in soup kettle until onions are slightly brown.
Remove pork and onions and keep hot.
Arrange layer of fish in bottom of kettle and sprinkle with salt, pepper and flour.
Add a layer of potatoes, and then the onion and pork.
Repeat.
Add the fish stock and cook slowly without stirring until potatoes and fish are done, about 45 minutes.
Add scalded milk.
Garnish each serving with chopped egg.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Soup, Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: fish, stock, salt pork, onion, pepper, salt, flour, potato, evaporated milk, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot

title: Scotch Woodcock
directions: Melt the fat in a pan, lightly scramble the egg with the milk and season to taste.
Pile on the rounds of toast, and decorate with capers and a cross made of anchovy fillets.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: butter, toast, egg, caper, milk, anchovy, seasoning

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pan

title: Puffy Omelet
directions: Add tapioca, salt and pepper to milk; cook in double boiler 15 minutes or until tapioca is clear and mixture thickened, stirring frequently.
Add butter.
Cool; combine with egg yolks, stirring constantly.
Fold in egg whites.
Set oven for moderate 350f.
Pour egg mixture into hot buttered 9-inch frying pan.
Cook over low heat 3 minutes.
Transfer to oven; bake 15 minutes.
Omelet is done when an inserted knife comes out clean.
Cut across at right angles to handle of pan, being careful not to cut all the way through.
Fold carefully from handle to opposite side and serve on hot platter.
other_info:

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, pan, double boiler

title: Chicken Filling
directions: Combine chicken, celery, walnuts, and olives with enough mayonnaise for easy spreading.

Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company

Category: Sandwich

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: chicken, celery, walnut, olive, mayonnaise

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, knife

title: Moravian Christmas Cookies
directions: Mix all together, except the flour, being careful to heat enough to melt the butter.
Then " work in " the flour.
This makes a large quantity, as the cakes should be rolled very thin.
Keep the cookies in a dry place, and they will be crisp and delicious as long as they last, even for months.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mary McCurdy
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: brown sugar, butter, flour, molass, ginger, clove, cinnamon, soda, orange juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven

title: Oatmeal Bread

ingredients.name: yeast, or 1 cake dry dissolved in 1 cup lukewarm water

directions: Add boiling water to oatmeal and let stand 1 hour.
Beat in the molasses, milk, salt, shortening, dissolved yeast and flour.
Cover and let rise in a greased bowl until doubled in bulk.
Knead well.
Shape into loaves and put into greased bread pans.
Let rise again until doubled in bulk.
Bake in a hot oven (425f) 15 minutes, then in a moderate oven (375f) 45 minutes longer.
If dry yeast is used, prepare this dough at night, let rise in a medium warm place over night, and until doubled in bulk in the morning; from this point proceed as above.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: oatmeal, water, molass, evaporated milk, salt, shortening, yeast, flour

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, bread pan, egg beater, bowl

title: Beef Stewed with French Beans
directions: Stew the beef 3 hours in the water.
String the beans, cut them in halves, peel and cut up the onions, and add all to the beef at the end of the first hour.
About 10 minutes before serving skim off all the fat; mix smoothly in a separate basin the flour, sugar, vinegar, pepper and salt, and add the mixture to the stew.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Meat, Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef, bean, onion, water, vinegar, flour, sugar, pepper, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, knife, stove

title: Silver Cake II
directions: Sift flour once; measure, add baking powder and sift three times.
Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add flour and milk alternately, a small amount at a time, beating after each addition until smooth.
Add flavoring.
Fold in egg whites, bake in two 9-inch layer pans, 375f, for 25 to 30 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs H Ward Conde
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, baking powder, shortening, sugar, milk, lemon extract, egg white

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, oven, bowl, baking pan

title: Baked Prune Whip
directions: Remove pits from prunes and mash to a pulp.
Add lemon juice, peel, and 2 tablespoon sugar; blend well.
Add remaining 2 tablespoon sugar to egg whites; beat until stiff.
Fold prune mixture slowly into egg whites.
Pile lightly in greased baking dish.
Bake in moderate oven (350f) 20-30 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: prune, lemon juice, lemon peel, sugar, egg white

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, egg beater, baking dish, oven

title: Cauliflower
directions: Remove outside leaves and soak in cold water (head down) for 1/2 hour.
Cook whole, or separate into flowerets.
Cook 30 to 60 min.
Serve in a white sauce made from required seasonings.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cauliflower, water, butter, salt, pepper, milk, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Kjod-Rul (Meat Roll)
directions: Cut to make a roll about seven inches in length.
Season with chopped onion, salt and pepper.
Form into roll and sew with strong cord.
Place roll in boiling water and cook until tender.
Remove from water and place between two plates or flat tins and press until cold.
Use something heavy to press.
Remove string when ready to serve and slice thin.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Coon Prairie Church

Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef, onion, salt, pepper

Equipment: knife, bowl, pot, plates

title: Banana Cream Chiffon Cake

ingredients.name: cup (1 cup plus 2 tbsp) sifted cake flour, (Spoon lightIy into cup, don't pack)

directions: Preheat oven to 325f (moderate and slow).
Measure-(all level measurements)-and sift together into mixing bowl, flour, sugar, baking powder, salt.
Make a well in the center of dry ingredients and add in order: oil, egg yolks, water, bananas, flavoring.
Beat with spoon until smooth.
Measure into another large mixing bowl: egg whites, cream of tartar.
Whip until whites form very stiff peaks.
They should be much stiffer than for angel food or meringue.
Do not underbeat.
Pour egg yolk mixture gradually over whipped egg whites, gently folding with rubber scraper just until blended.
Do not stir.
Pour into ungreased 9-inch tube pan, 31' inches deep immediately.
Bake 50 to 55 minutes in slow moderate over, 325f, or until top springs back when lightly touched.
Immediately turn pan upside down, placing tube part over neck of funnel or bottle.
Let hang, free of table, until cold.
Loosen from sides and tube with spatula.
Turn pan over and hit edge sharply on table to loosen.
Split cake crosswise in three even layers with saw-toothed knife.
Spread whipped cream filling between layers (widest layer on bottom) and over top and sides.
Garnish with banana slices.
Keep in refrigerator until serving time.
Dip banana slices in lemon, orange, grapefruit or pineapple juice to keep from turning dark.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, sifter, bowl, tube pan, refrigerator

title: Potato Croquettes
directions: Mix 2 large cups cold mashed potatoes with melted butter, egg, onion, and cream.
Season rather highly with pepper, salt, parsley and sweet marjoram.
Form in croquettes, brush with beaten egg, dip in cracker dust, and fry in hot lard until a golden brown.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot

title: Sweet And Sour Celery
directions: Cut up celery and cook in a little salt water until soft and almost dry.
Make a dressing of the egg, flour, sugar, vine gar and water, bring to a boil and when it thickens add the sour cream.
Pour this over the celery, heat and serve.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: celery, flour, salt, egg, sugar, water, vinegar, sour cream

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, knife

title: Stewed Shin of Beef (with Dumplings)
directions: Prepare the carrots and turnips and boil them quickly 20 minutes in 1 quart of water.
Cut the meat into pieces, fry a light brown in the dripping, then place the pieces in a saucepan.
Peel and slice the onions, fry them in the same dripping, then stir in carefully 2 tablespoonfuls of flour to brown.

Add the carrots and turnips to the meat, pour the water in which they were boiled into the frying pan to brown; then add it with the onions, pepper and salt to the meat, etc , and stew slowly 1 1/2 hour.
Shred the fat fine and rub it into the flour with the baking-powder and salt.
Mix with lukewarm water to a stiff paste.
Cut into eight pieces, and roll lightly into dumplings on a floured board.
Throw them into a saucepan of boiling water, and boil till they rise to the surface (20 minutes).
Add them to the stew 10 minutes before serving.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen

Measure: avoirdupois

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, frying pan

title: Angel Cookies
directions: Cream butter, shortening, and sugars.
Add other ingredients in order given.
Roll into balls the size of a walnut or smaller.
Dip top in cold water and then sugar.
Place on greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 425f for 10 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, baking sheet, oven

title: Mint Sauce
directions: Wash the mint, pick it from the stalk, and chop it fine; dissolve the sugar in the vinegar, then add the chopped mint.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, knife

title: Scalloped Potatoes

ingredients.name: quart water, mixed with evaporated milk

directions: Place a layer of potatoes in a buttered baking dish.
Dot with butter, sprinkle with flour, salt and pepper.
Repeat.
Pour diluted milk over all.
Bake in a moderate oven (350f) until potatoes are tender, 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Equipment: baking dish, oven, knife, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Date Muffins
directions: Mix the sugar, dates, baking powder, flour and salt.
Add milk in which one egg has been beaten.
Beat two minutes.
Add butter, melted.
Fill well-buttered muffin pans half full of the mixture, and place in the oven.
Bake twenty minutes.
Serve hot or cold.

Category: Bread

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater

title: Baked Apples II
directions: Wash the apples (if an apple corer be handy core them), notch them across the top, place them in a york- shire pudding tin, with the sugar, lemon-rind, lemon- juice, water, and cinnamon.
Bake till tender; serve hot or cold.
For apple snow, pass through a sieve and beat in lightly whites of 2 eggs and 3 ounce castor sugar, then pile roughly on a dish, and decorate to taste.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, brown sugar, cinnamon, water, lemon

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, baking pan

title: Baked Lima Beans
directions: Soak beans overnight in cold water.
Drain, add 2 quarts of fresh water and boil until tender.
Pour beans in buttered casserole.
Add minced pepper, onion, tomatoes and seasoning and mix.
Put bacon or salt pork on top and bake, covered.
Add water if necessary.
Bake 2 hours at (325f).
Uncover for the last 20 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Side, Meat

Ingredient: lima bean, tomato, salt pork, salt, onion, mustard, green pepper, brown sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, casserole

title: To Clear Soup
directions: Chop up the beef fine; clean the vegetables and cut them into small pieces.
After removing all the fat from the stock, which should now be in the form of jelly, place it in a stew-pan with the meat and vegetables.
Whisk it over the fire until just on boiling point, when it should be left to boil up well.
It should now be clear.

Fix a clean kitchen-cloth on the legs of a chair, placed with its seat on a table ; pour boiling water several times through the cloth into a basin, and then let the soup run twice slowly through the cloth.
Another way: use 2 whites of eggs whisked in 1/2 pint cold water, instead of the gravy beef.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pan, pot, sieve

title: Chocolate Cake II
directions: Cream the fat and sugar, add the egg yolks, sirup, and melted chocolate, and beat well.
Sift the dry ingredients together and add alternately with the milk.
Add vanilla and fold in the stiffly beaten whites.
Bake in loaf or layers in a moderate oven.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Food Administration, Organization.United States Department of Agriculture

Ingredient: fat, milk, brown sugar, barley flour, egg, baking powder, corn syrup, salt, chocolate, vanilla

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, pastry cutter, sifter, oven

title: Beleila (Peeled Wheat Dessert)
directions: Stir the wheat into the water in a medium saucepan and cook for 30 minutes or until the wheat is tender.
If necessary, another h cup of water may be added, but the consistency should be very thick.
Remove from heat and stir in sugar and vanilla.
Mix the raisins, coconut and nuts.
Spoon the cooked wheat into 6-8 small bowls.
Sprinkle the raisin-nut mixture over the top and refrigerate.
Serve cold.
other_info:

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: peeled wheat, water, sugar, vanilla, raisin, coconut, hazelnut

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, saucepan, oven

title: Sweetbreads a la Windsor
directions: Put sweetbreads in cool water with a little salt for one hour.
Drain, put into saucepan, cover with boiling water and boil very slowly 25 minutes; drain and when cool separate and remove all membrane.
Cut into small pieces.
Melt butter, add flour and stir until smooth.
Add milk and cream slowly, stirring constantly until boiling.
The sweetbreads should be previously cooked and cut into cubes, add seasoning, peas and sweet- breads to sauce.
Heat thoroughly and serve hot.
other_info:
Author: Person.Claire Windsor
Contributor: Person.Carolyn van Wyck, Organization.Photoplay Magazine

Category: Meat, Main Dish

Ingredient: butter, flour, cream, sweetbread, milk, pea, seasoning

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, strainer, stove

title: Broiled Beef Steak
directions: Wipe a porterhouse steak with a damp cloth and trim it neatly; have the broiler well heated; lay the steak on it, and place as near the flame as possible, without having it catch fire.
As soon as the surface is seared turn and sear on other side; then place broiler so that the steak is 3 or 4 inches from the flame.
If the steak is 1 inch thick, cook from 8 to 10 minutes, turning 2 or 3 times.
Place on a hot plate, spread with butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
other_info:

Equipment: oven

title: Stuffed Dates
directions: Dates will not require soaking, but should be washed and dried thoroughly.

Remove the stones with a sharp knife and refill the dates with nuts, crystallized ginger, fondant, peanut butter, or cream cheese, made into small rolls after seasoning with a little salt and paprika.
When nuts, ginger, or fondant are used, roll the dates in powdered sugar and serve as a confection.
Cheese dates or nut-butter dates may be served with a salad or after dinner with crackers.

Equipment: knife, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Washington Cake

ingredients.name: baking soda, dissolved in a little sweet milk

directions: Cream butter and sugar together, add the well-beaten eggs and the sour milk, then flour (sifted), mace, vinegar and soda.
Bake in a moderate oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Frances L Standbridge
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, flour, egg, buttermilk, mace, vinegar, baking soda

Equipment: egg beater, bowl, oven, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Sugar Biscuit
directions: Boil the milk; when it is lukewarm, dissolve in it half a yeast cake.
Measure in your pan 1 pound of flour; add 1 cup of sugar, 1 egg, 2 ounces of lard, the salt and the flavor.
Mix these ingredients with the milk in which the yeast has been dissolved, and stir until the lumps are all gone.
After mixing thoroughly beat steadily for five minutes, sprinkle a little flour over the top and set to rise.
Cover the sponge so it will be warm (when yeast is used, mix with the milk and add the yeast last, beating thoroughly).
In the morning, add to the light sponge the other 1/2 cup of sugar and make into a soft dough (be careful not to make the dough stiff).
Let this rise again, and when light mold into small biscuits.
Set these to rise, letting them get quite light before baking.
When risen enough, bake in a hot oven until done (about thirty minutes).

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, baking tray, pot, egg beater, oven

title: Graham Crackers
directions: Wet with sweet milk and roll them thin.

title: Fish-Tomato Stew

directions: Cook potatoes in fat until lightly browned.
Add onion, green pepper, tomatoes.
Cover and cook until potatoes are tender.
Add cooked fish, cut in about 2-inch pieces.
Season with salt, and pepper.
Cook about 5 minutes longer.

Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, molass, butter, egg, sour milk, flour, soda, ginger

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven

title: Biscuits
directions: Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with other dry ingredients twice.
Blend shortening with dry ingredients until mixture has appearance of coarse corn meal.
Add diluted milk.
Mix lightly and quickly.
Knead just enough to give a smooth surface.
Roll dough to 1/2 inch thickness.
Cut and place on ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in a hot oven (450f) until brown, about 12 minutes.
Drop biscuits variation: increase the milk to 2 3/4 cups and water to 2 3/4 cups; drop by tablespoonfuls on greased pan.
Cheese biscuits variation: add 1 1/2 cups grated cheese, working it in with the shortening.
Sour milk biscuits variation: add 1/4 cup vinegar to the diluted milk; omit baking powder and use 2 teaspoons soda.

Shortcake variation: increase shortening to 3 cups (1 1/2 pounds), cut dough with large biscuit cutter, place half of the biscuits on greased baling sheets, brush with melted butter and cap with remaining biscuits, when baked, lift off caps, pour on melted butter, then fruit, replace caps and add more fruit, one gallon sweetened crushed berries or peaches is required for this amount.
Fruit cobbler variation: roll shortcake dough to 1/2 inch thickness and lay over the top of sweetened fruit; bake in a hot oven (425f) until brown.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, baking powder, salt, shortening, evaporated milk, water

Equipment: oven, baking sheet, measuring spoons, measuring cups, sifter, rolling pin

title: Scalloped Chipped Beef and Potatoes
directions: Prepare a white sauce of the butter, flour, salt, water and milk.
Peel and slice potatoes, and shred dried beef.
Place a layer of potatoes on bottom of greased baking pan.
Add onions and dried beef, and one-half of the white sauce.
Add another layer of potatoes and cover with remaining white sauce.
Bake in a moderate oven (350f) until potatoes are tender, about 1 hour.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mabelle S. Ehlers, Person.Florence J. Atwood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, flour, salt, water, evaporated milk, potato, beef, onion

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, baking pan, oven

title: Champagne Cup
directions: Place the ice in a large jug and add the ingredients in the above order.
Stir well, and decorate with slices of fruit in season.
Hock cup variation: substituting hock for champagne, and omitting the abricotine.
Claret cup variation: substituting claret for champagne, and a little lemon juice for the abricotine.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, abricotine, Curaçao, brandy, champagne, soda water

Equipment: bowl, measuring cups, measuring spoons, strainer

title: Piquant or Sharp Sauce
directions: Melt the dripping in a stew-pan, add the vegetables cut up small, and fry them brown, then add the vinegar and boil stir in the flour and stock and cook 3 minutes after it boils.
Add the seasoning, strain and serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: vinegar, liquor, dripping, flour, shallot, pickle, pepper, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Chocolate Wafers
directions: Sift dry ingredients together three times.
Blend in butter, milk and vanilla.
Mix in chocolate.
Butter and flour outsides of 2 cookie sheets.
Spread mixture thinly, about 1/8 inch thick, with spatula on inverted pans for ease in removing late.
Sprinkle with nuts and pat them in.
Bake in moderate oven 350f 8 to 10 minutes.
Crease in strips 1-1/2 x 3 inches at once, as they become very crisp and fragile when cool.
May be cut in any desired shape.
Quickly remove with spatula.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, powdered sugar, flour, salt, milk, vanilla, chocolate, walnut

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, oven, baking pan

title: Snow Pudding
directions: Dissolve the cornstarch in a little of the milk and the sugar in the remainder.
When it begins to boil add the dissolved cornstarch, stirring constantly until it becomes a smooth paste.
Then, remove from fire and add the whites of eggs, beaten to a stiff froth.
Pour into individual moulds and serve with a custard made of the yolks of the eggs, 1 pint of milk, sugar and flavoring to taste.
other_info:
Author: Person.Nellie I Morris
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: milk, cornstarch, egg, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, egg beater

title: Jumbo Hamburgers
directions: Choose a lean cut of prime or choice grade beefâ€”top round, sirloin, or boneless rumpâ€”and have it ground once.
Allow 1/4 pound of beef for each hamburger.
Divide the meat, handling it gently, into the number of burgers wanted.
Then divide each burger in half and pat each half into rounds about 1 1/2 inches thick.
Season one round with salt, black pepper (freshly ground is best), grated fresh onion or onion powder.
Top with second round and pinch edges to seal.
Brush each side with basting sauce.
Grill about 3 inches from hot coals.
For rare hamburgers allow about 5 minutes for first side, turn, and cook about 5 minutes more.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, grill

title: Stew Soup No. 2
directions: Cut the meat, onions, and herbs up small, and simmer gently for two hours and a half.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.W Drysdale & Co


Source: Cookery for the Million (1877-01-01)


Category: Soup, Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: meat, onion, rice, parsley, herb, salt, pepper, water

Equipment: knife, stove, pot

title: Quick Carrot and Turnip Soup

ingredients.name: grated, ground or finely chopped carrots, or turnips

directions: Cook onion in fat for a few minutes.
Stir in flour.
Add milk and carrots or turnips.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir well and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Root Vegetables in Wartime Meals (1943-05-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: onion, fat, flour, milk, carrot, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Melted Butter
directions: Melt the butter in a saucepan, stir in the flour gradually, then add the water, stirring all the time ; let it boil well and thicken.
Anchovy sauce or chopped parsley can be added to taste.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, flour, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, saucepan, stove

title: Peanut Pudding

ingredients.name: stale bread crumbs, or 1 cup dried crumbs

directions: Soften the peanut butter with a little of the hot milk.
Soak the bread crumbs in the remainder of the milk.
Add the egg, beaten, with the sugar and salt, then the peanut butter.
Mix thoroughly and bake about one-half hour in a moderate oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bread crumb, milk, sugar, egg, peanut butter, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, pot, stove

title: Jellied Beef
directions: Soak the gelatin in one tablespoon cold water for three minutes.
Add the boiling water and dissolve thoroughly.
Add the meat, onion, pimento, salt, pepper, lemon juice and parsley.
Stir well together and turn into a mould that has been moistened with cold water.
(A square or rectangular mould is preferable.
) Stand in a cold place for two hours.
When cold and firm, unmould on lettuce leaves and cut into slices.
Salad dressing may be served with it.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Main Dish

Ingredient: beef, parsley, onion, lemon juice, pimento, gelatin, salt, water, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, refrigerator

title: Casserole of Lamb
directions: Cut lamb into small pieces, roll in flour, and brown well in hot fat with the onion.
Then put this into a well-greased casserole with the tomatoes and 1 cup of hot water.
Bake this two hours, replenishing the water from time to time.
Add potatoes and carrots and bake for 3/4 of an hour longer.
Thicken the gravy with a few tablespoons of flour and serve very hot.
other_info:
Author: Person.Edmund Lowe
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)

Ingredient: lamb, onion, potato, tomato, carrot, seasoning

Equipment: measuring cups, knife, oven, rolling pin, casserole

title: Potato Yeast Bread

ingredients.name: lukewarm water, to soften yeast cake

directions: Mix in ordinary manner.
The dough will be very stiff at first, but much thinner after first rising.
Probably you will have better results if you make a sponge with the potatoes, liquid, and a part of the flour, first, and, when risen, add the remaining ingredients.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes, Ten Lessons On Food Conservation (1918-01-01)

directions: Mix and bake.

Ingredient: flour, bran, baking powder, molass, baking soda, milk, salt, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven

title: Peace Sauce
directions: Combine ingredients and cook slowly until slightly thickened.

Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert, Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, brown sugar, egg yolk, peach, cinnamon

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot

title: Baked Salmon
directions: Mix milk, flour, butter together and bring to a boil.
Beat egg light.
Season the salmon with pepper, salt, and a dust of celery seed.
Beat the egg with the salmon and last add the boiling flour, butter, and milk.
Stir together and bake half an hour or twenty minutes in a quick oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Miss Elizabeth McCandless
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: salmon, milk, butter, flour, egg, pepper, salt, celery seed

Equipment: oven, baking sheet, measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater

title: Pickled Peaches
directions: Boil together and pour hot over : ripe peaches, one half peck, previously paired, and a clove stuck in each.
Let it stand till the next morning, when pour off, boil again and pour it over.
Repeat this two or three times, till the peaches seem penetrated- with the liquor.
Some like free-stone peaches the best and some clings.
If cling-stones, they will require more boiling, perhaps three or four times.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1919-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: vinegar, brown sugar, cinnamon, clove, mace

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, pot

title: Nadivka (Dressing for Stuffing Poultry)
directions: Simmer the giblets about water.
Soak bread (cubed) in broth from giblets or milk or part of each.
Saute onion, celery in margarine.
Combine with: poultry seasoning, marjoram, eggs, salt, diced giblets.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: giblet, water, bread, onion, celery, margarine, poultry seasoning, marjoram, egg, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Beets California
directions: Wash beets; trim off roots and all but 1 inch of stems: add 1 cup boiling salted water.
Cover; cook until tender, about 40 to 50 minutes.
Drain; rub off skins under cold running water; remove stems.
Melt butter or margarine; add orange peel, orange juice, and salt.
Pour over beets; heat.
Garnish with unpeeled orange slices cut in small sections.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beet, butter, orange, orange juice, salt

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, pot

title: To Roast Meat
directions: Have a bright and clear fire ; weigh the meat, allow twenty minutes to each pound, and twenty minutes extra for dishing up ; flour the joint well, and sprinkle it with salt; let it roast quickly the first ten minutes, then put it farther from the fire, and let it cook more slowly, basting often ; flour occasionally.
When dishing up, pour the dripping out of the pan, and set it aside.
Add one pint or more of boiling water to the brown lumps under the dripping, and put it in the hottest part of the oven.
Pour this gravy over the meat and serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Meat

Ingredient: meat, flour, salt, dripping, water, 

Equipment: oven, baking pan

title: Cherry Roll Delight
directions: Sift all dry ingredients, cut in shortening.
Beat egg, add milk and vanilla.
Stir into dry ingredients.
Form into ball on floured pastry cloth.
Roll dough into rectangle 1/4 inch thick.
Brush with melted butter.
Cover with filling.
Roll as for a jelly roll.
Place in greased loaf pan 4 by 12.
Bake at 375f for 40 minutes.
Slice and cover with cherry sauce.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, shortening, egg, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, egg beater, rolling pin, loaf pan, oven

title: Pease Pudding
directions: Soak the peas for a day; tie them loosely in a cloth and boil gently for two hours, when soft, drain and mash them, adding the egg and butter with a little pepper and salt, replace in the cloth and boil gently for half an hour.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.W Drysdale & Co


Source: Cookery for the Million (1877-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pea, egg, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, bowl, masher, pot, stove

title: Bran Butterscotch Cookies
directions: Cream the lard, add the sugar, well beaten eggs and bran.
Mix well.
Sift the flour with the baking powder and add to the first mixture.
Shape into a roll and store in refrigerator.
When needed, slice thin and bake on cookie sheet in hot oven (425f) for about 12 minutes.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.Mary Cullen's department, Household arts service of The journal


Source: Food Fashion Revue Cooking School Second Session (1938-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: lard, brown sugar, egg, bran, flour, baking powder

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, refrigerator, egg beater, knife, baking sheet, oven

title: Boiled Coffee
directions: Scald an agate or aluminum coffeepot.
Mix egg, using part of shell, with half the cold water and add to the coffee.
Put into coffeepot, pour on it the boiling water, and boil hard for 3 min.
Clear the spout, pouring back the coffee ; add remainder of cold water and let stand on back of stove for 10 minutes.
Serve with cream or scalded milk.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, coffee, egg

Equipment: pot, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Gulas (Goulash)
directions: Cut meat into bite size pieces.
Place the meat in pressure cooker with water or boil in kettle.
Add: celery salt, chili powder, celery (optional), parsley, onion, celery salt, pepper, paprika.
Boil 50 minutes under 10 lbs pressure or boil until tender.
While the above is cooking place 2 tbsp grease in a medium sized skillet on medium heat.
Blend in flour.
Brown, stirring frequently.
Cool.
Add 1 1/2 cups water gradually.
Stir until smooth.
Set aside.
Place gingersnaps in a bowl.
Pour 1/2 cup water over the ginger snaps.
Set aside until the meat is done.
When the meat is tender, add the ginger snaps and the browned flour mixture.
Add: ketchup, brown sugar, vinegar, 1/2 cup water, kidney beans (or more if desired).
Goulash is best when allowed to set 3 or 4 hours after being prepared.
If goulash becomes quite thick 1/2 cup water may be added.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pork, beef, water, celery, celery salt, chili powder, parsley, onion, pepper, paprika, flour, gingersnap, ketchup, brown sugar, vinegar, kidney bean

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pressure cooker, skillet, stove, bowl

title: Our Way of Cooking Kidney
directions: Trim every particle of fat from a fresh beef kidney and cut the flesh into small pieces.
Wash in clear cold water, and drain lightly, then put in a frying pan, cook about five minutes, turning all the time with a fork.
Then add a pretty large piece of butter, some pepper and salt to suit the taste.
Let this all cook a few minutes and turn out on a hot dish.
Serve immediately.
Particular care must be taken to add no more water to the kidney than adheres to it after draining.
other_info:
Author: Person.Anna M Soumeillan
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: metric

Ingredient: kidney, water, butter, pepper, salt

Equipment: skillet, knife

title: Cheese Butter
directions: Cream all the ingredients well together and add a few drops of green or other colouring.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: cream cheese, milk, seasoning, 

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater

title: Cream of Corn Soup
directions: Cook onion and green pepper slowly in the butter for 5 minutes.
Add flour.
Salt and cayenne.
Stir to blend well.
Add water slowly, then the corn and cook until thickened, stirring frequently.
When ready to serve, add milk.
Serve hot.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, onion, green pepper, flour, salt, cayenne pepper, water, corn, evaporated milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot

title: Grandma Slifer's Ketchup Sauce
directions: Boil one hour, stirring all the time.
Just before taking off, add 1 quart strong vinegar.
When cold, bottle and seal.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mary Beatty


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1893-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, salt, black pepper, clove, allspice, red pepper, onion, vinegar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Deviled Cheese Salad

ingredients.name: cup pimientos, cut in short strips

directions: Scald the 3/4 quart evaporated milk and water.
Add cheese.
Mix mustard and salt and add to the cheese and milk.
Soften gelatin in the cold water and dissolve over boiling water.
Add to the cheese and milk.
Cool, when mixture begins to stiffen, add the celery, pimientos, and ripe olives.
Chill the 1 1/2 quarts milk thoroughly and whip until stiff.
Fold into gelatin mixture and pour into molds to the depth of 1 inch.
Chill until firm.
Cut in desired shapes.
Individual molds may be used.
Serve on lettuce.
other_info:
Author: Person.M Faith McAuley, Person.Mary Adele Wood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, evaporated milk, cheese, mustard, salt, gelatin, celery, pimiento, olive

Equipment: pot, measuring cups, measuring spoons, chop, egg beater

title: Tuscan Salad
directions: Tear the ciabatta into small 2cm pieces.
Put into a roasting tray, drizzle with olive oil and toss with the fennel seeds, the oregano and a pinch of salt.
Mix so that the bread is coated then put under a high grill for 10 minutes or until golden.
Roughly chop together the capers with some of the basil leaves and the jarred peppers.
Crush over the garlic cloves or chop finely.
Add all of the tomatoes, roughly chopped.
Put into a large bowl with a splash of red wine vinegar, a good drizzle of olive oil and salt and pepper to taste.
Add the ciabatta.
Toss and gently squeeze the whole mixture together with your hands.
Top with the rest of the basil leaves and finely grated parmesan to serve.
Serve a generous portion and enjoy.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Oracle Ace, Person.Brendan Tierney


Source: ACE Cookbook (2013-02-23)


Category: Salad, Side

Measure: American

Ingredient: ciabatta, fennel, oregano, caper, basil, red pepper, garlic, cherry tomato, wine vinegar

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, baking tray, grill, knife, bowl

title: Stewed Ox-Feet
directions: Clean the feet thoroughly in hot water; cut them up and place in a stew-pan, with the onions cut up, rice and parsley and a little salt, cover with water and stew gently for three or four hours.
This is a very nourishing dish.
If placed in a basin and left to cool it will turn out.
A stiff jelly.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.W Drysdale & Co


Source: Cookery for the Million (1877-01-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ox-feet, rice, onion, parsley

Equipment: knife, pot

title: Ice Box Rolls
directions: Pour 1 cup boiling water, let stand until cold.
Put 2 yeast cakes in 1 cup cold water, 2 well beaten eggs, 6 cups flour, mix well but do not beat.
Keep in ice box at least 2 hours.
Make out into rolls.
Let stand 2 hours or more.
Bake in hot oven.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69
Contributor: Person.Claudia Biggs


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, shortening, sugar, salt, yeast cake

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, rolling pin, oven, refrigerator

title: Dutch Canpes
directions: Mix together the egg and haddock, and season to taste.
Pile on to the toast, and decorate each with capers.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: egg, seasoning, haddock, toast, caper

Equipment: measuring cups

title: Cheese Fondue III
directions: Bring milk to the scalding point in double boiler and add cheese and stir well until the cheese melts.
Add salt, pepper and paprika to taste, butter and the beaten yolks of three eggs.

Stir this until it is mixed thoroughly and then fold in the whites of three eggs beaten stiff -- remove from the fire and pour in a buttered baking dish, and sprinkle cup of bread crumbs over the top before putting in the oven.
Put in medium hot oven and bake for 20 minutes and serve with crisp toast and a green salad.
other_info:
Author: Person.Janet Gaynor
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, stove

title: Cabbage
directions: Prepare as for cauliflower recipe, quartering before cooking.
Cook 2 to 3 hours.
May be chopped, and seasoned or served in a white sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cabbage, water, butter, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove

title: Stuffed Peppers II
directions: Mix the meat, rice, eggs and seasoning together.
Cut tops off the peppers and soak in hot water for a couple of minutes.
Scoop out seeds and fill with the meat mixture.
Stand them in baking pan, pour the tomato soup over them and bake in slow oven (300f) for 1 hour.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ground beef, rice, green pepper, egg, tomato soup, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, baking pan, oven

title: Gangster Kick
directions: Shake well, strain into glasses and serve with a cherry.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, lemon peel, Curacao, brandy, cocktail cherry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, strainer

title: Suet Pudding
directions: Put the syrup on the stove and warm slightly, stir in the milk, then add the suet and spices, after which slowly stir in flour, lastly the fruit, which has some of the flour sprinkled over it.
Put into a well buttered pan and steam for at least 2 hours.
It makes an excellent plain pudding and better every time it is warmed over by simply putting back into the steamer and heating.
Imperial maple syrup makes an excellent sauce, either hot or cold, or you can thin the syrup a little, and add some butter, heating and stirring all the time.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Imperial Syrup Co


Source: Valuable Recipes (1920-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: suet, milk, maple syrup, raisin, flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, clove, citron

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pan, sifter

title: Swedish Fish Balls

ingredients.name: whole allspice, be used in gravy or directly in fish balls (optional)

directions: Mix above ingredients and form into about 40 fish balls about the size of golf balls.
Fry in butter until lightly brown.
Place in double boiler.
For gravy add more butter, then flour, and cream.
Use milk to thin a, little, plus seasonings.
Pour over fish balls in double boiler and simmer gently about 3/4 hour.
Also add dabs of butter.
(Too long over hot water will curdle gravy).
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs Harold Snow
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co


Source: Savory Seafoods of Oregon (1957-07-01)

Ingredient: sturgeon, onion, bread crumb, egg, pepper, salt, allspice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, double boiler, pot, stove

title: Crowdie - A Scotch Broth

ingredients.name: which a leg of mutton or beef, has been boiled

directions: Make the oatmeal into a paste with a little of the liquor over the fire; stir it well into the remainder, and serve hot, with bread, potatoes or boiled rice.

Contributor: Organization.W Drysdale & Co


Source: Cookery for the Million (1877-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: oatmeal, salt, pepper, liquor

Equipment: measuring cups, stove, pot, skillet

title: Quaker Muffins
directions: Set oven for hot, 400f.
Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy: stir in eggs, then corn meal.
Mix and sift flour, baking powder, and salt.
Stir currants into flour mixture.
Add to corn meal mixture.
Add milk; stir just enough to moisten.
Spoon into greased muffin pans.
Bake 25 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Bread, Breakfast

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: shortening, sugar, egg, corn meal, flour, baking powder, salt, currant, milk

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, muffin pan

title: Boston Brown Bread
directions: Sift together the dry ingredients.
Add the bran remaining in the sifter to dry ingredients.
Combine vinegar, milk, water and molasses.
Make a well in the dry ingredients, pour in the liquid and mix as quickly as possible.
Add raisins the last few stirs.
Fill greased molds, or pound baking powder cans, 2/3 full.
Cover closely and steam 3 hours.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: graham flour, rye flour, corn meal, baking soda, salt, vinegar, evaporated milk, water, molass, raisin

Equipment: steamer, measuring spoons, measuring cups, sifter, baking pan

title: Makovy Dort (Poppy Seed Cake)
directions: Soak poppy seed in milk for 2 hours.
Cream butter and add sugar.
Add poppy seed and milk.
Add dry ingredients slowly.
Fold in beaten egg whites.
Bake in layers or loaf pan.
Bake at 350 degrees.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: poppy seed, milk, butter, sugar, flour, baking powder, egg white, vanilla

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, bowl, loaf pan, oven

title: Steamed Boston Brown Bread
directions: Mix thoroughly, turn at once into a greased mold, add a greased cover or tie a greased paper over the top.
Steam at least 4 hours, if all in one loaf.
Remove from mold and dry in the oven a few minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes, Text-book Of Cooking (1918-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: rye flour, corn meal, graham flour, salt, baking soda, baking powder, molass, sour milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, baking mold, stove

title: Broiled Lamb Chops
directions: Wipe chops and place in a red-hot frying-pan.
As soon as the under surface is seared, turn and sear the other side.
Turn down the fire a little, and continue to cook, turning chops often.
Cook seven minutes if liked rare.
When cooked, sprinkle with salt and spread with butter.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Ingredient: lamb chop, salt

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife, stove

title: Broiled Halibut Supreme
directions: Arrange halibut steaks in shallow pyrex baking dish, and pour over them the remaining sauce.
Broil until tender (about 15 minutes).
Do not turn steaks.
Garnish with paprika and parsley before serving.
other_info:
