Ingredient: halibut, onion, butter, lemon juice, paprika, parsley

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, baking pan, oven

title: Diabolo Cocktail
directions: Shake well, strain, and serve with a cherry.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, bitter, Curacao, lemon, vermouth, brandy, cocktail cherry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, shaker, strainer

title: Broiled Swordfish Steaks
directions: Sprinkle surface of fish with monosodium glutamate.
Let stand 5 minutes.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Brush with melted butter.
Place on greased broiler rack in broiler, with surface of fish about 2 inches below heat.
Broil about 8 minutes on each side, brushing often with melted butter or margarine.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Main Dish, Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: swordfish, monosodium glutamate, salt, pepper, butter

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, brush, baking pan

title: Mlecna Polevka s Nudlemi aneb Kapani (Milk Soup with Noodles or Noodle Batter)
directions: Bring the milk to a boil.
Add the noodles, salt, and butter.
Cook slowly until the noodles are cooked.
Variation: beat eggs until frothy.
Add 5 tablespoon milk, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and flour to make a medium thin batter.
Set a colander over the boiling milk.
Pour the batter into the colander and press it through quickly.
The batter will drop through the colander in long strings and make little curls in the boiling milk.
Cook 5 minutes longer and serve.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: milk, butter, noodle, salt, egg, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, egg beater, pot, strainer

title: Zelniky (Cabbage Filling)
directions: Clean cabbage (4 lb) and wash well.
Chop finely.
Add salt and let stand for at least 1/2 hour.
Press out the excess juice.
Then, steam until soft.
Lightly brown flour in butter about the size of a hens egg.
Add water, the cabbage, sugar, and pepper.
Flatten kolache buns.
Fill with cabbage filling and punch edges together at the top.
Bake as you would kolaches, with pinched side down.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cabbage, salt, flour, butter, water, sugar, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot

title: Cau-Cau (Chow Chow)
directions: Chop coarsely tomatoes, cabbage, green peppers, onions.
Mix well and salt with salt.
Place in a cheesecloth bag and hang up over night to drip.
Then press out all the liquid possible.
Place in a deep bowl, pour over it cold vinegar to cover.
Let stand 6 hours and again press out the liquid.
Now add celery seed, allspice and horseradish (horseradish and allspice may be omitted).
Bring to a boil equal parts of vinegar and sugar (enough to cover the vegetables).
Add vegetables.
Bring to a boil and seal in jars.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, cabbage, green pepper, red pepper, onion, salt, vinegar, celery seed, allspice, horseradish, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, bowl, pot, stove, jar

title: Smoked Sturgeon S'mors
directions: Take smoked sturgeon and put through food chopper to make ground sturgeon.
Add rest of ingredients.
Shape into small balls and roll in flour and fry in shortening until golden brown.
Add one cup water and cover and simmer for one hour.
May be served hot or cold with toothpicks stuck into them for appetizers.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs A B Curtis
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co


Source: Savory Seafoods of Oregon (1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood, Main Dish

Ingredient:  sturgeon, onion, garlic, cracker crumb, salt, pepper, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, rolling pin, baking sheet, oven

title: Creamed Chipped Beef
directions: Discard tough fibrous portions and undesirable yellow fat from beef.
Heat fat in large saucepan until it bubbles, then add beef and cook until edges of beef curl.
Add flour.
Blend well, then add water.
Boil until sauce begins to thicken, stirring constantly.
Add milk and pepper and continue cooking 5 minutes longer, or until thickened.
Serve on toast.
Creamed chipped beef is also good served on mashed or baked potatoes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1939-01-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: fat, beef, flour, water, evaporated milk, pepper, toast

Equipment: knife, saucepan, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Gefilte Fish

ingredients.name: of fish, 3 kinds, such as salmon, sturgeon, halibut, or fillets of other fish

directions: Remove skin and bones from fish.
Set fish aside.
Place skin, bones, carrots, onions, and celery in a kettle.
Cover with cold water, season with salt and pepper and cook until vegetables are soft.
Strain liquid.
To make fish balls, put fish and the large onion through grinder, then place in bowl and add eggs, bread, water, and seasonings.
Mix thoroughly.
Form fish mixture into balls and cook in prepared liquid for one hour.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs L Friedman
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co

(1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood

Ingredient: fish, carrot, onion, celery, salt, pepper, water, egg, bread

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Hartford Tea Cake
directions: Cream the butter and sugar; add the beaten yolks, milk, and spices.
Then, the whipped whites stirred in alternately with the flour.
Lastly, the fruit.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mattie A Cairl
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, sugar, butter, milk, egg, brandy, raisin, currant, citron, spice, baking powder

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater

title: Mashed Potatoes
directions: Wash and peel medium-sized potatoes ; cook in boiling water (salted) until tender.
(About twenty minutes.
) Drain and shake over the fire a minute or two until they are a little dry.
Either mash with potato masher, or put through potato ricer.
Add butter, salt, paprika and milk.
Beat till very light, fluffy and white.
Reheat by setting the saucepan in a larger kettle place over flame.
More milk may containing boiling water.
Be needed.
Pile them lightly on the hot dish in which they are to be served.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: potato, butter, water, salt, paprika, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, strainer, stove

title: Sun Dew Cocktail
directions: Place the ice in the tumbler, and add the bitters, then put in the fruit juices and syrup.
Stir well, and strain.
Fill up with soda water, and serve with slices of orange on top.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, grape juice, sugar syrup, bitter, soda water, orange juice, orange

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, tumbler, strainer

title: Blitz Torte - Part One
directions: Sift flour once then measure, add baking powder, and salt, and sift together again.
Cream butter thoroughly, add sugar gradually, creaming until light and fluffy.
Add the well beaten yolks of eggs and mix well.
Add the flour alternately with the milk, a little at a time.
Beat again after each addition until smooth.
Add the flavoring.
Pour into two buttered, aluminum layer forms with removable bottoms.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, egg yolk, milk, cake flour, baking powder, salt, vanilla, almond extract

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, egg beater, baking pan

title: Little Coffee Cakes (Kleina Kaffee Kuchen)
directions: Dissolve yeast cake in 1/4 cup of warm milk, add 2 tablespoons of flour and stand in warm place to rise.
Cream butter and sugar, add salt and the eggs, beaten in one at a time.
Add the sponge containing the yeast, the lukewarm cream and the sifted flour.
Grease muffin pans and sift a little flour over them.
Fill pans about 2/3 full with the batter.
Set in a warm place until dough rises to the top of the pans.
Bake in hot oven (400f) for 25 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: shortening, sugar, flour, cream, egg, milk, egg yolk, yeast cake

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, muffin pan, oven

title: Buzzer Cocktail
directions: Shake well with the ice, and strain into glasses.
Serve with a cherry.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, vermouth, creme de menthe, bitter, gin, cocktail cherry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, strainer

title: Plain Paste or Pie Crust
directions: Mix flour and salt, cut the shortening through the flour, add ice-cold water gradually, about 1/2 cup.
Chill on ice 30 minutes.
Then place on well-floured board, roll out, fold 3 times and roll again.
Do this 3 times, then roll to fit the pie plate.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Denver Gas and Electric Co, Person.Katherine Newsbury, Person.Helen Parker Headden


Source: A Book of Hints on the Art of Cooking (1907-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, salt, water, butter, lard

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, rolling pin, pie pan

title: Sulc (Pork Loaf)
directions: Wash all meat well.
Cover with water.
Add salt.
Boil all together until done but not too soft.
If liquid boils down too much, add more water.
You should have at least 3 cups liquid when cooked.
Remove meat and remove bones, peel tongue, and cut all into about salt if needed.
Add pepper, onion (finely chopped) and vinegar.
Place the chopped meat into the liquid and again bring to a boil.
Pour into a deep bowl and place in the refrigerator to set.
Serve cold, sliced, with vinegar.
This may also be placed into fruit jars and sealed.
It may be kept in a cold place indefinitely.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pork, water, salt, pepper, onion, vinegar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, strainer, refrigerator

title: Broiled Fillet of Beef with Horse-Radish Sauce
directions: Put slices of tenderloin steak, cut, three-fourth inch thick, into a hot blazer which has been rubbed over with a piece of beef fat.
Sear one side, turn and sear other side.
Cook four minutes, turning frequently.
Spread with soft butter, and sprinkle with salt and pepper.

For horse-radish sauce, beat four tablespoons heavy cream until stiff, add three tablespoons grated horse-radish root, mixed with one tablespoon vinegar, one-fourth teaspoon salt, and a few grains cayenne.
other_info:
Author: Person.Thomas Meighan
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: steak, cream, horseradish, vinegar, salt, pepper, butter, cayenne pepper

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife, grater, egg beater, stove

title: Creamed Veal
directions: Mix the veal and sauce.
Heat and serve hot on rounds to toast.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Main Dish, Meat

Ingredient: veal, white sauce, toast

Equipment: measuring cups

title: White Cakes
directions: Cream butter, add sugar, and continue creaming.
Alternately add the dry ingredients mixed and sifted.
Add the milk.
Beat well, add flavoring.
Fold in the stiffly beaten whites.
Spread evenly, two-thirds of an inch thick, on waxed paper, placed in a pan.
Bake twenty minutes in moderate oven.
Remove from oven, allow cake to remain in pan five minutes.
Carefully remove and cool.
Cut with fancy cutters.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, baking powder, sugar, lemon extract, milk, flour, vanilla, egg white

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, egg beater, sifter

title: Spinach Soup
directions: Soak the peas over-night; next morning put them on in the cold water or pot-liquor.
Bring to the boil, and then add the prepared vegetables, bones, and seasoning.
Skim well, and boil for 1 1/2 hour, stirring occasionally.
Remove the bones, and pulp the soup through a sieve.
Heat it again, and serve with dried mint and fried bread.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: spinach, water, salt, pepper, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot, sieve, saucepan

title: Black-Eyed Peas and Cheese

ingredients.name: lemon juice, or vinegar, if desired.

directions: If too stiff, moisten with milk.
This may be used as a sandwich filling or the lemon juice or vinegar may be omitted and the mixture baked in a loaf.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: shortening, onion, pepper, pea, cheese, salt, lemon juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, knife, sieve

title: Hickory Nut Kisses
directions: Beat egg whites lightly, add sugar, then nut kernels, lastly the flour.
Drop on greased tins and bake in moderate oven 350 degrees.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, egg white, hickory nut, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, baking sheet, egg beater

title: Cheese Sauce
directions: Four pounds cheese makes a thicker sauce of greater volume and flavor.
Scald milk over boiling water.
Add cheese, that has been cut into small pieces.
Continue cooking until cheese is just melted, about 5 minutes.
Stir to blend well.
May be served on toast or over rice, spaghetti, macaroni, hard cooked eggs or boiled vegetables such as onions, green beans, cauliflower, broccoli, asparagus and potatoes.
Rarebit variation: use 4 pounds cheese and add 2 teaspoons dry mustard or 4 teaspoons worcestershire sauce.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cheese, evaporated milk

Equipment: measuring cups

title: Hashed Brown Potatoes
directions: Chop potatoes fine, season with celery salt, salt and pepper to taste.
Remove seeds and stem from pepper, wash drain and chop fine.
Mix with potatoes.
Put about 1 tablespoon of melted shortening in pan and when hot, add potatoes and cook slowly.
When partly brown, fold into omelet shape in one side of pan.
Fry until a rich brown.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: potato, green pepper, celery salt, shortening, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, knife

title: Bread and Butter Canapes
directions: Cut the bread fairly thinly, butter it and cut into fancy shapes, using a pastry cutter.
Cover with a filling such as those listed above, coat with aspic to hold the filling in place, and decorate with piped savoury butter.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: bread, butter, tongue, salami, sardine, prawn, salmon, egg, cream cheese

Equipment: knife

title: Ham Sandwiches
directions: Mix ham, olives and pickles with salad dressing and spread on lettuce or nasturtium leaves between buttered slices of bread.
Trim off the crusts, and cut the sandwiches in fancy shapes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Sandwich

Ingredient: ham, olive, pickle, salad dressing, bread

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: Apple Brown Betty

ingredients.name: soft bread crumbs, or ready-to-eat cereal

directions: Set oven for moderate, 375f.
Mix bread crumbs, butter or margarine, peel, sugar, and cinnamon.
Place half the sliced apples in buttered baking dish.
Cover with half the bread-crumb mixture.
Add remaining apple slices and cover with remaining crumb mixture.
Sprinkle with fruit juice.
Bake about 45 minutes.
Serve hot or cold with milk, cream, custard sauce, or other dessert sauce.
Mincemeat variation: use 1/2 cup mincemeat and 3 apples.
Rhubarb variation: use 2 cups stewed sweetened rhubarb in place of apples; omit sugar, cinnamon, and fruit juice.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bread crumb, butter, lemon peel, sugar, cinnamon, apple, fruit juice

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, knife, baking pan

title: Steamed Cranberry Pudding
directions: Dissolve soda in hot water.
Mix all together and steam 1 1/2 hours in top of double boiler or steamer.
Serve with butter sauce.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cranberry, molass, salt, soda, water, baking powder, flour

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, double boiler, stove

title: Nakladani Okurky (Dill Pickles)
directions: Boil: sugar, salt, vinegar, water.
Cool.
Wash cucumbers (about 4 to 5 inches) and place in layers in a 1 gallon stone jar with dill (about 6 heads) and grape leaves (about 8).
Pour the cooled brine over the cucumbers.
Cover with a weighted plate so that the cucumbers remain immersed in the brine.
Store in a warm place.
It requires at least 5 days before they are ready to eat.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, salt, vinegar, water, cucumber, dill, grape leaf

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, jar

title: Sally Lunn II
directions: Sift flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.
Combine the beaten egg yolks and milk and add to the flour mixture, stirring only until mixed.
Add shortening, fold in the stiffly beaten egg whites.
Turn into greased 9 inch square pan and bake in moderate oven (350f) about 30 minutes.
Cut into 3 inch squares.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, egg, milk, shortening

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, baking pan, oven

title: Frozen Cheese Salad
directions: Chill milk thoroughly, then whip until stiff.
Add lemon juice.
Mash cheese.
Add mayonnaise slowly, blending well, bold into whipped milk with the fruit.
Pour into a mold and pack with ice and salt; or freeze in the trays of an automatic refrigerator.
Serve on lettuce leaves or watercress, with or without salad dressing.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: evaporated milk, lemon juice, cream cheese, Eggless Mayonnaise, date, pineapple, lettuce

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, mold, refrigerator

title: Lemon Sauce
directions: Combine cornstarch, sugar, and lemon peel in 1-quart saucepan.
Add water slowly.
Stir over medium heat until thickened.
Remove from heat; add remaining ingredients.
Good with plain cake (cottage pudding), fruit cobblers, etc.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Dessert, Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cornstarch, sugar, lemon, water, butter, salt

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, saucepan

title: Boiled Green Peas
directions: Shell and pick green peas over, wash them in cold water, drain them.
Throw them into boiling water, add brown sugar, a little mint and salt.
Boil until quite tender, drain off the water, and serve in a hot dish with the mint.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: green pea, water, brown sugar, mint, salt

Equipment: strainer, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Creamed Tuna on Toast Strips
directions: Mix well.
Melt the butter, add the flour, salt and pimento.
Gradually pour in the milk.
Allow the mixture to boil one minute.
Stir constantly.
Add the fish, cook one minute and pour over toasted strips of bread.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, pimento, flour, milk, salt, bread, tuna

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Corn Soup
directions: Cook vegetable in water until soft (15 to 30 minutes) and rub thoroughly through a strainer.
Add more water if it boils away much.
There should be about 4 cups of the vegetable stock.
Scald onion in milk, or chop it and cook 5 minutes in the butter, being careful not to brown it.
Add flour to butter and stir into this mixture the hot milk, as for white sauce, method i.
Combine with the stock, reheat, season, and serve.
1 tablespoon chopped parsley may be added.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn, water, milk, flour, butter, salt, pepper, onion

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, strainer, pot

title: Grapefruit Sherbet

ingredients.name: grapefruit, sections cut in pieces, (about 6 grapefruits)

directions: Combine grapefruit juice, water, lemon juice, sugar and grapefruit sections.
Freeze to a mush in a 1:6 salt-ice mixture.
Whip the evaporated milk, which has been thoroughly chilled, and add to the partially frozen mixture.
Continue freezing until stiff.
other_info:
Author: Person.M Faith McAuley, Person.Mary Adele Wood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: grapefruit juice, water, lemon juice, sugar, grapefruit, evaporated milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, refrigerator

title: Fairy Gingerbread
directions: Mix, knead, roll and bake in moderate oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, molass, egg, flour, baking powder, ginger

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, rolling pin

title: Creamed New Peas
directions: Shell one quart of peas, cover with cold water and let stand ten minutes, wash well, and drain off the water.
Cover with boiled water and cook twenty to fifty minutes, according to age of peas.
A pinch of soda may be added to the water.
It softens the skins on the peas.
Add salt when the peas have cooked twenty minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: pea, soda, salt

Equipment: measuring spoons, strainer, stove

title: Haricot Soup
directions: Soak the beans in water all night.
Next morning put them in a saucepan with the water, pepper, salt, and sliced onion.
Boil gently 4 hours.
Then mash all through a sieve into a basin, stir in the milk, and return to the saucepan to get hot.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bean, milk, water, onion, pepper, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, saucepan, pot, sieve, stove

title: Pinwheel Biscuits
directions: Sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt, work in the lard with a knife, add gradually the milk, mixing with the knife to a soft dough.
Toss on a floured board, roll one inch thick, spread with butter, and sprinkle with the sugar and cinnamon, which have been well mixed.
Press in the raisins.
Roll up the mixture evenly as you would a jelly roll.
Cut off slices, an inch thick—flatten a little and place in a tin pan.
Bake in a hot oven for fifteen minutes.
(These are similar to the cinnamon rolls made from yeast sponge.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Ingredient: flour, milk, baking powder, raisin, lard, sugar, salt, butter, cinnamon

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, rolling pin, sifter

title: Corn-Flour Muffins

ingredients.name: cup corn flour, or 1 cup corn flour and 1/2 cup wheat flour

directions: Mix and bake.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church
Contributor: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn flour, egg, baking powder, wheat flour, butter, salt, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven

title: Hodge-Podge No. 1
directions: Put the meat and water in a stewpan, simmer for a few minutes and skim carefully.
Add the vegetables and seasoning; stew till the meat is tender; thicken with the butter and flour, and serve with turnips and carrots or spinach and celery.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.W Drysdale & Co


Source: Cookery for the Million (1877-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef, water, onion, carrot, turnip, celery, pepper, salt, butter

Equipment: knife, pot, stove, measuring cups

title: Orangeade
directions: Peel the fruit rind thinly and place in a pan, with the sugar and water, then simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Strain the hot liquid through muslin and cool.
Add the fruit juice, and chill before serving.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: orange, lemon, sugar, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, peeler, strainer, stove, pan

title: Honey Egg Nog
directions: Beat eggs in a large bowl.
Add remaining ingredients and beat vigorously with a rotary beater or wire whisk.
Serve cold.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, evaporated milk, water, honey

Equipment: egg beater, measuring spoons, measuring cups, bowl

title: Pumpkin Pie
directions: Make a smooth paste of the spices and water.
Add this with sugar, beaten eggs and salt to the pumpkin.
Stir to blend thoroughly, then add milk, which has been scalded, and the orange juice.
Pour into unbaked pic shells.
Bake in hot oven (450f) 15 minutes, then reduce to slow oven (325f) and bake 25 minutes longer.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ginger, cinnamon, water, brown sugar, egg, salt, pumpkin, evaporated milk, orange juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven

title: Egg Sauce
directions: Melt the butter, stir flour in well, and slowly add the milk.
Let it boil about two minutes, stirring constantly.
Season, add yolk of egg, and mix well.
(The oil from the salmon may be substituted for melted butter as far as it will go.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, salt, flour, pepper, milk, egg yolk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Zganci
directions: Roast the buckwheat flour in an ungreased iron pan until the aroma appears, stirring constantly.
Pour the salted boiling water over the flour.
Stir until it begins to form.
Cover the pan and place over very light heat for ten minutes so that flour swells.
Brown cracklings in lard.
Garnish over zganci.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Oracle Ace, Person.Matjz & Eva


Source: ACE Cookbook (2013-02-23)


Category: Breakfast, Bread

Measure: Metric

Ingredient: buckwheat flour, water, lard

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, pan

title: Creamed Eggs
directions: Prepare a white sauce of the butter, flour, salt, pepper, boiling water and milk.
Peel eggs, slice and add to hot white sauce.
Serve on hot, buttered toast or bread.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Breakfast

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, butter, flour, salt, pepper, water

Equipment: baking pan, measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot

title: Mutton Broth II
directions: Cut the meat into small pieces (removing the fat), and put it into a saucepan with the bones, cold water and salt; bring to the boil.
Draw to the side of the fire as soon as the broth boils, skim well.
Simmer for 1 1/2 hour, skimming occasionally.
Prepare the vegetables and rice, add them and let all simmer 1/2 hour till the vegetables are tender.
Add the parsley just before serving.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Soup, Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: mutton, barley, turnip, onion, carrot, parsley, salt, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, saucepan, pot, stove

title: Creamed Asparagus

ingredients.name: quart liquor from asparagus, or water

directions: Melt butter.
Add flour and stir to blend well.
Add salt.
Stir in asparagus liquor slowly.
Cook until slightly thickened, stirring constantly.
Add milk and asparagus, and continue cooking over boiling water until sauce is thickened and asparagus hot,.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mabelle S. Ehlers, Person.Florence J. Atwood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, flour, salt, water, evaporated milk, asparagus

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot

title: Bublanina (Cherry Cake)
directions: Cream butter and sugar.
Add egg yolks.
Beat.
Add alternately, beating after each addition milk and flour.
Fold in egg whites, lemon extract, salt.
Pour into greased pan (9 by 13 inches).
Sprinkle about pitted cherries over batter.
Bake at 375f degrees until brown.
Sprinkle powdered sugar over the top and cut into squares to serve.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, egg yolk, milk, flour, egg white, lemon extract, salt, cherry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, baking pan, oven, bowl

title: Grandmother’s Molasses Cake
directions: Cream shortening and sugar.
Add molasses and beaten eggs.
Sift dry ingredients and add alternately with 1 1/2 cups of sour milk.
Mix the soda in the remaining milk and add with remainder of flour.
Floured currants and raisins are added last.
Bake in a loaf pan in a slow oven about one hour.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: shortening, flour, sugar, molass, ginger, clove, salt, cinnamon, egg, sour milk, currant, baking soda

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, baking mold

title: Savoury Custard
directions: Beat up the eggs with the stock and salt ; strain into a well-greased gallipot, cover it with a piece of greased paper, stand it in a saucepan of boiling water and steam very gently for 30 minutes (the custard would be full of holes if steamed quickly).
When the custard is set, take the gallipot out of the saucepan, let it get cool, turn the custard out and cut it up into fancy shapes.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg yolk, egg white, stock, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, egg beater, saucepan, stove

title: Best Meat Loaf
directions: Set oven for moderate 350f.
Combine first 6 ingredients.
Let stand 5 minutes.
Add onion and meat; mix well.
Line a loaf pan, 8 by 5 by 3 inches, with bacon across the width of pan.
Pack meat mixture into pan.
Bake 1 1/2 hours.
Remove from oven.
Invert meat loaf on baking sheet: lift off pan: raise oven temperature to very hot, 450f.
Return meat loaf to oven for about 10 minutes to crisp bacon.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-23)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, milk, poultry seasoning, salt, pepper, bread crumb, onion, pork shoulder, veal, bacon

Equipment: oven, measuring cups, measuring spoons, loaf pan, bowl, baking sheet

title: Home-made Yeast
directions: Boil the potatoes.
When nearly done, add hops (tied in a thin bag), and boil ten minutes longer.
Put sugar and salt in an earthen or a porcelain vessel.
Lift out hops and press them dry in colander.
Mash the potatoes in the water and pass mixture through the colander to the salt and sugar.
Add sufficient boiled water to make about 3 1/2 quarts.
When lukewarm, add yeast.
Let stand until perfectly light (about 12 hours).
Put in a jug and cork securely.
If kept in a cool place this yeast will be good for four or five weeks.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mary Lingerman
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1893-01-01)


Category: Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, sugar, salt, yeast, hop

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, bowl, sieve

title: Six-Egg Sponge Cake
directions: Set oven for slow, 325f.
Sift together flour, salt, and cream of tartar.
Combine sugar and water in a saucepan; stir over low heat until sugar dissolves.
Cover and boil 2 minutes.
Remove cover and boil without stirring to 230f on a candy thermometer, or until a little syrup forms a very soft ball when dropped in cold water.
Whip egg whites until stiff but not dry.
Pour syrup in a very thin stream on egg whites, beating constantly.
Continue to beat until cool.
Beat egg yolks until thick and lemon colored; fold into egg whites; blend well.
Add vanilla.
Sift a small amount of flour mixture over egg mixture: fold in carefully.
Continue until all flour is added.
Turn into an ungreased 10-inch tube pan.
Bake 1 hour or until top springs back when lightly touched with fingertip.
Invert pan: let cake hang until cold.
Loosen from sides and tube of pan with a spatula.
Frost with your favorite frosting or sprinkle with confectioners' sugar.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cake flour, salt, cream of tartar, sugar, water, egg, vanilla

Equipment: oven, tube pan, measuring spoons, measuring cups, saucepan, egg beater

title: Orange Meringue
directions: Soak gelatine in cold water for a half hour, bring to the boiling point and carefully stir in well-beaten egg yolks mixed with 1 cup sugar.
Take from the fire and flavor with lemon juice and orange juice.
Let it stand on the ice till cold and stiff.
Turn into a glass dish and heap up over it eggs beaten until stiff with powdered sugar gradually sifted in.
other_info:
Author: Person.Florence A Cathcart
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: gelatine, water, egg yolk, sugar, lemon, orange, egg white, powdered sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, egg beater, measuring spoons, refrigerator, baking pan

title: Cranberry Salad
directions: Combine cranberries and sugar.
Dissolve gelatin in hot water.
Add syrup.
Chill until partially set.
Add cranberry mixture, nuts, pineapple, and celery.
Pour into mold.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, water, pineapple, celery, walnut, gelatin

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Brown Ben Biscuits
directions: Sift flour, baking powder, sugar and salt twice and place in a bowl with two heaping teaspoonfuls of butter.
Mix thoroughly and add milk gradually.
Roll dough slightly to thickness of about half an inch and cut with an inch and a half cutter.
Bake until brown.
other_info:
Author: Person.Colleen Moore
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, butter, baking powder, milk, sugar, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, rolling pin, sifter

title: Bean Salad

ingredients.name: cold boiled French beans, or 1 lb. cold boiled haricot beans

directions: Boil the beans, strain and allow them to get cold (haricot beans must be soaked 12 hours before boiling).
Mix the ginger, pepper, salt, oil and vinegar carefully together, and pour this dressing over the beans.
Cauliflowers and cabbages can also be treated this way.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Salad, Side

Ingredient: bean, salad oil, vinegar, ginger, pepper, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, strainer

title: Shrimp Wiggle
directions: Melt butter, and add the flour mixed with one-half teaspoon salt and one-eighth teaspoon pepper.
Pour the milk on gradually.
As soon as sauce thickens, add shrimps, broken in pieces, and the peas, drained from their liquor and thoroughly rinsed.
other_info:
Author: Person.Ed Wynn
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Seafood, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: shrimp, flour, pea, milk, butter, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, strainer

title: Baked Apples
directions: Pare and core apples (or, if it is desired to retain the color, do not pare); put in a buttered baking dish.
Fill centers with sugar and spice mixed, pour the water around them, and bake in a moderate oven until soft, basting occasionally.
The dish should be covered.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, sugar, water, cinnamon

Equipment: knife, baking dish, oven, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Sweet Sour Beans
directions: Heat green beans.
Drain and save liquid.
Combine crumbs, seasonings, vinegar and liquid of beans.
Boil one minute, stirring constantly.
Add mixture to hot milk and pour over beans.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.Mary Cullen's department, Household arts service of The journal


Source: Food Fashion Revue Cooking School Second Session (1938-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: green bean, gingersnap, salt, pepper, vinegar, bean, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, strainer, stove, pot

title: White Mountain Cream Icing for Cakes
directions: Boil the sugar, water and cream of tartar together without stirring.
Remove from fire as soon as the syrup hairs when dropped from a spoon.
Pour very slowly onto the stiffly beaten egg white.
Beat vigorously with sweeping strokes until cool.
If icing gets too hard to spread, add a little warm water and keep beating.
Add extract and spread on cakes.
Decorate with tiny pink candies.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, water, cream of tartar, egg white, vanilla

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, stove

title: Pork Chops
directions: Wipe the chops, sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Place in a hot frying-pan (no fat added), brown on one side and then turn on the other side, cooking over a moderate fire.
Add the water and immediately place the cover on the frying-pan.
The steam cooks the pork more quickly and prevents over-browning.
Cook twenty-five minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pork, salt, water, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove

title: Lahma B'baed (Meat Tube With Eggs)
directions: In a large bowl mix well: ground beef, salt, pepper, chopped onion, parsley and bread crumbs.
On a piece of aluminum foil approximately 10"x 14", pat the meat mixture into a rectangle 8" x 12" and 1/2 inch thick.
Peel the eggs and cut about h of an inch off each end.
Place the eggs in the middle of the meat rectangle in a line with the cut ends touching.
Roll the meat around the eggs, covering them on all sides and making a thick tube.
Fold the aluminum foil so that it is fastened around the meat and holds it in place.
Place in a baking pan and bake at 350 for one hour.
Let cool for about 45 minutes.
Slice about 1/2 inch thick, serve cold.
other_info:
Author: Person.Soad Mansour, Person.Layla Risk, Person.Suzy Grindi


Source: Festival of American Folklife: Egyptian Recipes (1976-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ground beef, salt, pepper, onion, parsley, bread crumb, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, baking pan, oven, knife

title: Dried Haddock
directions: Place the dried haddock in a frying-pan and cover with cold water.
Bring to the boil, then take out the haddock, place it on a dish in the oven, with bits of butter over it, for 5 minutes, and then serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient:  haddock, water, butter

Equipment: frying pan, stove, oven

title: Marcipan (Marzipan)
directions: Knead almond paste.
Add: egg whites.
Mix well.
Add: sugar (1 cup at a time).
Add: vanilla or rum flavoring.
Knead (total mixing time - 15 minutes).
Dust working surface with powdered sugar.
It may be necessary to work in additional powdered sugar to acquire the right consistency.
Divide the dough into small pieces, (being sure to keep remaining dough covered,) and with the hands mold into the shapes of fruits and vegetables.
Lay finished pieces on a mound of flour so that the bottom surfaces will not flatten while drying.
Food coloring may be used to obtain the desired colors of dough or the color may be brushed on after the molded pieces have dried.
Allow to dry overnight or longer before glazing with warmed corn syrup or a commercial glaze.
Artificial marzipan leaves may be inserted or leaves and stem may be piped on with decorators icing.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: almond paste, egg white, sugar, vanilla

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl

title: Kidney Bean Salad II
directions: Combine beans, pickle, eggs and celery lightly with a fork.
Mix milk and vinegar and add to salad.
Vinegar drained from pickles may be used and improves the flavor of the salad.
Chill thoroughly.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: kidney bean, pickle, egg, celery, evaporated milk, vinegar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, fork, knife

title: Tomato Sauce III
directions: Simmer the tomatoes, onion, bay leaves, cioves, sugar and water for fifteen minutes, rub through the strainer.
Melt butter, add flour and salt, add strained tomato juice and pulp.
Cook until the desired consistency.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, sugar, onion, water, bay leaf, butter, clove, flour, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Glazed Apples
directions: Boil sugar and water gently for 5 min.
Quarter and core the apples; put 1/2 the pieces into the syrup, removing when soft; put in the remainder of the apples and cook in the same way.
When all are cooked, strain syrup over them.
Lemon rind, thinly pared, may be cooked in the syrup if the apples are not sour, or a bit of stick cinnamon or ginger root may be added.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, sugar, water, lemon

Equipment: knife, teapot, strainer, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Beef Soup
directions: Make several cuts in the beef and chop the bone; put into the soup kettle with the water and let simmer for one hour, then add the vegetables and season to taste.
Simmer for two hours.
Some think it an improvement to fry the meat and vegetables slightly before putting them in the kettle.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.W Drysdale & Co


Source: Cookery for the Million (1877-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef, carrot, turnip, celery, clove, thyme, parsley, pepper, salt, water

Equipment: knife, pot, stove, measuring cups

title: Rolls
directions: Measure sugar, salt and shortening into mixing bowl.
Add water and stir until shortening is melted and sugar dissolved.
Add milk.
When lukewarm, add yeast that has been softened in 1 cup lukewarm water.
Add half the flour.
Beat well, then add remaining flour.
Knead until smooth and elastic.
Cover and let rise in a greased bowl in warm place until a little more than doubled in bulk, about 2 hours.
Punch dough down.
Allow about 15 minutes to rise, then shape and place on greased baking sheets.
Let rise again until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour.
Bake in a hot oven (425f).
Brush tops with melted butter.

Sweet rolls variation: increase the sugar and shortening each to 1 quart (2 pounds); butterflies, neckties, twists, cinnamon rolls, scrolls, and snails may be made from this dough; yields 21 dozen rolls.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, salt, shortening, water, evaporated milk, yeast, flour

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, bowl, baking sheet

title: Gumbo Soup a la St. Louis
directions: Cut the beef into small pieces and put them into a hot skillet with enough suet to prevent the meat from sticking.
Brown well.
Put the okra into a granite, agate or aluminum pan with the water, and place it on a hot fire.
Slice the tomatoes and herbs into the water with the okra and while the meat is still hot, add it to the whole mixture.
Let all come to a boil and with a wooden spoon remove the dark sticky substance which arises from the okra.
After cooking for a few minutes and removing this scum constantly, the soup becomes clear.
Then place it on a slow fire and let cook for at least three hours.
Before serving add salt and any other seasoning desired.
If desired, serve with boiled rice and stewed tomatoes, cooked separately, and placed in the bottom of the soup dishes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Laura La Plante
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Main Dish, Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: okra, tomato, beef, leek, thyme, carrot, red pepper, water

Equipment: knife, stove, pot

title: Macaroni-Shrimp Salad
directions: Combine ingredients and mix in mayonnaise to which a small amount of chili sauce has been added.
other_info:
Author: Person.Susan Latvala
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co


Source: Savory Seafoods of Oregon (1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood

Ingredient: macaroni, green onion, celery, pickle, shrimp, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl

title: Pickled Salmon
directions: Soak salmon in fresh water 12 hours.
Cut into slices one-fourth inch thick.
Put a layer of pickling spice on bottom of a quart jar, then a layer of fish, a layer of onion slices; spice, fish, sugar, onion, etc.
When full, add vinegar to cover and let stand three days or more.
Makes one quart.
other_info:
Author: Person.Carl Johnson
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co

(1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood

Ingredient: salmon, sugar, spice, vinegar, onion

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: Peanut-Butter Chops
directions: Mix and shape in the form of chops; put on a greased pan.
Bake about 15 or 20 minutes, or put the mixture in a deep pan and bake in a loaf.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: peanut butter, celery salt, hominy, ketchup, bread crumb, egg, salt, onion juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, baking pan, oven

title: Cold Tea Punch
directions: Grate the lemon rind and blend it with the sugar.
Pour on the freshly made tea, stir well, and set aside to become thoroughly cold.
Strain carefully, and add the rum and brandy.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: lemon rind, rum, sugar, brandy, tea

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, grater, strainer

title: Funnel Cakes (Drechter Kuche)
directions: Beat eggs and add sugar and milk.
Sift half the flour, salt and baking powder together and add to milk and egg mixture.
Beat the batter smooth and add only as much more flour as needed.
Batter should be thin enough to run thru a funnel.
Drop from funnel into deep, hot fat (375f).
Spirals and endless intricate shapes can be made by swirling and criss-crossing while controlling the funnel spout with a finger.
Serve hot with molasses, tart jelly, jam or sprinkle with powdered sugar.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, flour, milk, salt, sugar, baking powder

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, pot, stove

title: Egg Nog
directions: Beat egg yolks until thick and lemon colored.
Add salt and sugar and stir until well dissolved.
Add milk and water.
Fold in the stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into glasses and sprinkle with nutmeg.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, salt, sugar, evaporated milk, water, nutmeg

Equipment: egg beater, measuring spoons, measuring cups, pot

title: Dumplings
directions: Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with salt and baking powder.
Add melted shortening to water and milk and stir into dry ingredients.
Drop into boiling stock and cook uncovered for 12 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association, Person.Mabelle S. Ehlers, Person.Florence J. Atwood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, salt, baking powder, shortening, water, milk

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, sifter, pot

title: Hot Milk Butter Cake
directions: Combine eggs, sugar, and vanilla and beat until thick.
Add sifted dry ingredients.
Heat milk and butter to boiling point, add to above mixture.
Bake in a greased pan, 8 x 8 inches, in a 350f oven 30-40 minutes.
Remove from oven and frost.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, sugar, vanilla, cake flour, baking powder, milk, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, pot, stove, oven

title: Pineapple Fruit Salad
directions: Chop nuts and mix with cream cheese and roll into small balls.
Slice oranges and apples and place alternately on beds of lettuce, with pineapples.
On the top of this place cheese balls in attractive designs.
Top this with whipped cream and decorate with maraschino cherries.
other_info:
Author: Person.Aileen Pringle
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pineapple, lettuce, cream cheese, apple, walnut, Maraschino cherry, orange, whipped cream

Equipment: knife, rolling pin, egg beater

title: Apple Crisp
directions: Place in a greased 8" square pan: apples.
Blend until crumbly; then spread over apples: brown sugar (packed), flour, oats, nutmeg, butter.
Bake at 375 tor 30-35 minutes, until apples are tender and topping is golden brown.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, brown sugar, flour, rolled oat, nutmeg, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, baking dish, sifter

title: Epicurean Bouchée
directions: Clean and peel mushrooms, cut in one-fourth-inch strips cross-wise, and saute in butter three minutes.
Clean and steam frogs’ legs until tender, then add crab-meat, butter, salt, paprika and wine.
Cover and let stand thirty minutes.
Put on range and cook five minutes.
Pour off one-half wine and add mushrooms.
Scald cream in double boiler; dilute cornstarch with cold water, add gradually to scalded cream, and cook ten minutes.
Stir constantly until mixture thickens and afterwards occasionally ; then add yolk of egg, slightly beaten.
Add to first mixture, reheat and season highly with salt and cayenne.
Fill bouchée cases (known more commonly as patties) with mixture or serve with puffpaste points.

Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, egg beater, stove

title: Baltimore Caramels
directions: Boil 20 to 25 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Helen Campbell
Contributor: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Peanut Candy
directions: Boil first 4 ingredients till brittle when put in cold water, and pour over chopped peanuts in a greased pan.

Author: Person.Hope Smith
Contributor: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1919-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: molass, salt, butter, vinegar, peanut

Equipment: saucepan, measuring spoons

title: Chocolate Drop Cookies
directions: Mix and sift flour, baking powder, and salt; set aside.
Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs and chocolate: beat well.
Stir in milk, vanilla, walnuts, and raisins.
Add sifted dry ingredients; mix well.
Cover: chill 1 hour.
Set oven for moderate 350f.
Drop dough by rounded teaspoons on greased baking sheets 2 inches apart.
Bake 12 to 15 minutes.
Cool on racks.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1939-02-01)


Category: Dessert

Equipment: oven, egg beater, measuring spoons, measuring cups, sifter, refrigerator, baking sheet

title: French Custard
directions: Put the milk on to boil in a farina boiler.
Beat the yelks with the sugar and cornstarch, then add them to the boiling milk.
Then put the custard into the pudding dish.
Make a meringue of the beaten whites of the eggs with 1 tablespoonful of pulverized sugar and a teaspoonful of vanilla.
Drop the meringue over the custard, and place it in the oven only long enough to brown the meringue.
other_info:
Author: Person.Cornelia W Elmes
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater

title: Cabbage With Bacon Sauce
directions: Trim cabbage and cut coarsely.
Cook rapidly in an open vessel in a large amount of boiling water to which salt has been added.
Cooking requires 8 to 12 minutes.
Broil bacon until delicately brown and crisp, then chop.
Prepare white sauce, substituting bacon fat for butter.
Add chopped bacon.
Drain cabbage and add sauce.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)

ingredients.name: of frozen Torsk, thawed and broken up, or cut up fish balls

directions: Boil fish a little with cut up cauliflower, salt and a little nutmeg.
Drain.
Beat egg yolks.
Add all together.
Beat egg whites stiff and fold into the mix.
Put a few bread crumbs on top and bake til brown.
Serve with melted butter in which you put chopped parsley and chives.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Coon Prairie Church


Source: Country Coon Prairie Church Preservation Kokk Bok (1986-01-01)

title: Fish Croquettes
directions: Make a rich white sauce with cream.
Season with walnut catsup and add yolks of 2 eggs, salt and chopped parsley and a little chopped chive.
Add chopped cooked fish till mixture will leave sauce-pan.
Pour into buttered dish to cool.
Cut in pieces and fry in deep fat.
Do not let mixture be too thick.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf

Equipment: saucepan, pot

title: Mock Hollandaise Sauce
directions: Prepare a white sauce of the 1/2 cup butter, the flour, milk, salt, pepper and cayenne.
Remove from beat and stir in beaten egg yolks.
Add the 1 pound butter bit by bit, then the lemon juice.
May be served with fish, or is an excellent sauce or broccoli or asparagus.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)

Author: Person.Sarah Crowe
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Ingredient: tomato, green pepper, horseradish, mustard seed, brown sugar, salt, clove, allspice, cinnamon, celery seed, nasturtium, vinegar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: Custard Bread Pudding
directions: Set oven for 325f.
Pour milk over bread cubes.
Add salt and sugar.
Beat eggs; add to bread mixture with butter and vanilla: mix well.
Pour into a 1 1/2-quart greased casserole.
Set casserole in a pan.
Pour in hot water to within 1 inch of top.
Bake 50 to 60 minutes, or until knife inserted near rim comes out clean.
Surprise pudding variation: use plain whole-wheat or raisin wholewheat bread instead of white bread in making custard bread pudding.
Chocolate bread puddings variation: add 2 squares unsweetened chocolate, melted, to bread and milk mixture in custard bread pudding, and use 3/4 cup of sugar instead of 1/2.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: milk, bread, salt, sugar, egg, butter, vanilla

Equipment: oven, egg beater, measuring spoons, measuring cups, baking pan, casserole

title: Chocolate Custard
directions: Chip the chocolate and add sufficient boiling water to make it smooth.
Mix with it, gradually, the boiling milk.
When cool enough, stir in it the beaten eggs, sugar, and rose water.
Bake in a moderately hot oven.
Serve hot.
other_info:
Author: Person.Sarah A Walker
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)

Ingredient: milk, egg, sugar, chocolate, rose water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven

title: Breast of Veal or Mutton Stuffed
directions: Shred the smoked beef, chop the suet, lemon-rind, and herbs, mincing all very finely.
Add seasoning to taste, and mix well with the bread-crumbs before wetting with the egg.
Work all together and use.
Cut breast in half and stuff ; or bone, stuff and roll round.
Bake for 1 1/2 hour, basting well.
other_info:

directions: Rub a piece of sugar over the lemon rind.
Place all the ingredients except the lemon juice in a saucepan, and simmer without boiling for 5 minutes.
Strain the lemon juice into a punch bowl, pour on the hot liquid and serve at once.

directions: Beat eggs separately, add sugar to yolks, then add flour into which baking powder sifted; add whites (well beaten) nuts dates and vanilla.
Grease pan, line with brown paper but don't grease paper.
Pour into pan, bake 300 degrees, 1 1/2 hours.

directions: Add finely chopped cooked beets to meat broth, along with chopped cooked onion, carrot, or cabbage.
Season with herbs and serve hot.
Some like beet soup topped with sour cream.

title: Spanish Sauce

ingredients.name: cup fresh or canned (No. 2 can) tomatoes

directions: Cook onion in fat until lightly browned.
Blend in flour.
Add tomatoes, celery, green pepper, parsley, salt, and a little pepper.
Cook 15 to 20 minutes, stirring frequently.
Serve over meat loaf, cooked spaghetti, fried or baked fish, cooked cabbage, or omelet.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Peach Fritters

ingredients.name: cup chopped peaches, fresh or canned

directions: Cream the butter and sugar, add the eggs and beat thoroughly.
Sift dry ingredients together and add the milk slowly.
Fold in peaches, lemon juice and vanilla.
Drop by teaspoonfuls into hot fat.
Fry golden brown.
Serve with whipped cream or sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, stove, pot, sifter

title: Pepper Relish
directions: Seed the peppers and chop fine with the onion.
Put into a bowl, cover with boiling water and let stand for 5 minutes.
Drain and cover again with boiling water, let stand for 10 minutes longer.
Place in colander or cheesecloth bag let drain over night.
In the morning add the vinegar, sugar and salt.
Boil for 20 minutes.
Place in hot sterilized jars and seal.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)

title: Devilled Biscuits
directions: Mix some butter with a little dry mustard and cayenne pepper, and spread thickly on biscuits.
Cover generously with grated cheese, and brown slightly under the grill.

title: Chicken Fricassee II
directions: Roll chicken pieces in flour and brown in butter.
Add remaining ingredients and cook until tender, adding water so that there are 2 cups at end of cooking.
Make gravy by adding 3 tablespoons of hot liquid to yolk of an egg.
Stir thoroughly, then return to rest of liquid and cook five minutes.
Pour over steamed rice.

Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove

title: Orange Bread
directions: Cook orange rind in 2 1/2 cups water and 1 cup sugar (1/2 pound).
Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with baking powder, salt and the 2 quarts sugar.
Beat eggs, add milk, orange juice and rind.
Combine with dry ingredients.
Add melted butter.
Pour into greased bread pans and bake in a moderate oven (350f) until brown, about 50 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association

Equipment: bread pan, measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, sifter

title: Ragout of Beef

ingredients.name: pieces of beef, raw or cooked

directions: Peel and cut the onions into rings, cut the pieces of meat into squares, put them in a stew-pan, add all the other ingredients and then the water.
Simmer for 2 hours, stirring occasionally to prevent burning.
other_info:

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, peeler, knife, saucepan, stove

title: Batatess Forn (Potato Vegetable Dish)
directions: Layer potatoes and onions, then pork chops in a 9" x 13" baking dish.
Combine tomato sauce, water, spices and seasonings, garlic and pour over.
Top with sliced tomatoes and dot with butter.
Bake uncovered at 400f for 30 minutes, then at 350f for one hour.
other_info:
Author: Person.Soad Mansour, Person.Layla Risk, Person.Suzy Grindi


Source: Festival of American Folklife: Egyptian Recipes (1976-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pork, potato, onion, tomato, garlic, tomato sauce, water, nutmeg, chili powder, pepper, salt, paprika, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, baking dish, oven

title: Delicious Hazelnut Tart
directions: Open 1 pound hazelnuts: grate them fine or chop them in an almond grater.
Take egg yolks, beat them very light, and add powdered sugar.
Beat again until thick.
Add rose water, or vanilla flavoring.
Then froth very stiff egg whites and stir the froth into the eggs and sugar, adding very lightly, a little at a time, flour (sifted twice) and 1/3 of the grated hazelnuts.
Bake in two pans so as to have two layers.

When baked and quite cold, you place between the two layers a mixture composed of the rest of the grated nuts, which have been stirred into one pint of thick whipped sweet cream flavored with a pinch of dry vanilla bean.
other_info:
Author: Person.Frances Eger
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: hazelnut, egg yolk, powdered sugar, rose water, egg white, flour, whipped cream

Equipment: egg beater, measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, baking pan, oven

title: Biskety (Baking Powder Biscuits)
directions: Sift together sifted flour, baking powder, salt.
Blend in shortening.
Add milk.
Handle as little as possible.
Roll out on floured board about 3/4 inch thick.
Cut out biscuits.
Bake in hot oven about 425f for 20 minutes.
Brush the tops with melted butter.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)

Ingredient: flour, baking powder, salt, shortening, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, rolling pin, oven

directions: Pour the hot milk on the meal, sugar, salt, and butter; cool, add raisins, flour, baking powder, and egg.

Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven

title: Ham Slices With Asparagus
directions: Cut slices of cooked ham and warm in a glass of madeira.
Pour in some thick tomato puree and a little good brown sauce.
Season and turn pan on stove till mixture is hot.
Serve with cold dressed asparagus.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)

Measure: Metric

Ingredient: ham, madeira, tomato puree, brown sauce

Equipment: pan

title: Pumpkin Soup
directions: Cut pumpkin in small pieces.
Sprinkle with salt and cook in boiling water 5 minutes.
Drain, mash, and into a cupful stir tablespoonful melted butter.
Pour boiling milk over croutons arranged in soup-dish and sugared.
Then add pumpkin, stirring well together.
Serve.

Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pumpkin, butter, milk, crouton

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, pot

title: Lansdowne Lady
directions: Shake the ingredients well with the ice, strain into glasses and serve with a cherry.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, gin, orange squash, sherry, cocktail cherry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, shaker

title: Economical Mayonnaise Cake
directions: Cream sugar and mayonnaise, add cocoa.
Dissolve soda in warm water and add alternately with flour.
Beat, well.
After each addition add vanilla.
Pour into two 9-inch pans and bake at 350f.
other_info:
Author: Person.Oleta James
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, baking pan

title: Snip Kager
directions: Cream butter, add sugar.
Beat egg yolks and add.
Flour, baking powder, a little lemon and almond flavoring.
Fold in beaten egg whites.
Grease jelly roll pan and spread batter 3/4 in.
Thick in pan.
Sprinkle cut-up raisins or currants and chopped almonds on top.
Bake in moderate oven.
Cut; in diamond shapes while hot.
Loosen from bottom of pan and put back into very slow oven until crisp.
Store in tin cans.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Coon Prairie Church


Source: Country Coon Prairie Church Preservation Kokk Bok (1986-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, egg yolk, flour, baking powder, flavoring, currant, almond

Equipment: egg beater, baking pan, oven, bowl

title: Lemon Pie Meringue
directions: Do not beat the egg-whites until ready for use.
Then beat until stiff and add the sugar and extract, beating only a minute.
Pile the meringue lightly on top of the filling, and bake the whole slowly.
If baked too quickly, the meringue will rise and then fall.
Bake only until it turns a golden brown.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)

Ingredient: egg white, sugar, lemon extract

Equipment: measuring spoons, oven, egg beater

title: Poppy Seed Cake
directions: Soak seed in milk overnight.
Cream butter; mix flour, seed, baking powder, add milk.
Fold in egg whites.
other_info:
Author: Person.Lela Bray
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: poppy seed, milk, sugar, butter, flour, baking powder, egg white

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven, baking pan

title: Haro Sauce
directions: Cream butter or margarine to consistency of mayonnaise.
Sift confectioners' sugar; beat in gradually.
Cream until fluffy.
Add vanilla; mix thoroughly.
Chill.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Dessert, Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, vanilla

Equipment: egg beater, measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Light Chocolate Cake
directions: Cream butter and sugar until fluffy, add eggs, mix well, then add all dry ingredients, alternating with the milk.
Bake in two layers.
For filling, melt butter and add powdered sugar, and cocoa for filling.
Use enough hot coffee to make soft filling.
Spread after cake is cold.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs Jim Casada
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, cocoa, egg, buttermilk, soda, flour, vanilla, salt, powdered sugar, coffee

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven, baking pan

title: Tomato, Cucumber and Pimento Salad
directions: Arrange lettuce on serving dishes.
Place portions of tomato, cucumber and pimento on the lettuce.
Sprinkle with salt and paprika.
Serve with french dressing.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Salad

Ingredient: tomato, salt, cucumber, paprika, pimento, lettuce

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Meat Rolls (Rollitos de Carne)
directions: Brown steak on both sides in hot fat.
Add other ingredients and simmer for about 30 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Fried Egg Plant
directions: Pare eggplant and cut in slices 1/2 inch thick.
Soak slices in salt water for about an hour.
Drain and wipe dry.
Dip slices in beaten egg and roll in fine bread or cracker crumbs.
Fry in hot fat (or deep fat) until well browned on both sides.
Serve with catsup or tomato sauce.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, flour, butter, milk, brown sugar, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, frying pan, stove

title: Barley Soup
directions: Put into a soup kettle and simmer gently for four hours.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.W Drysdale & Co


Source: Cookery for the Million (1877-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef, barley, parsley, onion, salt, pepper, water

Equipment: measuring cups, knife, pot, stove

title: Mashed Potatoes II
directions: Prepare potatoes and cook like boiled potatoes.

When dry and mealy, mash thoroughly in saucepan used for cooking them, add other ingredients, beat well with a fork, and when light and creamy set in a hot place until ready to serve, or put into a buttered baking-dish and brown in a hot oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, milk, butter, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, saucepan, baking dish, oven

title: Perfect Cocktail
directions: Shake well and strain into glasses.
Serve with a slice of lemon on top of each.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, absinthe, vermouth, gin, lemon peel, lemon

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, shaker, strainer

title: De Luxe Shrimp Salad
directions: Soften gelatin in cold water and dissolve in hot tomato soup.
Cool.
Thoroughly combine remaining ingredients and gradually stir in gelatin mixture.
Tour into 2 1/2 quart fish mold.
Chill until firm.
Unmold and serve on crisp lettuce leaves with a french dressing.
other_info:
Author: Person.Suzanne Englund
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co


Source: Savory Seafoods of Oregon (1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood

Ingredient: gelatin, green pepper, onion, water, tomato soup, shrimp, cream cheese, lemon juice, mayonnaise, salt, celery, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, mold

title: Chocolate Cake
directions: Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with baking powder, soda and salt.
Cream shortening and vanilla thoroughly.
Add sugar gradually and continue creaming until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs.
Add chocolate that has been melted over hot water.
Add dry ingredients and diluted milk alternately, beginning and ending with dry ingredients.
Pour into greased layer cake pans and bake in a moderate oven (375f) about 25 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, shortening, vanilla, sugar, egg, bitter chocolate, evaporated milk, water

Equipment: oven, egg beater, cake pan, measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: American Chinese Chop Suey

ingredients.name: French cut string beans, or other fresh vegetables

directions: Season pan by browning in hot fat, sliced garlic.
Remove garlic from pan.
Brown the pork, out in small pieces.
Add french cut carrots and string beans.
Season with salt and pepper and simmer for about 5 minutes.
Add cut up celery and onions.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cover end simmer for about 20 minutes or until the vegetables are nearly cooked.
Uncover, and add the mushroom sauce and soy sauce.
Cook until done.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pan, stove

title: Glorified Hash

Add potatoes, meat, salt, pepper, worcestershire sauce, and water.

title: Dutch Meat Rolls (Boova Shenkel)
directions: After seasoning the meat with salt and pepper, stew the meat for two hours.
Then make dough with flour, baking powder, salt the shortening.
Mix into a pie-crust dough.
Roll into a dozen circles 8 to 10 inches in diameter.
Steam the potatoes, pared and sliced thin; add salt and pepper, 2 tablespoons of butter; the parsley and onions and then beat lightly the three eggs into the mixture.
Put this mixture on the circles of dough after it has stood a little while.
Fold half the circle of dough over like a half moon and press edges together tightly.
Drop these into the pot with the meat and stew water.
Cover tightly and cook for 30 minutes.
Into a frying pan put a couple of tablespoons of fat skimmed from the stew before putting in the dough rolls, add to this 1 tablespoon of butter.
In this brown small cubes of hard bread and stir in a half cup of milk.
Pour this milk sauce over the meat rolls when serving.

Cool.
Arrange sliced peaches in loaf pan.

Chill until firm.
Unmold on oval tray.
Serve either as a salad or a dessert.

title: Calf's Head Soup
directions: Thoroughly clean a calf's head, and boil until meat falls off the bones.
Cut the meat in pieces, not too small.
Tie the brains up in a bag and boil, too.

3 large potatoes cut into pieces about the size of dice, 1 bunch pot-herbs, 1 large onion, the hollow of your hand of cloves, sweet marjoram, summer savory, thyme ; rub well and put all in the liquor to boil, about the time the potatoes are put in ; pepper and salt to taste.
To make the force meat balls get about 1 pound of veal and chop fine.
Mix up with sweet marjoram, pepper and salt, and roll into balls about the size of a nickel, dust them with flour and fry brown in butter.
Put them on a plate and serve with the soup for those who like them in it (you may add to the soup after taking from fire a few slices of lemon, and sherry or madeira wine to taste).
Before taking soup from fire, mix some flour and water together to thicken, but do not get it too thick.
We always strain the liquor before putting in the other things so as to get rid of the little bones.
