Equipment: knife, pot

title: Ceske Kolace (Kolache)

ingredients.name: tablespoon fresh yeast, or 2 pkgs. active dry

directions: Dissolve yeast with half the sugar in 1 1/2 cups scalded milk which has been cooled to lukewarm.
Add 1 1/2 cups of the flour.
Mix all together and put in warm place and let rise until bubbles appear (1 1/2 hours).
Add the beaten egg yolks, salt, rest of the sugar, melted and cooled lard, and the rest of the milk (lukewarm).
Beat well.
Gradually add the rest of the flour, a small amount at a time, mixing well after each addition until smooth and elastic.
Cover and place in a warm place.
Let rise until doubled in bulk.
When dough is light, stir with spoon, let rise again.
Then shape into small balls about the size of a large walnut.
Put into well greased baking pans, well spaced, about 15 in a 10x15 in pan.
Brush top with melted fat and let rise in warm place until light.
Then in the center of each bun make a small indentation with your fingers and fill each with at least 1 tablespoon of prepared filling.
Return to warm place to finish rising.
Bake in a very hot oven until brown, 400 - 425 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes.
Remove from oven, brush with melted fat and remove from pans.

Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bran, soda, white flour, salt, molass, sugar, sour milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven

title: Boston Brown Bread

ingredients.name: cup sour milk, or 1 1/4 cup sweet milk or water

directions: Mix and sift dry ingredients, add molasses and liquid.
Fill well-buttered moulds two-thirds full, butter the top of mould, and steam three and one-half hours.
Remove from moulds and place in an oven to dry ten minutes before serving.
If sweet milk is used, 1 tablespoon vinegar to 1 1/4 cup will sour the milk.
2— baking powder cans, melon moulds, lard pails or any attractively shaped tin cans may be used as a mould.
3—two methods of steaming are used: (a) regular steamer in which the mould, either large or individual, is placed over a pan of boiling water.
Buttered papers may be tied firmly over the tops of uncovered moulds.
(B) steaming in boiling water.
The mould is placed on a small article in the bottom of a pan of boiling water.
This enables the water to circulate around the mould.
Care must be observed in keeping the kettle two-thirds full of boiling water all of the time of cooking.
(Bettina used the method in the fireless cooker.
) She started the brown bread in the cooker utensil on the top of the stove.
When the water was boiling vigorously, she placed it over one hot stone in the cooker.
The water came two-thirds of the distance to the top of her cans.
In the cooker, she did not have to watch for fear the water would boil away.
After fastening the lid tightly on the cooker-kettle in which the bread was to steam, she did not look at it again for four hours.
(It takes a little longer in the cooker than on the stove.

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: Brussels sprout, tomato, butter, salt, pepper

Equipment: knife, measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove, double boiler

title: One Egg Muffins
directions: Cream together butter and flour and add the egg, well beaten.
Sift flour, baking powder and salt together and alternately, add milk and flour in small quantities.
Pour into greased muffin tins and bake twenty minutes in a hot oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Anna Q Nilsson
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, butter, milk, egg, flour, salt, baking powder

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, sifter

title: Hot Biscuit
directions: Pour hot milk over lard.
Add, when nearly cool, yeast, salt, and flour to make a thick sponge.
Let it stand until light (about three hours) and then knead, add sugar and flour if necessary.
After a second rising roll out and cut into biscuits about a half hour before baking.
Bake twenty minutes in a hot oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mary C Dickes
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1893-01-01)


Category: Bread, Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: milk, lard, yeast, salt, flour, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven

title: Stewed Tomatoes II
directions: Remove stem ends and quarter tomatoes (peel ripe tomatoes, if preferred).
Add onion for flavor, if desired.
Cover and cook until tender, 10 to 20 minutes for ripe tomatoes, 20 to 35 for green.
Season with salt; a little pepper; sugar, if desired, 1/2 teaspoon for ripe tomatoes, 1 tablespoon for green; and fat.
For variety, add bread crumbs before serving or top with toasted bread cubes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Tomatoes On Your Table (1944-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, onion, salt, pepper, sugar, fat, bread crumb

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, knife, pot

title: Shrimp Salad
directions: Split shrimp lengthwise through center after cooked.
Heat the soup.
Add the cheese to this using an egg beater to mix until fluffy and smooth.
Add gelatin.
Use the egg beater again to make sure it is mixed thoroughly.
When cool, add the rest of the ingredients and pour into molds.
Save a few of the shrimp for garnish.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato soup, cream cheese, onion, green pepper, celery, gelatin, water, mayonnaise, shrimp

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, egg beater, knife

title: Pork and Kraut (Speck un Kraut)
directions: Put pork in large stew pan and cover with cold water, cook slowly for 1 hour.
Add the saierkraut making sure there is enough liquid in the pan to cover.
Cook slowly for another hour.
Season to taste.
Serve with mashed or boiled potatoes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pork, water, sauerkraut, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove

title: Fish Pie
directions: Butter a pie-dish, sprinkle on it a layer of breadcrumbs, then a layer of fish broken up into pieces ; some pepper, salt, and bits of butter; cover this with more bread-crumbs and bits of butter; pour on a little fish liquor or water, and bake 10 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cooked fish, bread crumb, butter, pepper, salt, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pie pan, oven

title: Sour Cherry Fritters
directions: Sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.
Combine the beaten egg yolks with water and mix until smooth.
Fold in the stiffly-beaten egg whites and add the cherries.
Drop by spoonfuls into hot fat (360f) and cook 2 to 5 minutes or until browned.
Drain on absorbent paper and serve with powdered sugar or fruit sauce.
Other fruits or berries may be used.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, sugar, baking powder, egg, salt, water, cherry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, stove, pot

title: Dutch Noodle Cheese Ring
directions: Boil noodles in salted water until tender.
Drain and place in well-greased ring mold.
Melt the butter, add flour and blend smooth.
Stir in milk and cook, stirring constantly until it thickens.
Add seasoning and cheese cut in small pieces.
Cook until cheese melts.
To 1/4 of the sauce add the well-beaten eggs and mix well.
Pour this over the noodles.
Set mold in pan of hot water and bake in moderate (350f) oven 45 minutes.
Unmold on large platter, pour over the remaining hot cheese sauce.
Fill center with peas, and carrots or spinach.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: noodle, paprika, milk, flour, egg, salt, swiss cheese

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, mold, oven

title: Turron de Fresa
directions: Place in a casserole or an electric mixer the sugar, the slightly mashed strawberries, and the beaten egg whites.
Beat together until foamy and firm consistency.
Place for a time in the refrigerator to get cold.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: metric

Ingredient: strawberry, sugar, egg white

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, mixer, egg beater, refrigerator

title: Frozen Custard
directions: Cut the bean in several pieces, scrape out the seeds in a gill of milk and gently boil seeds and bean, to extract full flavor.
Scald, in a preserving or custard kettle, the cream and milk, but do not boil it.
Beat the eggs until light, adding the sugar until all is thick and smooth.
Stir slowly the cream and milk into the beaten egg and sugar, add the boiled bean and milk and replace on the fire.
Stir constantly until it becomes of the consistency of thin custard.
Remove from the fire at once, and strain through a wire sieve into the ice cream freezer, which latter set in a pail of cold water.
When cool, freeze as ice-cream.
other_info:
Author: Person.Lizzie Settle
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cream, milk, egg, sugar, vanilla bean

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, egg beater, sieve

title: Buckwheat Breakfast Cake
directions: Mix and bake in a flat pan so that the cake is about 1 1/2 inches thick when done.
Cut in squares and serve hot like corn bread.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Food Administration, Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Wheatless Breads and Cakes (1918-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: buckwheat flour, sour milk, shortening, soda, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pan, stove, baking mold

title: Pineapple Orange Sponge
directions: Scald pineapple juice and pour over the slightly beaten egg yolks.
Cook over boiling water until mixture thickens.
Add to the crushed pineapple with the sugar, orange juice and rind.
Soften gelatin in the cold water and dissolve over boiling water.
Add to the pineapple mixture and cool.
When the pineapple mixture begins to stiffen, fold in the stiffly beaten egg whites and evaporated milk, which has been thoroughly chilled and whipped stiff.
Pour into molds and chill until set.
other_info:
Author: Person.M Faith McAuley, Person.Mary Adele Wood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pineapple juice, egg yolk, pineapple, sugar, orange juice, orange rind, gelatin, water, egg white, evaporated milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, egg beater, refrigerator

title: Cabbage in Cheese Sauce
directions: Shred cabbage: cover with boiling salted water; cook about 8 minutes or until crisp-tender.
Drain.
Melt butter or margarine; blend in flour, salt and pepper.
Add milk; cook, stirring constantly until smooth and thickened.
Add cheese; stir until melted.
Add cabbage; mix well.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cabbage, butter, flour, salt, pepper, milk, cheddar cheese

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, skillet

title: Meringue

ingredients.name: cup brown sugar, (1 1/2 pounds) for crust

directions: Use 2 to 3 tablespoons sugar to each egg white.
Either granulated or confectioners sugar may be used.
The sugar should be added to the egg whites when they are frothy and beating continued until the meringue is quite stiff and sugar is completely dissolved.
Brown in a slow oven (325f).
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, zwieback, sugar, salt, cornstarch, water, egg yolk, evaporated milk

Equipment: measuring cups, egg beater, oven

title: Stuffed Summer Squash
directions: Boil squash until done.
Scoop out center and pour about a teaspoonful of butter in each.
Break egg in the center of each squash and sprinkle with bread crumbs, cheese, salt, pepper and paprika.
Bake until the eggs are set.
This may be served with or without a cream sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.William S Hart
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: squash, cheese, egg, bread crumb, butter, salt, pepper, paprika

Equipment: oven, stove, knife, baking pan

title: Drawn-butter Sauce
directions: Mix flour with salt and pepper.
Melt butter, stir in flour, then add water, 1/3 at a time.
Boil sauce with every addition of water, beating each time until smooth.
Parsley sauce variation: add 1 tablespoon chopped parsley to sauce.
Egg sauce variation: add 1 hard-cooked egg, sliced, to sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, butter, salt, pepper, water

Equipment: bowl, stove, pot

title: Maple Sugar
directions: Boil over hot fire until it will harden when dropped in cold water.
Pour on plate and then partly cooled mark into squares.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Imperial Syrup Co


Source: Valuable Recipes (1920-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, maple syrup

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Tvaroh (Cottage Cheese Filling)
directions: Cream butter.
Add : dried sweet cottage cheese, egg yolks, sugar, raisins, salt, vanilla (lemon flavoring may be substituted).
Dust with cinnamon, mix well.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, cottage cheese, egg yolk, sugar, raisin, salt, vanilla, cinnamon

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, bowl

title: French Fried Cauliflower
directions: Break the cauliflower into flowerets and cook gently for 10 minutes.
Drain.
Roll in bread crumbs, then in the mixture of egg and water and again in crumbs.
Fry in deep hot lard at 375f until browned.
Drain on absorbent paper.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve very hot.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.Mary Cullen's department, Household arts service of The journal


Source: Food Fashion Revue Cooking School Second Session (1938-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cauliflower, bread crumb, egg, water, salt, pepper

Equipment: bowl, stove, pot

title: Spanish Onions
directions: Wash them, throw them into boiling water with their skins on, and boil until tender.
Remove the outer skin.
Serve with pepper, salt, gravy or butter.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: onion, water, pepper, salt

Equipment: pot, stove, knife

title: Aspic Jelly for Cold Savouries
directions: Cut the vegetables into large pieces.
Put all the ingredients into a pan and stir until the gelatine has dissolved.
Whisk briskly until a good froth is formed, remove the whisk and bring quickly to the boil.
Draw to one side of the stove, leave for 10 minutes and strain through a jelly cloth.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: carrot, onion, celery, water, sherry, vinegar, lemon, peppercorn, salt, egg, gelatine

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pan

title: Hush Puppies II
directions: Blend dry ingredients together first; add egg and milk (just enough milk should be added to make a stiff batter).
Form mixture in oblong or round patties with hands.
Fry in very hot deep fat until brown all over, drain on brown paper.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69
Contributor: Person.Mrs Harold Avery


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn meal, egg, flour, onion, baking powder, milk, salt, fat

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Sponge Cake III
directions: Beat the eggs until thick and creamy.
Add sifted sugar and beat well.
Add water and lemon juice and beat again.
Sift the flour, add salt and baking powder and sift again.
Combine dry ingredients with the egg mixture, a little at a time folding in gently.
When well blended pour into an ungreased pan with center tube.
Bake in moderate oven (350f) for 50 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: baking powder, egg, sugar, water, flour, lemon juice, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, egg beater, oven

title: Deviled Clams
directions: Beat potato, butter and yolks together; chop whites and onion.
Dip in cracker dust, fry, and place in shells.
other_info:
Author: Person.Frances M Carroll
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: clam, egg, potato, butter, onion, salt, pepper, parsley

Equipment: egg beater

title: BÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©chamel spinach
directions: Cook spinach as in spinach recipe, drain, and chop.
Melt butter, add spinach, heat, and sprinkle with salt, pepper, and flour.
Add hot milk, stir till well blended, and serve hot.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: spinach, water, butter, salt, pepper, flour, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove, baking dish

title: Sweet Potato Puff
directions: Scrub sweet potatoes.
Boil in jackets until tender.
Peel and mash.
Add butter, milk, salt, pepper and sugar.
Beat until creamy.
Pile lightly into a greased baking dish and bake in a hot oven (400f) until brown.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sweet potato, butter, evaporated milk, salt, pepper, sugar

Equipment: knife, oven, measuring cups, measuring spoons, baking dish

title: Cinnamon Whirls
directions: Set oven for hot, 425f.
Grease a 9 by 13-inch baking pan.
Prepare biscuit mix as directed on package.
Roll out on a lightly floured board, in rectangle about 8 by 16 inches.
Brush with melted butter or margarine.
Combine remaining ingredients.
Sprinkle over dough.
Roll up like jelly roll, and press long edge firmly to keep from unrolling.
Cut in 1-inch slices.
Place, cut side up, in pan.
Bake 15 to 18 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1986-02-01)


Category: Bread, Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: biscuit mix, butter, cinnamon, raisin

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, baking pan, brush

title: Tomato Welsh Rarebit
directions: Melt cheese over hot water.
Heat soup with all remaining ingredients except egg; add to cheese.
Add egg.
Stir over hot water 5 minutes.
Serve on crisp toast or crackers.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cheese, tomato soup, onion, ketchup, mustard, salt, pepper, egg

Equipment: egg beater, measuring spoons, measuring cups, pot

title: Salmon Wiggle

ingredients.name: cup liquid from salmon, and peas
quart canned peas, (1 No.10 can, minus the liquid)

directions: Drain salmon and peas, reserving liquid for white sauce.
Flake salmon with a fork and season with lemon juice or vinegar.
Prepare a white sauce of the fat, flour, milk, liquid from salmon and peas, and salt.
Add the salmon and peas and heat thoroughly.
Serve on hot, buttered toast or toasted crackers.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Seafood, Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: salmon, lemon juice, fat, flour, evaporated milk, salt, pea

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot

title: Rosettes
directions: Beat eggs slightly with sugar and salt.
Add milk and flour, beat until smooth.
Heat lard in a deep saucepan.
Heat rosette iron in lard, dip in batter and return to lard until rosette is delicately browned.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Coon Prairie Church


Source: Country Coon Prairie Church Preservation Kokk Bok (1986-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, milk, sugar, flour, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Sweet Milk Doughnut
directions: Make soft batter; roll out, cut and fry.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Breakfast, Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, milk, egg, salt, nutmeg, flour, baking powder

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, rolling pin

title: Fancy Frank Fry
directions: Slit franks lengthwise, but don't cut completely through.
Fill with fillings.
Wrap strip of bacon tightly around each frank, covering slit well.
Pin with pieces of toothpick.
Place in cold skillet.
Fry over medium heat, turning often, until bacon is crisp.
Pour off fat.
Add tomato sauce, sugar, and mustard.
Blend well.
Simmer 10 to 15 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: frankfurter, cheese, pickle, pickle relish, onion, pineapple, bacon, tomato sauce, sugar, mustard

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, frying pan, stove

title: Third Bread
directions: The dough should be stiff enough to be shaped.
Add more flour or more liquid if needed.
Let it rise, shape, let rise and bake.
Note: any bread containing a substitute for wheat should always be worked in one direction to make a finer grain.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: white flour, rye flour, corn meal, milk, salt, sugar, yeast, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven

title: Savory Hominy
directions: To hominy (coarse) add meat scraps finely ground.
Moisten with gravy, stock, or tomato juice.
Spread in a baking pan.
Sprinkle with buttered crumbs and brown in oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: hominy, meat, gravy, bread crumb

Equipment: measuring cups, baking pan, oven

title: Hot Chocolate
directions: Cook chocolate, sugar and water until a thin custard is formed.
Add milk gradually and bring to a boil whip with an egg beater, as this breaks up the albumin found in choco- late, and prevents the coating from forming over the top.
Add vanilla and marshmallows.
Allow to stand a moment and pour into the cups.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: chocolate, milk, sugar, vanilla, water, marshmallow

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, stove

title: Chess Pie Elite
directions: Cream butter.
Add sugar; cream until sugar granules are dissolved.
Add flour, salt and egg yolks.
Stir thoroughly, then add cream and vanilla.
Pour into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake in a hot oven (425f) 10 minutes.
Then reduce to slow oven (300f) to finish baking, about 20 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, flour, salt, egg yolk, heavy cream, vanilla

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, bowl, oven, pie pan

title: Upside-Down Loaf
directions: Combine and mix well ham, pork, bread crumbs, eggs, milk, pepper.
Arrange in bottom of well-greased pan pineapple slices with a maraschino cherry in each.
Sprinkle with brown sugar.
Bake in moderate oven (325f) for about 1 1/2 hours.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ham, pork, bread crumb, egg, milk, pepper, pineapple, maraschino cherry, brown sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, baking pan, oven

title: Canadian Oatmeal Sticks
directions: Sift dry ingredients together, except oatmeal.
Work in butter.
Scald milk and pour over oatmeal.
Allow this to cool.
Add to other mixture and work with hands until smooth.
Roll into sticks the size of a lead pencil.
Bake ten minutes in a fairly hot oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Norma Shearer
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, salt, sugar, butter, baking powder, milk, oatmeal

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, rolling pin, sifter

title: Chicken Fricassee

ingredients.name: pounds ready-to-cook stewing chicken, cut up
studded with a few whole cloves

directions: Simmer chicken with water and next 5 ingredients 1 1/2 to 2 hours until tender.
Remove chicken to a heated serving dish; keep warm.
Strain broth; skim off excess fat.
Measure 3 cups broth, adding water if necessary.
Mix flour and milk to smooth paste: add slowly to broth; cook over low heat, stirring until thickened.
Season to taste with additional salt and pepper: pour over chicken.
Serve with hot baking powder biscuits.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: chicken, water, clove, celery, bay leaf, carrot, salt, flour, cream, baking powder biscuit

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Cranberry Orange Salad
directions: Grind the cranberries and orange and cover them with sugar.
Let it stand for about two hours.
Combine the gelatin and boiling water.
When the gelatin begins to set, add the pineapple, apples and the first mixture.
Pour this into any desirable container.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cranberry, orange, sugar, apple, pineapple, gelatin, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove

title: Beet Relish
directions: Clean and pare the beets.
Grind the beets, onion and red pepper, using the fine cutter of the food chopper.
Add the finely shredded cabbage, horseradish, salt, sugar and vinegar.
Heat to boiling and simmer for 10 minutes.
Seal in hot, sterilized jars and seal.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beet, horseradish, onion, salt, red pepper, sugar, cabbage, vinegar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Lefse
directions: Boil salted potatoes, mash fine, and put them through a sieve.
When cool, add flour and work well into potatoes.
Take a small amount of dough and roll out on a pastry sheet until thin.
Bake on top of stove or lefse plate until light brown on both sides.
Use moderate heat.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Coon Prairie Church


Source: Country Coon Prairie Church Preservation Kokk Bok (1986-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, flour, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, pot, sieve, rolling pin

title: Lemon Sauce II
directions: Mix the flour, lemon juice and eggs together, stir in the water; stir over the fire till the sauce has thickened.
Add salt or sugar as required.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, egg, water, lemon

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, stove, pot

title: Blueberry Muffins II
directions: Cream butter and sugar.
Add fruit and egg, then milk and flour sifted with baking powder and salt.
Bake in muffin tins.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, baking powder, sugar, egg, salt, milk, blueberry, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, muffin pan, oven

title: Mock Turtle Soup
directions: The day before the soup is required cut up the foot and put it in a saucepan with 2 quarts of cold water ; simmer 5 hours, then strain ; cut all the flesh off the bones and chop it up into neat pieces.
Put on the shin separately in 2 quarts of cold water, and simmer 4 or 5 hours.
Prepare the vegetables, cut them up, fry them in the fat in a large stew-pan ; when soft add the flour, and stir till rather brown.
Add the stock from the foot, then that from the shin, the bay-leaves and all the other ingredients.
When it boils pass it all through a sieve, add the pieces of bullockâ€™s foot, and simmer 1/2 hour.
A little soy may be added if required.
Before serving pour the wine into the bottom of the tureen.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Soup, Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bullock foot, beef, carrot, turnip, celery, leek, onion, dripping, flour, bay leaf, clove, mace, sherry

title: Harvard Cocktail
directions: Stir well, strain into glasses and serve with a cherry.

Ingredient: ice, vermouth, brandy, sugar syrup, bitter, lemon peel, cocktail cherry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, strainer, tumbler

title: Hoppin' John
directions: Cook the peas and rice separately.
Cook the onion in the bacon fat.
Add rice and peas and cook until dry.
Add seasoning.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Soup Maigre
directions: Boil the vegetables till tender, pulp them through a sieve, add the water and stir in the butter, while boiling stir in the eggs, beaten to a froth.
Plain boiled rice goes well with this soup.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.W Drysdale & Co


Source: Cookery for the Million (1877-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: vegetable, dripping, egg, water, salt, pepper

Equipment: pot, stove, knife, sieve

title: Red Cabbage, Pickled
directions: Shred the cabbage very fine, spread it over some flat surface, sprinkle with salt, and leave 24 hours, then rub the cabbage in a clean cloth.
Add the spice, tied up in a muslin bag, to the vinegar, and let it come to the boil meanwhile, place the cabbage in a jar which has a cover with the slices of beetroot on top.
When the vinegar boils, pour it over the cabbage, and cover close when it has become quite cold.
This pickle will be ready for use in a few days.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: cabbage, vinegar, pepper, ginger, allspice, clove, beet, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove, knife

title: Shorpa Kharshofe (Artichoke Soup)
directions: In a medium-sized saucepan, melt butter; stir in flour and cook for two minutes until the flour becomes golden in color.
Gradually blend in the broth.
Add the artichoke hearts,lemon juice, salt and pepper and simmer for 30 minutes.
Serve hot.
other_info:
Author: Person.Soad Mansour, Person.Layla Risk, Person.Suzy Grindi


Source: Festival of American Folklife: Egyptian Recipes (1976-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: artichoke, beef broth, flour, lemon juice, butter, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, saucepan, stove

title: Refrigerator Cookies
directions: Beat egg.
Add brown sugar and shortening.
Mix and sift flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add chopped walnut meats and vanilla: mix well.
Shape in roll 2 inches in diameter; wrap in waxed paper.
Chill until firm; slice thin.
Set oven for moderate, 375f.
Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 5 minutes or until brown.
Makes about 48.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Dessert

Ingredient: egg, brown sugar, shortening, flour, baking powder, salt, walnut, vanilla

Equipment: oven, egg beater, measuring spoons, measuring cups, sifter, baking sheet

title: Golden Glory Icing
directions: Cream butter and salt with egg yolks.
Add well drained pineapple and sugar.
Add pineapple juice gradually to make proper consistency.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.Mary Cullen's department, Household arts service of The journal


Source: Food Fashion Revue Cooking School Second Session (1938-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, salt, egg yolk, pineapple, sugar, pineapple juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater

title: Zavareny Okurky s Koprem (Dill Pickles)
directions: In each quart jar place dill, clove garlic, grape leaves, alum (the size of a pea), cucumbers which have been washed and trimmed (if they are large they may be quartered).
Bring to a boil and pour over the cucumbers, filling each jar with water, vinegar, salt.
This will make about 4 quarts.
Seal and allow to set for several weeks before using.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: dill, garlic, grape leaf, cucumber, water, vinegar, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, jar

title: Welsh Rare-bit
directions: Toast carefully square slices of bread with the crust removed.
While hot, butter them, and then plunge in a bowl of hot water.
Place them on a heated dish and stand in the oven, while you make the rare-bit.
Put the milk into a porcelain-lined or granite saucepan and stand it over a moderate fire.
When boiling hot, add the grated cheese; stir continually until the cheese is melted.
Add the salt, cayenne, and beaten yolks, and pour it over the toasted bread.
A rich cheese must be used or the rare-bit will be tough.
other_info:
Author: Person.Cecelia Ewing
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cheese, milk, egg yolk, cayenne pepper, bread

Equipment: knife, bowl, saucepan, oven

title: Onion Sauce
directions: Peel the onions, chop them up, boil till tender with a little salt.
Strain them; place them in a saucepan with the liquor, the flour and dripping mixed to a paste, the pepper and salt.
Stir well till the sauce is quite thick.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: onion, liquor, flour, dripping, pepper, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, knife

title: Jumbles

ingredients.name: whites beaten stiff, and 1 yolk after another dropped in
flour, run over moulding board and then rub to one side
of hickory nut. Roll between fingers and under hand, joining ends to form ring

directions: Split dough into pieces size of hickory nut.
Roll between fingers and under hand, joining ends to form ring.
Put in dripping pan (without buttering).
Bake 10 minutes.
Do not keep with other cake.
Oven must be moderate.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs Van Ness
Contributor: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, baking pan, egg beater, board

title: Lemon Sauce
directions: Mix the sugar, salt and flour well.
Add the water slowly.
Cook seven minutes.
Add the butter and lemon juice.
Serve hot.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert, Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, sugar, butter, salt, flour, lemon juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove

title: Cottage Cheese Dessert Salad
directions: Sprinkle gelatine on cold water; dissolve over hot water; cool slightly.
Combine cottage cheese and mayonnaise.
Stir in gelatine.
Whip cream; fold in with lemon juice, tabasco, and sugar.
Add salt to taste.
Spoon into 5-cup ring mold; chill until firm.
Unmold.
Garnish with salad greens.
Fill center with fruit.
Serve sour cream dressing separately.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: gelatine, water, cottage cheese, lemon juice, Tabasco sauce, sugar, salt, salad green, berry, mayonnaise

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater

title: Sour Cream Waffles
directions: Yolks of eggs, cream, flour and lemon mixed slowly together.
Add the whites, beaten stiff, with the rum and bake quickly in waffle-iron over a quick fire.
Scatter sugar over while hot.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Breakfast, Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, sour cream, egg, lemon peel

Equipment: waffle maker, measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater

title: Jellied Tomato Salad

ingredients.name: cup fresh or canned (No. 2 can) tomatoes

directions: Soften gelatin in the water.
Cook tomatoes, onion, and bay leaf about 20 minutes for fresh tomatoes, 10 for canned.
Press through a sieve and measure 1 3/4 cups (if not enough, add boiling water).
Add hot, sieved tomatoes to gelatin and stir until gelatin is dissolved.
Season with sugar, salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
Chill.
When gelatin mixture begins to stiffen, add cucumber and celery.
Mix well.
Pour into a mold or pan rinsed in cold water.
Chill until firm.
Serve with salad dressing on lettuce or other salad greens.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Tomatoes On Your Table (1944-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, sieve, pot, stove, refrigerator

title: Extra Crisp Waffles
directions: Heat waffle baker according to manufacturer's directions.
Mix and sift flour, baking powder, and salt.
Beat egg yolks until light.
Combine with milk.
Add milk mixture slowly to dry ingredients, stirring until batter is smooth.
Add melted shortening.
Beat egg whites stiff, but not dry: fold in.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Bread, Breakfast

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cake flour, baking powder, salt, egg yolk, milk, shortening, egg white

Equipment: waffle maker, measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, egg beater

title: Whole Wheat Cereal Cookies
directions: Cream shortening.
Add sugar gradually and continue creaming until free from sugar granules.
Add beaten eggs, then the cooked cereal.
Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with salt, spices, baking powder and soda.
Add to the first mixture.
Add raisins with last few stirs.
Drop from a teaspoon onto a greased baking sheet.
Bake in a hot oven (400f) about 15 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: shortening, sugar, egg, cereal, flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, baking powder, baking soda, raisin

Equipment: egg beater, baking sheet, oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, sifter

title: Green Tomato Pie
directions: Wash, remove stem ends, and slice the tomatoes.
Combine with lemon juice, lemon or orange rind, salt, and cinnamon.
Cook 15 minutes, stirring frequently.
Mix sugar and cornstarch; add to tomato mixture and cook until clear, stirring constantly.
Add fat.
Cool slightly, then pour into a 9-inch pie plate lined with pastry.
Cover with pastry and seal edges.
Bake in a hot oven (425f) 40 to 50 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Tomatoes On Your Table (1944-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, cinnamon, lemon juice, cornstarch, orange rind, fat, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, pie pan

title: Eggs Benedict
directions: Cut the ham in rounds, split, toast and butter the english muffins, to fit the muffins.
Poach the eggs and place them on the ham and pour over the hollandaise sauce.
If you like, garnish with asparagus tips.
other_info:
Author: Person.Alice Joyce
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, ham, English muffin, Hollandaise sauce

Equipment: knife

title: Crullers II
directions: Beat the eggs, add cream and milk.
Sift dry ingredients and combine with liquid, using just enough flour to make dough that can be rolled, but still remain soft.
Mix well and let stand for 2 hours.
Turn out on floured board and roll to 1/4 inches thick.
Cut into strips 6" x 1".
Fry in deep fat (360f) brown on both sides.
Drain on absorbent paper and dust with powdered sugar, if you wish.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, rolling pin, pot, stove

title: Rose Cocktail
directions: Place all the ingredients (except the rose petals) in shaker, shake well, and strain into glasses.
Decorate with the petals before serving.

directions: Make in muffin pans.

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, shortening, molass, milk, egg, ginger, cinnamon, soda, flour

Equipment: muffin pan, measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven

title: Toffee Ice Box Dessert
directions: Cream butter, gradually add sugar, add the egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each one.
Add chocolate and vanilla.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites and whipped cream.
Roll wafers in fine crumbs and spread one half in a buttered 10 inch square pan.
Spread chocolate mixture over crumbs.
Mix almonds with remaining crumbs and spread over top.
Refrigerate over night.
Cut in squares and serve with whipped cream.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)

Ingredient: butter, powdered sugar, egg yolk, bitter chocolate, vanilla, egg white, cream, almond

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, baking pan, refrigerator

title: Blueberry Muffins

ingredients.name: blueberries, fresh or well drained; canned or frozen

directions: Set oven for hot, 400f.
Cream shortening; add sugar gradually, creaming thoroughly.
Beat eggs; add.
Mix and sift 1-2/3 cups flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add alternately with milk to first mixture.
Mix blueberries with remaining flour; stir in lightly.
Bake in greased muffin pans 1/2 hour.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Bread, Breakfast

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: shortening, sugar, egg, flour, baking powder, salt, milk, blueberry

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, sifter, egg beater, muffin pan

title: Baked Ham Slice

ingredients.name: cut uncooked ham, slice, 1 1/2 inch thick

directions: Set oven for moderate, 350f.
Cut slashes in fat of ham about 2 inches apart.
Stud fat with whole cloves.
Place ham in deep pan or casserole.
Add pineapple juice.
Combine brown sugar and cinammon; sprinkle on ham.
Bake 2 hours, basting every half hour with the pineapple juice in pan.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ham, clove, pineapple juice, brown sugar, cinnamon

Equipment: oven, measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: To Bake Meat
directions: Baking closely resembles roasting.
It is more economical, as the joint loses less weight, and if carefully attended to cannot be distinguished from roast meat.
A double tin which holds hot water should be used, so that the steam from the water may prevent the dripping from burning.

Place the meat on a trivet in the tin, flour the meat, sprinkle it with salt, put it in the hottest part of the oven for the first few minutes, then remove it to a cooler part, baste well, and turn it over occasionally.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Meat

Ingredient: meat, flour, salt

Equipment: oven, baking pan, trivet

title: Plain Pastry
directions: Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with salt.
Work shortening into flour until appearance is like coarse corn meal.
Add liquid and blend with a fork.
Some flours absorb more liquid than others.
Add only sufficient diluted milk to make dough soft enough to roll.
Chill before using, if possible.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, salt, shortening, evaporated milk, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, bowl

title: Evighets Ol (Everlasting Ale)
directions: Starter: soak barley in water for 3 days.
Then spread to dry in warm place until sprouted.
Put into kettle of water, add 1 cake of yeast, and put in dark damp place 3 or 4 days.
To make the ale, put the starter grain into a quart jar of water.
Add sugar and molasses.
Mix and leave at room temperature.
When aged to desired taste, pour liquid into another jar and refrigerate.
A new batch can be started with a portion of the grain left in the first jar.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Coon Prairie Church


Source: Country Coon Prairie Church Preservation Kokk Bok (1986-01-01)


Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: barley, yeast, starter grain, sugar, molass

Equipment: kettle, bowl, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Weissbrot (White Bread)
directions: Mix two cups flour with yeast.
Mix two cups warm water, sugar, salt and oil.
Add to flour and beat for two minutes with a mixer.
Add two more cups of flour; mix again for two minutes.
Knead in the rest of the flour.
Let rise in warm place until doubled in bulk.
Punch down.
Divide dough into two equal parts.
Roll each into 8 x 12" rectangle.
Roll up tightly, jelly-roll fashion.
Pinch ends to seal and tuck ends under.
Place in greased 8-1/2 x 4-1/2 x 2-1/2" loaf pans.
Make slashes in tops with a sharp knife.
Let rise in warm place until doubled in bulk.
Brush with a mixture of egg white and water before baking and again after 20 minutes of baking.
Bake at 425f for 35 minutes.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.National Park Service, Organization.Smithsonian Institution


Source: Festival of American Folklife: German Recipes (1976-01-01)

Ingredient: flour, yeast, oil, salt, sugar, water, egg white

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven, rolling pin, baking pan

title: Moulin Rouge
directions: Shake well with the ice, and strain into glasses.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, vermouth, whisky, Pernod, sugar syrup

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, shaker, strainer

title: Potato Patties
directions: Mix the potatoes, margarine and 2 ounce.
Flour to a smooth paste, roll out, and line greased patty tins.
Reserve a little of this pastry to cut into thin strips for the top of the patties.
Blanch and chop the almonds, mix together with the sugar, egg, remaining 1/2 ounce flour and cream, and work to a smooth paste.
Fill the cases with this mixture, and place two strips of pastry across the top.
Brush with egg and bake in a hot oven.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, sugar, egg, margarine, cream, flour, almond

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, rolling pin, pot, stove, oven

title: Deviled Eggs II
directions: Remove shells and cut eggs in half.
Mash the yolks to a smooth paste, adding the mustard, butter, salt and pepper.
When well mixed press into the cup- shaped egg whites, round the tops and sprinkle with paprika.
For a special treat, add 2 tablespoon finely chopped ham or a small can of deviled ham to the egg yolk mixture.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, butter, mustard, salt, pepper, paprika

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Carrot Soup
directions: Prepare the vegetables, slice them, then fry them in the dripping.
Add the water or pot-liquor, salt and pepper.
Boil till the vegetables are tender, then pulp through a sieve into a basin.
Heat again and serve with fried bread.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, carrot, onion, dripping, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pan, stove, pot, sieve

title: Dumplings (Spaetzle)
directions: Add milk to flour slowly, stirring constantly to keep mixture smooth.
Add 1 egg at a time, beating well after each addition.
Salt and mix well.
When cooking in boiling salted water or meat broth, pour the batter from a shallow bowl, tilting it over the boiling kettle.
With a sharp knife slice off pieces of the batter into the boiling liquid.
Dip knife in the liquid before each cut to prevent sticking.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: milk, egg, flour, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, egg beater

title: Scalloped Parsnips
directions: Arrange cooked parsnips, split lengthwise, in a shallow baking dish, pour over them medium white sauce, sprinkle with bread crumbs, and bake until brown and bubbly.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Root Vegetables in Wartime Meals (1943-05-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: parsnip, white sauce, bread crumb

Equipment: knife, baking pan, oven

title: Green Peas
directions: Vegetables should be thoroughly washed and cooked till tender in freshly boiling, salted water (1/2 tablespoon salt to 1 quart water).
Shell and wash.
Cook 3/4 to 1 1/2 hour according to age.
Drain and season.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: green pea, water, butter, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, strainer, pot, stove

title: Pork Steaks with Creole Sauce
directions: Wipe the meat with a damp cloth.
Brown in hot skillet in fat which cooks from the meat.
Season.
Cover with creole sauce.
Cook in moderate oven (350Â°f) for one hour.
For sauce: cook the chopped vegetables in the lard until brown.
Add the flour and stir until smooth.
Gradually add the tomato juice and seasonings.
Pour over pork steaks.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.Mary Cullen's department, Household arts service of The journal


Source: Food Fashion Revue Cooking School Second Session (1938-01-01)


Category: Meat, Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pork shoulder, salt, pepper, onion, garlic, parsley, mushroom, green pepper, lard, flour, tomato juice, sugar, olive

Equipment: skillet, oven, knife, pot

title: Virginia Beaten Biscuit
directions: Sift dry ingredients together, cut shortening in thoroughly.
Add milk, work and knead to smooth dough.
Turn onto board and beat with wooden mallet or potato masher until dough blisters.
Then fold together and beat again.
Repeat folding and beating until all dough is thoroughly beaten.
Roll dough out to 1 1/4 inch thickness and cut biscuit.
Bake in moderate oven 15 to 20 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Allison
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, butter, salt, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, rolling pin, egg beater, sifter

title: Cucumber Pickles

ingredients.name: mustard seed, (1/8 pound ground, rest whole)

directions: Take 100 small cucumbers and 1 quart of white onions, pare, slice thin, and put in a jar a layer of cucumbers, one of onions and one of salt.
Let stand in press all night; then drain off liquor, cover with vinegar, let stand a few hours, and drain dry.
Make a mixture of mustard seed, black pepper, oil, celery seed and vinegar; mix this compound with cucumbers and onions and cover tightly in a jar.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret S Rodney
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cucumber, onion, salt, vinegar, mustard seed, black pepper, oil, celery seed

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, jar

title: Dizzy Cocktail
directions: Shake well with the ice, and strain into glasses.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, Cointreau, whisky, Maraschino, vermouth, orange bitter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, shaker, strainer

title: Cornstarch Pudding
directions: Blend cornstarch, sugar and salt with enough of the water to make a smooth paste.
Scald remaining water and milk, being careful not to scorch it.
Add cornstarch mixture and cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
Cover and cook 20 minutes longer over boiling water.
Cool.
Add vanilla.
May be served with raspberry or strawberry sauce.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1932-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cornstarch, sugar, salt, evaporated milk, vanilla, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot

title: Caramel Fudge Frosting
directions: Boil 1 1/3 cups sugar and 1 1/3 cups water until syrup is thick and a delicate amber color.
Add rest of sugar and salt and stir to blend.
Add 1 cup water and cook until caramel is dissolved.
Add butter, then the milk gradually so that mixture docs not stop boiling at any time.
With constant stirring, cook rapidly to the soft ball stage (235f).
Cool.
Add vanilla.
Stir vigorously until icing crystallizes and becomes stiff.
If mixture becomes too stiff, knead like fondant until plastic.
Add just enough evaporated milk to make frosting soft enough to spread.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, water, salt, butter, evaporated milk, vanilla

Equipment: stove, measuring spoons, measuring cups, pot

title: Seven-Minute Cabbage
directions: Heat the milk to boiling.
Add butter and the cabbage.
Cook seven minutes.
Thicken with the flour, mixed with a little cold water.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: milk, butter, flour, cabbage, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Rot Kraut (Red Cabbage)
directions: Place sliced cabbage in boiling water for 2 minutes; drain.
Cook apples and onions in margarine until soft, add drained cabbage, wine or vinegar and seasoning.
When using vinegar instead of wine, add water to cover cabbage.
Cook slowly for 2 hours, adding more liquid if necessary.
(Reheated red cabbage has a better, flavor, so can be prepared 2 or 3 days in advance and refrigerated).
Serve hot.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.National Park Service, Organization.Smithsonian Institution


Source: Festival of American Folklife: German Recipes (1976-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cabbage, apple, onion, margarine, vinegar, salt, pepper, caraway seed

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Apple and Date Salad
directions: Toss apples, dates and dressing together lightly with two forks.
Serve on crisp lettuce.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: applesauce, date, cooked salad dressing

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: Veal Loaf
directions: Put two crackers in the meat grinder, add bits of meat and pork and the rest of the crackers.
The crackers first and last prevent the pork and meat from sticking to the grinder.
Add other ingredients in order named.
Pack in a well-buttered bread-pan.
Smooth evenly on top, brush with white of an egg and bake one hour in a moderate oven.
Baste frequently.
The meat may be cooked in a fireless cooker between two stones.
It is perfectly satisfactory cooked this way, and requires no basting.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Ingredient: veal, onion salt, salt pork, salt, cracker, pepper, lemon juice, cream

Equipment: measuring spoons, oven, stove, bread pan

title: Cucumber and Radish Salad
directions: Mix the cucumbers, radishes, onions, salt and pepper.
Add salad dressing.
Serve on lettuce leaves.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Salad

Ingredient: cucumber, salt, radish, pepper, onion, salad dressing, lettuce

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: French Cookies
directions: Have a dredge filled with powdered sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg, and when the cookies come from the oven dip a brush in melted butter and go over them and sprinkle on sugar and spice.
Cool and put in jar alone.
other_info:
Author: Person.Chef at Molechunkamunk
Contributor: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, powdered sugar, egg, vanilla, pastry, baking powder

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, brush, baking sheet

title: To Make Fresh Stock
directions: After koshering, skin beef melt, and notch it across several times; add water, carrot, turnip, onion stuffed with whole peppers and cloves, salt, and simmer about 5 hours.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef melt , water, carrot, turnip, onion, pepper, clove, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Savoury Cod
directions: Clean the fish and dry it, then cut it into nice sized pieces.
Boil as directed, then cover and keep hot.
Put the flour into a basin, and add pepper, salt, and butter (melted) ; mix well, and make into a paste with the vinegar.
Stir this into 1/2 pint of the liquor in which the fish has been boiled, and cook 3 minutes, stirring continually.
While this sauce cools beat up an egg; then stir it carefully into the sauce, add the chopped parsley, and pour it over the fish.
If preferred the egg may be boiled hard and chopped.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cod, vinegar, flour, parsley, salt, pepper, butter, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, bowl, pot, stove

title: Vanocka (Christmas Braid)
directions: Dissolve yeast in warm water.
Cream sugar and butter.
Add beaten egg and salt.
Stir in cooled milk and yeast.
Add 2 cups flour.
Beat until smooth.
Let rise about 1/2 hour.
Add nuts, and fruit, and mix well.
Add rest of flour to make a soft dough.
Knead until smooth.
Place in bowl and let rise until double in bulk.
Divide dough into 5 elongated strips.
Braid 3 strips and place on greased pan.
Twist the remaining 2 strips and place on the top of the braid.
Pinch the ends together.
Brush with beaten egg and water.
Let rise 45 minutes.
Bake 45 minutes in 350f oven.
May be iced with confectioners' sugar icing.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: yeast, water, milk, sugar, butter, egg, salt, almond, raisin, candied fruit, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, egg beater, knife, oven

title: Schnitzel Meat

ingredients.name: pound veal, steak cut in cubes

directions: Dredge meat with flour and season.
Melt shortening (preferably bacon fat) and brown the meat in it.
Remove meat from the pan, stir in the flour and blend.
Add the tomato juice and stir well until mixture thickens.
Add meat, carrots and onion.
Cover closely and simmer for 45 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: veal, carrot, onion, shortening, salt, pepper, flour, tomato juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Sponge Cake II
directions: Beat the eggs and sugar together for twenty minutes.
Add (without beating) the flour.
Flavor, and stir in the vinegar as gently as possible.
Bake in a moderate oven about half an hour.
Butter the pan and bake immediately.
other_info:
Author: Person.Emma Coulomb
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, egg, sugar, vinegar

Equipment: measuring cups, sifter, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven

title: State of Maine Chicken Pie
directions: Place chicken in large kettle with next 6 ingredients.
Cover; bring to boil.
Simmer 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until tender.
Remove chicken from bones and cut into bite-size pieces.
Skim fat from broth; measure 1/2 cup fat and 2 1/3 cups broth.
Heat the fat in 2-quart saucepan; blend in flour; stir in measured broth and milk.
Cook and stir constantly until thickened; boil 1 minute.
Add to chicken with carrots and onions.
Reheat.
Pour into a 3-quart baking dish.
Before mixing biscuits, set oven for 450f.
Arrange uncooked baking powder biscuits made with 2 cups biscuit mix over top.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until biscuits are brown.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Meat, Soup, Main Dish

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, kettle, saucepan, knife, baking pan

title: Rhubarb Pudding
directions: Line buttered baking dish with slices of plain stale cake or bread.
Fill with sweetened rhubarb.
Cover and bake in moderately slow oven (325f) for 30 minutes.
Make a meringue by beating egg whites stiff and adding 4 tablespoon sugar.
Remove pudding from oven, cover with meringue and brown in oven.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: rhubarb, sugar, cake, egg white

Equipment: knife, oven, egg beater

title: Cheese Pastry
directions: Sieve the flour and seasoning into a basin and rub in the fat.
Add the cheese, and mix to a stiff dough with the egg yolk and cold water.
Use as required.

Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sieve, bowl

title: Stuffed Green Peppers

ingredients.name: chopped onion, or 1/4 tablespoon onion salt
chopped ham, or 1 tablespoon salt pork

directions: Remove the stems of the peppers and take out all the contents.
Remove small slices from the blossom end so they will stand.
Cover peppers with boiling water, allow to stand five minutes and drain.
Mix rest of ingredients thoroughly and fill peppers cases.
Bake in a moderate oven twenty-five minutes, basting frequently with hot water.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)

Ingredient: green pepper, water, bread crumb, salt, onion, butter, ham, paprika

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, strainer, stove

title: Lettuce with Hot Dressing
directions: Cm bacon in small pieces and fry slowly until crisp.
Remove bacon, leaving 1 2/3 cups bacon fat.
Add the salt, sugar, and milk to the bacon fat, then the vinegar slowly, stirring constantly.
Pour over the lettuce.
Garnish lettuce with 10 sliced hard cooked eggs and the small pieces of cooked bacon.
other_info:
Author: Person.M Faith McAuley, Person.Mary Adele Wood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bacon, salt, sugar, evaporated milk, vinegar, cabbage

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, saucepan, knife

title: Klub (Blood Sausage)

ingredients.name: to make like medium cake batter

directions: Mix all ingredients.
Put into muslin bags, about 15 x 4 inches wide.
Do not fill bags to full; tie and cook for 2 1/2 hours in water.
To serve, slice and heat in milk.
other_info:

Category: Meat

Ingredient: blood, water, pepper, salt, oatmeal, barley, suet, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot

title: Salad Soup

ingredients.name: (spring onion) or 1 tablespoon finely cut chives

directions: Rub tureen or large bowl with garlic clove; spear garlic with toothpick and leave in bowl.
Add tomatoes and cucumber.
Slice scallions with about 2 inches of green tops; add with celery.
Add oil and vinegar.
Sprinkle with salt, freshly ground pepper, and monosodium glutamate; mix well.
Add tomato juice.
Chill at least 3 hours.
Remove garlic.
Serve with hot cheese crackers.

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, knife, bowl

title: Dan Hotkey's Pizza Soup
directions: Cook the sausage well, drain off the grease.
Put all soups/tomatoes/cooked sausage in a pan.
Add water till it is soup but still rather thick.
Heat over medium heat.
Serve it hot with the cheese sprinkled on top.
other_info:

Equipment: saucepan, knife

title: Pickled Green Beans
directions: Clean and cook whole green beans.
Place them in a sterile pint jar.
Boil the water, vinegar sugar and 1/8 tsp.
Salt.
Pour over the beans and seal jar.

Equipment: measuring cups, pot, stove

title: Corn Oysters
directions: Use fresh or canned corn, grated.
Mix in flour, egg yolks, salt a pinch of black and cayenne pepper and melted butter.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Drop spoonfuls, to look like fried oysters, on hot greased pan and brown.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, knife

title: Kraut Runza - Runza Filling
directions: Cook ingredients until cabbage is tender.
Cool.
Roll out pieces of dough to 1/4 inch thickness (about 5" x 8").
Fill with runza filling and pinch together bread dough edges.
Place smooth side up on greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 400f until golden brown.

Category: Bread, Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: shortening, ground beef, onion, cabbage, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, baking sheet

title: Baked Plaice and Tomatoes
directions: Slice the onion and tomatoes, heat them in a tin with the oil, salt and pepper.
Wash the plaice and dry it well, put it in the tin, season it, dredge it with flour, and baste it with the oil.
Parboil the potatoes and put them round the plaice to get brown.
When dishing up, squeeze the lemon-juice over the plaice and sprinkle with the chopped parsley.
Haddocks may also be cooked in this way.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, onion, tomato, oil, potato, pepper, salt, lemon, parsley

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, teapot, stove

title: Bassbousa (Farina Dessert)
directions: Warm the milk; heat the butter very hot.
Stir the butter into the farina.
Stir in the warmed milk, then the coconut, 1 cup sugar and the baking powder and mix well.
Butter a large (9" x 13") pyrex baking dish and spread the mixture in it evenly.
Cut it in small squares and place a piece of almond on each square.
Set aside for 30 minutes.
Then bake at 350f for approximately 45 minutes until it is golden brown.
While the farina mixture is set aside before baking, make a syrup by dissolving 3 cups of sugar in the water and stirring constantly while bringing it to a boil.
Add the lemon juice and boil for one minute, then set aside to cool.
When the farina mixture is removed from the oven, pour the cooled syrup over it.
Serve when cool.
other_info:
Author: Person.Soad Mansour, Person.Layla Risk, Person.Suzy Grindi


Source: Festival of American Folklife: Egyptian Recipes (1976-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Ingredient: farina, butter, milk, sugar, coconut, baking powder, water, lemon juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, baking dish, knife, oven

title: Stuffed Acorn Squash
directions: Wash squash and cut in halves, remove seeds.
Put a tablespoon of molasses in each half, sprinkle with salt and a pinch of powdered sage (if the sausage does not contain sage).
Fill the cavity with sausage and top -with bread crumbs.
Place the squash halves in a baking pan, add about an inch of water to the pan.
Cover and bake in hot oven (400f) for 40 minutes.
Remove cover and brown.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, baking pan, oven

title: Beet And Apple Salad
directions: Mix the apples, beets, and chopped eggs.
Add salad dressing (see grandma's salad dressing).
Mix and garnish with chopped nuts and parsley.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, egg, beet, salad dressing, nut, parsley

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: To Broil Fish
directions: Clean and dry the fish thoroughly, split it open, flour it, sprinkle with chopped parsley, pepper, and salt.
Grease a gridiron with oil or butter, and broil the fish over or in front of a very clear fire from 10 to 15 minutes.
Sprinkle with small pieces of butter before serving.
Before broiling mackerel or herrings lay them in a mixture of salad oil and tarragon vinegar for an hour.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: fish, flour, parsley, pepper, salt, butter, salad oil, tarragon vinegar

Equipment: knife, gridiron, oven

title: Bacon Pie
directions: Boil the bacon, cut into slices; chop the onions, peel the potatoes and boil them in as much of the bacon water as will just cover them.
When the potatoes are done, mash them, grease a baking dish, put in layers of potatoes and onions, and layers of bacon, covering the top with potatoes.
Bake brown.
other_info:

title: Perfection Salad
directions: Soak gelatin in water.
Dissolve over boiling water.
Add sugar, lemon juice and salt.
Add vegetables to the gelatin mixture.
Cool until salad sets.
Serve on crisp lettuce leaves with cooked salad dressing or eggless mayonnaise.
other_info:

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot

title: Cheese Straws II
directions: Run cheese through food chopper; add flour and butter.
Mix to consistency of pie crust with water, roll thin, cut in finger size and bake light brown.

directions: Stir well, and strain into glasses.
Serve with a slice of orange on top.

Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, orange bitter, Calvado, vermouth, orange squash, mint, sugar, orange

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, shaker, strainer

title: Hampton Corn Bread II
directions: Pick over beans, wash carefully, and put to soak in cold water over night or several hours.
Drain.
Put beans and pork over fire with plenty of water to cover.
Cook slowly until soft, no definite time can be given as the beans differ in time required.
It may be from one to four hours.
When the beans are soft put in a deep baking pan and bake slowly at least four hours.
Stir occasionally and add more water as needed.
About an hour before serving add 1/2 cup cottolene, or other fat, and return to oven to brown.
If sweetened beans are preferred add 1/2 cup syrup when beans are first put in.
Oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: navy bean, pork, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Custard Pie
directions: Set oven for hot, 425f.
Line 9- inch pie pan with pastry.
Beat eggs slightly; stir in sugar and salt.
Add milk gradually, mixing thoroughly.
Stir in vanilla.
Pour into unbaked pie shell.
Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Bake 40 minutes, or until knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
other_info:

title: Butterscotch Cookies
yield: 10 dozen, two and one-half in diameter
directions: Sift, flour, then measure.
Resift with cream of tartar and soda, cream shortening with vanilla, add sugar and continue creaming until free from sugar granules.
Add egg and milk.
Add flour mixture and stir until flour just disappears.
Add nuts and dates.
Form into rolls.
Chill thoroughly, then slice very thin with a sharp knife.
Place on greased baking sheets and bake in a hot oven (400f) until delicately brown, about 10 minutes.

Heat slowly to serving temperature.
Add salt, a little pepper, and fat.

title: Country Kitchen Brown Stew
directions: Thoroughly brown meat on all sides in hot fat, add boiling water, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, garlic, onion, bay leaves, and seasonings.
Simmer 2 hours.
Stir occasionally to keep from sticking.
Add carrots and potatoes (cubed potatoes may be used if desired).
Continue cooking 20-30 minutes or until vegetables are done.
Remove meat and vegetables.
Thicken liquid for gravy.

Add apples, sugar, and spice to taste.
Boil again.

title: Haddock Talmouse
directions: Melt the butter in a pan, stir in the fish, cheese, egg, and pepper.
Roll out the pastry thinly and cut into small rounds.
Put a little of the mixture in the centre of each round, wet the edges and fold to the centre to form a triangle.
Seal the edges firmly, brush with egg and bake in a hot oven for 10-15 minutes.

directions: Stone the cherries and sprinkle them liberally with chopped almonds.
Add the lemon juice and cherry syrup, and chill before serving,.

title: Sausage Patties
directions: Equal amount of lean and fat fresh pork, ground.
To each pound of this mixture, add 1 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, pinch each of sage and thyme.
Me.
Add one egg beaten, mould into cakes and fry until brown.
Wonder with pancakes or waffles.

title: Banana Cake
directions: Cream shortening and add sugar gradually.
Stir in well beaten eggs.
Sift flour, baking powder, soda and salt together and add alternately with the sour milk and bananas which have been mashed.
Add vanilla.
Pour into greased and floured layer cake pans.
Bake thirty minutes in a moderate oven.
When cool put together with any favorite frosting.

Milk added gradually.
Lastly the whites.
Roll out and cut with jagging-iron.
Cook slowly in lard.
Sugar and cinnamon scattered over.

Grate chocolate, add to mixture, and when thick, add butter.
Add vanilla after taking off fire and beat in vanilla.
