Ingredient: sugar, milk, chocolate, butter, vanilla

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, pot

title: Potato Pie
directions: Cut the meat into small pieces, or mince it, sprinkle with the seasoning and put in a pie-dish, add the water or gravy.
Melt the dripping, add to it the mashed potatoes, pepper and salt, stir well and spread over the meat to form a crust.
Smooth neatly with a knife dipped in hot water, and mark with a fork.
Bake in a hot oven about 3/4 hour.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: meat, potato, dripping, gravy, herb, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pie pan, oven

title: Frosting II
directions: Combine all ingredients except lemon in a top of a double boiler.
Place on stove; use mixer portably at high speed until frosting is fluffy and holds shape about 3 minutes.
Add flavoring and beat off stove a little until it stands in peaks.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs H Ward Conde
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, egg white, salt, water, cream of tartar, lemon extract

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, double boiler, stove

title: Shad Roe Appetizer
directions: Mix thoroughly and chill.
Serve with assorted crackers.
other_info:
Author: Person.Axel Englund
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co


Source: Savory Seafoods of Oregon (1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood, Main Dish

Ingredient:  roe, lemon juice, mayonnaise, horseradish, Durkee's meat sauce, chive, Worcestershire sauce, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, refrigerator

title: Panned Carrots
directions: Slice carrots thin.
Place in a frying pan with a little melted fat, cover, cook slowly until tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
If desired, fry carrots with sliced onions.
Variation with apples: cut the carrots in strips and cook as above until almost tender.
Then add apples sliced in rings with the skins on, sprinkle with salt and sugar, and brown well.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Root Vegetables in Wartime Meals (1943-05-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: carrot, fat, salt, pepper, onion

Equipment: knife, frying pan, stove

title: Poppy Seed Torte
directions: Mix crumbs and brown sugar.
Add butter.
Line a pie pan with mixture.
Cook milk, sugar, yolks, cornstarch, poppy seed, and vanilla in double boiler until thick.
Cool.
Pour into crust.
Beat egg whites with sugar until quite stiff.
Spread over filling.
Bake at 350f for 30 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: graham cracker, butter, brown sugar, milk, sugar, egg yolk, cornstarch, poppy seed, vanilla, egg white

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pie pan, double boiler, egg beater, oven

title: The King of Steaks
directions: Have porterhouse steak cut one to two inches thick.
Wipe with a damp cloth.
Preheat the broiler.
Place steak on center of broiler rack allowing three inches between the surface of the meat and the source of heat.
When steak is nicely browned on one side, it will be about half done; season, turn, and brown on the other side.
Only one turning is necessary.
For a two-inch steak allow 35 to 40 minutes to be medium done.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.Mary Cullen's department, Household arts service of The journal


Source: Food Fashion Revue Cooking School Second Session (1938-01-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: steak

Equipment: knife, oven

title: Fried Vegetable Marrow
directions: Put the flour into a basin with a pinch of salt, add the oil and tepid water gradually, then the white of egg, well beaten.
Peel the marrow, put it into boiling water, and boil until tender.
Cut it into slices, remove the seeds, dip each piece in the batter, and fry in hot fat or oil a golden brown.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: vegetable, flour, water, salad oil, salt, egg white

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Brussels Sprouts
directions: Vegetables should be thoroughly washed and cooked till tender in freshly boiling, salted water (1/2 tablespoon salt to 1 quart water).
Wash well and change water several times while cooking, keeping kettle uncovered.
Cook 20 to 30 minutes.
Drain and finish as for creamed salsify recipe.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: Brussels sprout, water, butter, salt, pepper, milk

Equipment: knife, measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove

title: Plain Cake
yield: 12 eight-inch layers or 9 nine-inch layers or 12 dozen cup cakes
directions: Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with baking powder and salt.
Cream shortening and vanilla thoroughly.
Add sugar and continue creaming until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs.
Add dry ingredients alternately with diluted milk, beginning and ending with dry ingredients.
Pour into greased layer cake or muffin pans.
Bake in a moderate oven (375f) about 25 minutes.
Orange or pineapple cup cakes variation: use orange or pineapple juice in place of the water; no soda is necessary; omit vanilla and use grated orange rind.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, baking powder, salt, shortening, vanilla, sugar, egg, evaporated milk, water

Equipment: oven, cake pan, muffin pan, measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater

title: Cleveland Cake
directions: Combine flour, sugar, shortening, and salt like pie dough.
Save 1/2 cup of dough for topping.
Dissolve soda in the sour milk.
Add cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and cocoa to the dough mixture.
Add sour milk and soda to dough mixture.
Add raisins and nuts to taste.
Place in 13x9 baking pan.
Sprinkle with the 1/2 cup dough mixture.
Bake in a slow oven (300f) for about 40 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, sugar, vegetable shortening, salt, sour milk, soda, cinnamon, clove, nutmeg, cocoa

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, baking pan, oven

title: Buttermilk Griddle Cakes
directions: Sift together flour, baking soda, salt, and sugar.
Combine eggs and buttermilk: stir into flour mixture: beat until smooth: add shortening.
Bake on hot griddle.
Serve with butter and syrup.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Bread, Breakfast

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, baking soda, salt, sugar, egg, buttermilk, shortening

Equipment: griddle, measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater

title: Chicken Noodle Soup
directions: Cut a young stewing chicken into serving pieces, bring to a boil and simmer for 2 1/2 hours, adding water as needed.
Skim of the fat and add peppercorns, bay leaf, onion, parsley, carrot, salt and pepper.
Bring to boil again and add noodles, preferably home made noodles.
Cook for 20 minutes longer.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: chicken, salt, water, noodle, peppercorn, bay leaf, onion, parsley, carrot, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, knife

title: Chow Mein

ingredients.name: lean pork, cut for chop suey

directions: Brown meat in fat, add celery and onion.
Cook until tender.
Add sugar.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pork, veal, onion, celery, fat, sugar, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, skillet

title: Apple Fritters
directions: Make a batter, not very stiff, with 1 quart of milk, 3 eggs and flour to bring it to a right consistency ; pare and core a dozen large apples and chop them to about the size of small peas, and mix well in the batter.
Fry in lard as you do doughnuts, and eat with powdered sugar and the juice of a lemon.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, egg, milk, flour

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, knife

title: Home Baked Beans
directions: Soak beans over night in cold water.
Drain, add 1 1/2 quarts.
Of fresh water, the onion and cook slowly until skins burst.
Drain save the liquid.
Mix molasses, seasoning and catsup with 1 cup of the liquid.
Put half the salt pork or bacon in bottom of bean pot or baking dish, add the beans and top with remainder of pork or bacon.
Pour molasses mixture over beans, add more liquid to cover, bake covered for 5 hours in slow oven (300f).
Uncover for the last 30 minutes.
Add water if necessary, while cooking.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Meat, Side

Ingredient: navy bean, mustard, salt, ketchup, onion, salt pork, molass

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove, oven

title: Lemon Pudding II
directions: Combine sugar, flour, butter.
Add beaten egg yolks, lemon juice, rind and milk.
Fold in beaten egg whites.
Pour into buttered baking dish.
Bake one hour in a pan of hot water at 325f.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, flour, butter, milk, egg, lemon

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, bowl, oven, baking dish

title: Chocodiles
directions: Combine flour, brown sugar, butter, shortening, peanut butter, and salt.
Using low speed of mixer or pastry blender combine until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add egg yolk and vanilla; mix well.
Press mixture into ungreased jelly roll pan.
Bake in moderate oven (350f) for 25 to 30 minutes - until golden brown.
Cool slightly.
Spread with chocolate crunch.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, brown sugar, butter, shortening, crunchy peanut butter, salt, egg yolk, vanilla

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, dutch oven, baking pan

title: Cherry Filling
directions: Reserved 1/4 cup cherries and juice for the sauce.
Chop drained cherries and force excess juice through sieve.
Add all other ingredients to the chopped cherries.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cherry, sugar, flour, salt, almond extract, coloring, nut, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, sieve, bowl

title: Orange Filling
directions: Combine all ingredients except orange juice in top of double boiler.
Stir to blend well.
Stir over boiling water until thickened.
Cool.
Stir in orange juice; mix well.
Makes enough to fill a 2-layer cake.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, butter, salt, orange, egg yolk, orange juice

Equipment: double boiler, measuring spoons, measuring cups, bowl

title: Pfannekuchen
directions: Take 1 egg and stir (not beat) the flour all in.
Then add the other eggs, salt and milk.
Cook on a griddle with a great deal of butter and turn over on a tin.
Can be eaten with sugar or preserves.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Breakfast

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, milk, flour, salt

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, waffle maker

title: Egg Salad
directions: Cut eggs in rather thick slices.
Whip cream and add to mayonnaise and parsley.
Place the toast in a salad bowl.
Over this place a layer of lettuce, a layer of mayonnaise and a layer of egg.
Then another layer of lettuce, mayonnaise and egg.
Garnish with beets and paprika.
other_info:
Author: Person.Eleanor Boardman
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, bread, beet, parsley, caper, mayonnaise, cream

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife, egg beater

title: Burnt Sugar Cake

ingredients.name: sifted flour, little at a time

directions: Bake either in loaf or two 9-inch pans at 350 degrees.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs H Ward Conde
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, shortening, egg yolk, water, flour, baking powder, egg white, vanilla

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, bowl, baking pan

title: Sole à la Maître d’Hôtel
directions: Put the bones and fins of the sole into a saucepan with the water, and put it on to boil.
Place the fillets folded loosely on a greased tin, and sprinkle them with lemon juice, pepper and salt.
Cover with a greased paper, and cook in a moderate oven, about 6 minutes.
Melt the butter in a clean saucepan, drop the flour in gradually, and mix well.
Add the fish liquor and boil 10 minutes.
Then add salt, pepper, cream, lemon-juice, and parsley.
Arrange the fillets on a dish with the sauce poured over them.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sole, butter, flour, lemon, salt, pepper, parsley, water, cream

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, saucepan, oven, baking pan

title: To Clarify Fat
directions: Cut up any scraps of cooked or uncooked fat into small pieces, place in a saucepan, add just sufficient cold water to cover them, stir often, and simmer with the lid off till nothing is left of the pieces of fat but brownish scraps.
Strain into a basin, and when cold, a hard white cake will be formed, which will keep good some time.
This fat makes excellent pastry, and can be used for frying.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: fat, water

Equipment: saucepan, stove, strainer

title: A Fish Cake
directions: Cover a greased cake-tin with stale pieces of bread; melt the butter in a saucepan; fry the minced onions and parsley in the butter ; mince the fish and stir into the fried onion and parsley.
Remove the saucepan from the fire, stir in the bread-crumbs, the milk or liquor, the beaten egg and seasoning ; pour all into the cake-tin and bake in a moderate oven three-quarters of an hour.
Turn out and serve with melted butter.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cooked fish, bread, onion, butter, pepper, salt, milk, parsley, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, cake pan, saucepan, stove, oven

title: Frimsels
directions: Beat up the egg well, add a pinch of salt, then, with a knife, work in as much flour as possible.

Flour the board thoroughly, roll out the paste very thin, cut into three, and roll out each piece till nearly transparent ; then fold into three, let it dry for 1/4 of an hour, and with a sharp knife shave off extremely fine strips.
Let these dry, and add them to the soup when boiling 1/4 of an hour before serving.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, salt, flour, soup

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, egg beater, rolling pin, knife

title: Boiled Rice
directions: Well wash the rice in cold water, then put it into the boiling water with the salt, and let it boil fast 15 to 20 minutes.
When it is quite tender, strain it into a colander, turn the cold water tap on to it for 2 or 3 seconds.
Then place it in a dry saucepan by the side of the fire, with the lid half on, to dry and get hot.
Shake it occasionally to prevent it burning, and serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: rice, salt, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, strainer, saucepan, stove

title: German Sour Cream Twists
directions: Sift flour, salt into mixing bowl.
Cut in shortening.
Dissolve yeast in water.
Stir into flour mixture with sour cream, eggs, vanilla.
Mix well with hand.
Cover with damp cloth and refrigerate 2 hours.
Roll half of dough on sugared board into an oblong, 8x16.
Fold ends toward center, ends overlapping.
Sprinkle with sugar, roll again to same size.
Repeat a third time.
Roll about 1/4" thick but into strips 1x4".
Twist ends in opposite directions-stretching dough slightly.
Put in shape of horseshoe on ungreased baking sheet-pressing ends to keep shape,.
Repeat with rest of dough.
Heat oven to 375f (quick moderate).
Bake about 15 minutes or until delicately browned.
Take from the baking sheet immediately.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, salt, shortening, yeast, water, sour cream, egg, egg yolk, vanilla, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, egg beater, rolling pin, baking sheet

title: Drop Dumplings
directions: Beat up the dripping till quite white; pour some boiling water over the egg, then break it into the dripping; stir these together, then add the flour, seasoning, a little grated nutmeg, and the parsley.
Drop pieces the size of a large walnut, into the boiling soup, and cook about 15 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: dripping, egg, flour, nutmeg, parsley, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, egg beater

title: Peach Butter
directions: Peel peaches and slice very fine.
Add one cup of sugar to every two cups of peaches.
Let stand twenty minutes.
Mix well, and cook quickly for twenty-five minutes.
Put in glasses and seal.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: peach, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, knife, stove

title: Cheese and Mushroom Turnovers
directions: Melt the margarine in a pan and add the cheese, beaten egg and seasoning.
Stir over a gentle heat until the mixture thickens, add the mushrooms and allow to cool.
Roll the pastry out thinly and cut into small rounds, place a little of the mixture on each, wet the edges, fold in half and press.
Bake in a hot oven for 10-15 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: margarine, seasoning, cheese, mushroom, egg, pastry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pan, stove, rolling pin, oven

title: Testo k Pajum (Flaky Pie Crust)
directions: Sift flour and salt.
Cut shortening into flour mixture and work until mixture is like corn meal.
Break egg into a cup and beat lightly.
Add vinegar and enough water to make a 1/2 cup liquid.
Sprinkle over flour mixture.
Stir together and form into a ball.
Chill for a while.
Roll out and bake as usual.
Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, lard, vinegar, salt, egg, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, egg beater, rolling pin, oven

title: Mashed Potatoes III
directions: Boil the potatoes, mash them through a sieve, or beat them with a fork.
Add a little dripping or butter, and brown in the oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: potato, dripping

Equipment: sieve, pot, stove, oven

title: Tomato Juice Cocktail

ingredients.name: cup fresh or canned (No. 2 1/2 can) tomatoes

directions: Cook together the tomatoes, celery, green pepper, bay leaf, and onions about 20 minutes for fresh tomatoes, 10 for canned.
Press through a sieve.
Add salt, worcestershire sauce, and horseradish to sieved tomatoes.
Chill.
Mix well before serving.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Tomatoes On Your Table (1944-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, onion, celery, salt, green pepper, Worcestershire sauce, bay leaf, horseradish

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sieve, knife

title: Fruit Kuchen - Crust
directions: Cream the shortening and sugar well; add one egg yolk.
Add the flour and moisten with milk until it is of pie crust consistency.
Roll out and line a 9 x 13" cake pan.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.National Park Service, Organization.Smithsonian Institution


Source: Festival of American Folklife: German Recipes (1976-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: shortening, sugar, egg yolk, flour, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, rolling pin

title: Savoury Horn
directions: Roll the pastry out thinly and stamp into 2 1/2-inch rounds.
Damp one edge of each round, and fold the pastry round the outside of a metal horn case.
Brush over with egg and bake in a hot oven for 10-15 minutes.
Allow to cool, and fill as desired,.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: cheese pastry, savoury filling, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, rolling pin, knife, oven, piping bag

title: Stewed Knuckle of Veal
directions: Simmer the veal for 2 hours in the salt and water.
After it has simmered 1 hour add the onion, peeled and cut up, and the rice well washed.
Simmer again for 1 hour, add the flour mixed to a cream with the lemon juice, then add the chopped parsley, cook for 10 minutes, and serve the meat in the middle of the rice and gravy.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: veal, rice, onion, salt, pepper, parsley, water, flour, lemon

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove

title: Rissoles

ingredients.name: mixed herbs, or 1 slice cold smoked beef

directions: Melt the dripping, stir in the flour and stock, the seasoning, and lastly the meat, chopped fine.
Heat thoroughly, then turn on to a plate to cool ; form into balls, dip into egg and bread-crumbs, and fry a golden brown in hot fat or oil.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: meat, gravy, flour, dripping, herb, parsley, pepper, salt, egg, bread crumb

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, frying pan

title: Peanut Soup
directions: Boil the peanuts in the water twenty minutes, or for five minutes if roasted nuts are used.
Add milk, thickening, and seasoning.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: peanut, water, milk, onion, butter, corn, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Grapefruit Nog
directions: All ingredients should be cold.
Mix milk, water and sugar.
Stir in the grapefruit juice slowly.
Canned or fresh juice may be used.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: evaporated milk, water, sugar, grapefruit juice

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Moravian Dark Cookies
directions: Cream the butter and sugar together until smooth.
Add the cream, molasses, cinnamon, ginger and cloves and blend smooth.
Work in the flour gradually.
Roll out as thin as possible on floured board.
Cut into various shapes with cookie cutters.
Bake on greased cookie sheets in moderate oven (350f) for about 12 minutes.
Decorate using a pastry tube and icing made from egg- white and confectioners sugar.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, cinnamon, sugar, ginger, clove, cream, molass, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, rolling pin, oven

title: Corn Relish
directions: Cook corn in boiling water for 2 minutes.
Dip in cold water and cut grains from the cob.
Chop the cabbage, onion and peppers into small pieces and add to corn.
Mix vinegar, sugar, salt and spices and heat to boiling.
Add the corn and vegetables and boil until tender, 20 to 30 minutes, stirring frequently.
Pour into sterile jars and seal.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn, vinegar, tumeric, cabbage, sugar, onion, salt, red pepper, mustard, green pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Stewed Carrots
directions: Scrape carrots carefully and cut in thick pieces.
Place them in sufficient water to cover them and stew till tender.
Then evaporate water till only half remains.
Add a little dripping, flour and pepper and toss carrots gently in pan till they are coated with their own juice, and serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: carrot, water, dripping, flour, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove

title: Baked Custard II
directions: Beat eggs.
Add sugar, salt and milk.
Beat well, then add water and vanilla.
Pour into custard cups rinsed in cold water.
Sprinkle tops with nutmeg.
Set cups in pan half filled with hot water.
Bake in a moderate oven (350f) until firm or until an inserted knife comes out clean.
Soft custard variation: beat eggs.
Add sugar, salt and milk, beat well, then add water.
Cook over boiling water until custard coats a metal spoon, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat at once, add vanilla and cool.
Caramel custard variation: increase the sugar to 4 1/2 cups (2 1/2 pounds).
Caramelize the sugar and dissolve caramel in the boiling water.
Beat eggs, add milk, caramel syrup and flavoring.
Then proceed as for baked or soft custard.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, sugar, salt, evaporated milk, water, vanilla, nutmeg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Florida Cocktail

directions: Combine molasses, water, sugar, flour, egg, lemon juice and rind, and pour into a 9 inch, unbaked pie shell.
Blend butter and sugar, add egg and beat well.
Add milk and the sifted dry ingredients a little at a time.
Spread topping over mixture in the pie shell.
Bake in moderate oven (350f) for 40 minutes.

Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, milk, liquor, parsley, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Kidney Stew Or Pie
directions: Remove membrane from kidney.
Split in half lengthwise: remove fat and white veins.
Slice crosswise, 14-inch thick: cut slices in pieces.
Cover pieces with cold water; let stand 1 hour; drain.
Repeat.
Place in 2-quart saucepan.
Add boiling water; simmer 1 hour.
Cover; simmer 1/2 hour longer or until liquid is reduced by half.
Mix flour and water to smooth paste; add to stew slowly, stirring constantly; simmer until thickened.
Add remaining ingredients.
Simmer few minutes.
Serve on toast.
Or, pour into 1 -quart casserole; top with pastry; bake at 425f for 15 minutes or until pastry is golden brown.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company

Equipment: knife, saucepan, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Cheese Spread

ingredients.name: jar stuffed olives, drained and chopped

directions: Scald undiluted milk in large double boiler.
Blend in cheese.
Remove top of pan from water when cheese is nearly melted to avoid overcooking cheese.
Mixture separates if cooked too long or too fast.
Stir in the olives and chill.
As it cools, mixture thickens to right consistency for spreading sandwiches and lightly salted crackers.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club

title: Potato Soup
directions: Boil the onion with the milk and water.
Pour over the mashed potatoes; strain; add salt and pour over the egg yolks, slightly beaten and stirred smooth with a little cream, and serve immediately with toasted bread cut in squares.

Bring to a boil, and keep warm while using.
Stir well before each use.

title: Twin Mountain Muffins
directions: Mix and sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.
Beat the egg, add the milk; add these liquid ingredients to the dry ones.
Beat two minutes.
Add the melted butter.
Fill well buttered muffin pans one-half full.
Bake in a moderate oven twenty minutes.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, sifter, muffin pan

title: Stuffed Prunes
directions: Cook as for stewed prunes.
When fruit is soft, remove the stones carefully, place half a walnut in each cavity, and roll prune firmly round it.
Place fruit, when prepared, in a serving-dish and pour over it the sirup left from cooking the prunes.
The sirup should be rather sweet.
Serve with cream (plain or whipped).

title: Corn and Rice Muffins
directions: Mix hot milk and cooked rice.
Work with a fork to separate the grains.
Add corn meal, shortening, salt, and brown sugar.
Let cool, then add flour and baking powder.
Bake.

directions: Use tart unpeeled apples and firm ripe peaches, cut into small pieces.
Combine with lemon juke and sugar.
Cook slowly until the apple is transparent (about 20 minutes).
Pour into sterilized glasses, seal.
Makes 7 - 6 oz, glasses.

title: Cold Slaw Salad
directions: Put the cabbage through a mincer.
Beat egg slightly, add vinegar and mustard.
Melt butter, add flour and milk and mix thoroughly over fire.
Then pour in eggs, vinegar and mustard, and whip until of a creamy consistency.
Place sliced cabbage on a red cabbage leaf and add dressing, and a dash of paprika.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, shaker

title: Lettuce Salad with Garlic
directions: Wash the lettuce carefully in cold water, put in lettuce bag and let drain on ice.
Then mix the french dressing, placing mixing bowl in cracked ice.
When you are ready to mix the salad—it should be done at the last minute—slice a clove of garlic and rub it thoroughly on small squares of the dry erust of bread.
Mix the salad and dressing and the crusts of bread in a large bowl, using a wooden fork and spoon.
If you like, remove the crusts after the garlic flavor has been thoroughly mixed in the salad.

title: Raspberry Rhubarb Jam
directions: Skin and/cut rhubarb into 1/2 inch pieces.
Add water and sugar, the orange juice and grated peel.
Cook all together, stirring frequently to prevent scorching, for 30 minutes, or until clear.
Put in sterile jelly glasses and seal.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc

title: Cream of Vegetable Soup
directions: Wash vegetables.
Cut in 1/2 inch cubes.
Cook with salt in enough water to cover (2 gallons) until tender.
Drain and save liquid.
There should be 3 1/2 quarts.
If not, make up with water.
Blend flour with a little of the milk.
Scald remaining milk with the vegetable liquid.
Add the flour.
Cook and stir until slightly thickened.
Add vegetables and diced meat.
Add butter just before serving.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: onion, celery, carrot, potato, green bean, salt, evaporated milk, flour, meat, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot

title: Swedish Cold Salmon
directions: Scale fish and clean thoroughly.
Rinse well.
Place a cheesecloth in a large kettle and place the fish in this.
The cloth should be large enough to be knotted over the fish so the fish can be lifted out with the cloth.
Add water, salt, and the pickling spices.
Cover and simmer for about 40 minutes or until the fish is just tender.
Remove cover and let fish stand in broth overnight in refrigerator.
Lift out fish carefully.
Remove skin and backbone, keeping the fish as whole as possible.
Put the two sides of fish together on a platter.
Make a sauce by melting the butter.
Add flour, blend, add milk.
Cook and stir to thick sauce.
Salt to taste and add sugar.
Mix lemon juice with egg yolks and stir in.
Add mustard and chill.
When cold, fold in salad dressing and whipped cream spread over salmon that has been chilled.
Garnish.
other_info:
Author: Person. Mrs A H Lofgren
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co

(1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood

Ingredient: salmon, sugar, , spice, lemon juice, salt, egg yolk, butter, mustard, flour, salad dressing, milk, whipped cream

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Tomato Soup
directions: Cook tomatoes in water until soft (15 to 30 minutes) and rub thoroughly through a strainer.
Add more water if it boils away much.
There should be about 4 cup of the vegetable stock.
Use the water for preparing the thickening and measure tomato after stewing and straining.
3 or 4 whole cloves and 3 or 4 peppercorns may be cooked in the tomato, and stock may be substituted for water.
Scald onion in milk, or chop it and cook 5 min in the butter, being careful not to brown it.
Add flour to butter and stir into this mixture the hot milk, as for white sauce, method i.
Combine with the stock, reheat, season, and serve.
1 tablespoon chopped parsley may be added.
other_info:

title: Uncooked Ripe Tomato Relish
directions: Combine all ingredients and stir until well blended.
Pour into clean jars and cover.
Kept in refrigerator or other place as cold, relish will keep from 2 to 3 weeks.
other_info:

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, jar, knife

title: Macaroni with Cheese

ingredients.name: tomato sauce, or roast beef gravy

directions: Break the macaroni into three or four inches in length and soak in cold water about fifteen minutes.
Then boil until tender, in about one-third milk and two-thirds salted boiling water.
Drain it well in a colander.
Put a layer of macaroni in the bottom of an earthen dish; add a layer of the cheese grated, sprinkling over it the minced parsley, the tomato sauce or gravy, and a little salt and pepper.
Repeat this twice, adding to the top a layer of bread crumbs.
Place in the oven and serve when brown.
other_info:

directions: Prepare a young duck for roasting.
Place in a roasting pan and add sauerkraut, water and sugar.
Cover and bake until duck is tender and golden brown.
Serve with creamy mashed potatoes.

directions: Cook juice of can of tomatoes and sliced onion together for about a half hour.
Strain and add the beef stock and shredded lettuce.
Allow to boil slowly for ten or fifteen minutes.
Serve with croutons.

title: Soda Biscuits
directions: Sift together flour, baking soda, salt into mixing bowl.
Cut in shortening until it resembles coarse cornmeal.
Combine vinegar and milk blend thoroughly.
Add to flour mixture.
Stir lightly until flour is dampened.
Turn onto floured board.
Knead 10 times.
Roll about one-half inch thick.
Cut with small biscuit cutter.
Place on baking sheet 1 inch apart.
Bake in hot oven, 450f, 12 to 15 minutes,.

Serve with baked potatoes.

title: Potatoes Anna
directions: Place alternate layers of diced cooked potatoes and sliced hard-cooked eggs in a baking dish.
Season.
Pour a thin white sauce over all of this.
Place in a moderate oven fifteen minutes.

title: Chicken Chartreuse
directions: Grease a charlotte russé or pudding mold, lining it one inch thick with fill the center with the chicken mixture, and cover the top with rice so that the chicken is entirely covered and the mold is full and even.
Cover and cook in steamer for 45 minutes.
Serve with it a tomato sauce; pour a little of the sauce on the dish around the form, not over it.

title: Potato Soup II
directions: Cook vegetable in water until soft (15 to 30 minutes) and rub thoroughly through a strainer.
Add more water if it boils away much.
There should be about 4 cup of the vegetable stock.
Scald onion in milk, or chop it and cook 5 minutes in the butter, being careful not to brown it.
Add flour to butter and stir into this mixture the hot milk, as for white sauce, method i.
Use freshly cooked or cold mashed potatoes, measure, and add liquid, then reheat and combine with a white sauce.

directions: Inspect and wash fruit carefully.
Add cold water to cover and allow to soak several hours or overnight.
Cook until tender in the same water in which fruit was soaked, sugar is not usually required for prunes.
One-fourth cup or less of sugar can be added to each pound of apricots.
Stewed dried fruits are delicious served with soft custard.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)

title: Devilled Eggs
directions: Shell the eggs, cut lengthwise in half, remove yolks, mash them and add vinegar, mustard, melted butter, parsley and salt.
Refill the whites and put pairs together.
Wrap in tissue paper with frilled edges to represent torpedoes.

title: Baking Powder Biscuit
directions: Mix and sift the flour, baking powder and salt; cut in the lard with a knife until the consistency of cornmeal.
Add the milk, mixing with a knife.
Pat into a rectangular shape, one-half inch thick, on a floured board.
Cut with a biscuit cutter one and one-half inches in diameter.
Place side by side in a tin pan.
Bake in a moderate oven fifteen minutes.

title: One Egg Cake
directions: Cream the butter, add the sugar gradually, and the egg well beaten.
Mix and sift the flour and baking powder and add alternately with the milk.
Add the vanilla.
Bake in a loaf- cake pan twenty-five minutes in a moderate oven.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, sifter, cake pan

title: Creamed Cabbage and Dried Beef
directions: Chop cabbage coarsely and cook in salted water until tender, then drain.
Chop the dried beef and soak in a little warm water for 10 minutes.
Grease a casserole and in it place alternate layers of cabbage and dried beef.
Pour the white sauce over it and top with buttered bread crumbs.
Bake in moderate oven (350f) 25 minutes.

directions: Dice onion and celery and brown in oil.
Add remaining ingredients except rice and simmer 2 -3 hours.
Before serving add rice and cook 20 minutes longer or until rice is tender.

(1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood

Ingredient: onion, clam, celery, parsley, oil, water, tomato, salt, pepper, tomato sauce, rice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Pan-Broiled Steak
directions: Wipe the meat carefully with a wet cloth.
Remove superfluous fat and any gristle.
Cut the edges to prevent them from curling up.
When the broiling oven is very hot, place the meat, without any fat, upon a hot flat pan, directly under the blaze.
Brown both sides very quickly.
Turn often.
Reduce heat and continue cooking about seven minutes, or longer if desired.
Place on a warm platter ; season with salt, pepper and bits of butter.
Set in the oven a moment to melt the butter.
If salt is added while cooking, the juices will be drawn out.
A gravy may be made by adding hot water, butter, salt, pepper and parsley to the pan.
Pour the gravy over the steak.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife, stove

title: Brown Bread

ingredients.name: bread crumbs, soaked in boiling water

directions: Steam for 5 hours.

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Data Pie
directions: Cut up cream cheese and leave at room temperature.
Juice 4 lemons.
Add condensed milk, lemon juice, passion fruit pulp, and cream cheese to bowl and hand mix for consistency.
Beat thickened cream until firm.
Fold in thickened cream into bowl.
Pour into pie crusts.
Refrigerate 2-3 hours before serving.

title: Scalloped Spinach
directions: Wash spinach thoroughly.
Drain and cook with a little water in covered pot, over moderate heat for 8 to 10 minutes.
Drain and chop the spinach.
Add milk, the beaten eggs, 1 1/2 cups of the bread crumbs, melted butter, salt and pepper then mix well.
Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup bread crumbs and the chopped bacon, on the top.
Bake in moderate oven (350f) for 35 minutes.

Cut into squares and serve with whipped cream and garnish with a whole berry, if desired.

Add butter; simmer for 2 minutes.
Serve.

Ingredient: butter, egg, sugar, flour, salt, vanilla

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, stove

title: Brown Betty
directions: Grease a baking dish and line with a layer of sliced apples, sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar mixed.
Then a layer of bread crumbs, with more cinnamon and sugar.
Alternate apples and bread crumbs until the pan is filled, covering finally with bread crumbs.
Small flakes of butter will make the pudding richer and, if you like, you may flavor with a little lemon juice.
Bake in a moderate oven for forty-five minutes, keeping the dish covered until the last ten minutes of baking.
Serve with hard sauce.

directions: Mix crab meat, butter, bread crumbs, cream and yolks of eggs beaten together; add seasoning; wash and trim crab shells; fill rounding with mixture; sprinkle with buttered bread crumbs; crease on top with a case knife, haying three lines parallel with each other across shell and 3 short lines branching from outside parallel lines; hake until crumbs are brown.

Ingredient: crab,  Tabasco sauce, eggs yolk, cream, butter, parsley, onion, bread crumb, salt, cayenne pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, egg beater

title: Summer Cocktail
directions: Mash the fruits to a pulp and strain the juice into a shaker of ice.
Add the sugar and equal quantities of lemon juice and water.
Shake well, and strain.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: currant, strawberry, raspberry, sugar, ice, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, masher, strainer

title: Soup with Pinto or Great Northern Beans
directions: Wash the beans well, and soak overnight in water to cover.
In the morning add 2 cups more water, cook the beans until tender, and put them through a sieve or colander.
Fry the diced salt pork until crisp, remove from the fat, and add to the bean pulp.
Brown the onion in the salt pork fat; stir into the bean pulp.
Add hot water to give the -proper consistency, and salt and pepper to taste.
Serve very hot.
If available, 1/2 cup of chopped peanuts may be added for variation and extra food value.
Or pour this soup over toast covered with sliced browned onions, and sprinkle a little grated cheese over the top.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Pinto and Great Northern beans are a valuable food (1940-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bean, onion, water, salt, pepper, salt pork

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, sieve, stove

title: Dill Pickles
directions: Place cucumbers in crock with dill.
Mix water, vinegar and salt, and pour over cucumbers until they are completely immersed.
Place dill on top and cover with a plate slightly smaller than the crock opening.
Place a weight on top of the plate to hold it down (this is done to keep the dill and cucumbers immersed in the liquid).
Allow to stand three days for 'half-sour' dills; after one week they should be well soured.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.National Park Service, Organization.Smithsonian Institution


Source: Festival of American Folklife: German Recipes (1976-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, vinegar, salt, dill, cucumber

Equipment: measuring cups, jar

title: Roast Beef Superb
directions: Select a two or three standing rib roast.
Wipe with a damp cloth and rub with salt and pepper.
Place the roast in a dripping pan with the fat side up.
Make a small incision through the fat covering and insert a roast-meat thermometer so that the bulb reaches the center of the roast.
Do not cover the roast and do not add any water.
Place the meat in a slow oven (300f) and roast to the desired degree of doneness.
The roast-meat thermometer will register 140f for a rare roast; 160f for a medium roast, and 170f for a well-done roast.
Allow 18-20 minutes to the pound for cooking a rare roast, 22-25 minutes to the pound for a medium, and 27-30 minutes to the pound for a well-done roast.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.Mary Cullen's department, Household arts service of The journal


Source: Food Fashion Revue Cooking School Second Session (1938-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef, salt, pepper

Equipment: dutch oven, thermometer, baking pan

title: Gravlax (Cured Salmon)
directions: Split salmon, bone, rub all sides with olive oil.
Mix salt, sugar, pepper, allspice, saltpeter and season fish.
Place fish in enamel pan or glass dish and top with sprigs of dill.
Put fish in a light press by placing a heavy flat plate on it for 24-36 hours.
Keep refrigerated.
Drain liquid, wipe off spices, slice thinly and serve with or without gravlax sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs Ragnar Nyback
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co


Source: Savory Seafoods of Oregon (1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood

Ingredient: salmon, olive oil, salt, sugar, pepper, allspice, saltpeter, dill

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, refrigerator

title: Gruyere Tasties
directions: Cut the gruyere cheese into thin slices and stamp into rounds, skin the tomato and slice thinly; cut the bread and butter into rounds.
Arrange a round of tomato on each piece of bread, and then put a round of cheese on top.
Decorate with a small piece of parsley.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: cheese, brown bread, butter, tomato, parsley

Equipment: knife

title: Brazilian Stew
directions: Cut the meat into neat pieces, dip each piece in the vinegar, and pack closely in a saucepan.
Sprinkle with pepper and salt.
Cut the vegetables into slices, and put them with the herbs into the saucepan.
Close the lid, and steam 2 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef, carrot, turnip, herb, pepper, salt, vinegar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, saucepan, stove, pot

title: Chow Chow
directions: Put each kind of vegetable into a separate bowl and sprinkle a small amount of salt over each.
Let stand 4 hours.
Press juice from each vegetable and combine.
Mix the dry ingredients and rub into a paste by using a small amount of vinegar.
Then add all vegetables and cook the vinegar and heat to boiling.
Put in the slowly for 20 minutes.
Pack in sterile jars and seal.
Cover jars with boiling water and simmer for 15 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cabbage, mustard seed, green tomato, celery seed, onion, ginger, red pepper, salt, vinegar, sugar, mustard, clove

Equipment: measuring spoons, pot, stove

title: Vegetable Soup
directions: Prepare the vegetables, cut them into slices, fry them in the dripping, add the water or pot-liquor, the salt, pepper, and herbs.
Boil till quite tender, mix the flour and mustard to a cream with the cold water, and add to the soup.
Simmer for half an hour longer and then serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, carrot, turnip, potato, onion, celery, herb, dripping, flour, mustard, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot, saucepan

title: Green Tomato Mincemeat Cookies
directions: Blend together fat and vanilla.
Gradually add sugar, creaming well after each addition.
Add eggs one at a time, beating after each.
Sift together flour, baking powder, soda, and salt.
Add alternately with the mincemeat to the creamed mixture, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients.
Add nut meats.
Drop from b teaspoon on a greased baking sheet and bake in a moderately hot oven (375f) 15 to 20 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Tomatoes On Your Table (1944-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: fat, vanilla, sugar, egg, flour, baking powder, soda, salt, tomato, nut meat

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, bowl, oven, baking sheet

title: Eggs Suzette
directions: Select six good-sized potatoes and bake them.
When they are done, break a hole in the top, being careful not to use a steel knife.
Scoop out the potatoes, without breaking the skin.
Drop an egg into each potato.
Mash the potato which has been removed from skin, seasoning with salt, pepper and paprika.
Cover the eggs with the mixture, sprinkle grated cheese over the top and return to the oven long enough to cook the egg.
other_info:
Author: Person.Betty Jewel
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, cheese, egg, salt, pepper, paprika

Equipment: grater, oven, stove, baking pan

title: Layer Sponge Cake
directions: Beat the yolks and whites of eggs separately (reserving the white of one egg for icing); then add the sugar to the yolks; then, whites of eggs; next, flour and baking powder; lastly, put in boiling water and place immediately in oven.

Bake in two layers, and when cold ice with following icing: 1 cup granulated sugar, 4 tablespoonfuls water ; boil together seven minutes; then pour into the white of the egg, which has been well beaten.
Beat all the time you are pouring the sugar into the egg; flavor; then spread on cakes when both are cool.
other_info:
Author: Person.Jennie Macauley
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, sugar, flour, baking powder, water, rose water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven

title: Cheese and English Walnut Sandwiches
directions: Beat butter to a cream, add a few grains of cayenne and salt; add very gradually the cheese grated.
Then mix in the walnut meats, sliced very thin; spread this mixture upon bread, prepared for sandwiches.
This preparation is good with any kind of bread.
other_info:
Author: Person.Helen Parker Headden, Person.Katherine Newsbury, Organization.Denver Gas and Electric Co

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, grater

title: Potato Soup III

ingredients.name: mealy potatoes, boiled or steamed very dry

directions: Mash the potatoes so that no lumps remain, and gradually add them to the boiling stock.
Pass it through a sieve, season and simmer for five minutes, skim well and serve with fried bread.
other_info:

Source: Cookery for the Million (1877-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, pepper, salt, stock

Equipment: masher, pot, stove

title: Nonpareil Corn Bread
directions: Beat the whites and yolks of the eggs separately and thoroughly; then melt the lard and add.
Into the dry meal and flour mixed, sift the soda and cream-tartar, and add these to the eggs, lard, and milk.
Beat vigorously.
Bake in a quick and steady oven for thirty minutes.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, bread pan, oven

title: Sodt Suppe (Fruit Soup)
directions: Soak prunes and dried apricots over night, drain and use water.
Boil sago 1/2 hour before adding to remaining ingredients.
Cook over medium heat until sago (or tapioca) and fruits are tender.

Ingredient: tapioca, water, salt, sugar, grape juice, cinnamon, currant, raisin, prune, vinegar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Squash
directions: Cut in pieces and remove seeds.
May be pared before or after cooking.
Will be drier if steamed instead of boiled, but a longer time will be required.
Cook 1 to 1 1/2 hours, mash, and season.

Ingredient: squash, water, butter, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot, knife

title: Vegetable Soup II
directions: Simmer a soup bone in water.
To each quart of this meat broth, add the vegetables.
Cut all the vegetables about the same size and shape.
Cook until tender in the salted meat stock.
Season well and serve hot.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Root Vegetables in Wartime Meals (1943-05-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: soup bone, onion, carrot, turnip, potato, green pepper, celery, tomato juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove

title: OId Fashioned Coffee Cake
directions: Take the bread sponge, add the eggs well beaten, sugar, butter and water.
Mix well together, then add enough flour to make a thin dough.
Let it rise until double in size.
Turn it on a board and roll it out an inch thick.
Place it in a baking tin, cutting it to fit the tin, and let it rise again until light.
Just before placing it in the oven, spread over the top with egg beaten with a teaspoonful of sugar.
Sprinkle over this some granulated sugar, and a few split blanched almonds.
If preferred, the dough may be twisted and shaped into rings instead of being baked in sheets.
other_info:
Author: Person.Esther Ralston
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg, bread sponge, butter, water, almond, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, rolling pin, egg beater

title: Harvard Beets II
directions: Mix cornstarch or flour, sugar, and salt.
Add vinegar and water and boil 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add the fat and beets, and let stand until the sauce becomes red.
Reheat if necessary.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Root Vegetables in Wartime Meals (1943-05-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cornstarch, sugar, salt, vinegar, water, fat, beet

Equipment: stove, knife, pan, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Quick Red Beans and Rice
directions: SautÃ© onions and garlic in large sauce pan.
Add beans, tomatoes and cayenne.
Bring the beans to a boil.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add instant rice.
Simmer for 5 more minutes.
Remove from heat and let sit for 5 minutes.

Category: Soup, Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: onion, garlic clove, black bean, rice, tomato, salt, cayenne pepper

Equipment: saucepan, measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Teleci s Parikou (Veal with Paprika)
directions: Cut veal into medium sized pieces.
Place saucepan (preferably iron or heavy aluminum).
When it bubbles, add meat, salt to taste, cover, and stew until tender.
Then add several tablespoon of the broth.
Dust with the flour.
Add paprika and stew a while longer.
Add sour cream.
When it bubbles, remove the meat from the gravy, strain the gravy to remove any lumps and pour the gravy over the meat.
For added zest, add a small amount of vinegar.
More flour may be needed to thicken the gravy.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: veal, butter, onion, beef broth, flour, paprika, sour cream

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, saucepan, stove

title: Scaloped Oysters
directions: Drain oysters over bowl to save juice.
Remove bits of shell from oysters individually.
Butter 1 quart casserole.
Alternate layers of oysters and crumbs, seasoning with salt and pepper and a little scraped onion.
Reserve crumbs for top.
Pour in oyster juice and milk enough to reach top layer of oysters.
More milk may be added later if mixture seems dry.
Sprinkle with buttered crumbs.
Bake in moderate oven 350f about 30 minutes until golden brown and oysters are ruffled.
Over cooking makes them tough and dry.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: oyster, cracker crumb, butter, milk, onion, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, casserole, oven

title: Whipped Evaporated Milk
directions: Pour contents of 1 tall can evaporated milk into freezing tray.
Place in freezing compartment of refrigerator.
When tiny ice crystals begin to form around edges, turn into chilled bowl and whip with rotary egg beater until stiff enough to hold its shape.
Sugar and vanilla may be added and whipped in at this stage, if desired.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: American

Ingredient: evaporated milk

Equipment: refrigerator, egg beater

title: Pie Crust II
directions: Mix flour and salt.
Gently rub in butter with the tips of the fingers.
Add cold water to make dough.
Turn on floured cloth and knead 2 minutes.
Pat with rolling pin.
Lift to prevent sticking and roll out to a long rectangular piece.
Spread 2-thirds of it with about 3 tablespoons of butter, which has been washed in cold water to free it from buttermilk.
Fold over in 3 layers, turn it 1/4 of the way around, pat, lift, roll, fold and turn (do this 3 times).
Roll to fit pie plate and bake.
other_info:
Author: Person.Douglas Fairbanks
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, salt, water, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, rolling pin

title: Oyster Stuffing for Turkey
directions: Moisten bread-crumbs with warm (not hot) water and add other ingredients, seasoning to taste.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: oyster, bread crumb, thyme, marjoram, salt, pepper, butter, oyster liquor

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, knife

title: Baked-Bean Soup
directions: Use 2 cups stewed and strained tomato in place of the milk if preferred.
Pick over and wash the vegetable and soak several hours or overnight.
Drain and add measured water and small onion, with a 2-inch cube of salt pork if desired.
Cook gently 5 or 6 hours until liquid is reduced one half.
Remove salt pork and rub vegetable through a strainer to remove skins.
Melt butter, add flour and enough stock to make mixture thin enough to pour.
Add to rest of stock, stir until it boils, season, and serve.
Milk may be added or not.
If used, it may be mixed with butter and flour as for white sauce.
If too thick, soup may be thinned with milk or water, and water must be added if it boils away.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Soup, Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bean, water, milk, flour, butter, salt, pepper, onion

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove, strainer, baking pan

title: Stuffed Tomatoes
directions: Cut a small piece off the top of each tomato and squeeze them slightly.
Mix the other ingredients over the fire for a few minutes, then stuff each tomato with some of the mixture, replace the top pieces, sprinkle with breadcrumbs and bake 10 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, beef, shallot, mushroom, parsley, bread crumb

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven

title: Orange Frosting
directions: Sift sugar into bowl.
Add milk, orange juice and rind and beat until well blended.
Use about 2 teaspoons frosting for each cup cake.
other_info:

Equipment: egg beater, measuring spoons, measuring cups, sifter, bowl

title: Strul
directions: Mix all ingredients.
Place 1 teaspoonful of dough on strul iron.
When baked, roll on cone until cool.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Coon Prairie Church


Source: Country Coon Prairie Church Preservation Kokk Bok (1986-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: whipped cream, milk, sugar, salt, vanilla, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove

title: Thin White Sauce
directions: Melt butter.
Add flour, salt and pepper, and mix thoroughly.
Do not allow flour to brown.
Add water and boil until smooth and thick, stirring constantly.
Add milk and continue cooking until thickened, about 10 minutes.
Medium white sauce (for creamed vegetables, meat and fish): increase flour to 2 cups.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, flour, salt, pepper, broth, evaporated milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot

title: Clam Soup
directions: Put in a pot the hard part of the clams, onion, parsley, mace, and seasoning, with clam liquor increased to 1 quart with water.
Cook covered, a half-hour after it begins to boil.
Heat in another vessel the milk ; when hot, stir in the butter rolled in flour and set in a pan of hot water to keep hot after it has boiled two minutes.
Strain the soup back into the pot, over the soft part of the clams, the only digestible part, and simmer five minutes.
Pour the thickened milk into a hot tureen, stir in the soup and serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.D Cornelia Earley
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Soup, Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: clam, milk, butter, flour, onion, parsley, mace, salt, pepper

Equipment: pot, tureen, measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Party Punch
directions: Mix all the ingredients except the soda water, and stand the bowl on ice for at least 1/2 hour.
Just before serving, add the soda water.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cider, mint, fruit, brandy, sherry, soda water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl

title: Ham en Panier
directions: Prepare a white sauce of the butter, flour, water, milk and seasonings.
Steam eggs, and chop, reserving about 12 for garnish.
Add eggs, ham and mustard to the white sauce.
Pour mixture into a greased baking pan.
Garnish top with chopped green pepper, pimientos and remaining eggs.
Bake in a moderate oven (350f) about 25 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mabelle S. Ehlers, Person.Florence J. Atwood


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, flour, water, evaporated milk, salt, pepper, egg, ham, mustard, green pepper, pimiento

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, steamer, baking pan, oven

title: Fillet of Sole (Stuffed)
directions: Place 1 fillet in bottom of baking dish.
Cover with a layer of mushrooms and sprinkle with 5 or 6 drops of garlic juice.
Cover with second fillet.
Place butter on top of fillet.
Bake in covered dish at 350f for 10 to 16 minutes.
Drain off liquor from baked fish.
Make a white sauce using some of the fish liquor.
Cover the fillets with the sauce.
Garnish and serve.
other_info:
Author: Person.A Y Engbretson
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co

(1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood

Ingredient: sole, butter, mushroom, garlic

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, baking dish

title: Cream Custard Dressing
directions: Mix corn starch with a little cold water; pour on scalded milk and let cook until corn starch is thoroughly done; add yolks of eggs and sugar, which have been beaten till creamy, and butter.
Cook until eggs thicken; remove from stove.
When cool, add juice of fruit and wine.
Just before serving, add the whipped cream.
Arrange fruit on lettuce leaves and place dressing on top.
other_info:
Author: Person.Helen Parker Headden, Person.Katherine Newsbury, Organization.Denver Gas and Electric Co


Source: A Book of Hints on the Art of Cooking (1907-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, lemon, whipping cream, butter, cornstarch, sherry, orange, egg yolk, milk, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Sole au Gratin
directions: Skin the sole, cut off the fins and nick it on both sides with a knife, dry it well.
Chop the shallot, mushrooms and parsley, mix them together, and sprinkle half of them on to a dish.
Lay the sole on this seasoning, and sprinkle the rest of it over the sole.
Squeeze lemon-juice over, sprinkle with salt, pepper and stale scraps of bread.
Put little bits of butter on the fish, bake in a moderate oven for 10 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sole, shallot, mushroom, parsley, lemon, butter, bread, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, baking dish

title: Sweet Potato Croquettes
directions: Mash sweet potatoes very fine and add salt, sugar and melted butter.
Shape into croquette rolls or patties and chill in the refrigerator for a half hour.
Then roll in bread crumbs, dip in the egg white, slightly beaten, and in the crumbs again.
Bake in a shallow, greased baking dish for 20 minutes, in hot oven (400f).
For a modern variation of this old recipe, place a marshmallow in the center of each with the potato mixture coating it completely.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sweet potato, sugar, butter, egg white, salt, bread crumb

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, baking dish

title: German Oven Package
directions: Beat eggs with fork; alternate milk, flour with salt, and beat well.
Have oven preheated at 350 degrees.
Place two tablespoons butter in large iron frying pan, and warm.
Add mixture, and bake 25 minutes.
Serve hot for dessert, with spread of applesauce or jelly.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: milk, flour, salt, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, bowl, frying pan, oven

title: Orange Cake
directions: To be baked thin in three tins, and piled.
See recipe for filling.

Author: Person.H Harris
Contributor: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1919-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, flour, egg yolk, egg white, cream of tartar, baking soda, orange juice

Equipment: oven, cake pan, measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Boiled Salad Dressing
directions: Beat egg-yolks thoroughly and add the dry ingredients (mixed and sifted).
Gradually add the vinegar and water.
Cook in a double boiler until thick and creamy, or directly over small flame, stirring constantly.
If whipped cream is to be used, no butter need to be added.
If not, add butter the last thing.
Beat with a dover egg beater until creamy.
Keep in a cool place.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: egg yolk, paprika, flour, butter, salt, vinegar, mustard, water, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, sifter, stove

title: Cottage Cheese Pie
directions: Combine cottage cheese, sugar, flour, salt, lemon rind and spices.
Add beaten egg yolks and mix thoroughly.
Add milk gradually and stir smooth.
Fold in beaten egg whites and pour into 9 inch, pastry lined pan.
Bake in moderate (350f) oven, 1 hour.

Cut rolled dough into squares.
Cut a slit in the center of each square.

title: White Sauce (thick)
directions: Use any of the three methods to cook white sauce: method i: melt butter in a saucepan and stir in the flour without removing the saucepan from the stove.

Add 1/3 of the milk, stir until the mixture boils, then beat until the sauce is perfectly smooth; add another third of the milk and repeat the stirring and beating ; then add remainder of milk, and when the sauce boils, season as required.
This method develops the flavor of the sauce better than method 2 and method 3.
Method 2: melt butter in a double boiler, stir in the flour.
Then add the milk (cold).
Stir constantly till sauce thickens.
Add seasonings.
Method 3: scald 3/4 cup milk and mix the flour with remainder of the milk before adding hot liquid.
Cook at least 15 min.
In double boiler, stirring until thick.
Butter and seasoning should be added last.
This method of making is considered better for those of weak digestion.

title: Chili Kidney Beans with Tomatoes
directions: Soak beans overnight in cold water or about 5 hours in lukewarm water to cover.
Add onion, garlic, green pepper, bacon drippings, tomatoes, and salt; and simmer for 2 hours in the soaking water.
Add more water if needed during cooking.
Add t he chili powder, stirring as little as possible to avoid mashing the beans.
Place in a baking dish or bean pot, cover, and bake in a moderate oven (350f) for about 2 hours.
Uncover during last part of the cooking if brown beans are desired.
If preferred, use lima or navy beans in place of the kidney beans.

Cook over moderate heat, stirring often, until thickened.

Cook until thick.

directions: Wash tomatoes, ripe or green, and remove stem ends.

Place under direct heat with top of tomatoes about 3 inches below tip of flame or broiler unit.
Broil until tender, 10 to 15 minutes for ripe tomatoes, 15 to 25 for green.
If desired, sprinkle with fine bread crumbs or grated cheese for the last few minutes of broiling.

Oven.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven

title: Coffee Cake (Kaffee Kuchen)
directions: At night crumble and soak yeast 20 minutes in lukewarm water.
Scald milk, add salt and let cool.
Add yeast to lukewarm milk and mix enough flour to make a thick batter.
Beat smooth.
Cover and let rise in moderately warm place (78 degrees) over night or until light.
In morning scald and cool milk.
Cream butter, sugar and salt.
Add beaten eggs.
Mix sponge with lukewarm milk, then add butter mixture and enough our to make soft dough.
Beat hard or knead by hand.
Let dough rise until doubled.
When light turn on floured board and roll out gently until 1/2 inch thick.
Place in buttered pans.
Brush top with melted butter.
Let rise until double.
Sprinkle with sugar or cinnamon and bake in hot oven for 20 minutes.

directions: Vegetables should be thoroughly washed and cooked till tender in freshly boiling, salted water (1/2 tablespoon salt to 1 quart water).
Remove stem end and seeds from the peppers and parboil 10 min.
Drain thoroughly, turning upside down to dry, and fill with a stuffing made from the stale bread crumbs and the seasonings, adding enough boiling water to moisten well.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes in a moderate oven and serve with or without toast and brown sauce.

Oven about 35 minutes.

Cover with boiling water, and let simmer until meat is tender.
Cook other ingredients for twenty minutes, adding one cup boiling water.
Rub through sieve, season with salt and pepper, thicken with flour.
The broth in which meat is cooked should be used for sauce.
Place meat on platter, cover with sauce.
Cooked carrots, potatoes, and sliced bell pepper should be placed on and around the meat, and rice may be arranged for a border.

title: Pot Roast
directions: Pat uses a ‘dutch oven’ to cook the pot roast.
It has a finely machined lid which fits so tightly that no steam can escape or air get in.
Get the oven or pan very hot.
Put in the roast and sear it on all sides.
Put in about three or four cups of carrots, onions and celery, all finely chopped.
Cook over a very slow fire, for six hours or so.
By this time there is a quart or so of liquid in the oven— juice from the meat and vegetables.
Stir in four tablespoonfuls of flour to make thick gravy.
Add horse-radish and serve.

title: Leg of Lamb Moderne
yield: 6-8 servings for six pound leg of lamb
directions: Wipe meat with a damp cloth.
Season with salt and pepper and rub with garlic, if desired.
Place skin side down on a rack in an open pan.
Do not add water.
Do not cover.
Roast in a slow oven (300f) until the desired degree of doneness is reached.
If a roast-meat thermometer is used it should register 175f, for medium-done lamb, and 180f, for well-done lamb.
Allow approximately 30-35 minutes to the pound.

title: Old-Fashioned Apple Pie

Roll out remaining pastry for top crust.
Set oven for hot, 400f.
Mix sugar, flour, and spices.
Spread a little of the sugar mixture over the bottom of pastry lined pan.
Pare apples; cut in quarters.
Remove cores; slice thin.
Arrange apples in pan; sprinkle with remaining sugar mixture.
Dot with butter or margarine.
Cut slits in top crust; adjust over apples.
Seal edges; trim; flute.
Bake 50 to 60 minutes until apples are tender.

title: Clam Chowder
directions: Saute bacon until golden but not brown.
Add onions and celery tops to bacon and cook until onion and celery are wilted.
Add next 5 ingredients, simmer until potatoes are tender, about 1/2 hour.
The base is now completed.
Melt butter and blend in flour.
Remove from heat and slowly stir in milk.
Return to heat and cook until slightly thickened.
Add clam chowder base and heat through but do not boil, add a little butter and paprika to taste.
Serves 8.

title: Ox-Tail Soup

Pour in the rest of the water and when boiling add salt to taste; skim well; cut the vegetables in slices and add with the herbs.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Scrambled Eggs II
directions: Beat eggs.
Add milk and seasonings.
Heat fat in frying pan.
When it bubbles, pour in the egg mixture.
Cook slowly, stirring occasionally, until eggs are firm but not hard.
To keep scrambled eggs very soft and tender cook over boiling water.

Equipment: egg beater, measuring cups, measuring spoons, pan

title: Upside Down Orange Biscuits
directions: Combine butter, orange juice, 1/2 cup sugar and orange rind; cook two minutes.
Pour into nine cup muffin pans.
Sift flour, salt and baking powder, cut in shortening, add milk, stir until dough follows fork around bowl.
Knead one-half minute roll one-fourth inch thick sprinkle with 1/4 sugar and cinnamon.
Roll as for jelly roll, slice one inch thick and place cut side down over orange mixture that has been placed in muffin tin.
Bake in hot oven, 450f 20 to 30 minutes.

title: Spaghetti Loaf

ingredients.name: quart spaghetti, broken in 2 inches pieces (3 1/2 pounds)

directions: Boil spaghetti until tender in boiling, salted water to which garlic has been added.
Drain and rinse.
Melt cheese in the milk over boiling water.
Beat eggs.
Add salt, pepper, onion, spaghetti, parsley, then the cheese sauce, stirring rapidly to prevent hot sauce from cooking eggs.
Pour into greased loaf pans.
Bake in a moderate oven (350f) one hour.
A sharper cheese may be used if desired.

title: Corn Bread Muffins
directions: Sift all dry ingredients together.
Beat egg well and add to milk.
Mix with dry ingredients and pour into well-greased and very hot muffin tins, and bake in hot oven (500f).
other_info:
Author: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69
Contributor: Person.Jewel Nickels

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, egg beater, muffin pan, oven

title: Bread and Cheese Puff
directions: Set oven for moderate, 350f.
Place 4 slices bread on bottom of shallow baking dish, cutting to fit.
Cover bread with half the cheese; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Repeat.
Combine remaining ingredients; pour over bread and cheese.
Bake 40 minutes or until top is golden brown, puffed, and shiny.

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, egg beater, baking pan

title: Glazed Baked Apples
directions: Set oven for 350f.
Wash and core apples; pare 1/3 the way down from stem.
Place in a baking dish.
Combine next 4 ingredients.
Fill centers of apples.
Top each with 1/2 teaspoon butter.
Combine water and the 1/2 cup sugar; pour over apples.
Bake, covered, for 45 to 60 minutes or until tender, basting once or twice with syrup in bottom of pan.
Remove from oven.
Melt jelly over low heat: stir with a fork.
Spoon over apples.
Place in broiler 3 inches from heat: broil 3 or 4 minutes or until glazed.
Serve warm or cold with cream.

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, knife, baking pan

title: Divinity Fudge
directions: Cook sugar, water and corn syrup together until the candy just crystallizes when tried in cold water.
Pour slowly on the well-beaten egg whites, beating constantly.
Add the nut meats and pour into buttered dish or pan.

Equipment: measuring cups, egg beater, stove

title: Liver and Bacon Sandwich
directions: Have liver sliced very thin.
Brown with bacon until crisp and done.
Mince both liver and bacon together.
Add enough cream to make a paste that is easy to spread on slices of bread.
Hard cooked eggs and capers may be chopped and added if desired.

title: SpÃ¤tzle (German Noodles)

ingredients.name: butter, melted or 1/4 cup sour cream - warmed, for serving

directions: Mix together well.
Let stand 1/2 hour.
Scoop up generous amount of dough with wooden spoon.
Cut off small pieces of dough and drop into large kettle of boiling salted water.
Spatzle rise to surface when done.
Drain well.
Transfer to deep serving dish.
Pour melted butter or warmed sour cream over spatzle.
(May be served plain with goulash or stew).

Category: Side, Grain
