Ingredient: flour, egg, water, salt, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stewpot, stove, egg beater

title: Frozen Pudding
directions: Cut the cherries and pineapple in small pieces and soak several hours in the sherry; scald the milk in a double-boiler, or over hot water, stir together the sugar and flour, add the eggs and beat until light and creamy; then add to scalded milk and cook until the foam disappears and custard is creamy.
Let this cool before adding cream; then freeze and when nearly frozen add fruit and wine.
This should stand several hours to ripen.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Denver Gas and Electric Co, Person.Katherine Newsbury, Person.Helen Parker Headden

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, double boiler, egg beater, stove

title: Salmon Salad with Jellied Vegetables

ingredients.name: cooked mixed diced vegetables, (string beans, carrots, peas or celery)

directions: Cooked vegetables may be combined for this salad.
Soak the gelatin in cold water a few minutes, add the meat stock or water and stir until the gelatin is thoroughly dissolved.
If it is not completely dissolved, heat over a pan of hot water.
Add the vegetables in such proportions as desired or convenient.
Add the salt, lemon juice and pimento ; turn the mixture into a moistened mould.
(A ring mould is attractive.
) Allow to stand for one hour or more in a cold place.
When ready to serve, remove from mould to a chilled plate.
If a ringed mould is used, the center may be filled with flaked salmon over which salad dressing has been poured.
If the vegetable part is used as a salad, salad dressing may be placed around the vegetables.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Salad, Seafood

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, refrigerator

title: Fig Sandwiches
directions: Cut brown bread in thin slices and spread with the following mixture: boil together rest of ingredients.
Simmer till soft; add teaspoonful vanilla ; beat to a smooth paste and spread on bread.
Alternate slices of brown and white bread, buttered and pressed closely together and cut transversely, make attractive sandwiches.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Sandwich

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: brown bread, water, lemon, raisin, brown sugar, fig

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, knife, pot

title: Arnabeet B'bashamel (Cauliflower Casserole)
directions: Bring 3 cups of water to a boil in a saucepan, add cumin and cauliflower, and boil for 2 minutes, until cauliflower is tender.
Drain and set aside.
Saute ground meat, onion, salt, pepper and allspice until meat is browned.
Add tomato sauce, and cook over lowered heat for 10 minutes.
Set aside.
To prepare cream sauce, melt butter in medium-sized saucepan, add flour and stir until the flour is light brown.
Reduce heat, slowly add milk, then salt and pepper and cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce is thick and smooth.
Set aside to cool for 5 minutes, then add sauce, a little at a time and stirring constantly, to the egg.
Place half the cauliflower in a greased 9" x 9" pan, cover with the meat sauce, then the rest of the cauliflower and pour the cream sauce over the top.
Bake at 350f for 30 minutes.
other_info:

Source: Festival of American Folklife: Egyptian Recipes (1976-01-01)

title: Quick Scallop Chowder

ingredients.name: sea scallops, fresh or frozen, cut

directions: Defrost sea scallops, if frozen.
Cook sea scallops 5 minutes in boiling salted water to cover; drain.
Cut in halves or quarters.
Add to vichysoisse; heat to serving temperature but do not allow to boil.
Garnish with cut chives.

title: Savoury Rolls
directions: Roll the pastry thinly and cut into small oblongs.
Place a sausage, sardine or anchovy fillet on each strip, brush one edge with cold water, and fold over.
Flake the joined edge with a knife, and make two small cuts across the top.
Brush with egg and bake in a hot oven for 10-15 minutes.

title: Banana Bread
directions: Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs.
Add sifted dry ingredients alternately with milk and bananas.
Add nut meats.
Bake in buttered loaf pan, at 350 for 45-55 minutes.

directions: Pare and core the pears.
Dice or cut into thin slices.
Add water and cook until tender.
Add the sugar, ginger, the lemon juice and grated rind.
Simmer mixture until thick and pears are transparent.
Pour into sterilized jars and seal.

title: Potato Surprise
directions: Choose a large potato, parboil it without peeling, cut a small piece off the end and scoop out the inside.
Mince the meat fine, flavour with pepper and salt, mix with a little gravy and fill the potato.
Cork up the end with the piece cut off and bake about 20 minutes.

title: Maple Cake and Frosting
directions: Put maple syrup into a marbleized dish and boil until, when dropped from a spoon it treads,water it can be formed into a soft ball.

Have ready the stiffly beaten whites of eggs; pour the boiling syrup slowly into the eggs, beating all the time with a silver fork until, when right thickness to spread, put them between layers of cake and on top.

Add mayonnaise and cold water.
Blend until smooth, bake in two layers in moderate oven (350f) 15 or 20 minutes.

title: Cucumber Salad
directions: Pare and thinly slice cucumber and onion sprinkle with a teaspoon of salt and let stand for a few minutes.
Pat with towel or absorbent paper to take out all moisture possible.
Place cucumbers and onions in serving dish, add the vinegar and mix.
Pour on enough sour cream to half cover and dust with pepper.
Chill.

title: Boiled Potatoes II
directions: Potatoes should be well brushed, dropped into a basin of cold salt and water, and when a saucepan of water boils they should be placed in it.
When a fork will pierce them easily, they are done.
The water must then be strained off, the saucepan drawn to the side of the fire, a clean cloth folded over the top of the saucepan, and the lid pressed down on to it.
This dries the potatoes, and makes them a good colour.
They should be held in a cloth and peeled, then re-heated for a minute.
New potatoes, if well brushed or scraped, do not require peeling.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen

title: Devils on Horseback
directions: Stone the prunes and place an almond and some chutney in each.
Spread out the bacon rashers and cut in halves, spread a little mustard on each and roll a prune tightly in it, place on a skewer and grill.
Place the "devils" on toast oblongs, and serve hot.

Cut up fine.
Bake about 3 hours,.

ingredients.name: quart Medium White Sauce, made with bacon fat

directions: Have the bacon sliced quite thin.
Panbroil until crisp.
Prepare white sauce with bacon fat instead of butter.
Chop the hot, crisp bacon and add to the sauce when ready to serve, since the bacon softens on standing.
Serve on toast, bread, hot biscuits or corn bread.

One and one-half cups sugar may be added if desired.

directions: Crush fine and put 1/2 of wafers in bottom of buttered cake tin.
Cream: butter, powdered sugar.
Add and blend: egg yolks.
Fold in: egg whites beaten very stiff.
Put on top of crumb mixture.
Whip: cream.
Add: pineapple, marshmallow bits, nuts.
Add to the above mixture.
Sprinkle remaining crumbs on top and refrigerate at least 24 hours.

directions: Pare potatoes and cook until tender in boiling water to which salt has been added, about 40 minutes.
Drain and force through a potato ricer, or mash.
Save potato water.
Add butter, milk and potato water, and more salt if needed.
Beat until white and fluffy.
More milk may be needed.
Pile lightly on a hot dish.
Amount of butter may be reduced or omitted if more evaporated milk and less water is used.

title: Apple Butter II
directions: Boil the cider until reduced to 1 quart.
Pare the apples and slice thin.
Put the apples into the cider and cook very slowly, stirring frequently, until it begins to thicken.
Add sugar, syrup and cinnamon and continue to cook until thick enough to spread when cool.
Seal in sterilized jars.
Makes 5 to 6 pints.

title: Beef, Tomato and Cabbage Scallop

ingredients.name: ground beef, or other lean meat
cup fresh or canned (No. 2 can) tomatoes

directions: Brown the meat in fat.
Add onion and celery; cook 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes, salt, and pepper : bring to boiling.
Place alternating layers of cabbage and meat mixture in a baking dish.
Top with bread crumbs.
Bake in a moderately hot oven (375f) 40 to 45 minutes.

Mix together and stir in the molasses.
A dash of nutmeg may be sprinkled on each serving if desired.

title: Angel Cake

ingredients.name: salt, added to eggs before whipping

directions: Flavor to taste.
Sift flour before measuring, then sift five times.
Sift sugar, whip eggs to a foam and add cream tartar.
When eggs are well beaten, add sugar, then flavoring and lastly the flour.
Bake in pans which have never been greased, but floured.
Oven must be moderate.
Requires 20 to 40 minutes to bake, according to temperature of oven.

Ingredient: egg white, sugar, flour, cream of tartar, salt

Equipment: oven, egg beater, measuring spoons, measuring cups, baking pan

title: Boubons

ingredients.name: cooked meat, ground fine (one or more kinds may be used)
green pepper, or pimento chopped fine

directions: Beat the egg, add milk, seasonings, melted butter, bread- crumbs and meat.
Mix thoroughly.
Fill buttered cups three- fourths full of mixture.
Place in a pan of boiling water, and bake in a moderate oven fifteen minutes.
The mixture is done allow them to as soon as it resists pressure in the center.
Remain in the pans a few minutes, then remove carefully upon a serving plate.
They may be made in a large mould or individual ones.
Serve with the tomato sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater, stove

title: Canned Cherries
directions: Measure the cherries after the stems have been removed.
Stone if desired.
If they are stoned, be sure to save the juice.
Put the sugar and water in a kettle and stir over the fire until the sugar is dissolved.
Add the cherries and heat slowly to the boiling point.
Boil ten minutes skimming carefully.
Put into sterilized jars, filling the jars to overflowing with the syrup.
Seal securely.
(When filling the jars stand them in a pan containing boiling water.
This keeps them from breaking) .
other_info:

title: Veal Supreme
directions: Brown veal in hot lard with garlic.
Remove garlic clove.
Add water, cover and simmer until tender, 30 to 45 minutes.
Cook noodles in boiling salted water for 20 minutes.
Drain.
Blanch the almonds, slice lengthwise into thin strips.
Brown in butter and add to the noodles.
Mix thoroughly and arrange in a ring on a large platter.
Fill the center with the cooked veal mixture, pour liquid from the veal over the noodles and sprinkle with poppy seeds.

directions: Halve each avocado pear and remove the stone.
Carefully cut the flesh away from the skins, dice it and mix with chopped celery heart, a squeeze of lemon juice and a little mayonnaise.
Return this mixture to the pear skins, and chill before serving.

title: Manhattan Cocktail

Cream the cheese with a little milk to a piping consistency.
Pipe with a large star nozzle on to the biscuits, and stick 5 slices of radish into each star.

directions: Cook chicken and pick in small pieces.
Mix all ingredients together.
Bake in pan of water for 2 1/2 hours.

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, knife, egg, pan, oven, stove

title: Pickled Onions
directions: Peel the onions.
And when some water with plenty of salt in it is boiling pour it over them, and let them remain in it for 24 hours keep them close covered till all the steam has evaporated.
After 24 hours wipe them dry.
Boil the vinegar, pepper, and ginger together, and pour this over the onions.
Cover tightly, and keep them several weeks before using.

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, peeler, pot, stove

title: Macaroni and Cheese
directions: Boil macaroni until just tender in a large amount of boiling water to which 3 tablespoons salt have been added.
Drain and rinse.
Scald milk over boiling water.
Add cheese, that has been cut into small pieces, mustard and cayenne and continue cooking over boiling water until cheese is just melted.
Combine macaroni and cheese sauce.
Turn into buttered baking pans, cover with crumbs that have been thoroughly mixed with the melted butter.
Sprinkle with paprika.
Bake in a moderate oven (350f) until crumbs are brown, about 25 minutes.
other_info:

title: String Beans
directions: Pare thinly on both sides to remove strings, cut off ends, and cut in inch pieces.
Cook 1 to 2 hours.
Season as required.

Ingredient: string bean, water, butter, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Pickled Cherries
directions: Select firm cherries.
White oxhearts are best.
Remove all specks.
Pack the cherries in wide-mouthed bottles, or jars.
Cover them with vinegar.
Pour vinegar off.
To each pint of vinegar use from 3/4 to 1 pound of granulated sugar.
(Quantity of sugar to be determined by strength of vinegar.
) Boil vinegar and sugar together from ten to fifteen minutes.
Pour over cherries while hot.
Into each jar, three or four cloves may be put.
Let them stand uncovered till the next day.
If any vinegar is left over the jars may be filled as the shrinkage takes place.
other_info:
Author: Person.E Allie Blakeley
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cherry, vinegar, sugar, clove

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Oatmeal Wafers or Crisps
directions: Drop by teaspoonfuls on a buttered sheet.
Sift all flour out of oatmeal.
other_info:
Author: Person.M B Campbell
Contributor: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, egg, oatmeal, baking powder, salt

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Hop Yeast
directions: Boil together.
When lukewarm, add a cupful of yeast and let it rise.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: hop, water, potato, sugar, salt

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, pot

title: Hot Fudge Sauce
directions: Combine evaporated milk and chocolate pieces in top of double boiler.
Cook over hot water until chocolate is melted.
Serve hot.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Dessert, Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: evaporated milk, chocolate

Equipment: double boiler, measuring cups

title: Mrs R's Cold Catsup
directions: Stir all together.
Keep in perfectly air-tight jars.
other_info:
Author: Person.Clemmie W McCloud
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, salt, mustard seed, nasturtium, onion, black pepper, red pepper, celery, clove, mace, cinnamon, sugar, vinegar

Equipment: knife, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Orange Queens
directions: Sift the flour, measure and sift again with the baking powder and salt.
Cream the lard with the sugar and the grated orange and lemon rind.
Add the egg yolks and beat well.
Alternately add the flour mixture with the orange and lemon juice.
Fold in the stiffly beaten egg whites.
Bake in muffin pans in a moderately hot oven (375f) for 20-25 minutes.
Ice with yellow topping.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69
Contributor: Organization.Mary Cullen's department, Household arts service of The journal


Source: Food Fashion Revue Cooking School Second Session (1938-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, baking powder, salt, lard, sugar, egg, orange juice, lemon juice, orange rind, lemon rind

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, egg beater, oven, muffin pan

title: Crumb Cake
directions: Combine the dry ingredients.
Work in melted butter until crumbs are formed.
Add nuts.
Sprinkle over top of coffee coke dough and bake.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, flour, cinnamon, butter, nut

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Fruit Punch
directions: Use juice of fruit only.
A good combination is made by using 1 lemon, 1 orange, and 1/2 cup grape juice or 1 cup strong tea.
Boil sugar and water, then add the fruit juice.
It is better to chill the punch than to add ice to it.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Beverage

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: fruit, sugar, water

Equipment: knife, stove, pot

title: Bread-Crumb Bread
directions: Soften the yeast in 1/4 cup of water.
Soak the bread crumbs in the rest of the water.
When crumbs are soft, mash thoroughly, add salt, molasses, yeast, and flour enough to make a stiff dough.
Proceed like ordinary bread.
other_info:
Author: Person.Edith Church, Person.Bertina A Leete


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, salt, molass, bread crumb, yeast cake, flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, bowl

title: Rye Griddle Cakes
directions: Sift dry ingredients together.
Add milk.
Add well beaten eggs.
Beat thoroughly and cook immediately on a hot greased griddle.
other_info:
Author: Person.Tim McCoy
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: rye flour, egg, wheat flour, salt, baking powder, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, sifter, stove, griddle

title: Steamed Fruit Pudding
directions: Combine and mix all the ingredients with flour enough to make a stiff batter; then add the soda dissolved in boiling water.
Put into a well greased mould, cover tightly and steam for 3 hours.
Serve with a sauce made from sugar, vanilla and egg.
Beat all together until creamy and pour over the pudding when serving.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, raisin, cinnamon, suet, molass, nutmeg, milk, allspice, salt, clove, soda, flour, brown sugar, vanilla, egg

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater

title: Apple Pandowdy
directions: Pare and slice apples and arrange in a well greased shallow baking dish.
Sprinkle with cinnamon, drizzle over molasses and dot with butter.
Cover with biscuit dough which has been rolled to about 1/2-inch thickness.
Cut gashes in dough to allow steam to escape.
Bake in moderate oven about 375 degrees for 30 minutes.
Serve hot, cutting out squares of the biscuit to use as a base for the fruit mixture.
Serve with cream flavored with nutmeg.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, cinnamon, molass, biscuit, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, rolling pin

title: Fried Chicken
directions: Cut the legs from the body, break the joint at the thigh and cut in two.
Cut off the neck and wings.
Break the breastbone and cut in two lengthwise.
Break the back in two pieces lengthwise, if desired.
Plunge the pieces into cold water and allow to drain.
Sprinkle each piece with salt and paprika, and roll in flour place the fat in a frying-pan.
When very hot add the chicken.
Allow all the pieces to brown thoroughly; cover the pan with a lid and add the water, lower the fire and cook over a moderate fire for thirty minutes.
Turn frequently to prevent scorching.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: paprika, chicken, flour, fat, salt, water

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife, rolling pin, strainer, stove

title: Stuffed Tomato Salad
directions: Wash tomatoes and remove stem ends.
Scoop out center, leaving a shell about 1/4 inch thick.
Turn upside down on plate to drain (use juice in soups or sauces).
Dice tomato pulp and combine with other ingredients.
Stuff tomatoes.
Serve on lettuce or other salad greens.

Meat stuffing variation: combine 1 cup diced, cooked meat or poultry; 1 cup diced, cooked potatoes; 1 tablespoon chopped parsley; 1 tablespoon minced onion; 2 tablespoons green pepper; 1 teaspoon salt; a little pepper; and 2 tablespoons mayonnaise or cooked salad dressing.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Department of Agriculture


Source: Tomatoes On Your Table (1944-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, egg, celery, cooked salad dressing, cucumber, onion, salt, green pepper, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, spoon

title: Maraschino Devil's Food Cake
directions: All ingredients mixed in same bowl.
Mixing time three minutes.
Sift together in large bowl flour, soda, and sugar.
Add snowdrift, buttermilk and cherry juice.
Mix enough to dampen flow; beat 2 minutes-if by hand, count beating time only; with electric mixer use low speed, beating 2 minutes.
Add eggs and chocolate.
Beat 1 minute for snowdrift, smooth batter, then fold in 1/2 cup chopped cherries dusted with flour.
Bake in two greased a-inch layer pans lined with paper at 325f about 35 minutes.
Frost with fondant icing.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cake flour, soda, sugar, snowdrift, buttermilk, cherry juice, egg, chocolate

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, egg beater, oven, baking pan

title: Dill Sauce
directions: Whisk cream, flour, salt and sugar.
Bring to boil, then simmer for 15 min.
Whilst simmering, grab some of the sauce and put in the fridge to cool down.
Mix yolks with some of the above sauce which has cooled down (to avoid the yolk cooking).
Once mixed, add it back into the simmering sauce and mix well.
Put vinegar into a saucepan and boil it.
When boiling add the dill and simmer.
Melt butter and add it to the dill.
Mix this butter/dill sauce with the main sauce and simmer.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Oracle Ace, Person.Marcelle Kratochvil


Source: ACE Cookbook (2013-02-23)


Category: Sauce

Measure: Metric

Ingredient: egg yolk, cream, flour, sugar, dill, salt, butter, vinegar

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, saucepan, pot

title: Frosting
directions: Melt butter, add sugar, cocoa, milk.
Cook 1 1/2 minutes after it comes to a rolling boil.
Add vanilla, and beat until it starts to thicken.
Start pouring between layers before it is ready to put on top as it hardens quickly.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, sugar, cocoa, milk, vanilla

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove

title: Savoury Whirls
directions: Roll out shortcrust pastry thinly into an oblong and spread with yeast or meat extract, leaving the edges free.
Brush the edges with water and roll up like a swiss roll, then cut off thin slices.
Place on a greased baking sheet and bake in a hot oven for 10-15 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: pastry, yeast, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, baking sheet

title: Praskovy Knedliky (Baking Powder Dumplings)
directions: Sfit flour, baking powder, salt together.
Add beaten egg and milk.
Add butter to batter.
Form into balls, about the size of a large egg.
Drop into slightly salted boiling water.
Boil about 5 to 8 minutes or until cooked through.
Test by taking 1 out and open to see if done.
If you wish to fill the dumplings, use the following procedure.
Wash italian prunes and partially slice each open and remove pit.
Mix together sugar with cinnamon and 1 teaspoon flour.
Put 1 level teaspoon of this mixture into each plum and close.
Put prepared plum into the center of each patty and wrap dough well around plum and seal.
Boil water with 1 tablespoon salt in large kettle.
Drop dumplings into fast boiling water and boil 12 to 15 minutes.
Drain.
When dumplings have been drained and dried slightly, pour melted butter over them.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, baking powder, salt, butter, egg, milk, water, prune, sugar, cinnamon

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, egg beater, bowl, stove, pot

title: Glazed Apples
directions: Boil the sugar and water six minutes in a deep saucepan.
Do not stir.
Pare and core the apples.
Place them in the syrup as soon as pared, to prevent them from discoloring.
Cook until apples are tender.
Remove the apples from the syrup and boil the sugar and water longer if it is not thick enough.
Add the butter to the syrup and pour in and around the apples.
Serve hot or cold.
Granulated sugar may be used, but "c" sugar gives a better flavor.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, water, sugar, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Pea Soup

ingredients.name: common stock, or liquor in which a joint of meat has been boiled

directions: Put the peas to soak overnight in soft water and float off such as rise to the top.
Boil them until tender enough to pulp ; then add the above ingredients and simmer for two hours, stirring occasionally.
Press the whole through a sieve, skim well and serve with toasted bread.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.W Drysdale & Co


Source: Cookery for the Million (1877-01-01)


Category: Soup, Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: split pea, beef, meat, bacon, carrot, turnip, onion, celery, seasoning, water, stock

Equipment: measuring cups, knife, pot, stove, sieve

title: Mock Mince Pie

ingredients.name: apples, pared, cored and chopped fine

directions: Mix the ingredients thoroughly, and if the mixture should not be moist enough, add cider (or water) to moisten it.
Line two deep pie plates with good plain paste, fill them with the mixture, and put on an upper crust; then bake the pies thirty minutes in a quick oven.
other_info:
Author: Person.Kate Kereven
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: raisin, currant, citron, brown sugar, molass, cider, apple, lemon, cracker, vinegar, cinnamon, allspice, clove, mace

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pie pan, oven

title: Apple Cheese Cole Slaw
directions: Peel and cube apples; combine with cabbage.
Cut cheese in long narrow strips; add with salad dressing, salt, and cayenne to apple and cabbage mixture.
Serve in salad bowl; garnish with sliced stuffed olives.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, cabbage, swiss cheese, cooked salad dressing, salt, pepper, olive

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, knife, bowl

title: Scalloped Chicken
directions: Cut raw potatoes in dice and parboil 10 minutes in salted water.
Same quantity cold chicken, diced.
Make sauce of chicken-broth, thickened with cornstarch, wet in hot water.
If not sufficient broth, use milk.
To 1 pint of liquor, use 1 egg, beaten.
Season to taste, celery and onion salt.
Put a layer of chicken, then potatoes, then sauce, etc.
Cover with cracker crumbs moistened in melted butter.
Bake one-half hour.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mabel
Contributor: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Main Dish, Meat

Measure: Metric

Ingredient: chicken, potato, chicken broth, cornstarch, milk, celery salt, egg, onion salt, cracker crumb

Equipment: oven, pot, baking pan

title: Green Corn
directions: Vegetables should be thoroughly washed and cooked till tender in freshly boiling, salted water (1/2 tablespoon salt to 1 quart water).
Remove husks and silk as soon as corn comes from market.
Wash before cooking.
Requires 20 to 30 minutes to cook and is done when no juice appears if corn is pricked with a fork.
2 teaspoon sugar may be added to water while cooking.
Serve wrapped in a napkin.
other_info:
Author: Person.Margaret W Howard


Source: Practical Cookbook (1917-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn, water, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Currant Soy
directions: Put all in a preserving kettle over a moderate fire; cook three hours from the time the fruit begins to boil.
Stir frequently to prevent burning.
Keep in glass jars.
Excellent with meat.
other_info:
Author: Person.Clara R Phillips
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: currant, brown sugar, cider vinegar, black pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, jar

title: Big Walnut 12 Cake Part 1
directions: Dissolve yeast onto lukewarm milk in small bowl, then add sugar and combine.
Cover and let rise in warm place for about 10 minutes.
In big bowl scald milk and add butter.
Cool to lukewarm.
In small bow beat egg yolks and then add sugar, salt and vanilla.
Mix all the ingredients.
In large bowl, sift 3 cups flour.
Pour mixtures of prepared yeast, milk, butter, eggs and sugar into mixing bowl with 3 cups of flour.
Beat with electric mixer until smooth and elastic.
Keep adding remaining flour and mixing with a wood-en spoon.
Place on floured board and knead for about 15 minutes, adding flour as needed, to make non-sticking dough.
Place dough in a lightly bowl and turn to grease top.
Cover with a clean towel and let rise in warm place for about 2 hours until double in bulk.
When dough has doubled, punch it down, again let rise till doubled (45 minutes).
Meanwhile grease a round angel food cake pan.
See part 2 for filling and baking.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Oracle Ace, Person.Matjz & Eva


Source: ACE Cookbook (2013-02-23)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: yeast, milk, sugar, butter, egg yolk, salt, vanilla, flour

Equipment: mixer, oven, food processor, measuring spoons, measuring cups, bowl, egg beater, cake pan

title: Strawberry Preserves
directions: Pick over, wash and hull the berries.
Make a syrup by boiling the sugar and water fifteen minutes.
Fill sterilized jars with the berries.
Cover with syrup and let stand fifteen minutes to settle.
Add more berries.
Adjust rubbers and covers.
Place on a folded cloth in a kettle of cold water.
Heat water to boiling point and cook slowly one hour.
Screw on covers securely.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: strawberry, sugar, water

Equipment: measuring cups, stove

title: Fruit and Nut Cookies
directions: Cream shortening and sugar, add the eggs and beat until light and fluffy.
Sift flour add salt and cinnamon and sift again.
Dissolve the soda in the hot water and add to the creamed mixture.
Add half of the sifted dry ingredients mixing well.
Fold in the chopped fruit and nuts and the remaining flour mixture.
Stir until thoroughly blended.
Drop teaspoonfuls on greased cookie sheets, about 2 inches apart and bake in moderate oven (350-f) for 15 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: shortening, soda, sugar, water, egg, raisin, currant, flour, nut, salt, cinnamon

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, baking sheet

title: Dutch Country Bean Soup
directions: Soak beans in water overnight.
Drain, add fresh water and cook slowly with the ham bone for 2 hours.
Put in the onion, celery, potatoes, tomato sauce, parsley and the salt and pepper and simmer until vegetables are soft.
Remove the ham bone, trim off any meat, cut it up and add to soup.
Many pennsylvania dutch cooks cut up hard boiled eggs and add them to the soup.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: bean, tomato sauce, ham, potato, parsley, onion, salt, pepper, celery

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Tuna Crunch Salad
directions: Combine first 5 ingredients.
Chill.
Add cabbage and toss.
Add potato chips just before serving, toss.
Heap in lettuce-lined bowl.
Garnish with eggs and tomato wedges.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs J H Wood
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co


Source: Savory Seafoods of Oregon (1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood, Salad

Ingredient: tuna, pickle, onion, mayonnaise, lemon juice, cabbage, potato chip, egg, tomato, 

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: Corn-Meal and Wheat Bread

ingredients.name: cup milk or water, or mixture of two
yeast cake, , or 1/2 cup less of the liquid and 1/2 cup liquid yeast

directions: Pour 1 1/4 cup of the water over the meal, salt, sugar, and shortening, if used; heat the mixture gradually to the boiling point or nearly to it; cook twenty minutes.
This can be done best in a double boiler; the water is sufficient only to soften the meal a little.
Allow the meal to cool to about room temperature, add the flour, and the yeast mixed with the rest of the water, or the 1/2 cup of liquid yeast.
Knead thoroughly, let rise until double its bulk, make into a loaf, let rise in pan, bake 45 to 50 minutes.
Note: when corn is added, less time is needed for the rising.
other_info:
Author: Person.Edith Church, Person.Bertina A Leete


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: water, yeast cake, salt, sugar, corn meal, wheat flour

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, double boiler, stove, baking pan, oven

title: Mixed Fruit Preserves
directions: Wash and seed cherries.
Drop the apricots into boiling water for a few seconds, remove skins and seeds.
Cut into quarters.
Wash the berries.
Mix the fruit and sugar together and cook quickly, until fruits are clear and tender.
Seal in hot jars.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Sauce

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: cherry, raspberry, apricot, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, knife, stove, pot

title: Soup Bag
directions: Tie in a tiny round of cheese-cloth and hang over the side of the soup kettle.
other_info:
Author: Person.Isabel Harris Metcalf


Source: Just A Few Tried and True Receipts (1916-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: clove, peppercorn, mustard seed, parsley, basil, summer savory, celery seed

Equipment: measuring spoons

title: Whole-Wheat Griddlecakes (2)

ingredients.name: cup water, or milk if available

directions: Mix the dry ingredients.
Combine the beaten egg, liquid, and melted fat.
Add gradually to the dry ingredients, stirring only until the batter is smooth.
Add more liquid if a thinner griddlecake is desired.
Bake the cakes on a hot griddle.
other_info:
Author: Organization.United States Bureau of Home Nutrition and Home Economics


Source: Whole-wheat (Graham) Flour Recipes (1940-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: whole wheat flour, white flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, egg, water, fat

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, bowl, griddle

title: Rattle Cocktail
directions: Shake well, and strain into glasses.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, vermouth, whisky, Kummel

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, shaker, strainer

title: Individual Corn Puddings
directions: Set oven for slow 325f.
Combine all ingredients; mix well.
Divide among 4 to 6 baking cups.
Set in pan of warm water.
Bake 45 minutes, or until firm in center.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: corn, egg, sugar, butter, salt

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, baking pan

title: Kartoffel Kloese (Potato Dumplings)
directions: Boil potatoes, peel and grate.
Add to this the three eggs slightly beaten.
Stir in flour and salt.
Mix thoroughly.
Mold into small balls.
Boil 15 minutes in left-over meat or chicken gravy or in water, keeping cover on kettle.
other_info:
Author: Person.Emil Jannings
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, flour, egg, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, grater, egg beater, stove

title: Koprova (Dill Cream Soup)
directions: Boil: potatoes, water, salt.
When the potatoes are almost done, add sour cream (can be thinned with some milk) mixed with flour.
When the soup comes to a boil add dill.
Raw eggs may be dropped into the soup after it is thickened and cooked over a slow fire, or it may be served with hard boiled eggs.
For added zest, vinegar may be mixed into the soup,.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: potato, water, salt, sour cream, flour, dill, egg, vinegar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Jerusalem Artichokes II
directions: Peel and wash them, place in cold water with a little salt and lemon-juice, and cook till soft.
They can be served either with gravy or butter sauce.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: artichoke, water, salt, lemon juice

Equipment: stove, pot, peeler

title: Tomato Jelly
directions: Simmer tomatoes, water, sugar, bay leaf, cloves, and salt for ten minutes.
Strain.
Soak the gelatin in two tablespoons cold water, and add the hot vegetable mixture.
Pour into small wet moulds.
Chill for two hours and serve with salad dressing.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tomato, bay leaf, water, clove, salt, sugar, gelatine

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: White Sauce for Peas
directions: Melt the butter, add the flour and salt, mixing well, and the milk, stirring constantly.
Cook two minutes.
Add the peas.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Side, Sauce

Ingredient: butter, flour, salt, milk

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove

title: Banana Trifle

ingredients.name: cream, or whipped white of one egg

directions: Slice bananas and lay them in glass dish in alternate layers with four ladyfingers split in two.
Put the milk and water in a saucepan; add the sugar, salt and the cornstarch diluted in a little cold water.

When it has thickened pour it over the bananas, and let it stand until cold and ready to serve, then cover the top with whipped cream, or if that is not convenient use the whipped white of one egg sweetened with one tablespoonful of sugar.
Split and break in two the remaining ladyfingers, and place them upright around the edge.
other_info:
Author: Person.Pola Negri
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: milk, salt, water, banana, cornstarch, ladyfinger, sugar, cream

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, egg beater

title: Grapes and Cheese
directions: Wash green grapes, and split, without cutting into halves.
Remove the pips, and if desired skin them.
Place a little cream cheese in each, and secure with a cocktail stick.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: green, grape, cream cheese

Equipment: knife

title: Creamed Oysters
directions: Take fifty large oysters.
Stew in their own liquor until the edges curl.
Skim out the oysters and put where they will keep warm but not cook.
Add to liquor 1/2 pint of cream, 1/2 pint of milk, 3/4 cup of butter, salt and pepper to taste.
Thicken with 1 dessertspoonful of flour and 2 of cornstarch.
Let it boil up and pour over the oysters.
other_info:
Author: Person.Ellen L Kenney
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Seafood

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: oyster, cream, milk, butter, salt, pepper, flour, cornstarch

Equipment: pot, measuring spoons, measuring cups

title: Sour Cream Raisin Pie
directions: Combine all ingredients and turn into uncooked pie shell.
Bake in hot, 450 degree oven 15 minutes, and then reduce to 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, sour cream, cinnamon, egg, nutmeg, raisin, salt, pie shell

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven

title: Frankfurter Kebabs
directions: Thread some small frankfurters and bacon rolls on skewers and grill.
Add some 1/2-inch cubes of cheese, and serve at once.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: sausage, bacon, cheese

Equipment: grill

title: Beef Steak Pudding
directions: Put on a large saucepan of water to boil.
Mix on a plate 2/3 tablespoon of flour, some pepper and salt.
Beat the steak well, cut it into slices, dip each piece in the mixture, and roll it up.
Put the flour, baking-powder, salt, and suet chopped fine, into a basin, and mix to a stiff paste with cold water.
Cut off one-third for the top.
Grease a basin well, line it with the paste, put in the meat with a little water or gravy, wet the edges, press the top on.
Tie a pudding cloth, dipped in boiling water and dredged with flour, over the basin, place it in the saucepan of boiling water, and boil hours.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Meat

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef, suet, flour, water, baking powder, salt, pepper

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, saucepan, stove, knife, pot

title: Vegetable Soup III
directions: Into 2 qts.
Of water put soup bone and beef and boil for 2 hours.
For a hearty, substantial soup, cut up the meat in small pieces and return to the broth.
Add tomatoes, onions and celery.
Also add other available vegetables, such as diced potatoes, carrots, turnip, string beans, corn, peas, cabbage or chopped peppers.
Boil until all vegetables are tender.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: soup bone, celery, beef, tomato, water, salt, black pepper, onion

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Blueberry Delight
directions: Make crust of: graham crackers, butter, sugar.
Mix: eggs, sugar, cream cheese.
Spread the mixture over the top of the crust and bake at 325f for 20 minutes.
Whip cream, fold in blueberries, and lemon juice.
Spread filling over cooled pie crust.
Chill.
Serve.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club

Ingredient: graham cracker, butter, powdered sugar, egg, cream cheese, whipped cream, blueberry, lemon juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, oven, refrigerator

title: The Pie Crust
directions: Sift dry ingredients together—rub in shortening very lightly with fingertips; add water slowly, just enough to make stiff dough; roll out very thin on floured board and line pan, being very careful to make pastry come well over edge of pan.
other_info:

Ingredient: flour, shortening, salt, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, rolling pin, sifter

title: Cheese Noodle Casserole

ingredients.name: canned ripe olives, cut in pieces

directions: Cook and drain noodles.
Brown onions and meat in the fat.
Season with salt and pepper.
Mix all of the ingredients and place in greased casserole.
Bake 1 hour at 375f.
During last 15 minutes add chopped nuts and chow mein noodles to the top and brown.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, pot, stove, oven, knife

title: Cole Slaw II
directions: Add salt and sugar to cabbage.
Let stand an hour in a cold place, then drain well.
Combine lemon juice or vinegar with milk, pour on cabbage and toss together with two forks until thoroughly blended.
Keep cold until ready to serve.
Shredded lettuce may be used in place of cabbage.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: salt, sugar, cabbage, lemon juice

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, bowl, refrigerator

title: Huckleberry Cake
directions: Rub the butter and sugar into a cream.
Add next beaten egg, then stir in milk.
Gradually add flour, having baking powder thoroughly mixed in the last half cup of flour.
Beat all together thoroughly, and last stir in lightly the huckleberries, cleaned and dry.
Bake in a cake pan in good oven.

It is better to put the pan on the bottom of the oven first so that the cake will rise to its required height, then change to a higher shelf so that it may get done on the top, otherwise the top gets hard before the baking powder has done its work.
Serve hot.
Eat with butter.
other_info:
Author: Person.Warner Baxter
Contributor: Organization.Photoplay Magazine, Person.Carolyn van Wyck


Source: Photoplay's Cook Book (1927-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: butter, egg, flour, milk, sugar, baking powder, huckleberry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven, egg beater

title: Rivel (Crumb) Pie
directions: Mix or “crumb” the above ingredients together with the hands to form small lumps or rivels.
Stew the rivels into a prepared pastry shell and bake in a hot oven (400f) for 30 minutes.
Some spread 2 tablespoons.
Of molasses over it before baking.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, flour, shortening, pastry, molass

Equipment: measuring cups, oven

title: Armenian
directions: Marinate fish fillets in french dressing to cover for 1 hour.
Saute eggplant slices in oil.
Remove slices, and add parsley, onions, and seasonings, and saute.
Oil a 2 quart casserole, and alternate layers of sauteed seasonings, egg plant and fish fillets.
Top with tomato sauce that has been mixed with 1 can water and mushrooms.
Bake in hot oven, 450 degrees for 20 minutes.
Serve with garlic bread.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs C M Love
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co

(1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood

Ingredient: fillet, oil, green onion, French dressing, eggplant, pepper, parsley, salt, mushroom, herb, tomato sauce

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, baking dish, stove, pan

title: Buttered Potatoes
directions: Scrape, boil and drain potatoes, and toss in butter and chopped parsley.
Serve on sticks.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Ingredient: potato, butter, parsley

Equipment: sieve, pot, stove

title: Chicken Paprika
directions: Wash chicken and dry well.
Heat fat in 10- or 12-inch skillet or chicken fryer over moderate heat.
Brown onions.
Add paprika and chicken; sprinkle with salt.
Cover; cook over very low heat 1 hour until tender, turning after first half hour.
Pour sour cream over chicken: heat.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Meat, Main Dish

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: chicken, fat, onion, paprika, salt, sour cream

Equipment: skillet, measuring cups, measuring spoons

title: Cod Fish Stew (Danish)

ingredients.name: pound fresh or thawed, frozen cod fillets
pound peeled white potatoes, cut in 3/4 inch cubes
celery seed, or 1/2 cup diced celery
peeled carrots, cut in 3/4 inch cubes

directions: Saute bacon in deep kettle or dutch oven until lightly browned; then set bacon aside.
In same kettle, saute onions until tender.
Add fish cut in 2 1/2 inch pieces; add next seven ingredients.
Simmer, covered, until vegetables are tender, about 25 minutes.
Add tomatoes, heat through.
Garnish with parsley and bacon bits.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs Clifford Olsen
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co


Source: Savory Seafoods of Oregon (1957-07-01)


Category: Seafood, Soup

Ingredient: fillet, green pepper, bacon, salt, onion, pepper, potato, water, tomato, celery seed, parsley, carrot

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Pineapple Chiffon Cheese Cake
directions: Combine one-half the sugar and 1/2 cup syrup drained from pineapple with slightly beaten egg yolks.
Cook over hot water until smooth and thickened, stirring constantly.
Soften gelatin in water for 5 minutes.
Add to the hot mixture and stir until dissolved.
Chill until it starts to thicken, then add pineapple, sieved cottage cheese, grated lemon rind and lemon juice.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites, salt and whipped cream.
Combine crumbs, remaining sugar and butter or margarine.
Line pan with crumbs, saving out about a third for the top.
Add cheese mixture and cover with remaining crumbs.
Chill several hours until firm.
other_info:
Author: Person.Claire V Pulliam
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, lemon rind, pineapple, lemon juice, egg yolk, egg white, water, salt, gelatin, whipping cream, Zweibach, cottage cheese, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, double boiler, stove, refrigerator

title: French Tapioca
directions: Soak the tapioca in the water over night, or for five hours, in a cool place.
Heat the milk to boiling, in a vessel set within another of boiling water, add the tapioca and water in which it was soaked, and a pinch of salt, stirring occasionally.
When all is boiling hot, add the yolks of the eggs, beaten very light, with the sugar, and stir until it thickens perceptibly, but do not let it boil too long or the custard will break.
Remove from fire and stir in briskly, but carefully, the whites of eggs beaten to a stiff froth, and the vanilla.
When sufficiently cool, pour into a glass dish and set away to get very cold.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mary C Morris
Contributor: Organization.Girls' High and Normal School


Source: Alumnae Cookbook (1891-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: tapioca, milk, water, sugar, egg, vanilla

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, pot, egg beater, baking dish

title: Hominy with Cheese
directions: Make a sauce of the milk, flour, and butter.
When it thickens add cheese cut fine.
Remove from the fire and stir carefully while the cheese melts.
Too much heat will make it curdle.
Mix with the hominy, that has been heated before mixing and serve at once, or if desired sprinkle with buttered crumbs and bake just enough to brown crumbs.
other_info:
Author: Person.Bertina A Leete, Person.Edith Church


Source: Practical Patriot Recipes (1918-01-01)


Category: Side, Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: hominy, butter, milk, cheese, flour, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pot

title: Lemon Filling II
directions: Mix com starch and sugar, add boiling water, stirring constantly.
Cook 2 minutes, add butter, egg yolk and rind and juice of lemon.
Bake the crust, pour in the cooked mixture.
Make a meringue of the whites of eggs; spread on top and bake until a light brown.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Denver Gas and Electric Co, Person.Katherine Newsbury, Person.Helen Parker Headden

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, oven

title: Polevka z Zitnym Chlebem (Soup with Rye Bread)

ingredients.name: onion, chopped, which has been lightly browned in
garlic, rubbed to a paste (if desired)

directions: Place the cubed bread in a shallow pan and brown in a hot oven.
Put the bread in a kettle and pour the beef soup over it.
Add: pepper, onion, garlic, and caraway seed.
Bring the soup to a boil.
Add chopped parsley leaves.
Drop eggs into the boiling soup, mixing them into the soup with a fork.
When the eggs are boiled, serve.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Clarkson Woman's Club


Source: Old Czech Recipes for Today's Kitchens (1920-01-01)

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, pan, bowl, knife

title: Old-Fashioned Flannel Cakes
directions: Sift together in a bowl the flour, salt and baking powder.
Beat the egg yolks and add the milk.
Pour milk mixture slowly into the dry ingredients and beat to a smooth batter.
Add the melted butter then fold in the stiffly beaten egg whites.
Bake on hot griddle.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Yorkraft Inc


Source: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (1960-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, milk, baking powder, egg, salt, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sifter, egg beater, griddle

title: Spice Cake

ingredients.name: tablespoon mixed spices, soaked in 2 tablespoons boiling water
cup water, mixed with evaporated milk

directions: Sift flour, then measure.
Resift with baking powder and salt.
Cream shortening thoroughly.
Add sugar and continue creaming until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, then the spices.
Add dry ingredients and diluted milk alternately, beginning and ending with dry ingredients.
Pour into greased layer cake pans.
Rake in a moderate oven (375f) about 25 minutes.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: flour, baking powder, salt, shortening, sugar, egg, spice, evaporated milk, water

Equipment: oven, baking pan, measuring spoons, measuring cups, sifter

title: Strawberry Shortcake
directions: Cut the fat into the flour, salt and baking powder until the consistency of cornmeal.
Gradually add the milk, using a knife to mix.
Do not handle any more than absolutely necessary.
Toss the dough upon a floured board or a piece of clean brown paper.
Pat into the desired shape, and place in a pan.
Bake in a hot oven for 12 to 15 minutes.
Split, spread with butter, and place strawberries, crushed and sweetened, between and on top.
Serve with cream.
other_info:
Author: Person.Louise Bennett Weaver, Person.Helen Cowles LeCron


Source: A Thousand Ways To Please a Husband (1917-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: lard, salt, butter, baking powder, flour, strawberry, milk, sugar

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, oven, baking pan

title: Oatmeal Savouries
directions: Rub the fat into the flour, add all the other ingredients except the butter, and mix to a stiff dough with cold water.
Roll out to 1/4 inch thick and stamp into rounds, then from half the rounds remove the centre to form rings.
Place the biscuits on a greased tin and bake in a moderate oven for about 30 minutes.
When the rounds are cold, spread them with butter, place the rings on top and fill the centre with a savoury filling.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Side

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: margarine, flour, rolled oat, salt, baking powder, butter, water, savoury filling

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, baking tray, rolling pin, oven

title: Baked Fillets Margo
directions: Cut fish fillets into serving size pieces.
Brush pieces with melted butter and sprinkle with salt, glutamate, and pepper.
Place in shallow baking dish and completely cover with milk.
Bake, uncovered 1 n a moderate oven, 350 degrees, for 30 minutes.
Remove fish to warm platter and keep warm, to serve over fish, make cream sauce as follows: melt butter and remove from heat.
Blend in flour until smooth and add 1 cup remaining milk gradually.
Return to heat and stir continually until thickened.
Add seasonings and if desired.
A, bit of parsley or pimiento for color.
other_info:
Author: Person.Mrs M M Lunning
Contributor: Organization.Point Adams Packing Co

directions: Shake all the ingredients well with the ice, strain into a glass, and serve with a cherry.

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: ice, mint, gin, grenadine syrup, lemon, egg white, cocktail cherry

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, shaker, strainer

title: Brown Candy
directions: Melt 1 cup sugar in a heavy skillet over iow heat, stirring constantly until melted and light caramel-colored.
Pour slowly into saucepan containing 2 cups sugar and cream.
Cook to firm ball stage (260f), stirring constantly.
Remove from heat.
Add soda and stir vigorously.
Add butter and cool for 10 minutes.
Add vanilla and beat until mixture is thick and loses shininess.
Blend in pecan.
Spread in greased pan and cut in 1-inch squares,.
other_info:

Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69

Equipment: measuring spoons, measuring cups, bowl

title: Peach and Tangerine Cocktail
directions: Sieve the fruit, add all other ingredients, and fill up with soda water.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Good Housekeeping


Source: Cocktails & Savouries (1955-01-01)


Category: Drink

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: peach, tangerine, lemon, sugar, Cointreau, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, sieve

title: Boston Pudding
directions: Mix white sugar, flour, milk, raisins, baking powder and put in greased casserole.
Mix together brown sugar, butter and hot water.
Pour over batter.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Can be served in its own sauce or with cream added to pudding.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Stout State College Home Economics Club


Source: Stout's Favorites (1955-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: sugar, milk, raisin, flour, baking powder, brown sugar, water, butter

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, egg beater, casserole, oven

title: Nut Caramels
directions: Combine brown sugar, brown sugar, butter, light corn syrup, 1 1/3 cup condensed milk and 2/3 cup milk.
Cook over a low flame, stirring constantly, until temperature reaches 246f or until a ball is formed when dropped in water.
The time is approximately 1 hour.
Remove from fire and add vanilla and pecan.
Turn at once into a slightly buttered pan about 9 inches square.
As soon as candy is cold, turn on waxed paper and cut in straight pieces about 1 inch square.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69
Contributor: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook (1951-01-01)


Category: Dessert

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: brown sugar, butter, corn syrup, condensed milk, water, vanilla, pecan

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, stove, bowl, baking pan

title: Fortified Bread
directions: Dissolve cake of yeast in lukewarm water (or leftover vegetable water.
Combine all other ingredients except margarine.
Add liquid to dry ingredients.
Also add 1 tablespoon margarine and mix thoroughly.
Put the smooth dough in an oiled bowl and cover.
Let rise in warm place for 1 1/2 hours.
Then punch down and let rise 20 minutes more.
Finally make a loaf and put in large bread pan, cover, and let stand in warm place.
When dough has again risen to top of bread pan, bake for about 40 minutes at 400f.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Order of Eastern Star Chapter 69, Person.Gayelord Hauser


Source: Eastern Star Cookbook, Look Younger, Live Longer (1951-01-01)


Category: Bread

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: yeast, water, margarine, whole wheat flour, , flour, milk, brown sugar, vegetable salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, bowl, oven, bread pan

title: Vegetable Soup No. 2
directions: Wash the equal quantities of onions,carrots, and turnips well, and cut up into stew-pan with the butter and sugar, stir them over the fire for ten minutes, not letting them brown.
Then pour the boiling water or stock over them, and add the celery, herbs and seasoning.
Stew all for three hours, and flavor with a little ketchup.
other_info:
Contributor: Organization.W Drysdale & Co


Source: Cookery for the Million (1877-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: carrot, onion, turnip, celery, herb, butter, sugar, water

Equipment: measuring spoons, knife, stove, pot

title: Apple, Carrot and Raisin Salad
directions: Combine apples, carrots and raisins.
Sprinkle with salt and sugar.
Add dressing and mix lightly with two forks.
Keep in a cool place until ready to serve.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Salad

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: apple, carrot, raisin, salt, sugar, cooked salad dressing

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife

title: Baked Wild Rice
directions: Wash rice thoroughly in 3 or 4 changes of water.
Place in greased 1 1/2 -quart casserole; add undiluted consomme and liquid from mushrooms.
Let stand 3 hours.
Set oven for moderate 350f.
Cover casserole; bake 45 minutes, adding a little water if rice becomes too dry.
Heat mushrooms in butter or margarine.
Remove rice from oven, lower heat to 300f.
Stir mushrooms and butter into rice.
Return to oven; bake uncovered until all liquid is absorbed.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Metropolitan Life Insurance Company


Source: Metropolitan Cookbook (1964-02-01)


Category: Grain

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: rice, consommé, mushroom, butter

Equipment: oven, measuring spoons, measuring cups, casserole

title: Another way of Making Fresh Stock
directions: Cut the meat into pieces, break up the bones, add the cold water and the salt.
Bring to the boil and skim well.
Prepare the vegetables, cut them into pieces, and add them.
Simmer 5 hours.
other_info:
Author: Person.May Henry, Person.Edith B Cohen


Source: The Economical Jewish Cook (1897-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: beef shin, turnip, carrot, onion, celery, salt, pepper, water

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot, stove

title: Cream of Mushroom Soup

ingredients.name: water, or chicken or veal broth

directions: Wash mushrooms.
Separate stems and caps.
Slice caps.
There will be 1 gallon.
Put stems through grinder.
There will be 2 1/2 cups packed.
Cook onion and mushrooms slowly in the butter, about 15 minutes.
Sift flour over mushrooms and blend thoroughly.
Add hot water gradually, stirring constantly.
When soup has thickened slightly, add milk, salt and pepper.
Stir while heating, or heat over boiling water.
other_info:
Author: Organization.Evaporated Milk Association


Source: Quantity Recipes for Quality Foods (1939-01-01)


Category: Soup

Measure: avoirdupois

Ingredient: mushroom, onion, butter, flour, water, evaporated milk, salt

Equipment: measuring cups, measuring spoons, knife, pot
